description:
Good Italian food with large portions. 
My friend had pizza and I had paste. Both very delicious. 
Slow service. Has late evening hours. 

Will come back.
author: Zita M.

description:
What a great place!
Probably the best pizza I have had in San Francisco. 
Very convenient for a late night dinner.
Price is very reasonable as well.
Very nice overall.
author: Sara B.

description:
The pizza is OK, the place is small but very popular. The things that need improvement: 
1) it's so cold inside! On a cold day the door is left wide open, the fans working full speed; I had a table close to the kitchen and still it was so cold, I had to leave my warm jacket on. 
2) This place needs some very thorough cleaning. The glass on the kitchen counter was hardly transparent when looking against the light - you could see all the stains and dirt. The decorations on shelves have thick layer of dust, grease and... cobwebs. The picture on the wall close to the table had lots of old food stains on the glass. I know that cleanness standards are not very high in US but this is beyond average American place.... 
I'm sorry to say that but this place was not cleaned (I mean really cleaned with every single detail and every inch of surface) for decades.
author: Magia B.

description:
I've been ordering from Uncle Vito's for a while now and was surprised I hadn't written a review yet.  I always get my pizza's delivered at work and have never been disappointed.  

I've always enjoyed their Mountain pizza, which is their version of a combination.  It comes with salami, pepperoni, onion, bell peppers, mushrooms and sausage.  I like that they don't skimp on their portions their crust has a nice texture to it and they are very reasonably priced when you compare to other pizza places in SOMA.  I've also enjoyed their pepperoni and have on occasion feasted on their Calzone's.  I don't usually eat pizza crust, but I do with Uncle Vito's pizzas.  

Some of my fellow co-workers prefer a plain cheese pizza, which isn't my cup of tea, but they really enjoy the cheese pizza here.  Whenever we talk about getting pizza delivered, there's always a few who want a cheese pizza.  I want pretty much everything on mine, but everyone has their preferences.  

They deliver free if you're in the area, which is a bonus.
author: Lon H.

description: The food is good and the prices are very reasonable for the quality. They offer takeout and delivery too. Keep an eye out for the daily specials!
author: Joel C.

description:
Seeing all the reviews at this place made me want to come and check it out. And to be honest, to me, this place wasn't the most exciting pizza place. I have started to become more inclined to eating Neapolitan style of pizzas. I think though, this pizza was just okay.

I got the Mountain Pizza, and honestly it was really nothing special. The taste was like a pizza. There was no special cheese or something extra they did to the dough. It wasn't wood fired. There was nothing special. This was a pizza you would get at any other pizzeria, that was where this pizza was at to me. I mean, it's definitely better pizza compared to any chain though, but it just wasn't anything that special to me. The taste was alright, but honestly it seemed like the owner who served us didn't even seem enthusiastic about his product.

And that was what sort of turned me down. He wasn't happy, maybe he was having a bad day, but it seemed like he had no energy or happiness on what he was doing. Seeing all the things on the wall and all the recommendations this place once had, I really don't see it. And, splitting bills is a hard thing on the west coast? When we asked to split our bill we got a sigh and a weird face. Is it not custom? I haven't heard of this before and I'm confused why that's such a big deal...

Overall, it's just okay. This place definitely doesn't stand out in my mind when I think back to my trip and the places that I've eaten.
author: Bruce K.

description: Horrible.  We ate 2 peices of our delivered pizza and tossed the rest.  Very small portion of pepperoni, and other toppings.  So much bland sauce.  The delivery guy gave our salad to another customer, so we didn't have that to round out the meal.
author: EC N.

description:
I've gotten the spaghetti and meatballs here for takeout several times, as well as a couple pizzas.

The spaghetti is good enough. Nothing fancy, just a lot of spaghetti with meat sauce and meatballs that taste good. The serving size is generous.

The pizzas are also great, although rather greasy. You can see them making it if you care about that. They taste fine - good cheese and toppings were also better than what you'd get at a Pizza Hut. Prices are reasonable for SF as well.

I've never sat down to eat here because there always seems to be a line. Seems to be a popular spot for tourists. 

Overall a good spot for simple pizza / pasta / spaghetti at a good price. Certa
author: John L.

description:
Never go wrong with Uncle Vito's !
Pizza is delicious, half Hawaiian half Greek. I normally would get fettuccine with clams, but lately I have been on the fettuccine primavera... scrumptious!!!
author: Joey O.

description: It's ok. Just a convenient location for me. Just run of the mill pizza for San Francisco. Nothing special. Plus the servers that take your order could be a lot more friendly.
author: Richard T.

description:
This place was first recommended to me by the valet at the Fairmont. My daughter woke up too late for our reservation for high tea at the Laurel Court and my boys' were very hungry for something to eat.

Uncle Vito's Pizza is a very short walk from the Nob Hill but the walk back is very steep one. 

The pizza is made to order and is so delicious and fresh and cheap for San Francisco. The crust is a little sweet and my friend who is trained in making Napolitano type pizzas say some pizza makers put sugar in their dough. 

I will almost never eat pizza but I will eat a slice or two from here...
author: Christina W.

description: I've been going here for years. Then one day about 6 months ago they hiked up all their prices. Now I don't go anymore
author: Nick D.

description: I can't give this place enough stars!  The line is long but it moves fast. Once seated you feel like you are dining in Italy. Wonderful house wine, lasagna and pizza. We have one night left in San Fran and it is so tempting not to eat here again. Don't let the line scare you off, this is the real deal. It's not a 4 Star dining experience or service but that only added to the experience.
author: Caryl R.

description: I had the cheese ravioli with meat sauce, it was ok. Really thankful for this place being open at 10pm when everything else was closed. A coworker told me that pizza is what they're good at, so maybe I could've ordered smarter. Service was slow on a packed Tuesday night.
author: Jeff B.

description: Ordered the mountain pizza and was happy with the freshness of ingredients and taste.  Definitely coming back again.
author: Marky M.

description: When I was staying in downtown Sanfrancisco, I was in the mood for some pizza.  I came across this place. It was pretty dam good. Yes for the 1,000,000th time the CHEESE is worth mentioning and it was good and it is relevant,  need I say again and again
author: Jin K.

description:
Uncle Vito's offers some pretty delicious pizza and pasta for very reasonable prices.  As someone who has lived across the street from the place for a couple of years, this was my go to-pizza place and when my family visited me from LA, Uncle Vito's was always a highlight for them.

I recommending getting a medium The Mountain pizza which has a tone of meat and toppings fettucine with baby clams.  This place delivers around the area for free so that's pretty awesome as well.
author: Mark C.

description:
I decided to get a Pizza from Uncle Vito's Pizza while waiting for my laundry to complete across the road. At around 9:30 pm on Sunday it was slammed. Upon entering you will find the ordering station to your right, if front of the open kitchen. There is a small strip of space near the entrance that is used to place orders, pick up pizzas, come in and go out of the restaurant, so when they are full you will literally be standing on top of each other in this narrow space to order. The person taking orders was obviously having a bad day. He was out rightly rude to people who were simply placing orders.
 
When my turn came I decided to get a medium Greek pizza ($16.50) which has feta cheese, salami, pepperoni, bell pepper and black olives. I was a little hesitant to customize, but then I said what the heck we are paying for this, we should be able to choose, so I subbed the pepperoni with sausage. Thankfully there was no drama.

Anyway after ordering, without exaggeration, I waited 30 minutes for my pizza. It was too cold to wait outside so I found a small chair inside. Let's come to the pizza. It is your hand tossed thin crust pizza that was badly made. It seems to be a Neapolitan style pizza, but it lacks the crispy crust and delicate balance of sauce and cheese that keeps the pizza from becoming soggy and mush. This one had way too much sauce and cheese making it a soft soggy mess. It could have used some more time in the oven, but I guess because they were so slammed they seemed to be rushing orders out without proper quality control.

Price wise they are in line with what you would pay at other pizza joints, but the quality and service is seriously lacking. Delarosa & Pachino both of which are within 10 mins of Vito's manage to do pizza right. Vito's is just super popular. I don't get the draw is so I'll pass.
author: Ahmad J.

description: My favorite stop when I'm in San Francisco. Always always enjoy the food. Best prices for the food you get.
author: Art H.

description: Crowded but worth it!!! Stayed in San Francisco for one night and came to this place for some pizza, pasta and beer and was not disappointed one bit!! Located in a great area as well, not far from the mall or the hotels. The two of us ate every bite!
author: Kyla C.

description:
Your average pizza place providing average pizza. We got a pizza here to go for dinner mainly because it was so close to our hotel. We placed an order for a 12 inch veggie pizza with pepperoni by phone and was told it would be ready in 20 minutes.

When we arrived (20+ minutes later) the pizza was ready for us. When we got back to the hotel and opened up the box it looked and smelled very delectable. The taste was just average though. The center of the pizza was super soggy and the crust didn't have a lot of flavor nor did it have a noticeable interplay between crisp crust and soft interior. The pizza place itself was a bit dark inside and a little grimy feeling. 

I'd probably only get food from here again if I were looking for something open a little later in the evening and were in the immediate area and too lazy to eat in.
author: Karen W.

description:
The neighborhood go-to spot for sure. Their regulars are the ones keeping them alive, and the tourists are keeping them growing. They'll deliver too!

We always order from there when we want something pretty quickly - Their lasagna comes with a salad, and their meat ravioli is pretty good. The bf loves their calzones and I always manage to order a cheesecake for dessert. Delivery is free after $15.
author: Charo F.

description:
Hate to say it but it's way too overrated. 
Definitely not worth the wait. 
Mediocre pizza and mediocre pasta. 
Trust me you can make better pasta at home by following a standard recipe.
Service is not so great either. Should've read all the reviews before coming here.
There are way too many better pizza places to go in the city.
author: Ivy Y.

description: I was referred by hotel front desk. Based on his recommendation and Yelp reviews, I was more than willing to make the 25 minute trek. Mistakes were made that day. The pizza itself was underwhelming and just "meh". Also, why the heck don't they offer ranch dressing!? Ranch is a staple while consuming pizza. I was given a funky "peppercorn" sauce -- blah. I had a slice and the remainder was consumed by an individual with lower standards. ;) Was the pizza terrible? No, but it definitely wasn't as good as I had anticipated. It was also a little pricey for what it was.. or wasn't.
author: Jennae H.

description:
Drink: House Chianti ($7). A generous pour but the wine was somewhat acrid and not a good Chianti. 

Entree: Lasagna ($14).  A meaty lasagna with good spices and a generous portion. Includes a very large side salad with tomatoes, chickpeas, and olives. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. 

Service: Regretfully, the Server seemed a little distracted and not pleasant. I did not see her smile to any of the guests.  Deduct 1 star.

Ambiance: A very small and crowded place.  We were seated upstairs, at a small table, in an area about 10 feet by 5 feet.  The decor was nothing special. Deduct 1 star. 

Overall: The food is good enough.  Although, the table next to us ordered the pizza and only ate one piece. Due to the small seating area, consider taking it to go--and eating in the comfort of your hotel room or apartment.
author: Steve K.

description:
Uncle Vito's is not the most comfortable place to sit and eat even when the place is empty on a early afternoon. The tables are very close together so anytime you move your chair you will most likely hit the chair behind you but with that being said you still get a very good pizza. The crust is very crisp and sturdy.  Nothing worse than a soggy pizza! The pizza is full of ingredients and very tasty. I can taste the sausage, peppers, the olives and pretty much everything on that pizza and it makes for a flavorful mouthful! I have had bland pizza before and this would not be one. 

Never had their wine but the beer is good and cold. 

If you are looking for a romantic pizza place, this would not be your 1st choice but if you want good pizza and a cold beer you came to the right place!
author: Vikki J.

description: Ordered a plain cheese pizza, garlic bread, and the spinach salad for delivery and it was all delicious!  The crust was not too thick and there was just enough cheese.  There is a sweetness to the tomato sauce and crust that enhances the flavor.  Usually the crust is the worst part of the pizza and not worth eating but their crust was delicious.  The cheese garlic was also definitely worth it.  Just enough garlic so it wasn't overwhelming.  The salad was simple.  It just had spinach, mushrooms, and croutons, but the ingredients were fresh and a nice balance to the heaviness of the pizza.  Definitely did not disappoint!
author: Ruth H.

description:
My husband is obsessed with this place. Every time we go party in the city he's got to have one of their pizzas to go on our way home. Honestly though, those pizzas are some of the most delicious I've ever had.

Love that they'll let you do half and half, and that you can drink a beer while you wait for them to serve up your deliciousness in a box. One of these days I'm going to come through and eat in instead of just grabbing my pizza and running off. Not greasy but cheesy and that's a hard thing to pull off. Love love love!!
author: Joanna R.

description: Really enjoyed the crisp and sturdy crust (I hate floppy slices) on the combination pizza. Sauce, cheese, and toppings were very fresh. Higher end prices for what feels like an everyday-type pizza, however.
author: Tony P.

description: Picked up some pizza from this place night... luckily we weren't trying to sit down because it was absolutely packed. The pizza was a little thicker than what would be considered New York slices but very tasty with a great cheese/sauce ratio. Ordered a cheese pizza and a tia mia pizza and would definitely recommend the latter.
author: Gabriel L.

description:
We ended up here very hungry after walking the city all day. Greeted a few times as we entered the door and seated a few minutes after that. 

We were seated in the corner in front of the window. Overall the place was clean, although had a very tight layout of chairs and tables. Making the corner table uncomfortable.

Ordered our drinks and our meal right away, along with an appetizer. The app arrived before our drinks, I had to flag someone down in order to actually get them. 

Our pizza came and plates from the app were cleared, only then were we offered refills. 

After eating and our only one refill I had to again flag someone down to get our bill. After we received the bill I had to point out to the waiter once again we never received the salad we had originally ordered. 

After a few minutes I got an updated bill. Ended up paying cash because we just wanted out of here. I do not recommend this place as they seem to busy to help you and the pizza was not all that great.
author: Christopher S.

description: Great pizza, light crust. Not meant to blow your mind but definitely gets the job done and super consistent. I always do takeout because there's usually a wait for a table and this place seems to be getting busier and busier lately. I always just go with a classic sausage pizza.
author: Ryan P.

description: Whether you live in San Fran or are just visiting, this place is a must go to for eating! From the appetizer, chicken Caesar salad and calzone, we couldn't believe how great everything tasted. Definitely will be telling others to come here and will be eating here next visit!
author: Cody A.

description: Delicious food! Good location, not far off Union Square. Service could have been better, when we arrived it wasn't busy and it took a while for the waiter to take our drink and food order. We ordered the Calzone- which we thought was a pizza since it was listed under pizza. We order this because of the Ricotta, but which it would have been clear this was a calzone, not pizza. Flavor was good. Price was right.
author: Francesca C.

description: We got the fried ravioli and cheesy garlic bread to start, very good flavor but very small portions. We got a couple personal pizzas and one medium pizza... pretty yummy flavor, but the range in $ was off-putting, $9-10 for the personal pizza jumping to $18 for the medium  definitely not worth $18, but I would go back when hungry for a snack
author: Rachel G.

description: My sons love the pizza.  Very popular restaurant with long lines, but well worth the wait.  On our short 4 day trip to San Francisco we ate there twice.  Less crowded at lunch.
author: Mark K.

description: If you are from the east coast you may want to find another place. The sauce is watery with little to no flavor. I had spaghetti and my son had pizza. We literally left and hit a diner after bc it was not good. Also, the server messed up my drink w another customer and after we realized he swapped them and simply switched our straws!! Yes, with a complete stranger. Very disappointing place :(
author: Stephanie R.

description: I always forget to post a review for uncle Vito's. The absolute BEST meatball sub of your life!!!! Pizza is great too but the meatballs sub!! Agh-Maze-Inggggg. The spot is small and nothing fancy, my parents condo is on Pine street that's how I found it. I happen to be walking to market and stopped in. First time was over 4 years ago and I still come here. A must try.
author: Nelys'ia B.

description:
Totally unprofessional. We waited 1.5 hours for our pizza that they have forgot. After we reminded them 2 times. We ended up leaving and looking around for other place to eat at 11pm. 

Food is OK.
author: Yiannis V.

description: I could see this place from our hotel room 25 floors up. Needless to say it was still a walk all up hill. Looked like it was a happing place. 9 pm on a Friday BUSY...But it took us about 30 mins for a table. It was cool to watch the chef right there by the front desk . May hats off to you , you are great under pressure. We had our food in about 20 mins with all the food he was making that was quick. Pasta and ravioli was really good. If I get back to Ca I am going to try the pizza it looked so good as the waiter kept walking by us with pizza after pizza. Nice job keep it up.
author: Steve G.

description:
Bit of a wait to be seated. The lady handling the take out counter and acting as hostess was very nice, but the wait staff were inattentive and somewhat rude. They've tried to cram too many tables into the dining area. Kudos to them for trying to accommodate more customers, but what's the point if everyone is uncomfortable?

Pizza is good. It's thin crust and sort of NY style as the name would sort of imply. We ordered a half-pepperoni/half-hamburger-mushroom. Both sides were delicious. My daughter got the spaghetti, but the sauce was a bit heavy on the tomato flavor (almost like they just dumped a can of crushed tomatoes over the pasta without any herbs or seasoning).

Their iced tea is horrible. It's probably made from concentrate and comes out of a fountain dispenser like only soda should.

I recommend getting takeout to avoid the wait for a table and their not-so-friendly wait staff.

4 stars for the pizza. 2 stars for the service.
author: Chad K.

description: Maybe I was just tired when we ate here, but I didn't get all the praise for the place. I got the Fettucine with Baby Clams in white sauce. It was ok.  Nothing overwhelmingly amazing about this place. The service was a little slower than what we have experienced in the city. Plus, the server wasn't too happy to split the bill in half, but he ended up doing it after making some faces. (Is that a West coast/California thing? I have noticed this a few times now here.)
author: Vanessa N.

description:
Great pasta dishes and ok pizza. 

Pasta is cooked al dente. The creamy sauces are garlicky the way I like them. The chicken in the Alfredo was tender and moist. I will definitely be back for these dishes.

Pizzas have a great thin crust with char that adds great texture and some flavor but the topping I believe lacked. On the Pesto I tasted the onions, cheese, and black olives BUT no pesto. I could see the pesto, I just couldn't taste it. The Hawaiian flavor was dominated by the Canadian bacon smokiness. 

I am not saying the pizzas are bad they just might need some adjustments. Maybe the one pasta cook can help the 5 pizza makers to perfect the pizzas?

My hat goes off to the only two waitresses that are none stop. We were seated upstairs and we never felt abandoned. Thank you girls!
author: Juan G.

description: Hats off to Chef Martin! Excellent food, traditional Italian dishes with an authentic taste! Highly recommend if you're in the area!
author: Ashley L.

description:
"Leave the gun, take the cannoli." - The Godfather

Ahh such fond memories of my once favorite pizzeria! Ok, the thing about coming to a place 100 times is you start noticing the fine details or lack of it over time. Sadly, my onetime 5-stars rated pizzeria is closer to 3-stars now, yet in my heart I need to be generous at 4-stars! Just too many memories of the area and oh that Calzone! 

Uncle Vito's! 

The Calzone! To me it's all about the Calzone: the signature stuffed pizza with pepperoni, mushrooms, salami, ricotta & mozzarella (can be substituted for vegetarian). They make it right here, though lately I noticed slightly smaller, slightly less filling, and slightly rising prices /sigh. I guess being located in Nob Hill it is inevitable that this would happen, so no hard feelings. 

Located on Bush st. & Powell st. it is literally on a hill in the heart of San Francisco! The cable car drops you off right at the doorstep if need be! As you enter you'll be at the tossing the pizza window. If you want to eat-in, turn to your left, and step-up a couple steps. It's somewhat crammed, but hey it's an Italian pizzeria! Service is usually hit or miss here... like I said I've been here 100 times & still it's hit or miss. Even with my Italian silks on!

Uncle Vito's! 

Lastly, I'll be back, but it's just no longer my fav pizzeria. That went out with 98 Degrees and the reduced ricotta. I still love my Calzone & the spaghetti & meatballs weren't bad either. Good memories here, and why that's amore!
author: Eric R.

description:
Went back to Uncle Vito's and still the same - cashier touches salad with bare hands after he touches money. No sense of hygiene here and how it can poison customers who eat here.

I don't ever order salads at Uncle Vito's even though I wanted to. 

Also even though they say they deliver, several times when I tried to have a deliver,y they said that our address is one block further away from Van Ness and hence they won't deliver- I thought that was utterly ridiculous; other times they said that they don't have a driver etc. So there is no real delivery to begin with, why falsely advertise?
author: Jane P.

description: Was looking for pizza near my hotel and didn't want to travel to North Beach. Solid choice. Pizza was great and was still "fresh out of the oven hot" when I arrived back at my room.
author: Randy F.

description: Pizza is okay. Calzones are better. Good service. The place itself is kinda dirty. I guess it's worth the price but there are much better pizza places in the area.
author: Nick K.

description: Soooo bomb! This place was right down the street from our hotel and we ate there 3 days in row! The pizza was so fresh & decently priced. Every time we went in it was a packed house and there's a good reason why. If we are ever out here again we will stop in
author: Sarah P.

description: Ok, as you can tell, I have been to this place numerous times.  I am working down the street, and this place is convenient, affordable, and the staff, happens to be very nice, friendly, and very quick to come up with your order.  The food is hot, and has pretty good flavor.  This place is kinda old school, and I have had the chance to try the pizza, hamburgers, meatball sub, chicken sandwich.  All very good.  The pizza is best, when it is fresh....  Do not put it in the fridge, the dough go to crap.  Other than that, I kinda like this place.  The dining area is small and cramped, but hey, get to know your neighbor, like I said, this is an old school place, and it has charm to go with it.....
author: Paul G.

description:
On vacation. Asked a friend for recommendations. Uncle Vito's came up AND it was literally 30 steps from our hotel - SCORE!

Hubby and I shared a Cesar salad. Super yummy - not too much dressing, enough to share but just enough to keep you wanting more. I had the pasta special - chicken ravioli with mushroom and sun dried tomato in a cream sauce. Delicious! Lots of flavor, pasta was cooked perfectly, mushrooms were plentiful and chunky (in a good way). Hubby had the calzone. Although it came out piping hot and he had to wait a while for it to cool down enough so he could take decent bites enough to enjoy it, he DID enjoy it (especially after dipping it in my extra sauce)

Highly recommend!
author: Kathryn C.

description: Been wanting to come here for years, and finally got a chance to sample Uncle Vito's. I wasn't disappointed, the pizza has delicious flavor and the toppings are nice and big. We took it to go because it's pretty small inside, but I'd definitely come back.
author: Paul L.

description:
The worst place in town!!
Dont even try to waist your money!!!
Service sucks, pizza sucks!!
author: Athanasios V.

description:
This place has the worst service ever. I literally waited for more than 30 min just for a spaghetti with meat sauce. A family of three who came 10 min after us already received their food... 

I couldn't wait any longer so I walked out and had them cancel my order. The waiter notified me that they were making my food... Seriously?????? 

Awful service!!!! 
I'm Never coming back to this place no matter how good the food is.
author: Candice T.

description: This place is a little hole in the wall but it's so yummy! It seems to be family fan and the prices are reasonable. I got the original (medium) calzone and it was super filling. Very cheesy and flavorful. Just thinking about it makes me wish I was in SF again!
author: Crisia S.

description:
My boyfriend and I went to Uncle Vito's on a Friday night, after having gone to Plouf and Hawthorn for happy hour. I had consumed an indecent amount of alcohol and all I wanted was pizza.

A great part of my experience was a blur, but I remember two things: we had The Mountain and the crust was made by angels. 

Here's a small tip: when you get your pizza, eat it right away, don't wait for it to cool down because the crust will get soggy and you'll never know how great your life could've been.
author: Sabrina B.

description: Pizza and the ravioli were just amazing! Perfectly baked and tasted delicious! A must try for sure :)
author: Saloni A.

description:
If you like pasta and pizza this is the spot to come to. I enjoyed  all 4 dishes I ordered the day I brought my family this weekend it's the best tasting pasta I've ever had and I've been to a lot of places that's why i even pulled out my phone to rate this place we will be back the prices are amazing based on the amazing taste 
I already recommended and will continue to recommend friends and family to this amazing place Uncle Vito's
author: Jose H.

description: Honestly only eat here if you're blitzed. Daytime service, food and atmosphere is all extremely disappointing. Never been here under the influence but I imagine that's the only way Uncle Vito's can be an enjoyable experience
author: Austin C.

description:
First time ordering from here and they impressed.
Food was delivered piping hot and very quickly.
Pizza was excellent. We asked for extra sauce and they put the perfect amount of sauce on pie.
Spaghetti and meatballs had delicious pasta and good meatballs (my favorites are Pasquale's). Excellent portion. Two thumbs way up!
author: Amarita Amy K.

description:
Called and ordered a personal pizza last week. Took a quick stroll down the hill to pick it up and it wasn't ready by the time I arrived so I waited a lil longer. I walked back up the hill and had my pizza. When I opened up the box the cheese looked melted but the peppers in top were still cold. When I pulled the pizza apart to chow down... The pizza was extremely soggy and limp. I was so upset... 4 stars for what? They couldn't even make my pizza right. The only thing that was decent was the crust‍

I will not be recommending this place to anyone I know. There are too many good pizza in the city to ever return here for their soggy pie. 



I pass by this place often so seeing it made me want to give it another try..I'm glad I did. Uncle Vito's second time here..I got the pesto pizza this time. It was really good. This crust was crispy and thin all the way through this time  with the right amount of bite to it. Olives,red onions and sun dried tomatoes on it was just right. Brought some home and my son loved it too.  

If you like that thin crust this place makes it just right on a good day

I'm for sure coming back.
author: Tru T.

description: This use to be one of my favorite pizza places until recently. Me and friend were working on a Sunday a few weeks ago and decided to order a medium pizza with pepperoni / Salami.Well when we got back to work and opened the box we were disappointed to find what we call a poor mans pizza.very little of both toppings we ordered and very little pizza sauce. We paid almost $20.00 for a Pizza that was not worth more then a $5.99 Digiorno pizza, which actually would have been better. Whats up with such little proportions of the toppings, Oh well this is one customer that won't return.
author: Rick D.

description: Uncle Vito's is the best place to go for pizza in San Francisco! We loved it so much we made the long and hilly walk up two times to have it twice in one visit!!
author: Yvette L.

description: Understaffed and literally the worst fries I've ever had. It is as if they take leftover fries from the night before and refry them. It was like eating a dried cricket. There was no fluffy potato filling, you'd break through the barrier of the fry and it would be empty.
author: Stacey V.

description: I picked up a personal pizza and when I got to my hotel room it the cheese and bread were chewy. Which to me says there's just a lot of processing of the Mix and cheese which makes it best of eaten hot...so it can sit hard in your tummy.  There also wasn't much flavor but lots of grease. Choose at your own risk.
author: Chasity R.

description:
Great food.  Horrible service.  Horrible as in had to stop the waitress for everything needed.  Had to stop her to order, refills, to get the check and to PICKUP the check.  Really bad.

Again food is great, just get it to go
author: A L.

description:
Great pizza and salad!!! Had a short wait, but worth it.  Small dining room with that family owned restaurant feel. 

The pasta also looked great. 

Go for this one. You'll be glad you did.  I'll be back on my next trip to San Francisco. 

Enjoy!!!
author: Keith H.

description: Being a native New Yorker, I'll always be a pizza skeptic when I step outside of my bubble.  My last two visits to San Francisco found me in Uncle Vito's.  They bake a fantastic pie, very consistent crust, with cheese and toppings that balance flavors and textures.  Get yours topped with Canadian bacon!  They've got some specialty pies or create your own.  I'll be back for a 3rd time on my next visit.
author: Matthew R.

description:
We just ate here and it was really good! 
I had the cheese ravioli and I was nervous because cheese ravioli is normally really good or really bad. It was so good! My sister and my dad had the lasagna and they were also very impressed. My mom had the chicken linguini Alfredo and she loved it. It was a small space to fit in with close tables but it was well worth the stop and only a little more expensive than fast food! Very good. Would eat here again. We've discussed coming back to try the pizza.
author: Skylar H.

description: Absolutly amazing pizza Bianco!!! OMG the dough was light and fluffy. One of the best I ever had. The toppings were so fresh. The service was fast and satisfying. Very professional. The atmosphere is intimate and very warm. Great first stop on our first family trip San Francisco. This is definitely an must stop in San Francisco!!!
author: Anthony R.

description: Easily 5 stars for the food but the service was lacking. The combo pizza and Greek salad were great. Crunchy crust and a good amount of toppings. The hostess sat us across from the bathroom. Probably 3 feet away. Additionally the waitress was pretty unattentive. It's a small place with additional upstairs seating. Being ignored at a bathroom table might make you feel like you're in a New York pizza parlor.
author: Tom R.

description: GREAT calzone with pepperoni, salami, mushrooms, and cheese! Keeping it simple and still delicious.  We ordered the medium 12" which was enough for 2 people. The interior isn't anything special, but with great food, it doesn't matter!
author: Katie R.

description:
This rating is based solely on the pizza. 

The pizza is pretty mediocre. The crust is bland and pretty dry, they are light on the tomato sauce and heavy on the cheese, so it is very greasy. The pepperoni is low quality and tastes like it's straight out of a pack of lunchables.

I don't have an alternate recommendation bc I'm from out of town and this place was right around the corner. 

Bottom line is, if you are looking for any slice, and this location is convenient, it'll do the trick. But if you are looking for good pizza, you won't find it here.
author: Sebastian S.

description: Very cozy and warm place with a great delicious menu! Even through this place can get very busy, the service level is amazing. Our server Anna gave us the best recommendation on the menu and get our order super fast! The pizza is one of the best that I have tried in the whole city! Everyone, who is picky about their pizza ... check out this place. Cheers!
author: Lana M.

description:
Mediocre pizza. The crust was dry and bland. The toppings were lacking and not that great. 

We went to the restaurant and ordered The Hawaiian (one of their specialties) for take out. It seemed busy so we waited outside due to the limited space inside. When we got our pizza, we were really disappointed by the pale crust, sparse chunks of pineapple, and undercooked bell peppers. It reminded of a frozen pizza. Definitely not what we were expecting from a place with so many good reviews.

Definitely would not recommend for take out...  maybe they put a little more care when dining in.
author: Kimi L.

description: We are locals and usually do not eat around Union square, but we ran into this place accidentally and woooow, I think this is so far the best pizza in the city (sharing first place with Golden boy pizza)... It's the type of oven they use here that changed the game! Be back here for sure
author: Stefan K.

description:
PROS
*food is really inexpensive
*Huge portions
*convenient location if you are the in the area

We had clam fettucine and meatball spaghetti. The food could use a little flavor, though. Perhaps add a tinge of chilli sauce to the pasta sauce would do wonders! The server seems abit overworked and exhausted.
author: Tiffany W.

description: Go here they make you feel they care about you.  The food is great. Wait time was just what they said. The pizza was bake perfect and the topping was perfect.  You know you get toppings at some places and you say where's the toppings. It was awesome. Go here if your in San Francisco.
author: Chris H.

description: I recently moved to the neighborhood and was missing my old pizza joint in the marina. I called in an order to Vito's one Friday night after a long week when I just wanted to chill and have some good pepperoni za. Good call. Vito's pizza is delicious. It was very quick, the sauce and cheese were in perfect proportions and it wasn't oily like some pizza I've had in the city. The prices are very reasonable too. Will be back for sure - need local neighborhood places like this to stick around!
author: Chris S.

description: Pizza was ok. Barely any toppings. We asked for no onions and it was as if we said no toppings instead. Delivery took an hour when they said 40 minutes. Pizza was warm by then.
author: Chanette K.

description:
Absolutely horrible. It's a tourist spot since it's right in the heart of Union Square. Walked in and waited in line and was planning to order a pie to go. Woman behind the counter was discussing the menu with a couple for what seemed to be 15 minutes (they were asking about every single dish). When they finally finished, another customer walked right in and the cashier just took their order immediately. She completely ignored me waiting there for so long. So I walked out to find something better...

Upon walking around the area for another pizza place to no avail, I decided to return because I was really just craving pizza...

I ordered a "one large plain pie" to go. After waiting about 25 minutes for the pie to be done (I went down to Walgreens and did some shopping in-between), I picked up the pizza brought it back to our hotel and if had EVERYTHING on it: onions, olives, meat, etc. Had to go all the way back to return it. Turns out she also charged me for all the toppings. She gave me the extra money I paid back.

I had a really bad experience. This place thrives on tourists hungry for pizza since it's the only close place near by. It wouldn't last anywhere else based on food (not great) and service (terrible). It was a really unfortunate way to spend my last night in San Francisco.
author: Marissa S.

description: Saturday night had a line out the door always a good sign. This is a great neighborhood Pizza Parlor/ Restaurant. The pizza crust was perfect & the sauce was just right. My wife had the Spaghetti with the Meat Sauce. She cleaned the plate. Uncle Vito's is a what a San Francisco restaurant should be.
author: Peter G.

description: Thx Yelp! Once again you found us the perfect place for dinner. I'd definitely recommend this place to my friends
author: Patrick D.

description: My friends told me about this place a while ago so I decided to join them today during lunch. I ordered the turkey sandwich and for $6.50 it was huge and pretty good. Pretty hard to mess up a turkey sandwich. My friend ordered his favorite meatball sandwich and I wish I had too! It was so good. I definitely want to come back and try their pizza and salads!
author: Kassie E.

description: Fav pizza spot in the city...especially for delivery. Crust is perfect -- not too thick, not too thin. Delivery is always pretty fast, and the delivery guy always comes up to my apartment door (instead of just waiting at the lobby like other delivery services). Overall, great pizza and great service - haven't eaten more pizza anywhere else in SF! Outside of SF, my fav pizza spot is Waterfront in Foster City in case you ever find yourselves in the area (order the Moussaka pizza).
author: Mohamed A.

description: I really like this pizza place.  Great pizza and the best place in the city to get it IMO.  All items on the menu are good.
author: Angelique G.

description:
Our pizzas were delicious.  The salads were yummy and  fresh.  They accommodated our special requests.  The waiter was attentive and friendly.   
But there is more.... the owner deserves a standing ovation and he deserves everyone in SF to frequent  his establishment.  Let me explain...my son left his jacket at the restaurant.  We only realized this after we were home 400 miles away!   After calling we found out they had the jacket.  The owner personally called me and mailed the jacket to our house.  I Venmo him money for postage with extra for  my appreciation.  To my surprise he Venmo me back the extra amount!  What a great guy!!!!  
Support local business and kindness.  You can't go wrong and won't be sorry!!!
author: Heather H.

description: The order took forever. We were two people and our two orders got ready 45 mins apart and after all these stories my order was wrong. They ended up not charging me for my pizza. But still very disappointing.
author: Scheherazade A.

description:
Garlic bread w/cheese: very average. Kind of like the French bread you buy at the market w/a few slices of mozzarella on top. Wasn't spectacular or particularly outstanding. Not bad- just average. Skip. 

Cheese ravioli- the breaded part was really underwhelming. Not fully coated w/breading, and the breading wasn't really crispy. Soggy ravioli w/mildly crispy breading. The ravioli wasn't flavored very well, & the only thing that had some flavor was the thin marinara that came with it. Skip.
author: Charlene S.

description: Decent food and service. It was convenient for us based on our hotel. The staff wasn't to keen on our needs and never checked on us to see how were doing.
author: Henry V.

description:
I was in town for a conference and found this spot a few blocks from my hotel.  The pizza was pretty darn good and Amy was very friendly and helpful.  I'm not sure why other reviewers trashed their level of service... I was treated very well.  The only negative attitudes that I saw came from the customers asking for slices, rather than a whole pizza.  I'd go back again.

There was some serious pizza-envy when I strolled through the St. Francis lobby with all of that garlicky goodness wafting through the air.
author: Kirk T.

description:
Solid pizza choices. At a good price. Everything they had on the burners smelled and looked  fantastic!
I was getting takeout, but I liked the cozy atmosphere. I'd definitely dine in.
author: M G.

description:
The food, I'm a fan of. The service seemed to be lacking a bit. 
A few friends + a baby came by on Saturday around 2 for lunch. The place is pretty small, but it wasn't full. No one greeted us when we walked in, despite the kitchen being next to the front door. We had to ask/repeat ourselves about 5 times, stating there were 4 adults plus a baby. 5 times! We even pointed out an open table that could accommodate us and we still got some questioning looks- very weird. 
Anyhow, we were offered a high chair and seated. As stated, the place is small so the tables are pretty close together. 
The first thing I looked at on the menu was wine, and for $2.75 a glass, count me in! Well, count me in either way, but that price is a steal. We ordered a few items for the table to share and they came out pretty quick. One member ordered a sandwich but didn't get fries; we looked at menu and only the burgers came with fries- we thought that was odd. We did have to ask for napkins a few times as well before we got them. 
The food was pretty good, the greek salad, minestrone soup and pizza were all delish.
author: Sarika S.

description: Im going two stars. Ordered the meat calzone. While It was togo, I felt it lacked flavor, the bottom was a thick layer of flour. Not consistent with the expected hand tossed amount. This was clearly in error. A thick layer coated the entire base. Calzone was wattery and runnny. When you're looking for a "cheat" meal, in my opinion, you want it to be spot on. I want those calories to count towards a GREAT meal. Uncle Vito! Step your game up son!
author: Brian W.

description: This is literally my favorite place to eat at in the city. It seriously is better than the fanciest rooftop restaurant that you can think of. I always order a cheese pizza when I come and recently I tried the fettuccine alfredo pasta and now I'm just going to have to always order both! SO GOOD. The only downside is there is extremely limited seating so try to only come with one other person if you want to sit down and eat, you will be more likely to a get a table sooner. Can't wait to go back again!
author: Sophia K.

description:
I was in the area and decided to get a small pepperoni pizza.  I've had Uncle Vito's bookmarked for years and never had a chance to try them until today. 

The pizza is okay. This is one of those places you may remember due to its location and say "that pizza wasn't bad"...but they're not worth going out of the way for. 

In all honesty...I'm writing this because I will probably forget that I've been here. I'll check yelp to see the reviews and then see mine...

So this is a warning to my future self.

You've been here. It was okay. Enter if you're drunk/stoned and need greasy carbs. Go elsewhere if you still have a strong sense of taste.
author: Zoran L.

description: Really delicious Greek pizza and Sierra Nevada for $3.50. I highly recommend a visit.
author: Benjamen H.

description:
We got lucky and didn't have to wait for a table for two. 
Crust was amazing. Crust was Sweet. Service was a bit slow but worth it.
author: Rahim R.

description: Pizza was okay, but absolutely terrible service. From the minute we walked in the door, we felt like we were bothering the workers to eat there. Once we were seated, waitress got our drink orders immediately and wanted us to order, umm we just got the menu. She then brought out drinks but did not return until we asked the other server to order. Then once our food came, the waitress began being too attentive, in trying to get us to leave. Would not recommend for dine in at all, takeout maybe, but place your order ahead of time.
author: Angie F.

description: So after a few strike outs at different places, we final walked into a local neighborhood Italian restaurant.  Uncle Vito's is a GREAT option.  Not only was the food fresh and delicious, but the bill came out to under $30!   The service was quick and very friendly. Definitely will make this a must do when we're in San Fran.  Enjoy!
author: Patrick D.

description:
Omg!!!! Their Pesto Cheese ravioli is to die for & only $8.75 but it fed two of us! Creamy pesto sauce is so rich and creamy!
We started with the chicken Caesar salad but the chicken was tough!!! that's one reason why I did not give this place five stars. The Caesar dressing  itself was delicious. We also started with half a carafe of white wine for $5.75! So we each got almost 2 glasses of wine for under three bucks each! That's a deal!
This is a small  place but super cute, & great food. The only thing that is left to be desired our waiter. Not super friendly nor helpful but the food makes up for it!
author: Carmela S.

description: I've gotten uncle vito's to go a few times and it's been pretty consistent each time. I'm a fan of their crispy crusts, but I feel like their dough is always slightly undercooked on my orders. The pizzas and calzones I've tried are always super soggy towards the middle and end up falling apart. I would come back more if the entire pizza could be crispy like their crusts are.
author: Estelle C.

description: With numerous seats available it took the wait staff over 15 minutes to recognize we were waiting for a table. Just recognizing a customer is basic service essentials. Once the food came, it tasted like day old dominos pizza. The beverage I ordered never came and the entire experience was just horrific. If you like being treated like shit and want even shittier pizza, by all means go to Uncle Vito's Pizza.
author: Joseph Y.

description:
Went here with my GF (Vegetarian) while on vacation in SF.

This is a small little place like most in and around the Union Square area. When we went at around 8p.m. on a Friday night it was packed with a line out the door, to be expected... 

We decided to order a pizza to go and just eat back at our hotel room only a block and a half away to get away from the crowds. Upon looking at the menu they had a great selection of Pizza and deciding which one to order was fairly difficult because they all sounded so good! 

We ended up ordering a large Pesto Pizza to go, due to the larger crowd of people in line and ordering food the pizza did take a little while to be prepared, right around 30 minutes. When we received it, it was so difficult not to just devour the entire pizza while walking back to the hotel because it smelled amazing! It ended up tasting even better than it smelled...

For the price, which was somewhere around $20.00 it was worth the money. The ingredients tasted very fresh and the crust had a crunch that led to a soft center. Would definitely go back the next time I am in the area
author: Taylor F.

description:
Looking for a late night snack, I decided to head to Uncle Vito's for a Calzone before they closed. I ordered a medium 12" for 17 dollars and change to go. Wait was about 15 minutes or less even as they seemed to have a bit of a full house. 

Pros- ingredients( cheese, pepperoni, salami, mushrooms) were flavorful and dough was crispy on top, short wait, open late, great location to see passing cable cars while you wait.

Cons- dough could use a pinch more salt to my liking, wish they had a bar area to drink a beer while I waited for my order.

If I come back to SF I would definitely head back here for a Calzone.
author: DR R.

description: Great crust, great sauce, good toppings and decent price.  Call ahead and pick up in 15 minutes.
author: Jennifer H.

description: If your drunk and looks N.J. for food then come here. If you've ever had excellent NYC pizza,then this place doesn't compare. I was sad because with Vito's great reviews I thought it would be good. Unfortunately I think it's just good for the neighborhood. Crust is too thick and nothing special.
author: Sara B.

description: Such a good local pizza and sandwich shop. Meatball sub...crazy good, pizzas were good as well, service was quick and efficient. Prices as reasonable as you will find in SF.
author: Patrick B.

description:
A hidden gem of SF. We walked from our hotel
In Union Square and it was well worth it. The seating is limited but the food is great and the prices are even better. We went in December of 2016 and my daughter still talks about this place.
author: Beth I.

description: I ordered delivery and the pizza box was soggy and almost falling apart. I'm guessing it was steam from other pizzas because it wasn't raining. The actual pizza (bacon) was alright and I should have stuck with their pepperoni which is usually better.
author: Alejandro L.

description:
I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and had them delivered. They were disgusting and tasted like
elementary school cafeteria spaghetti. Don't order this item. They were gross. I only give the second star because they were cheap and delivery was quick.
author: Rebecca S.

description: The go to place for pizza take out and delivery. I always order the large Mountain pizza. Delivery takes about 35-45mins. You can pay credit card upon delivery.
author: Kath S.

description: This place has once again disappointed... I yearn for this place to deliver on basic customer service... It failed once again. I've had good meals here, and I begged them to get basic customer service... Alas, service still sucks!
author: Tomas S.

description:
I came here on a Friday night with a few friends. We were waiting to meet other friends so we decided to get a quick bite to eat. We ordered our food to go. I got a simple personal size pepperoni pizza and my friend got spaghetti. 

We got our food and found out our friends were running late. So we asked to eat our food inside. The waitress with the blonde hair (didn't catch her name) said we could not since we ordered to go we couldn't dine-in. We decided it was okay and we'll eat in their to-go section. But then it became too difficult because my friend ordered spaghetti. -__- So we saw two empty tables and asked the waitress if we could sit there for a bit, she again denied us. 

We decided to just leave because it didn't seem like she didn't want to help us even though we were paying customers (we tipped too). So we asked her for some Parmesan and she said "All to-go orders have to be helped over there" and pointed to the cashier area. Then walked away. No one was at the cash register so we had to bug a chef to help us. 

I was very disappointed in my service at Uncle Vito's. The waitress was extremely rude to us. We left and ended up eating on a stoop we found and the food was just not enjoyable at all. The pizza was extremely greasy, like those cheap pizzas they gave you in high school cafeterias. And the spaghetti had a very strong taste to it. It was not good. My friend and I could not finish our food and we were HUNGRY. Not a very good experience. Never coming back.
author: Meliza M.

description: Pizza was delicious. Ordered a personal size with Pepperoni and sausage, crust was thin with a good crisp to it and plenty of cheese. Also ordered the Greek salad which came with plenty of feta cheese. Table service was great, server was nice. It is a Small dine in area, so came before the dinner rush and got seated right away. Great price for a good portion of food, can easily share the pizza and salad between two people.
author: Rubi L.

description: I'm not sure why this place is so popular probably because of the location and they get ton's of tourists.  The pizza is mediocre at best, I used to live down the street from here and that's the only reason I would go.  Nothing to rave about, I did enjoy seeing the "twins of SF" eating there quite a bit in the window back in the day. It's an ok spot but really there are much better pizza joints to check out in SF and I know my pizza!
author: Tina T.

description: Came across Uncle Vito's Pizza in search of dinner on New Year's Eve.  Was NOT disappointed.  Fantastic nosh.
author: Leanne M.

description: Excellent food!  Pizza was great as was the chicken pesto fettuccini.  Very delicious.
author: Jan S.

description: I had this two days ago and forgot to post a review and here it is. The decor inside was okay. They had pictures of the events that happened in San Francisco and more. All the food was homemade and it tasted amazing! Service didn't take that long. The prices were good not expensive or too cheap. Great for the whole family! So, when you want pizza in the bay area stop by at Uncle Vito's Pizza!
author: Kylie Q.

description: I don't know what the hype about this pizza place is all about. We waited for about 45 miniature for a small pizza, which the dough was very bland tasting as well as the pizza sauce. The waiter was rude and never filled our empty drinks. What a waste of time and money. I will give zero stars if I could.  I miss Blondie's pizza!
author: The Critic 1.

description:
You know that phrase, 'never judge a book by it's cover'? Well it couldn't be more true on this occasion. This is your typical Yelp story! By that I mean that if you walked by this pizza joint you might just keep on walking but if you have your trusty Yelp app in hand then you'd see it had a pretty spectacular rating and a shed load of reviews!

Based on what other reviewers said we decided to spend our Friday Night in San Fran munching on pizza at Uncle Vitto's!

We walked in without a booking and were seated at the window almost immediately. It's definitely a tight squeeze, they've managed to cram about eight tables in to the small space. Expect to be bumping in to the person sat behind you. 

The whole atmosphere is extremely authentic, on one occasion I heard plates smashing from the open plan kitchen and some Italian expletives bellowing out - it sounded like a soundbite, but I loved it!

The pizza was a work of art, you know when you lift a slice of pizza and it's not too heavy so it doesn't automatically fold but the cheese sticks to the base creating huge, delicious strings desperately clinging on to the remaining slices........you're drooling aren't you?  

Stop drooling and get to Uncle Vitto's! You'll wish you were part of the family so you could be privy to their secret pizza making skills!
author: Stevie M.

description:
We have to visit this place first time. We ordered a pizza and waiting it for 25 minutes. Our table was located close to the open window. I closed it after that waiter was coming and said angry why're u closing it? It was really cold outside and we came in for become hot and have some food. The forks wasn't clean perfectly. 
Also I would like to add review food. We ordered a calzone pizza. It was fresh and tasty amazing. Thanks for kitchen guys.
author: Alex B.

description:
Open windows that let the summer breeze into this restaurant adorned with photos and portraits of a San Francisco past puts the charm of this place front and center. 

The pizza isn't half bad either, it's almost a New York style thin crust. They serve pints of Sierra Nevada for under $4 which is a bargain in my book.

The staff isn't really friendly but efficiently seats and serves which is what is important to me. Would recommend to anyone in Nob Hill.
author: Sam C.

description: I only gave this 2 stars because even though the salad I got was fresh and the place was cozy and packed in a sudden weather change night, i was supposed to have a half red eye and half Hawaiian.  I think I got the red eye on one half but on the other half, the Hawaiian, was supposed to be ham, pineapple and green pepper; I got cheese (gobs and too much gobs of it) without anything Hawaiian on it at all. Their Greek salad was huge and fresh but after I walked to my hotel which was a few steep uphill blocks in freezing windy weather, found out the pizza was ridiculously wrong, I couldn't go back. I really wanted to like this place. I visit from la all the time and I finally was staying close enough to try them... maybe I had a new guy making the pizza?
author: Meghan D.

description: I wanted easy dinner so I ordered medium Pepperoni Pizza. I was very surprised by the flavor. I am not even a pizza fan, but I ate every bite of that pizza. It was cheesy, "garlicky", and crust was perfect. This place gets very busy so call ahead.
author: Diba T.

description: Staying at a hotel a few blocks west of Chinatown, there are a lot of restaurants that specialize in feeding tourists. However, most, I have found, are just slinging sustenance for a high price, that's little better than microwaved food from a gas station. I was very happy to find Uncle Vito's Pizza. The hand made pizza was great. We like the area and will definitely be back.
author: Joseph J.

description: Had dinner here while in San Francisco teaching.  I like to try different pizza places wherever I am, and just happened by Uncle Vito's.  The location is easy, near Union Square, but is was not touristy.  And while not "fancy", it was comfortable and relaxed.  The service was great, prompt and helpful, and the pizza was great, a nice crust with actual flavor, great red sauce and ingredients with real flavor!
author: George W.

description:
A definite SF staple. I have passed this place a million times and finally checked it out. I LOVED it. The pizza was amazing and the fettuccine alfredo was just as good. My friend ordered a grilled chicken salad and even that was delicious. I consider myself a pizza connoisseur and this is on my list of top 5 pizza places. The service was very delightful and pleasant. 

There was nice crowd of people new and regulars with that SF city feel.
author: Edie R.

description:
Easy place for a quick lunch. Love how everything is made fresh (and you watch them make their dough through the window!)

For $22 dollars you can easily feed 3 people. Food is good but not overwhelming phenomenal that you'd have to come dine again. Still better than a lot of pizzerias I've tried in San Francisco.

I wish the place was more spacious. It was a little difficult to be seated properly without bumping into the guest dining on the tables next to us.
author: Ida H.

description: Good food at good price (for San Francisco especially) good service and was quick but not rushed.  Had chicken linguini.   Relaxed.  Like all good Italian places not fancy but very good for casual meal.   Feels like a local neighborhood place.
author: Karl S.

description:
Love their Red Eye thin crust pizza, pepperoni, red onion & roasted red peppers.
Place is small so we order for pickup or delivery whenever we crave pizza.
author: Charles C.

description: Tiny place, but we had a lovely night sharing pizza and salad and a glass of the house wine at affordable price. Would definitely go back to try more things from the menu!
author: Cristina M.

description: Exactly what I was wanting. Yum. New York style pizza. Crust was 'crunchy' on outside and chewy on the Inside with really nice flavor. Sauce was good too. We created our own..sausage pepperoni and mushroom... and they deliver!!! The brought right to our hotel room. Loved that. Would have given 5 stars but the forgot the sausage, but still delish. Reasonably priced too.
author: Krista M.

description: Service and waiters are extremely rude. Walked a mile from my hotel with my family to this place because we heard great things. We were a group of 10 people. The place was pretty full but there were 2 tables of 5 that were clearly open. They refused to accommodate us and seat us no matter how much we convinced them. We even suggested we sit upstairs (there are tables upstairs) but they kept saying no and giving us attitude. It was clear they wanted us to leave.  Never dealt with such rude customer service before, karma goes a long way.
author: Jessica R.

description: Nice place to eat, but the waiter was very unkind!! The food taste very good and it is much
author: Steve J.

description:
5 stars for the service from Amy. 

3.5 stars for the food - it was okay- I ordered the meat lasagna that came with side salad and garland c bread and order a glass of house wine (2.75). It all hit the spot for a late lunch.  

5 star for the bill - $18 with tip!!

A busy corner shop with only 12 2 top tables but very quaint and worth the price, service and food.
author: Cathy B.

description: Absolutely horrible food. My mom, brother and I ordered some pretty simple dishes, spaghetti marinara, ravioli marinara and spaghetti meatballs. We literally had to fish our pasta out from the ocean of sauce they put on the plate. It wasn't even good sauce. Not to mention the service was pretty dismal waited quite a long time to order even drinks. Super over rated. Go somewhere else for some good Italian food.
author: Rachel V.

description: Consistently the best pizza I have ever had in San Francisco! Salads are fantastic! I highly recommend the Caesar salad and add chicken. It's not crappy pre-made frozen chicken. It's an actual chicken breast which they cook right there on the grill. Definitely worth the money! Sometimes, it can be tricky placing an order, depending who is working. But I have to say that special mention should go to Martin, Jaime and Jose! They always make my experience extra fun with how truly helpful they are every time I see them! Uncle Vito's is fantastic!
author: Peter C.

description: Boring pizza. Not bad, but the crust seemed to be rolled out with no good rise or texture. Sauce tastes like kids sauce; too sweet and pasty consistency. Lady is nice but doesn't care. Fun to eat at the window and look at the street.
author: Rad F.

description: Wow!!! This place is the BOMB! Delicious & cheap in San Fran?! IMPOSSIBLE!! House wine, pasta, pizza, cheesecake! All of it YUM!
author: Tracie P.

description:
They should be embarrassed they call this pizza.  Yes, it was 1014pm on a Tuesday, however they close at 11. Since they refused to sell us slices, we decided to order a pie. Liked the place, hole in the wall from the 70s....even made a joke about no food critics, and now I know why.

The order was simple a medium cheese pizza to go you think they would take our money happily and send us on our way.......but the owner was tired and a total sour puss.  Still not worth one star, but notable.  However, this is where we go downhill fast. So here we have the top ten of crap thanks Vito!
1) the crust was still raw
2) tasted like uncooked pita bread
3) the slice was BARE after you lift it
4) wasn't cut at all
5) sauce was slapped on
6)oily beyond compare 
7) insane amounts of cheese
8)bottom completely soggy
9) no flavor
10) threw out all of it minus 6 bites

And to make matters worse, we are less than an hour later and I am beyond sick. Embarrassed for my previous yelpers. Want my $$ back and my intestines cleared.
author: Alex R.

description:
I live 2 blocks away and this place always hits the spot whether I want a meatball sandwich, pasta of sorts, or a personal size pizza.

A very big part of me doesn't even want to write bc I don't want them to increase their prices or it to get too busy. Selfish... I know. Just not trying to blow up a neighborhood spot.
author: Viet N.

description: Stopped here on a work trip with some coworkers. The food was pretty good. Service was rather slow. We were done eating and waiting for quite a while for our bill. The space is cramped, so not ideal for larger groups. We went in the evening, but probably would be a good stop for lunch.
author: Alicia S.

description: Ordered a cheese pizza for delivery. Should have just gotten a frozen pizza from the grocery store - that would have been better. Tasted like cafeteria pizza - flat, bland, greasy.
author: Chris S.

description: Took a chance on Uncle Vito's Pizza while staying in San Francisco. The pizza was good and we enjoyed it. They told us 90 minutes for delivery, but we had pizza in 60.
author: Larry R.

description: Great food, service and value. Pretty much unheard of in any other tourist setting. Go!
author: Dave K.

description: We wanted a night in at our hotel and Uncle Vito's Pizza was recommended. Very good pizza. Our favorite was The Red Eye. If you're looking for good pizza that's a big step above the chains for delivery this fits the bill.
author: Greg H.

description: Absolutely some of the best pizza i've ever had. Super small place but the pizza was incredible and affordable! MUST COME TO THIS PLACE!!!
author: Emily S.

description:
We wanted a simple late evening bite near Union Square and Yelp led us Uncle Vito. We had to wait an hour, but it was fun chatting up others in line. There are few tables, only eight, I think.  When seated we were well-served by a lovely waitress.  We found the pizza to be delicious and the salad was amazing... loaded with yummy treats like kidney beans and garbanzo beans and olives and beets... loved it. 

The house Chianti was smooth and delicious and amply served.

The restaurant was very busy, take-outs really kept the cooks hopping. It was fun to watch the cooks as we waited for a table. They must be exhausted at the end of the day!  Even with all the hubbub, the restrooms were clean.
author: Linda B.

description: Good Service. We shared the 16 inch calzone. It was delicious and cooked perfectly. This is a popular spot for take out and eat-in. Would definitely return.
author: Kay R.

description:
Fresh pizza in the square!!!
Five stars for just that
Great location 
And they deliver?!
I ordered a pizza but all the other food looks good
author: Kelly A.

description:
This is highly recommended pizza joint in the Nob Hill area and by the wait (well over an hour on a Thursday night at 7:30 to dine in at one of the handful of tables they have crammed in an unimpressive, rather dingy, building), I expected to be wowed.  

Maybe it was all the hype, but my veggie calzone fell flat.

It was bland...in fact, it had almost no taste, the artichoke hearts were hard and sharp, and the dough was soggy.

We waited a full 30 minutes for take out, were treated rudely by wait staff while we jockeyed for standing room in the tiny restaurant and we're pretty disappointed in the overall quality of the food we received after all of the waiting.  

Our meal was definitely not worth the wait.
author: Lucky S.

description: My wife and I were looking for a place to eat in San Francisco and I really don't know how we came up with this place. We got here and it was still closed, but we decided to wait. About 20 minutes later they opened the door and let us in. BEST PIZZA WE HAVE EVER HAD! I will be going back to San Francisco soon just for the pizza.
author: Roberto A.

description:
Amazing food , great salad & piza , and 
Patricia amazing women  and she is lovely serve and nice Love this place very recommend
author: Maya M.

description:
DON'T USE THIS GREASY JOIN! I work at a high-end hotel on Union Sq so we recommend this joint, because it's close, but I removed all their info that's  on anything we have it on at work, & I called the concierges at my neighboring hotels to do the same because they're just in it for the money! I'd stopped recommending 'em years ago but forgot 'til l ordered 2 days ago. 

I ORDERED: sun-dried tomatoes on my pizza, and a Coke.
I GOT: Chopped tomatoes & a Pepsi!

THAT'S 100% TYPICAL OF THEM. I couldn't complain because they delivered at 11p, and they close at 11p.

They Stink!!
author: Louisa V.

description:
A local hotspot. The line was out the door. Service was extremely efficient. We ordered an antipasto, I have to say the weirdest antipasto we ever had:  kidney beans and garbanzo beans tons--a few pieces of meat and drowning in dressing. 
Ordered 2 pizza, pesto and a Greek. Both ok, boring spices. I think it's just a matter of taste, we like spices and the food was bland.
author: Johnnie L.

description:
Was really looking forward to eating here but leaving severely disappointed. The food was below average and the service made it even worse.

The place was completely empty when we walked in at 4 pm. The waitress would not allow us to sit at a table for four. And she was rude about it. 

Save your money and time!
author: Mary A.

description: We got delivery which was pretty good considering how much we had ordered. What we didn't realize was that the portions would so generous and huge. The calzone was pretty good to try if you are craving anything greasy. The sandwiches were pretty generous and delicious considering the cheaper price. The garden burger was pretty good, a lot of fries served along with it. Lasagna was pretty greasy and oily. Overall not too bad.
author: Elizabeth N.

description: Terrible costumer service. I usually enjoy this experience but this time when I ordered, my pizza was not ready at the specified time. They told me to come back in 10 minutes. When I called in ten, they told me that they hadn't started on the pizzas yet and they gave me some attitude when I expressed disappointment. Then when my roommate went to pick up the pizzas the second time they gave him even more attitude. They need to fire some employees in my opinion. Not going back.
author: Nate R.

description:
Delicious classic Italian food, mom's and pop's atmosphere, great value and good service.

My wife and I split the small Bianco pizza and the fettuccine siena.  The pizza crust was soft but crunchy, toppings were fresh.  The fettuccine was perfect.

I highly recommend this to resturant.
author: Dante G.

description: I came with my family on a Friday evening around 7pm and just waited for 20 minutes. We had a medium "mountain" pizza, a medium calzone, a grilled chicken breast salad, and a grilled chicken breast fettltucine. Everything was super delicious and fresh. When I come back to San Francisco I will definitely be coming here again.
author: Cynthia G.

description: Pasta was watered down so lost flavor in the meat sauce and your employee is rude, questioning your customer when asking for sides and to go boxes is quite rude. Especially when your being specific in what you want..
author: Daniel M.

description:
Uncle Vito's has been a carby staple in my life ever since my good-ish old elementary school days at a nearby school. After a mean school day or a long day in the city, a slice at Vito's has been the gooey, cheesy fix for me and my family.

THE HIGHLIGHTS.
+ Cute, quaint little pizza joint serving up nothing but the good stuff
+ Solid Italian food, especially their Mountain House combo
+ Great place for a low-key hangout 
+ Reasonably priced for the awesome serving sizes you get
~ Parking can be a no-go, you're best off in lot across from the NDV church

I'll admit, I don't make it out to Uncle Vito's too often these days, but they hold a fond place in my heart, for sure!
author: Claire S.

description: Love places like this.  Just far enough away from union square.  Good pizza and very good service.  Wait staff is friendly.  I love pizza and there's was very good.  I got the personal combo with a side salad.  Flavor was great and crust came out very good.  Good amount of toppings as well.
author: John R.

description:
Went in for some pasta - way too many cooks in the kitchen and only 1 person serving customers. I asked for Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken - I got it with chicken, mushrooms and broccoli.  Was not very good, broccoli was way over cooked, pasta was way ovee cooked - 

Doubtful I will return -
author: Sean G.

description:
OK,so this review is long over due!
I have been eating here since the eighties, and the food is consistently delicious!
I would typically enjoy a Greek salad, with feta, and of course Thier signiture dressing! 
But the one thing that always stands out, and can never be beaten, is the turkey avocado Swiss sandwich! My goodness.... Nothing is better.
I'm surprised that a food critic hasn't mentioned these in the past. I have eaten sandwiches all over the bay area, and nothing comes close.
author: Todd G.

description: This is a busy, loud, fun place to eat! Right on the world famous Cable Car line at Pine & Powell St.s The prices are quite reasonable considering the location, quality, and, quantity of food. It's typical pizzeria fare...that's what it is. I found the service, despite the chaos, was outstanding...for a pizzeria...friendly, attentive to requests, I wouldn't say quick...but I don't expect "quick" when the service staff has every table full. You do have PLENTY of other choices in this cool and safe neighborhood. The fact that I have been eating there since the '80's speaks to it's local support...our local support is huge. A local can choose from 7,000 places to eat so you had better be doing something special. I had the cheese burger and a soda...it comes with fries. It was fab! Cooked as I asked, fresh-that minute fries, with the tip...$12.50. You gotta be kidding me? Seriously...you can have a great, inexpensive meal and watch the Cable Cars go by...ding, ding, ding...then walk a block to the "Top 'O The Mark" and enjoy the best city view available to the public.
author: Rodney M.

description:
Food is good, service a little slow but OK. 
We went because of the reviews and the pizza is great, accessible prices and in walking distance from my hotel. They only had 1 waitress which made the service a little slow, but we didn't mind.

I would recommend Vito's pizza for a quick lunch.
author: Arlen S.

description: Vito's has been my go to pizza place for some time now. I love the mountain with extra sauce and a side of fries!
author: Adam T.

description:
I go occasionally on business trips to San Francisco. I am usually always trying out new places, but I tend to go back to this one.

Uncle Vito's is a simple, and to the point venue where you can enjoy authentic, rich and tasty pizzas. Wondering why there is almost always a queue to this place and seldom any space inside ? Wonder not anymore...

- Situated in a touristy spot (Powell St) but it's absolutely not a tourist trap. 
- You have to wait 15-20 minutes when ordering take away.
- The kitchen is exposed and you can see cooks in action and how pro they are
- Portions are generous and most importantly the ingredients are generously placed.
- Tip: if you want to avoid queues, come after 22.

Needless to say, you should try it out if you are considering visiting San Francisco!
author: Tom D.

description: Lovely little no fuss place with friendly staff, great pizza and very close to Union Square.  It was my first visit to SF and I lucked out with my first meal.  I went early, and when I left there was a queue to get in.  A great find!
author: Anthony V.

description: Horrible service and terrible pizza! I was surprised by the terrible service since there are so many other great pizza places close by! Go to Pizza Piraat instead. They are nice and the pizza is great!
author: Jonathan K.

description:
Pretty good spot, decent pies.  

Doesn't do slices, so not the best for a lunch spot unless you have a partner-in-crime with similar tastes.  Takes about 15 minutes to get a pizza (they cook it fresh).
author: Scottie B.

description:
Puts profit before customers.
I went there for dinner. When a small table opened up, the waiter wanted to give the table to a party of three that had arrived after me. When I pointed out that I had been waiting longer than the other party, he told me that he was just following orders. Apparently, management is more concerned about  their profit than their customers.
author: Thomas F.

description: Absolute worst service ever. Had to ask to be seated twice after standing at the front where it says "please wait to be seated" for 20-25minutes. The waitress (Amy) is EXTREMELY rude and will not bring anything you ask for, seems to only like male customers. This place is not worth the hassle or rude staff. Food tastes mediocre, could get better pizza else where.
author: Brittney B.

description:
Great Pizza , light crust and very flavoursome. The staff were prompt , knowledgeable and very friendly .
I visit San Francisco often with business and will come again .
author: Graeme M.

description:
Pizza is DELICIOUS and so fresh/homemade/authentic.

I strongly recommend going here if you're in town. You will NOT be disappointed.
