The people are friendly and down to earth. I love pizza and this place hit the spot.
Try the "Mountain Top" pizza which is very popular.
author: Kay M.

description:
Tucked on the corner with a tiny dining area and some space upstairs is the by far the best pizza I have had in San Fran. It gets pretty hectic and they probably need some more wait staff, but I understand why people line up and wait for the food.

The waiter took a long time to get to us as he appeared to be the only one there along with the owner (I assume). We put our order in and started with the fried ravioli. It was delivered in about 3 minutes and was fantastic. The cheese tasted like fresh mozzarella and not store frozen. If it wasn't made in house then I would be very surprised. 

I had half veggie and half cheese pizza and it was so good. The crust was just right, the cheese was fresh, and the veggies were great. My friend had the fettuccine Alfredo and she loved it. It looked creamy and rich on her plate. 

For San Fran the prices were awesome too. I would come back here on my next trip. It is hectic and chaotic and reminds me a NYC pizza joint.
author: Leslie D.

description:
Great pizza and pasta at reasonable prices.
My friend and I split a medium pepperoni pizza and the grilled chicken and broccoli fettuccine alfredo, and it ended up being around $25 with drinks. The pizza was good but not as good as the pasta, it was one of the best fettuccine alfredos I've ever had in my life. The staff was friendly and the restaurant was small but clean. 10/10 would recommend if you're in downtown!
author: Colette U.

description: Hidden gem near Union Square. Food was great ordered raviolis and calzone. Large portions. Just expect to wait as there are only a few tables inside. Many people were doing takeout orders as well.
author: Christal C.

description:
I can't comment on the service or atmosphere because I got this to-go, but based on the food alone, 5 stars, hands down! 

Old Fashioned Antipasto Salad: Given that there were only 2 of us eating, I had to laugh when I saw this salad--IT'S HUGE. This could have been our dinner in itself. For the price, I was in love with this salad that was full of protein and veggies. We ate it over the next 2 days and it was just as good as the first day. 

Calzone: I have never been a fan of calzones because they've seemed like a mouth-full of bread. This one has a delightful crust. At first, it looked like it might be thick and dry, but it was just the opposite. The choices of meat and cheese perfectly complimented the sauce. 

Fettuccine with Baby Clams: At first glance, I thought the sauce appeared thin and I prepared myself to add parmesan, salt, and pepper. Not necessary! This pasta was FULL of clams and the sauce was to die for. I'll be craving this in the future.
author: Susan G.

description: Always packed but totally worth it. Calzones are bomb. Call ahead and carry out to avoid the wait.
author: Mike R.

description: I was excited to eat here due to the reviews, but was not impressed with the food or service. I visited on June 5 2017, around 9:30p. I had the fettuccine alfredo and house salad. The alfredo sauce had an odd almost sour taste to it and lacked additional flavor or seasoning. The salad was drenched with dressing which over powered the salad greens and vegetables. Although yo we were seated fairly quickly, the server was not courteous,  seem preoccupied with other things, and checked on our table once.  Maybe I should have ordered the pizza which did look delicious. #betterlucknexttime
author: Eli G.

description: Staying at a nearby hotel. Called and ordered pizza...painless, walked two blocks to pick up pizza...painless, ate pizza...delicious! Staff friendly, and it was a busy Friday evening.
author: Richard H.

description: My rating is based on the service I received. It was quick and accurate as our waiter was polite. There was a line inside and outside the restaurant when we approached. However after a brief wait we were seated. Once inside it became obvious the line was a result of the restaurant size. It is ridiculously small and hard to get comfortable in the restaurant.   Upon approaching the restaurant I had high expectations. After dining there, I have no desire to return or order from there in the future.
author: S. D. B.

description:
This place was so delicious and reasonably priced that we ate here both of the two consecutive nights we were in town. Tiny opening to the restaurant and it gets crowded and there was a wait both times but SO worth it. 

Calzone was amazing and cooked perfectly. Not doughy inside at all like how calzones can sometimes be. 

Chicken Caesar was delicious and the marinated grilled chicken on top was so flavorful I got a portion to-go to give my dog who was waiting back at the hotel.

We tried two pastas, the pasta Siena, which had chicken, sundried tomatoes and pesto, and the spaghetti and meatballs. Both were amazing. 
Also, a carafe of wine for $9 doesn't hurt ;) 


10/10 would come here again when in San Francisco!
author: Ashley D.

description:
I am impressed!

I am new in town and walked past on my way home. I was starving and was not in the mood to cook so I thought why not.

I ordered the Mt Mountain and I must say this comes in my top 5 pizzas I have ever eaten.

Really nice tomato sauce base, really nice pizza base and nice toppings and it is not everly greasy or heavy either.

Looked like a busy place and you could see the guys making the pizzas were putting some love into each one they made.

I will be back that is for sure!
author: Stefan S.

description: It's really hard to find food in San Francisco after 10PM. Thankfully, this restaurant was open and available for take out. The pizza was very fresh and delicious. The location was extremely busy but they still had the pizza ready by the time they had promised. We ordered a small ham and pineapple. I definitely recommend this pizza spot.
author: Veronica H.

description: I was not impressed by this place. From the Yelp reviews I was so excited to go! Nothing about it was great, but it was OK. The pizza was average, the wine list was awful, the ambiance was standard. I would say it is probably better as a take-out location. Nice to it's there if I need to go, but I prefer other pizza places.
author: Makenzi B.

description: Great crust, good toppings, friendly take out guys, solid pie! Try the mountain - tasty with a cold beer, can't go wrong.
author: Mr C.

description: I'm trying not to make this my cheat spot every Sunday but that's how good they are. My favorite is the pesto pizza w/ sundries tomatoes.
author: Ashley D.

description: The pizza was really good. I recommend eating here. They have other food items to choose from. They are also reasonable in price.
author: Jeremy C.

description: Affordable and tasty eats near Nob Hill. Picky eater kid declared the Pesto Fettuccine the best ever. We stayed at a hotel nearby and appreciated the quick service and economical alternative. We did take out twice. We also had the calzone which was very good. My lasagna was meh, but huge. Side salad and Caesar salad were also good. They are crazy busy for eat in and take out.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Holy cow, if you are in this area and don't go to Uncle Vito's you aren't even living.  We stopped here because we missed lunch but weren't quite ready for dinner. We had the mountain pizza and now I dream about it on the regular. Seriously. Eat here. You will not be disappointed.
author: Rachael B.

description: Pizza was decent but nothing to write home about. The service was lacking. The waitress didn't have the greatest attitude and everyone seemed to have an issue with their order (wrong item, missing item, etc). I didn't like how soggy my crust was either. I would give it another chance though.
author: Chandler D.

description: Absolutely the worst service that we've experienced on our vacation. We've been to Uncle Vito's every time we've visited San Francisco. Our waitress couldn't have cared less about us, and she seemed annoyed by us having a couple of requests for our food. Goodbye Uncle Vito.
author: David R.

description:
Decent cheap food, Rude Service. 
I went in to get a table - they are overcrowded with people waiting ... a sign says "please wait to be seated."  I'm waiting several minutes before someone even acknowledges me. The waitress rudely berates me "can you out your name on the list!" (As if I was supposed to know there was even a list). She points to a tiny pad of paper sitting on the counter near the kitchen.  

Hey Vito's- 1) in a normal restaurant a hostess or waitress might say (with a smile) "welcome to uncle Vito's sorry for the wait!  Could you please put your name on that list over there?"  This waitress acted like I was in her way instead of a paying customer. She acted like I should have known to put my name on a list when there was no sign to tell me a list even existed.  

2) if you're going to have customers sign up on a list,  put up a sign that says "please sign our list and we will be with you in a moment."  Maybe or a dry-erase board on the wall that is easily visible instead of a tiny pad of paper on the kitchen counter. 

3) tell your waitresses to be nicer to customers. 

This is the third time I've had service problems in this place.
author: Frank R.

description: The pepperoni pizza was excellent, New York style thin crust was better than average. The pizza price was fair and the wine tasted great for the price. The dinning area was in need of serious renovation and the server wasn't attentive. The pizza and wine helps you get over that part a bit.
author: Doug B.

description: Best pizza I've ever had hands down! Small, family friendly location. Great service and menu has a variety of Italian dishes.
author: TSwizzle 3.

description:
This restaurant was just down the street from my hotel, so I tried it out. They were busy and no tables were available, but the hostess promised only a 15 minute wait.  At 15 minutes exactly, I was seated. The waitress quickly appeared with a menu and returned after an appropriate time to take my order.

While the restaurant has a reputation for good pizza, I ordered linguini with pesto sauce.  The food was served in less time than I would consider average.  The sauce was a creamy pesto and quite good. Prices across the board on the menu were more than reasonable, so there is good value for the money spent.

The only criticism (and the reason for deducting one star) is regarding wine. First, they ran out of the house red wine. Come on guys! This is an Italian restaurant.  You don't run out of the house wine. Second, the house wine is a burgundy. Again, this is an Italian restaurant. Serve an Italian wine!
author: Tony L.

description: You can see why Uncle Vito's pizza is so crowded--great intimate ambiance; fantastic Nob Hill location; close to a wide variety of things to do. However, the food will immediately get you obsessed. The pizza is out of this world. The Greek salad is packed with the freshest ingredients. The meatballs will make most San Franciscans forget their obligatory smart phone in hand!
author: Eric P.

description:
This place is pretty good. The food would disappoint someone visiting the city to go out to dinner but as an SF downtown staple, it is superb. I always order a salad and garlic bread on late nights when I don't have time to cook. They haven't changed their prices since the 90's. The pastas are salty and excellent. The pizza isn't half bad either. The deliveries are quick. All around good SF landmark. I get the creamy pesto linguini. Greek salad. Pizza with whatever on it. I've even ordered the burger a couple of times. I hope this place stays open until I die.  
P.S.  Actually, it wouldn't disappoint if you were looking for something cheap and good. Go on a date night there. Get drunk on cheap wine and beer and get carbed-out.
author: Eden M.

description: Place is located in a great location in SF.  I have to say without a doubt that the pizza is delicious.  Definitely will return here again next time I'm in SF.
author: Mel P.

description:
Uncle Vito bakes a solid pizza, but he doesn't beat most average places in other cities and is no where close to the hallmarks of piedom (for that see my Homeslice London review.)

Don Vito deserves applause though for fresh veggies, copious meaty morsels, and fast service. His chambers also ain't too bad but I'm not gonna wax philosophique about 'em. It's yer standard pie place!

That's about it.

Why isn't this a top spot for the round wonderfulness? Mainly the dough. It was doughy and rather tasteless. Far from the flat, slightly-charred, rock-salted sublimity of NYC or Homeslice London pizzas. The cheese was also über plentiful, which some might like, but I enjoy tasting more than a mouse's fantasy on steroids.

So, overall, average pizza. Not worth a second trip, as I savor those moments traveling across town to find more rapturous round wonders.
author: Christopher M.

description: This pizza was definitely not worth the 2hr Wait. I figured it was was good pizza based on people who are actually from around here. To me this pizza was a 3 out of 10 at best. I gave them the address to my hotel and they got my room number wrong after I had to tell the same person three times because she had to put me on hold to ask someone else questions. I won't order from them again.
author: Matt F.

description: Delicious pizzas,well prepared,slightly pricey (I feel) and a bit slow service!We ordered a veg medium (3 slices each for a party of 2)pizza costing 17.40 including tax.
author: Pooja R.

description: Uncle Vito's is a divey, wonderful Italian joint. We got the lightly fried ravioli, which honestly was more delicious than the main dish, not that that was bad. We got the fettuccini Alfredo and Fettuccini Siena. Their homemade pesto is to die for. Definitely recommend.
author: Kevin B.

description: Such a delicious pizza place! You can tell the dough and ingredients are fresh. A little small for the seating area, bit it's nice and cozy. The food was good and the servoce.was good too.
author: Tiffany S.

description: By far the best food and the prices are unbeatable. We had the meat calzone (huge!) great flavor, best mixture of everything. Also had the fried raviolis, delicious!! A must try when in SF
author: Tracy S.

description: I was trying to order a pizza. They put on hold twice for 10 minutes at a time. Finally took my info after 20 minutes  and they tell me that they don't deliver because we are to far. I live on 6th and Folsom and they are located on bush and Powell, a 10 minute or less drive. I don't understand. I guess they would rather deliver to a hotel rather a San Francisco resident!! You guys suck!! I will never recommend your establishment to anyone I know!!!
author: Archie O.

description: Uncle Vito's came through for us because we were at the tail end of our trip and we needed a quick meal. I'll look at the yelp reviews a notice that this place was highly rated. Since we hail from Chicago, we are pizza snobs so we have very high expectations for pizza. Uncle Vito's met our expectations of a great pizza place. Not only is this place great in San Francisco, this place could do great business in Chicago. When it comes to a good pizza, crust is everything at uncle Vito's crust was the perfect combination of soft and crunchy. My three-year-old son ate three slices of pizza and said this pizza is delicious. I agree with him and I felt that this place hit the spot at a time where we needed a good pizza place. If you are visiting the San Francisco area and you need your pizza fix I would recommend this place.
author: Terence W.

description: Delicious authentic Italian food at a good price. We ate every last crumb! Highly recommend
author: Kevin G.

description:
This place is the real deal and one I have on my priority list when I return to SFO. Had the Friti, calzone, and Caesar salad. I will crave this food until my next visit. 
Outstanding prices, food is just spectacular. 
Red sauce for the friti was amazing, the crust and fillings for the calzone were perfect - right amount of salty, sweet, light acid with fresh veggies and perfect meats. The Caesar salad was rally fresh with one of the best house made dressings I have ever had. 
You won't be disappointed!
author: Brian F.

description: We started with the Greek Salad that was complimented with garbanzo beans -- great dressing too.  Had a medium pizza with wonderful crust and fresh vegetable toppings.  Definitely recommend!  Reasonably priced as well.
author: Rose B.

description:
Good luck finding a parking spot nearby. 

We got lucky and only waited 15 minutes for a table. Staff was busting their chops. They were way under staffed and the place was tiny. All things considered, we still had a good meal at a good price. Thanks Uncle Vito.
author: Joe P.

description:
WORST FOOD!!!  NOTHING AUTHENTIC ITALIAN!!
4 of us ate here last night & the food looked ugly and tasted worse!!!
Pizza was like A frozen supermarket pizza - YUK!!  The Caesar salad was soaked with horrible dressing and cheap Parmesan cheese!!
2 of our part had pasta....totally over cooked & flooded with creamy sauces. 
NO Italians here.... FORGET IT!!
Also the front kitchen area looked dirty!!
Don't waste your money !!
author: Lili D.

description: Very very normal basic pizza. I would go to Costco next time to get this flavor. I was floored that the "foodies" of SF would give this place 4 stars and rave about it. If you look through my reviews I gave Domino's 2 stars because the flavor was about the same as this. This was just slightly better. I am so disappointed.
author: Roya A.

description: So this is my third time to visit this place and I was still impressed. I went here with my family last Sunday after church. We came at 11am and we were very surprised because they were still closed and I notice some crew in preparing to open and others were cleaning. They opened the door at 11:15 and we were very hungry. Food was perfect as well as the customer service.
author: Natasha R.

description: By far, the WORST experience ever!  We showed up and there was a party of 5 already waiting.   We are also a party of 5.  They told us to put our name on the list and we would get the wait time.  We were told 25 min wait time.  My husband and 3 kids were ok with that.  So we make the best out of waiting outside in the cool weather.  The people in front of us get sat about 30 min into our wait but about 10 min before one of the workers came out and told them they will be seated soon.  We didn't get the courtesy at ALL.  We waited about 40 min before going in and raising hell.  I stressed how long we had been waiting and they said we were next.   Well DUH!  we were the only party waiting outside now.  The whole time for about a half hour there was a table that could accommodate us sitting open with noone there.  The best part of this really crappy situation is a party of 5 show up close to our hour mark and get seated at THAT open table!  Oh hell no!  At this point my husband had already went in and ordered to go and was told 15 min for the food.  The food wasn't even on time!  These guys SUCK!  The service SUCKS!  the only slight good is the food but if you like really bad service then go for it.
author: Jackie A.

description:
Who would have thought Nob Hill had decently priced quality food? 

Uncle Vito's was a random spot my husband and I stumbled upon as we were walking through the neighborhood. He normally likes to order the daily special, while I toggle between a salad or their veggie burgers. The food is nothing spectacular, however the service is fast (if you can get a seat), and the prices are good for the area. This is our normal stop off as we walk home from work. Keep up the great work Uncle Vito!
author: Tracy C.

description: Service was frazzled. Waitress kept apologizing. It wasn't that busy. Food was soso.if you love heavy dressing on your Caesar salad, stale crust and flat soda, this is the place for you. However, the people were polite.
author: Andreas X.

description: Probably my favorite pizza in San Francisco! A nice cozy spot in Nob Hill. I've been here a few times and have always had good service.
author: Winston S.

description: The concierge at our hotel recommended us to head here if we wanted good pizza - and they were right. The salads were a nice size where three of us decently split a good Caesar salad. My sister got the veggie pizza with two vegetable substitutions and my mom and I split a three topping pizza. All the food was delicious and we were scraping our plates (which may have also been our hunger). The service was a bit slow and it seems like only one or two servers were on duty. It appeared that we had to remind our server we had ordered a salad.
author: Alex L.

description:
Great service and delicious pizza, the good reviews were dead on.
Fried fried cheese ravioli and pastas dishes were really good.
The server never wrote anything down, she remembered out order and  everything was perfect .
author: Gus L.

description:
Pizza was ok to average, inside was plain and bit sparse, good service from server !

Entrees looked good

Overall nothing special for a pizza only stop
author: Ed B.

description: We stayed at Hotel Abri and after a very long 20 hour day of traveling and sight seeing, we decided to order pizza for delivery. The delivery was fast, and the pizza was tasty. It has a nice crisp crust and we all enjoyed it.
author: Wendy Y.

description:
I was staying nearby so I walked over for dinner. I would have been happier if I had gotten takeout. The price is good for that part of town. The service is not. 

I ordered the house salad, veggie pizza, and a glass of the house red wine. The salad was fine,  the pizza was quite good. Everything was fresh. The house red was nothing special. Mine came in a warm glass which didn't help. 

The service is pretty bad. It's  a small place so waiting for a table was expected. The brusque manner of the person who greeted me, if you can call it that, and the person who gestured to my table wasn't appreciated. 

My waitress didn't come to my table for about 10 minutes. I think I saw her once more before my check came. My water wasn't refilled and she never checked to see if I needed anything.
author: Scott G.

description:
We first learned about Uncle Vito's several years ago while staying at our Worldmark by Wyndham timeshare that is located a block away.  We've always been treated well and enjoyed the food, so it's comforting to return for another round of pizza and beer.

I ordered a medium pepperoni pizza, since I was by myself, and a pitcher of Sierra Nevada (only other choice was Heineken).  I was in San Francisco for a one-day finance conference, while the family stayed home back in Orange County.

The pizza was prepared far sooner than I expected, even though the restaurant was pretty packed.  The pizza was served extremely hot, which was a little rough the first couple of slices, but at least that meant that the last slice I had was still warm and inviting.

The pizza had a thin layer of sauce, so that the focus was on the ingredients and the crust.

Uncle Vito's pizza has a crispy crust and plenty of cheese and pepperonis.  They did not skimp on the ingredients when preparing my meal.

The restaurant is a small location located along the Powell Street Car line near Union Square.  When you first walk in, the to-go register is right there, along with the pizza ovens and food prep stations.  Straight ahead are a couple of tables and the main dining area is to your left.  When things get really busy, there's another dining area upstairs with 4 tables, or room for about 10-12 people.

The prices are pretty good for a pizza joint in the middle of San Francisco, near a ton of tourists.  Uncle Vito's also offers many of the traditional Italian dishes you'd expect - like fettuccine, ravioli, and lasagne - as well as some basic burgers and sandwiches.

Although it make take a few days for my tongue to recover from how hot the pizza was, I definitely plan on returning for the taste of the pizza.
author: Lee H.

description: Food was good, however service was lacking idk if he always the server but he's not friendly and just takes your order and walks off. We ordered some waters and he said... "I know." The other staff was nice and food was good though.
author: Johanna B.

description:
This place is dimly lit and quaint.  When you walk in they ask if you're doing take out or dining in, if you're dining in, they seat you to left (which I think is the only seating area from what I remember).  Open kitchen and register on the right.

We got the medium 12" Pizza Pesto (came with basil pesto with sun dried tomatoes, red onions and black olives) with extra sausages.  The pizza was served piping hot and was cut into 6 slices... just the right amount of pizza if not plenty to share between 2 people that aren't too hungry.  The amount of black olives was surprisingly overwhelming.  x___x;;;  I personally HATE black olives, but my friend likes them, so we kept them in our order and I just picked them out individually.  The pesto sauce was very subtle (there was actually barely any sauce) and I honestly didn't taste too much of the pizza other than the olives.  :c  It was only when I bit into a side of my slice of pizza where I encountered the other toppings that I had a different sudden burst of flavor.  The pizza isn't anything spectacular, but it's certainly not bad.
author: Carena N.

description: We started off with a Caesar salad. The grilled chicken actually tasted grilled and the salad was nice and fresh. The calzone was very tasty and quite big! If you are looking for fresh pizza and friendly people give this place a shot!
author: Paul L.

description: We saw on Yelp that this place was highly recommended and it did not disappoint. Great pizza, the crust was thin, and there was lots of toppings. Prices were great and the appetizers were delicious (we ordered the fried ravioli, which came with homemade marinara sauce). Lots of menu choices to chow down on, not only pizza's but also other Italian food. We were seated pretty quickly, although there aren't too many seats, with only about 10 tables downstairs and then more tables  upstairs (although we did not look to see how many seats were up there). Even though every table was taken, we didn't have to wait long for our food, and the server was very attentive. Portions sizes are ample and I'd recommend it to anyone who likes good Italian food.
author: Alicia W.

description:
Wow what a great calzone they make. I can't wait to try their other dishes. I have tried a few places recently but they all PALE in comparison to Uncle Vito's. My calzone was filled last night with fresh every thing. I WILL be ordering again very soon. Prices aren't bad either. Thanks one and all for a great meal. Okay, update here. I had a chance to order their Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken, all I can say is WOW, you have to try this, it's almost like my Italian mothers who was unbelievable.  


Henry's


6/12/16 Update
I was in the hospital for 4 mos. fighting cancer, the whole time I craved Uncle Vito's. Finally upon discharge I had my chance to order and I jumped it. The food was spectacular as usual. I highly recommend Uncle Vito's. All of their dishes are FAB!
author: Henry F.

description:
I think I found my new favorite Italian restaurant in the city.  I know it's a very simple dish, but I'm a big fan of spaghetti and meatballs and they do It right.  A lot of places try too hard on something that should be easy and quick.  It also comes with a piece of French garlic bread that was perfectly toasted and not too much butter or garlic.  

It may be a small place but it tastes better than some fancy restaurants.  And like other reviewers said, they don't jack up their prices just because it's located in a tourist area.  Gonna come back when I can to try their pizzas.
author: Alfredo M.

description: I honestly should've read the yelp reviews more thoroughly because I was so disappointed in the pizza that I ordered from here. They do not sell pizzas by the slice so I had to order a small Mountain Pizza (basically a combo). The cashier told me the small had about 4 slices which I thought would be perfect since I was sharing with two other people. What could go wrong right? The place was packed and once I placed by order I waited about 25 minutes for my pizza which I took to go. When I opened up the box what I saw was literally the saddest looking pizza staring back at me. The small sized pizza was thin crust with sausages spread all over one half. You can tell it was rushed and there was zero effort put in. The slices were TINY it was more like a personal pizza. It seems like the 5 star reviews are referencing more towards the pastas and other menu items. As for pizza, avoid this place and go somewhere else!
author: Michelle G.

description: I love this place and would give it 5stars( I live 2 blocks up and order pizza from them very frequently) -- the reason I am giving Uncle Vito's Pizza 3 stars is --- Uncle Vito's Pizza refused to accommodate my request -- not a complicated request -- simple veggie pizza - just do not put veggies on 2 slices -- it's a manual process so it should be very easy to accommodate -- but they have refused to do this. ( I was told by Jocelyn -- that the owner has strict rules about this) If they had pizza by the slice I would happily buy 2 slices for the kid but they don't hence the request. I would appreciate and frequent  the local business more if they showed a little more flexibility. Thanks
author: Vishal V.

description:
We had a good meal.  Spaghetti and meatballs were good. A homemade type of style. Authentic and reminded me of the way my grandmother used to make spaghetti, who is Italian.  I normally order pizza but decided to go with the calzone instead.  My wife and I enjoyed it.  My daughter enjoyed the pasta.  

The service was so-so.  They didn't seem to care that we walked into the restaurant.  Not friendly but not completely rude either.  I'd stop by to try the pizza if I didn't feel like having Blondies down the street. 

Overall, the food was decent so I'll give them a 3.  Probably would have been higher if the service just friendly.
author: J G.

description:
This place isn't too bad! I was with a friend and he suggested this place since it was really near where he lived and we wanted to grab a quick dinner to go. They're pretty fast with their food. We ordered, went to buy some drinks, and our pizza was during that time (~10 min). You can get multiple toppings on a single pizza if that's what you desire. We went for half Hawaiian and half pesto. End pizza was pretty delicious. Crust is on the thinner side but pretty well done. Service is also quite friendly here. 

tldr; solid pizza, pretty fast and was about $20 for a medium sized one, so not bad
author: Jasmine X.

description: Best pizza in San Fran. Staff was great, pizza killed and drank wine from old school wine glasses like the homeland!!! I'll be back!
author: Jack V.

description: The food and service was ridiculously speedy (definitely not complaining). I had the fettucine alfredo and my friend had the pesto pizza. We both enjoyed them. The server was mostly very curt but he was the only one serving the lobby and he was accommodating and smiled at us a few times so I found his service to be perfect for the venue. Overall, a wonderful Italian food place and I would come back.
author: Cassandra L.

description: The blonde waitress today is sooooo rude! Today we went there for early dinner with a big backpack on 5pm. The floor was quite dirty, seems like not ok to put on (see photo below) . There were three two-seat-tables with only one customer setting there (and two empty four seat tables) . So we asked the waitress if we could borrow a chair. Guess what, she answered:" No! chairs are for people!" We were shocked by this attitude, and then started to eat with holding the backpack. It's only 5pm, not many customs, so many empty chairs there. Of course she can reject us, please say it in a polite way. After a wile, she saw me opened Yelp, realized I might be write something, then gave us a chair. I still gave her tip in the end, but write "rude" on the top of the paper. Hope manager will see it.
author: Tiffy L.

description: Excellent attention and The pizza was soooo delicious!!! Definitely going back there when visiting SF!!
author: Stephanie A. M.

description: Very impressive pizza, full of flavour. Great service and very friendly staff! Travelling from Australia I would recommend this place to anyone new travelling the area. Well worth the trip!
author: Ryan D.

description: I was in a crunch for time and feeling in the mood for some pizza, so I asked yelp who directed me to Uncle Vito. I can't eat an entire pizza on my own, so I got a personal pizza and added artichoke heart and mushrooms. Now, I am no expert on artichoke heart but I know it is not supposed to taste like that. It was very bitter to say the least, so I ended up eating one and picking off the rest. Secondly, the cheese was very off. I am used to cheese on the pizza being a certain way - melty, sizzling and chewy. This was the polar opposite. It was very hard and stiff. I saw someone in a previous review compare it to a cafeteria pizza and I think that is a spot on description (you go Glen Coco!). Lastly, some of the staff was nice but others were just plain weird. After we looked at the menu and ordered to go, one of the characters who saw that we were ready to order just looked at us. Didn't acknowledge us, just stared, and told no one else that we were ready to order.
author: Sabryna L.

description:
Vito Pizza is advertised as NY style pizza. I was craving pizza and this was close to my hotel - being originally from NY, I was extra excited. I ordered a personal 8" pizza topped with artichoke, onion and mushroom. I also got one of their house salads, which was iceberg lettuce, lots of mozzarella, a sprinkling of kidney beans and chickpeas and some tomato. 

The pizza was just okay. Cheese was a bit unevenly distributed (heavy blobs on parts and none on others) and there was very little sauce (and no zip to the sauce that was there). There were a good scattering of veggies, which I appreciated. Unlike true NY pizza, the crust felt a bit soggy. My overall pizza craving was satisfied, but not in the best way it could've been.

The salad wasn't special - typical pizza place salad. I did appreciate the amount of beans in it though.

They have a big menu of sandwiches, salads, pizzas and pastas, so maybe I didn't order well. It seemed to be a pretty typical just okay pizza place though. I got takeout and it was ready in about 12 minutes, but there is a small seating area with waitress service.
author: Jackie W.

description: This pizza is fine - not bad but also not spectacular.  It was packed on a Saturday evening, probably full of tourists.  We had the Pizza Pesto and there were a lot more black olives than sundried tomatoes which was disappointing but it's still hard to go wrong with those ingredients.  The crust was also decent.  The fact that I don't have much to say backs up my "average" rating.
author: Beatrice W.

description: Perfect dinner for a rainy night! Ordered a personal pizza and Caesar salad. The pizza crust was perfectly cooked for me, not too thick or to thin. More importantly, it held up well and wasn't soggy. Generous portions of toppings and not too much sauce! The Caesar dressing was think and garlicky. The croutons were buttery. A bit heavy on the Parmesan cheese but otherwise, no complaints. All this in only 15 minutes, from the time I called in the order.
author: Jenni R.

description: We stopped here for lunch before the airport to head home after a weekend trip to SF. I had the Mountain pizza and my husband had a pepperoni calzone. YUM! We both loved our dishes and tasted each others and loved them both! Place is very tiny inside and could be a little uncomfortable if dining in. But the food and our waitress made it worthwhile and we will definitely be back on our next visit!
author: Rachel G.

description:
Get their white pizza. So good. 

This is the perfect place to have a little dinner after work or if you want to pick up something after work to enjoy at home. Really cozy spot if you decide to eat there (not much seating, so it does get a little hard to get a table sometimes) but great service and the food is delicious.
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
If you're looking for authentic and absolutely delicious Italian food, give this place a try. I had the grilled chicken fettuccine and can vouch that it is made with care and detail. The mushrooms and broccoli were nice and soft and the pasta perfectly smothered in just the right amount of cream. I had it with a side of Heineken on draft which complimented the meal well. The only downsides were the garlic cheese bread which was quite hard for bread, and the chicken was somewhat dry. 

All in all, really great place to eat with a small group, couple, or just a single diner.
author: Serge T.

description:
It was ok, but nothing to make us go back rather than places.  We ordered a Hawaiian and a pesto pizza.  We weren't disappointed but didn't think we couldn't find better.
Staff was friendly.
author: Rowland A.

description: Best pizza ever‼ I heard they had great pizza.  So I Called in the order, ready in 10 minutes.   The pizza building is on the corner of Powell and Bush. Very small but cozy. The box was sturdy and made the trip home-warm pizza! I will be back.
author: Maria B.

description:
Some of the best pizza I have ever had. Anywhere.

My wife ordered pizza and I ordered spaghetti with meatballs. The spaghetti was very good. And the pizza was brilliant.

We went back for lunch the next day and both had pizza. It is that good.

Beer selection is fine and it's served in a cold glass.
author: David T.

description: The pizza is pretty good but the environment can be a bit rustic, which was fine for us. The only thing to complain was the lack of a hostess, we felt a bit lost and we asked a very rude waitress where should we put ours names on to get a table, she just told us that she had 'more important things to do' and didn't help us at all! The cashier guy was very thoughtful tough and we decided to give it a chance.
author: Rachel S.

description:
Oh how I had such high expectations for this place, based on all the great reviews and overall hype. I ordered delivery for a conference in my office, of some rather important people I wanted to impress with "our pizza" in SF. . . I ordered a couple pies, with some salad and the highly touted garlic bread.

The order arrived on time... I will give them that. But, the pizzas were cold and literally stuck to the bottom of the box (the paper on the bottom that is). The dough was a bit on the tough side, and they just didn't look or taste all that great. Again, I was going from all the fantastic gushing reviews here folks. The salad, well, it was just your basic cesar salad. Kinda hard to mess that one up. The garlic bread was a tray full of little finger sized slices, about two/three bites each, so they were mostly the harder crust part.  They were "OK", but really???

For what this cost, I would certainly have chosen to go elsewhere. Not happy, not impressed, and not going back. My YELPERs have let me down on this one.
author: Greg S.

description:
Poor attitude and poor service. Food was ok. Worth ordering to go. But not sit in. We weren't asked if the order was to go or sit in. We sat on a table, then we're told that we can't sit on the table for 4 when we are 2 (but there were other tables open). Since the order came as to go, we were told that the table was reserved for sit in. I told them we never were asked and we still got our food in a to go box, are at the restaurant and not once had been asked if we needed anything from either waitress.

Wasn't worth it
author: Nerses T.

description:
Soo.. definitely one of the best Fettucine Alfredo's I've ever had. Had to add salt, but still. Damn.

Their salad was tasty.

Although, the marinara sauce in their pasta/ravioli is terribly bland, and this is an essential factor for an Italian restaurant. If your tomato sauce is no good..well then.. damn, I don't know what to say. 

Only reason why I'm giving 4 stars is for the Fettucine Alfredo, it's hella good!
author: Shruti D.

description:
I guess these guys don't sell by the slice, so I went for a small pepperoni and enjoyed waiting the ten quick minutes to carry it out. 

These guys take their pizza making seriously. I enjoyed seeing my pizza pulled to the edge of the oven, examined, and tossed back in after my expert pizza-maker determined it was not yet perfectly cooked. I can't imagine these guys ever release a subpar pie from their kitchen.

Uncle Vito's will definitely see my face again! Sturdy crust, perfectly melting cheese, delicious sauce, and nice sweaty pepperonis will have me back before the week is up. I burnt the roof of my mouth multiple times rushing to eat this order on my walk home, so that's worth at least 4 stars. I will have more to say once I enjoy a meal in-house from these nice folks.
author: Nick S.

description: Food was pretty good. Service was helpful. This place is always packed.  But not sure if we'll come back again.
author: Zheng W.

description: We ordered our large pepperoni pizza for delivery in the late afternoon.  It came on time, approx 40 minutes, but the crust was was really dry - probably the worst pizza in a decade for me.   I selected the pizza based on Yelp reviews and have to believe that Uncle Vito just had a very bad day with us
author: Ted M.

description: This is our favorite pizza place in the world. Hand made crust and fresh garlic are the features we love. This trip, I left my purse behind, and I was sure it was gone forever. But our waitress called a few minutes ago and she had found my purse and kept it for us!
author: Laura R.

description:
Having read other reviews I thought it would be a pleasant stop for dinner only a block away from our hotel. 

So we got there at 7:30 PM there was one person ahead of us. It didn't take long before we were seated by the steel beam at the window and as others stated it is a tight fit but the chair and table height was comfortable. 

We had already decided what we wanted before sitting down but the waitress simply tossed the menus on the table and said she would be back. She then seated a table of one behind us and a table of five not far from us and took their orders. Still didn't come back. 

Twenty five minutes later she strolls over and takes our order, the pizza special and ravioli special along with two drinks. 

Another ten minutes goes by and our drinks show up. In the mean time the two tables seated after us had their food delivered and were well on their way to completing their meals. Another table is cleared and a new group seated orders taken drinks delivered and we still have no food ( remember the two specials?). I had already finished my beer and my wife was almost done with her soda (a glass of water is $2) and I had no intention of "buying another round" to make up for the service incompetence, so we were standing up to go pay for the drinks and go somewhere else when little miss inefficient brought our plates. 

The flavor and texture of the ravioli dish was very good and had a lot of mushrooms which we both like. The ingredients on the pizza were flavorful but I found they didn't cover the pizza very well with the sauce. So about a fourth of the pizza lacked flavor. The texture of the dough left a lot to be desired. Tasted a little better than what they use at a Chinese buffet. 

I also realized that we were the only mixed race couple seated in that area and I would opine that is the reason for the service being what it was. 

So the food was marginal in flavor and quantity, and the service was abhorrent. 

Thanks for ending our day on a sour note Uncle Vito!
author: Dwight C.

description: We took our pizza loving son to SF for his 16th. birthday.  After googling best pizza in SF for guidance, we stumbled into Uncle Vito's.  The delicious food was overshadowed only by the incredible serviced we received from Alex.  This place is legit! Great food, great service, reasonable prices.  We will definitely be back for more.
author: Arnold M.

description: Popped into this window-front, pizza making place to escape a rainy cable car ride. We were seated almost immediately and our order was placed within minutes. The sun dried tomato pesto with olives and pepperoni pizza was perfectly baked and positively delicious. And, to top it off, it was priced just right!
author: Tracey R.

description:
I would NEVER order from this pizza place EVER. Placed my order at 4:30pm to beat the dinner rush and they said they would deliver in an hour. An hour goes by and NOTHING. I call and they said the driver was on its way. 30 minutes later... and nothing. By this time, it's been TWO HOURS since I've placed my order and still nothing. We call back and they said they tried calling my phone but I receive NO missed calls. I have a doorman so if they had arrived to my apt, the doorman would've called me or let them up, but I got no call.

They refused to deliver the pizza after the whole ordeal and said that WE could pick it up if we still wanted the pizza and STILL pay for it. The whole purpose of DELIVERY PIZZA is so it is delivered... People clearly don't understand the concept. 

THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I have ever dealt with in my life. Next time you consider ordering from this place, DON'T. 

Uncle Vito's, you are a disgrace.
author: Jamie N.

description: Busy place. Pizza and house salad were very good. Could use more wait staff. Service was pretty slow getting out drink order. Would go back, though.
author: Dewitt M.

description: Simply the best pizza I have ever consumed. It was so delicious that once I had finished the large I was wishing I had another. We were looking for a good pizza place in San Fransisco, and after looking through a bunch, we settled on this one, and I do not know how it could get any better. The staff was friendly and beyond courteous to you as an individual. Kind of a wait at times, but the pizza (and pasta) makes up for it and more. Nice cozy little place. So if you are wondering if you should come here, just do it.
author: Zach A.

description: Wow!  Staying downtown and wanted pizza.  Glad I tried UVs!!!!  I had it delivered and it didn't take very long at all on a Friday night.  The nice lady helped me decide on my order when I called.  P.S. you won't be sticker shocked at their prices either.
author: Randy D.

description:
Walked in for dinner. They didn't have any tables available, about 15 minute wait.  So we walked away.  The head man came out to catch us and said they had a table available  in 5 minute.  So we agreed to wait. So glad we did.  
The food is so tasty and pleasing.  The preices are great and the alcohol was the cheapest I've seen. 
For a table of 4 with wine and beer was just under $67. Yummy...
author: Sandra C.

description: This place was amazing. I'd been craving pizza and they had good reviews. We ordered the fried cheese ravioli. The cheese inside was really good and the marinara was delicious. After that we had the Red Eye  pizza with extra cheese. Again the cheese was so good and overall the favors were nearly perfect. My only complaint would be that it could have used a bit of salt but some Parmesan fixed that. We will be eating here again, maybe like tomorrow.
author: Carrie V.

description: Out of the many pizza spots in downtown San Francisco, I like to come to this place. The pizza tastes good all around - toppings, sauce, and crust. Seems like they put some thought in to making a quality pizza.
author: Semaj F.

description:
Apparently a longtime stalwart of the neighborhood, Uncle Vito's has been feeding local residents, tourists, and a famous pair of twins who have their usual table for a while now. 

I appreciate the efficiency of the place. We called our order in for pickup and it was ready for us within 20 minutes as promised. They take cards too so we were in and out in no time. We ordered a large "The Mountain"(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uncle-vitos-pizza-san-francisco#Rv-2hOiyJwVqMQu8ZqPSmQ) - a huge meaty pie chocked with with salami, pepperoni, sausage, onion, bell pepper, and mushrooms. The pie isn't out of this world crazy good but it is satisfying and was a good amount of food for three grown men. I wished the crust was crispier but overall, I enjoyed my slices. 

It's a quaint local eatery if you have the time to sit down but otherwise, Uncle Vito's is just a quick call away for decent pizza in the neighborhood.
author: Jon L.

description: We are a regular here. We always order delivery. We usually get the Chicken Fettucine Alfredo, Fried Ravioli or Small Mountain Pizza. This place is my 2nd fave to buy pizza from. Im not sure if they make it fresh by order but it sure does taste like it! My fave has to be their Alfredo.. everything is on point! Creamy sauce, juicy mushroom, love how they slightly char the broccoli and chicken bits are flavorful. Fried Ravioli is pretty good too.. crispy on the outside and cheesy in the inside with the tomato sauce on the side mMmm! Gotta eat it fast because crispy-ness dies down over time. Got no complaints since I order roughly around once every 1-2 weeks. Im glad they're nearby :)
author: Sharmaine M.

description: Good food without the frills or high price tag. Originally, some reviews made me hesitant, but I'm glad we came. Alfredo and pizza, can't be beat.
author: Robert A.

description: Fantastic traditional Italian food. It's rated not as well on here because SF city dwellers like modern and chic style eats and this is far from it.
author: Joseph M.

description: Amazing food, Heineken on tap, and great service. My wife and I tried this place and will be here again.
author: Scott R.

description:
Recommend: Pesto Ravioli, Meatball Sub

Stay Away from: Pizzas and Caesar Salad. 

If you've had pizza from Philadelphia, New York, or a place that specialize strictly in pizzas, you'll understand why you need to stay away from pizza.
author: Jay B.

description: Was craving pizza, thanks to Yelp , found Uncle Vito's. Pizza was great ! Thin crust , not very oily , and the flavor was delicious. Ordered The Mountain Pizza with a glass of wine. All the veggies taste fresh. This place was busy, I can see why now . Only downfall is the inside is small , sat in a corner table by the window and was a little crowded . Besides that it was worth it.. Yum .
author: Sulema V.

description:
Really a great experience.  We were cold, wet, and hungry and this was close to where we were staying so off we went. 

2 of us had lasagna, one had grilled chicken salad, and I had a pasta dish with chicken, mushrooms, red onion, and a lite marsala wine sauce.  

All of us really enjoyed our meals and would go back anytime.  

The waitress knocked over a glass of water on me, but no worries and she was really nice and felt so bad about it she brought us cheesecake and tirimusi at no charge

We spent about 50$ for all of us so that was great too and worth it
author: Marie A.

description: The food tastes great and the lady that helped us was super sweet. She actually had an Italian accent. Makes me feel like the food is extra authentic! Lol.
author: Aaron G.

description:
Always fast and ready to go for pick up.

There calzones are out of this world and HUGE!

One of my favorite pizza places in the Nob Hill area for sure.
author: Melissa F.

description: Great Pizza, ordered the Medium for two and filled is up.  Nice thin crust Pepperoni and ground beef.  Great place, small but excellent service.
author: D H.

description:
The cable car left us at the corner and we immediately saw the employees busily at work making pizzas. We knew we had to go in.  It was packed and we waited for a few minutes to get a table upstairs.  The waitress was busy with many tables both upstairs and downstairs.  
   We ordered drinks and a fried ravioli appetizer. It was delicious. Our party of 3 ordered 2 pizzas ( small and personal sizes) and a spaghetti dinner.  The pizzas had a great crust and fresh ingredients.  The spaghetti was great and a huge serving. The garlic bread was so tasty and perfectly toasted. 

That night we paid our bill and walked to our hotel down the road.  We realized we had left our credit card at the restaurant and the manager personally came to deliver it to our hotel after we called to inquire about it. Now that's service.  

We were so happy with our eats at Uncle Vitos that we went back a few days. ..2 days on 1 trip!  We had fettuccine siena and a pizza...All so yummy.  I'll be back next time I'm in SF.
author: Venessa A.

description: Walked into this place after walking around aimlessly looking for food. WAS not disappointed. Perfect pizza. Perfect cut, not too messy. Wait staff was personable, while also letting us eat in peace. Would definitely come back next time we're in the city!
author: William W.

description:
Such a great little spot!!

I love pizza, so when J suggested we had to try Uncle Vito's, I knew one of the stops we'd be having on our adventure. Small, quaint in that Italian/pizza joint kinda way you find in cities like NY and San Francisco. Tight between tables but the kind of place where you don't really mind, or you actually even expect it. I wish we had places like this in Atlanta!!

We went yesterday as we were exploring the Union Square area after some time in Fisherman's Wharf and H-A, and it was great. Good Caesar salad and a delicious pepperoni, tomato and extra cheese pizza. The medium was more than enough for two. J always lets me pick pizza toppings and we'd never had this particular favorite combo of mine and it was a winner!

Bathrooms are at the back. Nice staff. Great location. I will remember to go back next time I'm in the Bay City - the calzones I saw look unbelievable! A girl's gotta eat, right??
author: Carrie Neal W.

description:
While I was fortunate enough that I didn't have to wait, and was able to get a table right away, I did notice several customers over the course of my meal who did end up waiting. I felt somewhat guilty, taking in the taste of my meal as they watched.
That being said, the establishment itself is atmospheric, exuding the aura of an Italian pizzeria. I ordered the calzone and the fettuccine with baby clams, all impressively delivered within fifteen minutes. The calzone was scrumptious; a tad soggy, but still good. I wasn't too fond of the fettuccine, but after running it through several of my friends, I found my dislike only stemmed from my personal preferences, as everyone else enjoyed it. The complimentary garlic bread, however, we all agreed didn't have enough flavor to it, but since it was free, I can kind of let it go.
Service was nice, nothing to write home about, but nothing too rage-inducing either. I did eventually need to get the waiters' attention for my bill and to attend to my plates, but we managed to get it worked out. The chefs I could hear were somewhat distressed in the kitchen, though. I hope that's not a regular thing, because their distress can get rather loud and slightly obscene.
Overall, I enjoyed it. While I'm not sure I'd be willing to wait for a table, I do think the food is good, service is nice, and the building itself is well maintained. Because it's situated sort of halfway up the workout of a hill that is Powell Street, I think it's a good place to stop by if you ever pass by. Worth the climb, in my opinion.
author: Guide S.

description:
Location-Hidden (looks like every pizza joint in New York with the guys making pizza in the window) 
Food- Great
Price- Outstanding (especially for the location) 
Overall great place to come for some good Italian Food
author: Rodney B.

description: Seriously we ate this 2 nights in a row while visiting San Francisco it was so delicious. We got pizza and pasta. Really recomen this is you're visiting. Kind of snug if you come with a lot of people though so just keep that in mind.
author: Cinthia G.

description:
The food was delicious but the place and space was not good.
We ate vegetarian pizza& pasta spaghetti with pesto.
author: Faeze G.

description: It has been a long time since I have been excited about pizza.  What a great find! The crust was thin, crispy, and perfect. Sauce was a little sweet. They were willing to swap topping for other desirable options. I wish we found Uncle Vito's sooner in our trip.
author: Ben B.

description:
Needed last minute delivery to our hotel during a rain storm and Uncle Vito's pulled thru. 

Good crust, nice toppings. Pizza stayed great every time we ate another slice on day 2 and 3. 

Salad was big and fresh, good amount of ranch.
author: Loren L.

description:
I had a craving for pizza. Uncle Vito's was near my hotel.

I ordered a 10" cheese pie and a beer.

I've had worse pizza. The beer was cold.

30 minutes and $15 later, my pizza craving was satisfied.
author: Steve N.

description: The food here was very good. This review is mostly based on the service. The waiter seemed very annoyed to seat us. Then when my brother in law asked for a refill the world came to an end. We also had a dirty fork to start with and when asked for a new one the server was even more upset with us. I would definitely recommend this place for the food. But the service is awful.
author: Myndee H.

description: Ordered a veggie pizza and a spinach salad. Good but not exceptional. The waiter was polite yet seemed impatient at times. And considering i am a speedy customer i still felt the pressure to wrap up and leave.
author: Bob M.

description: Good food, enjoyed Medium Pepperoni Pizza and an Antipasto Salad.  Me and my 26 yr old daughter. We had been hiking the street and hills of SF all day and needed to refuel. Perfect amount of food. Busy and good service. Check it out!
author: Steve B.

description: The food is good, but the customer service folks seems to barely tolerate the customers.  Perhaps the service person was having a bad day.
author: Fred D.

description: Fresh toppings with house made red sauce & a good crust on the bottom of the pie. Can't go wrong if you're in a hurry and need a meal.
author: Jason F.

description:
The last time my boyfriend and I ate their delicious pizza was 2 years ago. We've craved their pizza ever since.

We ordered the best pizza we've ever tasted: a medium half red eye, half mountain. It was cheesy and simply delicious! The reason why this place is receiving 4 out of 5 stars is because our waiter abandoned us. After he dropped off our food, he never checked on us. We had to flag him down just to get a refill but that was already at the end of our meal.

We love their pizza and can't wait to go back for more. Til next time!
author: JD W.

description:
Can't understand the overrated reviews?! The pizza was just bland!

Arrived late in San Francisco and got recommendation from our concierge at our hotel Orchard Garden to eat here.

A take-out line out the door, but we went in and asked if there was any table available for us. The waitress sighed and rolled her eyes, but showed us an empty one. She slammed down the menus on our table and rushed us to order.

When we received our drinks and the pizza she slammed down these as well. You can fairly say that we didn't feel very welcome.

The pizzas were standard ones, we expected more actually. And small! The smallest meal we had on a 3 weeks long road trip on the west coast. And we ate a lot of meals. :D

The were quite expensive too.

Wouldn't visit again or recommend to others. Even though I reeallyy like pizza! Have spent to much time in Italy I guess. :)
author: Maria E.

description: Homemade dough made right in front of you. PERFECT crust. Mountain pizza is superb!  Was seated immediately. View of street from most all tables, order taken immediately. Highly recommended!
author: Christy F.

description: Our tour guide recommend this restaurant, and boy was it good! It's a bit small, but that didn't bother us. This will be our go to spot when we visit SF again.
author: E L.

description: What a lovely find on short notice.Husband and I wanted a close to hotel, easy on the pocket eatery on a rainy evening. What a great surprise to find Uncle Vitos! Friendly courteous staff despite the busy night. Wait could've been longer than our 10 minutes because it would've been worth it. Tucked upstairs in a tiny loft, we ate spaghetti and meat sauce and fettucini with clams with garlic bread, two glasses of house wine, and dessert for under $30! A do-over for sure!
author: K O.

description: I asked for a side of alfredo sauce, I told the waitress I really like alfredo with my lasagna. I also told her I would be very happy to pay for it. She told me that the cook won't make it... ??? And he didn't. I don't understand why? To me the customer service is more than the quality of the food!
author: Diana C.

description:
Went there the other night and wow was it busy. It's a tiny little hole in the wall place, but clearly it was popular because people were lined up outside just to get in.  We opted for take out. 

I got the cheese ravioli pesto and it was one of the best I've had in a long time.  Most times when I get something with pesto the sauce ends up being either way too thick and chunky or way too ground up and creamy.  This place found a really good mix between the two, it was rich but not too much.  The boyfriend just got a medium pepperoni pizza and he loved it. 

Glad we tried it!
author: Kristen T.

description:
We did not like this place at all. First of all, the service is unpleasant and not very friendly. Secondly, the quality of the food is not good. I had the Calzone which had more cheese in it than anything else. My wife had the chicken pasta and has had stomach aches for the remaining 12 hours after we ate. 
Should you go to this place look around because sitting by the window offers some nice views and experiences. But do NOT look at the floor...
author: Nico V.

description: Went last night and the place was packed.  We now know why. The cheese ravioli with pesto was heavenly.  The Hawaiian pizza was pretty yummy and you can order beer by the pitcher.  We had Heineken.  I would strongly suggest you check it out if you are in San Francisco
author: Kristina V.

description: In a city with really good pizza available,  unfortunately this doesn't make the cut.  Crust too thick for my liking.  Slow service too.
author: Ann Beth C.

description: Food is sorta average. Doesn't stand out either positive or negative. Crust a little too on the crunchy side. The side salad was actually very good. The dressing was some sort of vinaigrette and honestly that was my favorite part of experience.
author: Todd C.

description: The service is absolutely terrible. Walked inside and the entrance was filled with people who were carrying out. There is no host. So I had to hunt down a waitress to ask the wait time and was told 15 minutes. I waited 30 minutes just for two groups of people to get seated before me. Mind you that there were two extra tables cleaned and set up a good 15 minutes in during my wait. At the end, it look me an entire hour just to get seated, 15 minutes to get offered drinks, another 18 minutes to place my order, and another 30 minutes for my food. Don't see myself coming again.
author: Griselda M.

description:
Visiting San Fran from Philly...and we know pizza..but Uncle Vito's was a pleasant and welcomed surprise! Got the "Red Eye" and a salad and everything from the sauce to the crust was delicious! Got it for take out and glad we did, on a Tuesday night at 7pm there was a line out the door for the small pizza shop. 

Only regret is that we didn't try the garlic bread and there weren't any leftovers!
author: K H.

description: Busy busy night so we decided to order take out.  Got the fettuccine siena, so good! It has sundries tomatoes,  pesto sauce with grilled chicken.  Spaghetti with meat sauce was flavorful.  Cannot forget the garlic bread!  Nice portion size and it comes with each pasta dish.  The pastas where nice portions and filling.  Definitely worth the long wait for takeout.   Heard their pizza is good so we'll be back again.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
Great Pizza! 
I'm sure there are hundreds of decent pizza places in SF, but if you're anywhere near Union Square, give this place a try.  We had gone to a high-end restaurant the night before and just wanted something simple, so our concierge recommended Uncle Vito's.  We arrived around 6:30, and were seated upstairs.  A waitress was with us in a few minutes, and brought our drinks right away.  I ordered a small special-of-the-day pizza, and my wife had the Eggplant Parm.  Both were really good.  I will warn diners that the garlic bread is really strong, my wife sent it back for just plain bread.  Check this place out!
author: Don T.

description: I'm visiting and thought I'd try this place out since it was close to where I was staying. Went in to get take out thinking I could grab slices of pizza and they just have whole pizzas. I ordered my food Togo and stood aside in the small area. One of the servers asked me to move out of her way... don't know where else I'm suppose to wait? But moved to the other side then after 20 minutes I was wondering how much longer so I went to ask and Amy said it's been ready... they never once called my name. So when I got back to my hotel my food was cold. This place isn't big enough for them to call my name and me not hear. Very disappointed.
author: Nicole H.

description:
It was the end of another long day in San Francisco. The sun was setting. My family and I were hungry, but we were also tired. Dead tired. The thought of walking up the steep hill to get to our favorite, locally-owned pizza place was too much to bear after a day chock-full of walking. We wanted nothing more than to kick back in bare feet and watch TV the rest of the evening. 

But then we had a revelation - they deliver.

So we called, ordered a large pizza, half cheese, half ham and pineapple, and 30 minutes later, we were chowing down. It was just as good as if we were eating in the tiny restaurant (I daresay better, BECAUSE we weren't eating in the tiny restaurant). Fresh cheese and sauces on the pizza, delectable crust, tasty herbs... It's soooooo good. A true SF classic, and there is no place better in this town to get pizza.
author: C.A. C.

description: I was told that this was the best slice in town. Oddly enough, they don't sell it by the slice. The sauce was great. The dough was crispy. But the atmosphere kept me wanting more. It's worth a trip, if you are near by.
author: Thomas N.

description: Meh. Pizza was average, service was sub par. Pretty sure the man serving us was a 3rd string waiter. The girl was busting her ass so I think he was helping. Over all, 3 stars. Nothing special in my experience eating here.
author: Chris H.

description:
We ordered and had it delivered as it was a staff lunch.

The prices for the amount of food is really good. I ordered the Fettucine with Baby Clams which was so creamy and tasty.

We also ordered a half Cheese & half Pepperoni, it was good. I will say the delivery took a while but overall the food was good and after tip it was still under $45.
author: Mei L.

description:
Absolutely the WORST pizza I have EVER had!!!!
Tasteless mostly nonexistent sauce/horrible pasty dough.  This place should be ashamed!  Because of location they attract a lot of tourists.  I pity these unsuspecting folks.  Please don't judge SF by this place!!
author: Lynne P.

description:
Ok, so let me sum it all up, so you don't have to read all the reviews! After reading a lot of the reviews, I got from most that there 
 1. not a lot of sauce
2. pizza dough is "gooey" in the center 
3.You don't want to do a late night delivery. 

Let me give you the reality! Me and husband ordered this pizza( pepperoni and sausage) and it arrived at our hotel room within 40 minutes. That is freaking awesome considering we were staying in the middle of union square! Upon first bite, the pizza was great! It wasn't the best pizza I have ever had in my life, but I would 100% get it again! For THOSE CARB LOVERS... THIS PIZZA DOUGH IS AMAZING and Smells like fresh baked dough!!! I ordered a side of marinara since some bad reviews complained there was not enough sauce. Those people are dramatic. I didn't even need marinara sauce! And what gooeyness?? Anyways, just get this pizza. It's great and your stomach will be satisfied and so will your wallet!!
author: Kayla B.

description: Quick pizza in 15 min but maybe a little too quick. I think the pizza needed more cooking but actually needed a hotter oven. It probably wasn't hot enough because they were busy and the guy kept having to open the oven. The crust was mushy and didn't quite do it for me. The sauce needed more flavor too. Kind of plain.
author: Dre V.

description: Great antipasto salad, garlic bread and pizza! Very reasonable prices. Get there early for dinner! We arrived around 6pm and it was a short wait, the line was out the door when we left.
author: N B.

description:
Really good pizza and my manager devoured her chicken Caesar salad! I looked up best pizza near union square on yelp and this was top 3! 

The only reason I gave it four stars is because I asked for 3 ingredients and they only gave me 2 of them. Still good and will be asking for deliveries because that walk from work is no joke!
author: Ruby S.

description: WOO let me tell you! This pizza is a hoot and a half.... just .. the best. I've had a lot of pizza. (I'm a pizza man (MANY have told me lol!) and this place was so good. If you are looking to get the best for your buck you might as well stop here. I only had a large pepperoni pizza but let me tell you....WOO .... that was enough to change my life. FOREVER. Shoutout to Uncle Vito tbh! you did that!
author: Alicia C.

description: Excellent pizza! I bought a large pepperoni for my family. Pizza was a bit pricey ($18) but I guess that is what you will pay in SF. They do not offer pizza by the slice so only come here for a whole pie. Go big or go home right? Vito's was busy, which was a good sign for newcomers. Pizza was fresh and my family and I loved it!
author: Dan A.

description: I have to say the best thing in the entire restaurant is the pizza bianco, which is Canadian bacon with feta cheese.  Just incredible. For the cost of food which is quite good its a great bargain.
author: N A.

description:
I realize that we were there at around 10 on a Thursday night but.... The place was kind of a cluster. They were moderately busy. Most of the front room was full and the to-go business seemed brisk but there were open tables. But man there was NO communication, nothing welcoming except the smells. We got the feeling that they were understaffed but there were a few staff that were either off shift or just standing around doing nothing. There appeared to be only one server/busser who was obviously overwhelmed, overworked and exhausted. He was plodding along and it was agonizing. 

Why didn't we leave? It was our first night in town. We had traveled all day, our hotel was just down the street and the ratings for what we were looking for was fine. We also aren't quitters and the smell, the smell made us tough it out. We eventually got a seat, got our order in and got our food. There was no service just an order taker and plopping the food down. That's were the 4 star pizza raised the experience to a overall 3 stars. The pizza was excellent we got the simple red pepper, red onions and pepperoni/cheese and it was delicious. The antipasto was heavy with meat and cheese but absolutely drowned in dressing (just get it on the side.) No dessert offered, none ordered and that was it. Waited to pay, paid and out the door.

Maybe it was just a bad night. Every business has one but for some reason the way everyone was acting our suspicions are they've done this before. I HIGHLY recommend ordering to-go I think it would have been fine.
author: Glenn M.

description:
Uncle Vito's, I'm a fan.  I'm stuck in a hotel in the Financial District for a while, and room service options are limited.  Here's what I expect when I'm at a hotel and order pizza delivery:  1 hour minimum wait, and lukewarm soggy pizza.

Here's what I get from Uncle Vito's, and this is not based on just one-time ordering:

FAST delivery.  That means I don't have to wait long, and my 'za is still warm when it arrives.  Sweet.

Crazy fresh veggies on my super delish Greek salad.  Uncle Vito, do you grow your own tomatoes out back?  So good.

Tasty thin crust.  I've only had the pizza pesto, so I can't speak for other pizza/sandwich/pasta options.

To sum it up, the pizza is good, the salad is unexpectedly awesome, and the service is top notch.


Highly recommend.  Great job guys!
author: Cindi R.

description:
Near the Marriot so why not? Decent yelp reviews so away we went for a much needed lunch after shopping. 

Ravioli with pesto yes please!!! The alfredo was also a winner.

The salads are huge and are enough to share for two if you are getting a side salad. The chicken salad was also a hit with the family. 

Pizza by the slice was pepperoni and cheese only.  

Garlic bread was a half hoagie like slice (which can be shared... or not) with just the right amount of butter and garlic. Not too greasy but full of flavor. 

Reasonably priced and service was decent.
author: Vicky T.

description: Not only was delivery fast and fresh, the food was on point. We didn't have to dip into our kids college savings plan to pay for it either.  You could tell the quality of ingredients was excellent, which makes a mighty fine pizza and bowl of spaghetti that much better.  I have no clue what they actually use, but I told my wife they use "special spring water" in the pizza dough and "magnificent cheeses" on top.  If that wasn't enough, they brought us paper plates and silverware since we were bunked up in a hotel. Which...if you read my Red Chilli review, you would know is important to me.  These are good people folks, feel good about ordering from them.
author: Mike R.

description: We ordered the mountain which has mushrooms, sausage, pepperoni, bell peppers and onions. Was not cooked enough, which is probably why we got it so quickly. The pizza overall was okay, but the service SUCKS. Our waiter (chubby older man) was awful, if we didn't have our order ready within a second he would just leave and come back in "2 min". Never checked on us for refills, or to see how the pizza was. It's a small little restaurant so it's not like he had a crazy crowd in here. I will probably not be returning again.
author: Crystal L.

description: Great little place.  Fast service and clean.  We ordered a large pepperoni and Italian sausage and it was pretty darn good.  The crust was thing ah and really crispy and the toppings were plentiful.  I am usually a two slice person but I ate four.  Definitely recommend it.
author: Scott W.

description: I've never really liked meat balls to begin with since I never really grew up eating them and it's just way too much meat in one bite. HOWEVER, when my BF came home with a meatball sub from this place, I about died. 3 meatballs smothered in cheese with peppers on a warm toasted roll. May I also add, there's something about this sandwich that stays warm forever. NOM NOM NOM.
author: Shela D.

description: We stumbled on this one while looking for a different place-- really pleased with our pizza. We ordered delivery on a different night after 2 days of disappointing, overpriced, overhyped  meals in the area. Second time around was just as good! This time we also got spaghetti and meat sauce -- really high quality, fresh, piping HOT (delivery was hot?! Wow!). The space is tiny so may not work for a huge group but we thought it was cozy!
author: Lara A.

description:
Great pizza and great staff! One of the best pizzas I've had in San Francisco :) 

Will be back soon!
author: Per F.

description:
Really tasty Calzone, less than stellar service, but let me start at the beginning. I was looking for a quick pick me up and a calzone sounded great on my way home. I called in to see how long the pick up time would be for said calzone and the guy was annoyed that I asked first. He told me 15 minutes and I decided to give it a shot. Never had I heard of 15 minute turn over time on a calzone, so of course, I ordered. I went to give the guy my name and he promptly hung up on me before I could give it to him. Okay, I get calzones aren't widely ordered, so I had faith instead of calling back.  

Headed over to the restaurant about 10 minutes after I ordered, big mistake. First the girl at the counter didn't have my order, eventually she found the ticket, charged me and told me to have a seat since it was in the oven still, and shouldn't be too long. 

35 minutes later finally one of the chefs noticed I was still sitting there and asked what I ordered. After some confused looks and finding my calzone that had just been boxed and put on top of the oven with someone else's order, I was finally on my way. But not before being asked for payment once more, which I politely reminded the girl that was taken care of already. Not that I was provided a receipt to prove my claim. But she let me go with no hassle. 

For the amount of time I spent in there on a pick up order, I can say a bunch of the other food they serve looks pretty tasty and smells fantastic.
author: Gina C.

description:
Place was solid. The standard cheese pizza was just well made and tasty. The garlic bread with cheese was also nice.

No frills or fancy-ness here but it's great pizza for takeout
author: R Q.

description: Awesome pizza ! I take the mountain and everything was delicious! The staff was friendly. If you want to eat there you should call first (at least during the summer)!
author: Minh Duc T.

description: First off out the mouth of uncle vito he docks the dough for over a day then prepares it in balls it up which by this time are dry and cracky the way it should be done is made in the morning before lunch let rise for about 3 hours mix it with umm hmm did uncle vito say water to me to make the dough wha???????Yes hummmmhumm hummm water so yes and the  antipasta usually comes with mortazella and uncle vito said out his mouth now is this guy something or what he says yeah i don't use that i use Ham!!!!! Hamm!!!!!!! hamm and it was more like Canadian bacon are you ITalian because i do not know what you are thinking so in other words don't be fooled i busted the place wide open with its unoriginal ingredients bringing italian cooking to its knees bringing the essence of true italian cooking to shame and its ancesctors  putting to shame the the I in italian shame on you Vito I can't even call you uncle ps VITO DOESNT EVEN HAVE FRESH BASIL ON THE SPOT WHAT ITALIAN DOESNT HAVE BASIL IN AN ITALIAN RESTAURANT LUCKY I EVEN CALLED THIS PLACE THAT UGHHH 67 DOLLARS LATER!!1 hard pizza cardboard like old cheese water down soda not so fresh toppings and the pizza was floppy and wobbly
author: Jimmy M.

description:
