The rudest employees ever. We got here at 9:30 pm and the restaurant closes at 11:00 pm. The worker gave us attitude and said that they had cleaned their tables and chairs and now because of us they had to bring their tables and chairs back out. After we sat, it took them 20 minutes to take our order and he gave us attitude and said the kitchen is closing and we need to eat and leave. 

Wtf? 

No class....no service.
author: Sara H.

description: The service was great for 10pm and the pizza is delicious. I love how you can see them making the pizza in front window. We will definitely return. Just so you know they Do Not sell by the slice.
author: Liza P.

description: Tried to order takeaway delivery from these guys. They obviously don't need the business because the guy in the phone was super rude . I thought America was supposed to be the land of good service .
author: Ka M.

description: Wow. One of the Marriott employees told me about this place. Great pizza and cheap. I saw the pasta dishes and looked good. Small dive place. Locals and not a suit and tie/heels and dress place. Hole in the wall place, but great food.
author: Brian A.

description: Uncle Vitos has wonderful pizza...just the right thickness of crust and plenty of cheese and toppings. Great service and nice bottles of wine in this little hole in the wall.
author: Patricia W.

description: I have never dinned in here so my review is just for their take out. Their pizza is hands down the best in the area. I have tried all of the pizza places around lower nob hill and union square and this one is bar far the best tasting. It is a bit on the pricer side compared to some other local options but it is well worth the extra few dollars. The only downside I would mention is the other items that I have ordered arent as good as the pizza. I tried a few of the salads and the garlic bread but those were mediocre. If you want a good salad then you should look at another spot but for pizza this is the best in a mile radius.
author: Luis M.

description: Visiting SF for work and came across Vito's.  I would recommend it to ankle!  The pizza is great, especially the personal 8" pizzas.  We also got a pasta Bolognese which was also great.  Come check it out if you are in town.
author: Chris R.

description:
Carb loaded here since it was a block from our timeshare.

It was busy, which we thought was a good sign. We were promptly greeted and led to a table. 

I opted to order the ravioli with meat sauce. I special requested meat ravioli (vs. cheese) for more protein. My friend ordered the pesto pasta. The pasta dishes came with (shared) garlic bread.

The service was left to be desired. Water wasn't refilled and we had to request it. 

Additionally when we were left with our bill, my friend requested separate checks. The waiter gave a sour puss face and a lame excuse saying that he couldn't do it ? [Really, because other restaurants can with no problem.] 

When he returned with my credit card, he deeply apologized for his behavior. 

Too late, my friend...

You get a 1-star for poor customer service...
author: Maria C.

description: Disappointed! The original place we wanted to eat was closed so we went for this place due to location and ratings. Everyone at our table got their food except for me. You could tell the waitress forgot. When I finally got it, everyone else at my table was wrapping up. I had the spaghetti with meatballs. The sauce was watery, pasta cooked ok, meatball obviously frozen. I could have made a better version. I had some of my cousin's fettuccine senia since I was starving with no food. The pasta was overcooked, pesto sauce greasy and chicken was flavorful at least. Won't be coming back at all. Cheap wine at least.
author: Michelle G.

description:
It's like visiting your family!
Really good food, fast service. 
Not the greatest atmosphere, but the quality of food made up for that. The dining room was full so we had a small table way on the back of the hallway, right by the bathroom. They squeezed two small tables here, and it's rather dark.
Looking past that, portions were a good size and it was just like homemade. 
Very busy!
author: joan d.

description:
After recently moving to SF from CT, I was craving some yummy pizza- my understanding is that the pizza here on the west coast is "not the same" or "not good". Uncle Vito's is the first place I decided to go based on reviews and locality. 

I ordered half sausage and peppers and half bacon and feta. I liked both! The bread definitely was not as crispy as I am used to, they put Canadian bacon instead of regular bacon, and the pizza didn't keep well as it cooled down (which is not the case w/ NY style pizza that is delicious even when it's cold).

However, I thoroughly enjoyed the pie and would totally go back for a quick pizza fix! Also, the service was friendly, I had an enjoyable time chillen on a beer while I waited, and the price was right. 

Definitely give it a try
author: Mayra M.

description: It's your standard pizza places but due to location it's always swarmed with tourists and has a line for average food. I like the Greek salad and the chicken sandwich is a nice alternative to pizza.
author: Larisa J.

description: Really great pizza and garlic bread! I had the red eye pizza - would recommend! Will definitely come here again.
author: Renee F.

description: Individual on staff was unhelpful. He was unable to communicate the process for getting a table. He pointed to some list on the wall that didn't exist, and wouldn't explain further so had to leave. He didn't care at all.
author: Robert A.

description:
We were staying off Union Square and exploring our options, overwhelmed by all of the variety.  Before we knew it, we'd lost track of time and everyone was hungry, grouchy, sore-footed and tired.  Someone in our hotel had suggested Uncle Vito's, and while we originally thought we'd be more adventurous, by that time Italian food sounded like a good, family pleasing way to go.  I am so glad that we did.  Pasta is a winner nearly every time, and this was really a winner--everyone left happy and stuffed.

I got a pasta dish with artichokes, mushrooms and a light red wine sauce.  It was tongue-blisteringly-hot when it arrived at the table; I'm sure it arrived directly from the tiny kitchen.  No heater lamps in use here!  It was a huge pile of pasta, with a ton of veggies; it was nearly half veggies, which is really generous especially for something like artichokes--usually, I feel like the veggies get used more like garnish on top of a pile of pasta.  This was a really well composed, generous combination of veggies and pasta; the kind of proportions I'd prepare at home.  The wine sauce was light but flavorful.  I thoroughly enjoyed my meal.  The rest of the fam got traditional Itialian dishes, including a huge pile of spaghetti and meatballs--everyone was happy, and as I said, stuffed.  The garlic bread was crispy--I'd prefer it softer, but that's just me.  My wine was -- I believe--$3 for a glass.  Nothing fancy, but perfectly suitable for the meal.  I felt like I was in someone's home--the simple wine and generous food is just what I'd expect.  Looking around at the other diners--several single seaters--it looked liked this is where the locals go to eat a good homey meal.  Prices were good--I don't think any of us had a meal more than $10, which is outstanding nearly anywhere, especially in SF.

My only negative comments would be pretty peripheral comments.  The place is TINY.  We were there on a Tuesday night and waited for 20 minutes for a tiny cramped table.    That's just what it is, but expect it.   It was clean, but don't go there for the decor or ambiance--the tables were probably 30 years old, finish fading from the frequent washings; the walls simple off white with a hodge podge of art.  My wine was not served in a wine glass but in a sturdy tumbler.  The servers were brisk, efficient and polite; I had to chuckle when the waitress gently nudged me aside to set something on the table.  Again, like eating in someone's home--not rude, just efficient.  If you want delicious, hearty Italian food without any foo-foo trimmings, this is your place.
author: Heidi C.

description: Excellent food at surprisingly affordable prices.  I had the side salad and Fettucine Primavera. The atmosphere was perfect for a place named Uncle Vito's. Definitely recommend this place.
author: Dale L.

description: Was craving pizza in the area of my hotel and of course turned to Yelp. The prices were decent and pizza delicious. Def one of those pizzas that you want to eat right away so it's fresh and hot. Not as tasty once getting cooled off. But was still satisfied
author: Samantha M.

description: Checked this place out because of the Yelp ratings. It was a Saturday night, so it was super packed, and it is a tiny restaurant. If you are claustrophobic, I would maybe just order it to go. For how busy it was, the wait wasn't super long. Which was a plus. They need some sort of organizational system. It was a mess. I was bothered by the fact when we got to our table, it had not been bussed. And was not bussed until we asked the waitress to do so. The waitress was sweet, I could tell she was overwhelmed. I'm pretty sure she was serving the entire restaurant. (Maybe like 20 tables max?). My friend ordered ranch dressing, but never got it. I'm thinking she might need some help with another server. The pizza was pretty solid. But nothing really to write home about. It just got the job done. I would probably come back if I was craving pizza, but would probably do take out.
author: Brooke L.

description: Veggie pizza was amazing and the calzone was amazing. Price range pretty dead on for SF its near a the cable car. I'm not a local but I would definitely stop by again. Very friendly staff.
author: Diana F.

description: Ok food, poor house wine, grumpy waiter, dismal atmosphere.  Not sure how it stays open.
author: Jonathan G.

description: Visitor from the mid-west:  I was afraid, based on prior review, that this might not be the best customer service experience. But I received a very strong recommendation from a cable car driver. The recommendation was good!  It's a very small shop.  And it's hard for the staff to do their job if the customers move tables or chairs or otherwise disrupt the flow of traffic. So be a good patron  and obey yourself and you will have a wonderful dining experience. Oh yes. We were a group with varied tastes and everyone was thrilled with their meal.
author: Elaine M.

description: While shopping in Union Square we worked up a serious appetite! This place was a perfect choice. We were immediately seated. Not bad for a Friday night. Seating is pretty tight. The pizza was delicious. Hubby had the meat calzone. Both were perfect. My kid killed a whole plate of spaghetti and she loved it. Portions are huge and affordable. Service was fast. We will definitely be back!
author: Jennifer B.

description: Took my kids here last night. We ordered a salad, garlic cheese bread and a pizza called the Mountain.  EVERYTHING was delicious. I recommend it to everyone!
author: Frank M.

description:
This is such a small, yet crowed little pizza place, but well worth it!! 
We had to wait about 20 minutes to get a table, but the delicious pizza was well worth the wait. We ordered two pizzas one was the veggie special of the day with added pepperoni and they other was a sausage and mushroom pizza with a side order of french fries. 
I know odd combo, but definitely good mix! 
The pizzas were full in flavor and very fresh in taste, I loved the melted goey cheese and the delicious crust. Simply good. The service was great, as we came in kind of late and at a busy time!!  
I loved this small corner pizza spot!!
author: Lizeth M.

description:
Great pizza. Good service depending on who you get it seems. Cheap but good food. 

Kinda odd TV placement and some people working are little rude.
author: Miguel L.

description: This is the corner pizza spot in my neighborhood. There's nothing fancy about this place, but they make respectable pizzas and calzones. Plenty of seating is available inside and they also offer delivery.
author: Rodney G.

description: We eat here every time we visit San Francisco.  The food and service is superb.  The owner Gary even seated us tonight and served us our beer. I love it that he takes pride in his restaurant and is not afraid to be engaged. As a business owner myself you see a need and fill it makes a successful owner. It was an honor once again to eat at your restaurant.  Thank you
author: Lori H.

description: I like to break down pizza by parts. Crust, sauce ,cheese and toppings. It is difficult to get all the components perfect. Uncle Vitos gets everything almost perfect. Generous toppings and cheese. A subtly sweet sauce, and a great crust. I only could slightly think of one thing that could have improved our pie. That would be adding about two more minutes  of cooking time to give a slightly more golden cheese and toppings. Perhaps the fact that there is such a wait to order or get a table causes the bake times to be a bit shorter than I work prefer. Otherwise they have a near perfect pie.
author: Mark V.

description: Cool little pizzeria with great pizza. No frills just honest food. A really good find!
author: Jo C.

description: Pizza was pretty dang good. We added fresh garlic to our pizza, I wouldn't do that unless you really love garlic.
author: Elle C.

description: Great Pizza! Antipasti was ok, never heard of kidney beans and chick peas in antipasti. Must be Mexican thing.
author: Kris S.

description: Fine food great service well worth your stop , it is a place to me takes you back to the mom and pop business that we have forgotten stop in and enjoy you will like it.
author: Ernie B.

description: I didn't enjoy this at all.  We were there on 10/12 and ordered "the mountain" pizza and it was just o.k.  I was expecting New York style pizza and this didn't have the thin crust witih huge bubble from baking in oven - nope.  More like just run of the mill pizza.  Expensive for what we got and service was 'meh' too.  Wouldn't go back.
author: Karen B.

description: This place sucks, the hospitality sucks, service sucks, the pizza sucks, the wine sucks. Disappointed through and through.  Oh and the menu was ripped to high heck, if they don't  care about their menus what does that say about the rest of their establishment.
author: manuel d.

description: I love this place! My little furball gets lots of love when he comes with me! The calzone is much needed every time!
author: Happy G.

description:
Wow! My husband & I stayed at the Hilton Union Square & ordered delivery to the hotel- they were super fast & the pizza was outstanding!! Best pizza we've had, which says a lot from sunny San Diego area locals!

Pizza crust is epic! Get the pineapple & ham!
author: Tiffany N.

description: I can't attest to any pasta dishes because I've only had Uncle Vito's pizza but it was delicious! Fresh, yummy crust. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Emily F.

description: What a great pizza place in the heart of the city. As a pizza lover I enjoy coming here as the food is always fresh and delicious, the ambience is cozy and the staff is welcoming and professional. I would like to say big thank you to Anastasia, she is always on top with great and fast service. Garlic bread here is very yummy as well. Great place for a pizza date place or family/friends dinner.
author: Iryna P.

description:
Rude as shit. Called for a delivery order not even 10 minutes away and he snapped at me asking me to hold after I did not hear what he said under
his breath. Horrible customer service
author: Jasmine B.

description:
Insanely mediocre.  Grow some taste buds San Fran. These positive reviews are crazy, they make me question this city's collective sanity. 

The garlic cheese bread was decent. The pizza... Go get a Jacks frozen pizza from your local grocery store and you'll be better off.
author: Joe P.

description: Tried the Italian salad and spaghetti with meatballs.  The Italian dressing was very bland but had a lot of cheese, meat and other veggies on it. I had to use my salad dressing at home. The spaghetti and meatballs were very average. Reasonable prices, but I won't be coming back.
author: Cyndi H.

description: Lied about Gluten Free Pizza.  It should be on Trump's 100 day plan to close bad pizza shops.  Make pizza great again.
author: Alisa E.

description: Disappointed with our pastas that myself and 2 other friends ordered one night before closing I'm sure we were the last costumers but the man at the counter was very rude the pasta was not good and only ONE garlic bread for all the pasta? Defiantly will not be returning. Thanks Vito's
author: Celeste R.

description: We were extremely underwhelmed at this place. We came here on a recommendation. The canned ravioli I have in my pantry has more flavor than their cheese ravioli with meat sauce. You couldn't taste the cheese AT ALL. The pizza was decent; the sauce is a sweeter marinara. The food was hot but the service was cold.
author: Nicole P.

description:
Second visit.  Good experience again!  This place is really a bargain, from pizza to wine.

Tip:   Ask to be seated upstairs. We were seated upstairs.  At first I almost declined but then realized that the upstairs is really on the street level with Powell.  We were seated at a table a few feet from the window and watched the traffic, cable cars, and swarms of tourists pass by.
author: Bradley C.

description:
******UPDATE*******

After writing and posting my original review below, I was contacted by the owner or manager of Uncle Vito's. He immediately moved to address and rectify the issue. He took the steps to issue a refund for my pizza. He was prompt, courteous and very unhappy about my experience.

Poor experiences happen in this business. It's how we handle them that sets us apart. It took a bit, but this place stepped up and refunded my purchase, which is what I wanted. Thanks!


******Begin Original 1-star review********
So, this place was recommended by the concierge at my condo in the city, so we took a stroll...First, it was small and VERY tight. It was a busy night, so I expected to be patient. It was also a bit confusing on how things worked, but we figured it out eventually. So, we ordered a small pie to share to go. Took the standard 20-25 minutes for a good pie, and we took it back to our condo. 

Opened up the box and dug in...my first impression was "meh, not bad, but not awesome either". My companion, however, had an ENTIRELY different reaction:

She found a long hair baked right into her pizza slice! Yummy! NOT!!!!!!!

OK, so, I was NOT happy, but "stuff" happens, right? I figured they were slammed and that I would deal with it in the AM... NOT!

This is where the ACTUAL 1-star comes from: When I called the next morning, I got put off. I was told that I should have called the night before and that there was nothing they could do now. I paid for a freaking pizza I didn't eat due to a hair baked in!
author: Anthony A.

description:
Great choice for the hungry, sightseeing family of five. Highly recommended for the quality of food and pricing. We are visiting San Francisco and the kids wanted pizza. We found this place on Yelp
and we were not disappointed. We come from a big Italian immigrant population city (Philadelphia) and found the pizza, pasta,and fare delicious. Service is competent and quick. Thank you for feeding us!
author: M J.

description: Went in for a late dinner with my family. We got a large pepperoni pizza and a classic antipasto salad. What a great meal. The pizza hit the spot. The place was packed and I can certainly see why. They even had Sierra Neveda on tap. You always want a good pizza with good tap beer. They served up both!!The prices were fantastic and service was quick! We will be back to this cozy, simple,delicious, delight.
author: Amber M.

description:
Walked in just before closing and was seated right away with a smile. Ordered two pizzas that came out pretty quick, good sauce, good crust, good pizza. 

My only regret is I waits till my last day in Dan Francisco to check Vito's out, had I tried it earlier, I would have definitely made at least one more trip.
author: Michael B.

description: This location does NOT carry gluten free pizza regularly. I don't believe they should be listed as serving gluten-free pizza; we were very disappointed for the second time in one night.
author: Karen B.

description: Great food! Awesome service.. The fettuccine Sienna was awesome! We ordered also the spaghetti marinara and it was super fresh. Cheap beer too!
author: Mario M.

description: shouldn't prejudiced this restaurant by its location. It is definitely not a touristy place at all. The portion of food is HUGE. Love it.
author: Xi L.

description: Got a small "The Mountain" and fries. The pizza was delicious! Loved the dough and toppings! Fries were dry but what did I expect coming from a pizza place? We came on a Saturday night during President's Day/Valentine's Day weekend. The place was pretty full but wait wasn't too long. We ordered togo. The place has like, 10 tables and pretty dark inside. I don't know how the cooks, cook!
author: Angelina W.

description: Very nice pizzeria with great menu and service. You can chose pizza, salads or sandwiches. Not expensive - small cheese pizza is around $8, big portion of pasta $10. Well for kids.
author: Peter G.

description:
There are not many places in the San Francisco bay area that makes a pizza that isn't a California pizza. To me, a born-and-raised New Yorker, a good pizza does not have thick dough. It's not crunchy in the middle or have too many toppings. The cheese should be fresh, not rubbery, and it should not be so thick that you can blindfold yourself with it. The other toppings should also be fresh, not from cans (except maybe olives). A slice should be foldable, lengthwise, the way Jon Stewart demonstrated on his show.

Uncle Vito's after 3 orders has not yet disappointed me. It's not the best pizza, but around here it's good enough for me, especially since it's conveniently located.
author: Kiai K.

description: Staying at the Marriot nearby and wanted to order in. It's nice that delivery is free, and they got here right when they predicted (40-45 minutes). We ordered a large pepperoni pizza, lasagna, 2 slices of cheesecake and drinks and it was a little over $40. The food was good, the dessert was decent, so we'd definitely order again. We asked about dessert since it wasn't on their takeout menu so it's nice they had some anyway.
author: Aryana W.

description: We ordered a pizza and salad delivered to our hotel room.  It was fantastic.  I particularly enjoyed the salad.  I like that it had cheese and garbanzos in it.
author: Brad B.

description: Fast service and great flavors in their meatball sandwich and Hawaiian pizza. See picture of the meatball sandwich which is packed with meatballs, cheese and marinara for $6. Portion is generous and you will not leave hungry with this one.
author: Zac D.

description: Great atmosphere. We sat by the window and watched the cable cars go by!  Pizza was very good. Service was excellent!
author: Andrea B.

description: Family stopped by here while on vacation. Quick, clean, fast all very necessary when you have a kid with autism. Fettuccine Alfredo was one of the best I've ever had. Chicken Caesar Salad delicious. Perfect amount of dressing and the chicken, warm and delectable. Cheesy garlic bread was so good we ordered a second batch. Pizza was a winner with the boys and they loved that it wasn't greasy. Price was right!!! Great find!!!
author: Stacey D.

description: This is such a yummy place to eat. Prices are good. We ordered cheese ravioli with pesto, fettuccini Siena, spaghetti with meatballs, cheese ravioli and the Mountain and Hawaiian personal pizzas. They were all excellent!! Service was wonderful. My favorite was the creamy pesto on the ravioli. I wanted to order a gallon to have shipped home. I will come here again.... And again!
author: Linda P.

description: Wow. I didn't think I'd enjoy this place but boy was I wrong. I had the spaghetti and meatballs. Best meal I've had in San Francisco. Can't say it's the fanciest place or even the best Italian ever but if your looking for a like "home" cooked meal, this the place. The prices are very reasonable too!! Happy Eating.
author: Heriberto D.

description:
Five stars for delivering the goods. It ain't upscale and it ain't fast food but it's food so good you have to pry yourself away from ordering more. An unexpected surprise: the chocolate cake we ordered on a whim was fantastic. 

Kids even ate out of their comfort zone because food was so good.  They will split small pizza toppings for half and half, too. Staff is awesome. Just be ready to squeeze into the narrow doorway to put your name on the list and then be patient. Tables open up faster than you'd think.
author: Greg Y.

description: Really good, kid friendly Italian food and pasta. Great prices. The salads are fresh and big but get the dressing on the sides.
author: amy j.

description:
We ordered the garlic cheese bread and The Mountain pizza. The food was excellent and the ingredients were high quality. We loved it so much that we returned the next day and had the same thing (but with a side order of marinara for the cheese bread).

Unfortunately, the service was substandard on both days. It was very slow, and tables who arrived after us were served first. The server never checked up on us after we got our food, and gave us the bill without asking if we wanted dessert.

We were there around 6pm both nights. Although it was busy, there was no wait. We did notice lines out the door later on at night.
author: Lexter C.

description: Good place, good food. We love the fettuccini with baby clams. Just the service a little slow..
author: Jany O.

description:
Wow had pasta before and it was great. 
Decided to try pizza.  Service was very poor. We kept having to ask for more water and beer. Pizza poor. Asked for Eztra sauce and cheese. Neither appeared. Generally pretty sparce on toppings. Won't go back even though I live around the corner. Sad and don't get the other positive ratings.
author: Dale H.

description:
Super packed on a Friday night, so my BFF and I, while staying at a nearby hotel, ordered a pizza for takeout. 

We ordered a medium pizza with sausage, pepperoni and sun dried tomatoes. Nice crust, bubbly and slightly burned (I like!). Generous helping of toppings- fresh and flavorful. Since we only did take out, we didn't get a real feel for service and such, but the gentleman that took our order was friendly and efficient.

Added bonus, open kitchen! If you wait outside (the place is pretty small...when it's crowded you'll be forced outward) you can watch them make your pizza through the window :)
author: Syd M.

description: Why not 5 stars? Petite cosy Italian restaurant with pure taste of pizza and pasta. I love be it.
author: Syd V.

description: I love there burgers i don't know why but its not like a 5 start burger but yet it is amazing and there pizzas are very good to i say its a hit or miss i have heard people saying they don't like it but me and all my coworkers enjoy it ! There prices are very very reasonable
author: Alexius G.

description:
Anyone who follows my reviews knows that I am not a huge fan of carbs or pizza.  
My default meals are seafood, vegetables, fruit, yogurt, and nuts.

But when working late, and having to pack for hotel check out it is nice to call for delivery and not be bothered with time and expense of finding restaurants.  

When ordering delivery: Im not expecting to be delighted; but the Mountain pizza and spinach salad were definitely at least equal to the good hotel food here at the Hilton at literally one quarter the price and delivered.  
Next time that I get stuck in downtown hotels I will call Uncle Vito's before room service.  

The spinach salad is a basic salad but the spinach and mushrooms are impeccable.
The pizza is not the best that I have ever had but it is one of the better delivery pizzas, and the prices are excellent.  

Why the pizza is good:
Crisp fresh veggies, very good sauce, well proportioned, moderately thin crust (yay fewer carbs).
What could improve: dough in center was a little bit mushy but was happy to just not eat all of the crust anyways.
The meats were all good, with a little red pepper, some jalapenos and sprinkle of garlic this can be a contender (personal choices to spice things up a bit)

Uncle Vitos WILL be getting more delivery orders from me in the future.  Wish that they had one close to my home for nights when I don't have time to cook or time to go out.
author: Veronica S.

description: I got a large pep and it was great! Crust was soft and the pizza had good flavor...I got takeout and walked out the door in 15 mins...the place was PACKED.  It's not that big but they had a line of 10-15 people out the door.
author: Spencer Y.

description: We just checked into Grand Hyatt late and was looking for a quick cheap pizza place.  Walk in and there was 3 people ahead of us waiting for a table.  We waited about 10 minutes and then the waiter took everyone waiting for a table upstairs.  There was like 5 empty table - like why a wait?  Think they were way under staffed that night - looked like they only had 1 waiter and 1 hostess.  Told my wife lets go, this place is disorganized and it will take forever to get our food.  Decided to stay and glad we did.  Pizza came out fast and hot.  Had better but for what it was it filled our needs.
author: John L.

description:
Very popular little place. I went here on a Sunday evening and had to wait quite a while for a table, as it was very busy, but it was worth the wait. 

The Mountain pizza was delicious - very cheesy and hot, with lots of meat and vegetables. The wine was also very reasonably priced - around 10 dollars for a carafe.
author: Kira G.

description: First time staying near Union Square and Uncle Vito's happened to be near our hotel. Hubby and I decided to try it out and it was really good. I would definitely come back.
author: Luisa H.

description: Great pizza at a great value!! Walking distance from Union Square. Best I've had in the area
author: Frank C.

description:
This is a must-go-to for me whenever I am in San Francisco.  It is casual dining and a great place to hit if you are shopping in the Union Square area. 

The warm toasted Turkey Avocado sandwich will melt in your mouth and in not exaggerating. It's amazing. Just be sure to plan ahead - it is filling!  If you have it for lunch, you may not need dinner! 

Prices are reasonable. And the seating is laid-back. You can sit and watch for Viviene Brown, sadly just one of the famous San Fran Twins, as this has been on their walking route for years. 

Take a walk up Powell St to "earn" the calories of this tasty treat on the corner of Bush and Powell.
author: Sonya D.

description: Really great pizza for the price. Great service as well they delivered to our hotel room in a timely manner.
author: ChrisNWill B.

description: Excellent. Pie was ready in 15 minutes. Gooey cheese, toppings falling off. It was exactly what I wanted.
author: David R.

description:
This is a best in class type of joint!
The food is always fresh hot and always available love the late hours.
Visit here every time I come to San Francisco.
If I lived here this would be my every Saturday night for dine in or carry out to take home and watch a movie.
Pizza comfort food!
author: Craig D.

description: Pizza was delicious. Service wasn't very fast but it was packed and they didn't have many people to help serve but the ones that were they were working their butt off. I'll definitely come back!
author: Esther A.

description:
Visiting from LA and found this nifty place was a block over from our hotel. The employees are nice, the restaurant is humble looking but clean, and although they can get very busy, they always seem to get you what you need. 

I should mention my sister and I are extremely picky eaters and everything was fabulous!

Fettuccini Alfredo 10/10
Pizza 10/10

Overall, 11 out of 10. Tasty as heck.
author: Sun S.

description: We go to Uncle Vito's every time we're in the city. It's a great Italian place. The pizza is delicious. Does not disappoint. The atmosphere is cozy. Patricia was our waitress today and was super friendly.
author: Donna S.

description: Good pizza at lower than average SF prices. Nothing exceptional but still very good. Personal pizzas are very small, would recommend a medium if going solo. Fast service. Friendly staff.
author: Owen O.

description:
Loved this place!

Ordered side salad, which had chick peas, delicious mozzarella cheese, and a tantalizing dressing.

For dinner was the spaghetti w/meatballs - delicious dish that was well-seasoned. The bread that came with was huge and fantastic! My son ordered the fettucine alfredo - ended up stealing quite a bit from the creamy delight.

They really should do a fresh cheese kind of thing on the entrees and not have guests rely on using the parmesan from the glass jar on the table.

$54 for a family of 4 in downtown San Francisco - left with bellies full and with our taste buds tantalized. Uncle Vito - can I be your real nephew?
author: Matthew C.

description:
We stopped in after a long day of traveling.   Hungry!
Ordered pizza and salad.  Salad was awesome!  Fed three of us.  
Got basic pepperoni. Not bad.  Very basic pizza. 
Great service. Cute place
Cold beer too.
author: Mimi B.

description: Excellent, well run neighborhood pizzeria. Traditional Italian-American food well prepared, reasonably priced, and fresh. Gotta love Uncle Vito's!
author: stephan k.

description: So the pizza is great, but staff just seems a little awkward. They barely say a word to you, but all talkative amongst themselves.  The service is on a needed basis, means you order, they bring your food and that's it. No checking if you need refils, no checking if everything is good, it is what it is. Because of this they get 3 stars. Little extra service goes a long way. Not expecting waiting on me hand and foot, but just would like a refill when I'm empty. Would love to visit this place again, but only if they get better service...if not, won't bother
author: Andrew M.

description: This is the best pizza by the bay--thin crust baked to perfection with a fantastic SF sourdough tang. Sauce that has just the right amount of Italian seasoning to be perfect. The Greek salad is huge and fed three of us (two of whom are picky kids that now want to eat all our meals here). Love it here!
author: R O.

description: Spaghetti & meatballs, pasta special, beer, wine, and Anna's service all excellent. 12/09/16
author: paul s.

description: Very good service and the food is nice as well. Have free delivery and can't really as for more for a pizza joint. The pizza itself is not bad at all, very well made, not too doughy and the sauce is at it's perfect level.
author: jiopkly Y.

description: SO much fun!!! I went to Uncle Vito's (LOVE the name!) for dinner tonight and my friends and I enjoyed a delicious cheese pizza, a calzone with ricotta and mozzarella, and some pasta carbonara. The pizza was delicious with just the right ratio of cheese to sauce. My only (small) complaint is that the crust is too thick. However, the crust has a fabulous taste, so it's a win anyway. Our waitress was kind and attentive without hovering. I already can't wait to go back and try some different things on the menu. Maybe next time I'll build my own veggie pizza. (I guess we were craving cheese tonight! LOL) We ordered so much food we needed an extra table for the food and one for us to eat on! Needless to say, there were leftovers for a huge meal tomorrow. Yay Uncle Vito's!! I'm a fan.
author: Amy V.

description: I flew into San Francisco from a long flight and the concierge at my hotel recommended this place. I ordered a Greek salad and a small pizza and it was double the amount of food I needed and was pretty inexpensive. The Greek salad was excellent and had lots of veggies and cheese. The pizza was piping hot and great... a little soggy because of the huge amount of cheese, but it was overall delicious. Would eat here again!
author: Allison B.

description:
Not impressed. The service took forever and the center of our pizza was a little raw. 

The toppings were sparse, the flavor is okay. I have had a lot better, even from chain joints.
author: Vay V.

description: The place is cozy, with huge portions of food and reasonably cheap. Single Medium pizza is sufficient for two adults.
author: Pooya E.

description: Pizza to go twice now has been very soggy in the middle. Cheap pizza with quality toppings though, and very convenient location.
author: Kristin C.

description:
My first trip to SF as an adult was spring 2008. I was in Mountain View for an internship interview with Microsoft. The interview didn't take very long (read: I bombed it) and afterwards I decided to take my MS provided rental car and generous MS food stipend to go visit SF. I parked somewhere on the embarcadero and just started walking up hills. I happened to end up in front of Uncle Vito's right around dinner time so I stopped in for dinner. Could have been all the walking up hills, but I remember the pizza to be excellent.

Just a couple years later I ended up moving to SF and happened to find a place on this same block. I went here all the time.

The pizza is solid thin crust pizza. Don't expect Delfina and you'll be fine. It's all and all a little pricier than I'd like it to be. But a worthwhile splurge if you're in the neighborhood. The pizza is much better eaten fresh in the restaurant, instead of delivered --I had one or two disappointing delivery experiences.

It's totally possible I'm giving this place an extra star for sentimental value. Or maybe because of the serendipity of happening to eat near where I would live just a couple years later. Either way, Uncle Vito's is a solid 4 stars in my heart and a monument to my first visit to SF.
author: John B.

description: Ordered the tia maria pizza, fettuccine with clams, spaghetti with meatballs, fettuccine with chicken and pesto, and meat ravioli. The pizza was delicious, the fettuccine with clams was okay-thought it would be creamer and the clams were very tiny. Almost like it was chopped. Spaghetti with meatball - the sauce was really good but the meatball did not have a lot of flavor. Fettuccine with with pesto - the chicken was good. Ravioli - descent and serving a plenty. Small place and the wait was very long. Almost got seated at a table directly next to the bathroom which was not going I work out for my family. They do try to stuff customers in there.  I would recommend just ordering pizza.
author: E E.

description: Pizza is pretty good. We got the red eye and it was awesome. I did not care for my salad. I had the antipasto and there was barely any lettuce and tons of chickpeas and kidney beans. The system there is not organized and a ton of people waiting but not sure what to do. Very small place and it is better for takeout.
author: Megan B.

description: Great basil pizza, nice sweet crust, red onions and right amount of sun dried tomatoes! Ordered the side salad too! Nice and crisp and came with a nice helping of red beans, garbanzo beans, tomatoe and cheese
author: Reeni R.

description:
Uncle Vito's was packed when we stopped in recently for a late dinner.  They comped us beers and garlic bread, even though we didn't feel the service was that slow.
Food and service were great!
author: Maury C.

description: After looking around union square and couldn't decide where to eat we ended up going here. Overall the pizza was good and not to pricey at all!
author: Jessie B.

description: Good simple Italian food and pizza. Had the pepperoni and garlic pizza. A little greasy but garlic was wonderful but pepperoni was way too mild.  Date had lasagna which was good not great.  But the Italian salad was very good. the price was very good for area. Would go here
author: Georgio S.

description: We visited on a very busy Saturday night. Service was adequate. We agreed it felt like we were in a Seinfeld soup nazi episode. Our group of 4 ordered the meat ravioli, spaghetti marinara, pesto pasta, spinach pizza and Caesar salad. All in all not bad but nothing to write home about.
author: Miranda B.

description: We had the spinach salad and a small Greek Pizza. It was the perfect amount for 2 people and the food was good. The staff was ok. I've also had the Mountain Pizza which was good as well. When I'm in the area I'll be coming back for more great PIzza
author: Jeff C.

description: The staff was very busy, so service was OK.  We had the soup of the day which was the minestrone.  The soup was typical - nothing special, so that was fine.  For dinner, I had the spaghetti and meatballs.  The pasta was over cooked - a little on the softer side.  Also the sauce was OK, meaty which was good, but the sauce was on the thin side so it did not bind well with the soft spaghetti.  However, the meatballs were good - soft and very flavorful.  My girlfriend had the small calzone which was the perfect size for 1 person.  It was good but on the watery side.  There's ricotta cheese, so that made it watery.  Overall, the place is not bad!!
author: Kevin N.

description:
I had lunch at uncle vito's today.
I didn't have a lot of time, so got the Canadian burger,
With fries. 

 It was excellent, good beef, fresh lettuce, toasted good quality bun,  nice fries, tasty bacon. Actually really good, very tasty.

I sure the pizza will be good too, will defiantly go back and try.
author: Graham C.

description:
I live in Lower Nob Hill and generally order pizza and salad a couple times a month.

I have not found a better "take-out" pizza in the area in 4 years.  I've only tried when Vito's was closed and nothing has compared for me.  The service is fast, consistent and the side salad is one of the best "side-salad's" I've ever had... Chick peas, kidney beans, tomatoes, greek olives, mozzarella AND some of the best house dressing ever!

I always order the Mountain Pizza with the salad, and I like extra sauce, but crispy - so that the sauce doesn't make it soggy!  They are always accommodating and I am always confident that my food will arrive quickly and the way that I ordered it.

I'm a fan.  :)
author: Candace M.

description:
Ambience....atmosphere... great prices....friendly staff.
We stay nearby on Bush Street and always go here several times.
Great pizza! Fair prices for a cold Heineken on draft too!
author: Jon U.

description: We had the pizza bianco and the antipasto salad. Amazing! I highly recommend this place. It's small so come early or expect a small wait. Definitely worth it!
author: Jennie W.

description: 4 Stars for quality and service but it is still just pizza. However it is really good pizza and some of the best I've ever had. The antipasto salad was huge and delicious as well. Only wish we had ordered a bigger pie so that I could have had some for breakfast the next morning :-)
author: Kirk J.

description: I can't understand the good reviews. Our pizza we had tonight was bland and uninspiring. The toppings were not what I would consider edible portions. The fries that came with it were not much better I'm afraid. The service was bordering on rude. Perhaps it's because I've been to Italy and tasted the real mcoy but I just can't recommend this place as highly as everyone else.
author: W W.

description:
My friend and I took a vacation to San Fran this past weekend. Our second night was spent roaming around North Beach for great pizza without avail. By Sunday we were looking forward to trying Uncle Vito's mainly due to the convenient location to our hotel. 

I have to say there isn't a single reason why you'd need to go anywhere but Uncle Vito's for pizza in San Fran. If you are looking for a fancy dinner out this is not your place. It's small and cozy like most restaurants in San Fran, but quite casual. Our server, Angel, was attentive and nice. The Greek Salad was amazing with tons of fresh veggies, feta cheese, and chick peas mixed in. We ordered a caraf of wine for around $10. Can't beat that! Our pizza choice was half Hawaiin and half Red Eye. Both were deelish! I especially loved the ham on the Hawaiin side. This place is a must for a quick lunch or reasonably priced dinner.
author: Allison F.

description: After a long day spent at airports we ordered delivery from Uncle Vito's. Our food arrived in a timely manner and we were pleasantly surprised at the large portion sizes.  The fettucine alfredo was very good.  I would recommend this place to all my friends visiting SF.
author: Stacey K.

description: Bad, bad, bad... avoid at all cost. Rude. Not accomodating. The guy behind the counter must own the place. Will never set foot in there again.
author: David S.

description: This place was great and renewed my faith in San Fran pizza. We tried another place close to our hotel and it looked like they found their pepperoni off of a frozen personal pizza and we had about 8-10 mini pepperonis on our medium pizza. It was terrible. However, at Uncle Vito's the pizza was fresh, large pepperonis, taste was awesome and even their garlic bread was amazing. I highly recommend this place!
author: Kody B.

description: Not bad,  but not exceptional.  I agree with other reviews that this is a solid choice,  but nothing to write home about.
author: Jim H.

description: Outstanding classic Italian dishes at bistro prices. I recommend the spaghetti and meatballs and a couple of glasses of the house Chianti. Friendly service, great location.
author: Col M.

description: Pesto basil and the mountain. I personally really enjoyed the mountain, wife likes pesto pizza.  Coyly go wrong with uncle Vito's.
author: Joe B.

description: Visiting from San Diego. Excellent pizza and great service. As a family of five, I expected a long long wait on a Saturday night. With three small children, we were willing to wait because of all of the great reviews on the food. After only 15 or 20 minutes, we were seated. Awesome! Our server was excellent. The pizza was amazing. The beer was cold. Life is good. The chef even gave my kids a plate of fries while we were waiting!
author: Matthew A.

description: weekend working union square...lunch break at uncle vito's pizza...mostly open oven kitchen visible...counter order or small restaurant room to the left...table seated and browsing menu...diet coke requested to quench thirst after hard day...free refills excellent...staff taking orders at the table....simple salads crisp and fresh...lightly dressed...standard pizza pies decent...warning on calzones...quite the hefty folded pizza half circle...thick and piping hot cheese oozing...crusty hard bread shell sealing in all moisture, oil and meats...poke a hole to release the steam...too hot to handle fresh from the oven...quite the filling meal...ordered too much and taking boxes to go...
author: Hen A.

description:
The thoughtful response to my previous review was both genuine and incredibly accommodating, the owner even gave me his cell number. This is exactly how businesses should be run and why I will give Uncle Vito's another chance. (see: below)

"David D: Business Owner
It breaks my heart to hear how completely we failed to meet your expectations. I won't waste your time offering any excuses, but if you can find it in your heart to give us another chance I know we can, and will do better.
And please believe me when I say that my local customers are the ones who keep me in business. Tourism helps me keep up with the ever increasing cost of doing business in San Francisco, but without my regulars, I wouldn't even want to try to stay open. 
My cell is 415-244-3767. Please give me a call, or text, so that we can find a way for you to allow me to regain your business, and your trust.
I will not be able to contact you again unless you reply to this message, or contact me by cell.

Warm regards,
David Dubiner
Owner, Uncle Vito's Pizza"
author: Amber W.

description: Love the food here.  Been here plenty of times.  Disappointed that the waitress was adamant to seat me at the window with spilled-over pasta on the seat even as late as it was.  Service is a bit subpar unfortunately.  This has the potential to be a solid 4 star eatery.  Best to order take out to save yourself the hassle of having to deal with mediocre service.
author: Mike P.

description: We stumbled upon this restaurant and saw the crowds and I decided it must be good. I am an eggplant parm aficionado and this was one of the Best! The sauce is delicious. I wanted to keep the taste in my mouth as long as possible. I live in NJ but will be back on my next trip to San Francisco.
author: Karen N.

description: We had a medium pizza with ground beef, mushrooms and olives. We wanted chicken but it wasn't an topping option.  Pizza was hot, tasty and hit the spot.  Service was excellent and courteous.  It was good find in the neighborhood.  Thank you Uncle Vito's team for seating us quickly and feeding us hungry travelers.
author: Marlene B.

description: If you want a quick bite, DO NOT go here.  This is a busy place and the service was so slow.  It took a bit to be seated which was fine but once we were seated it took 15 mins to place our order (including drinks) and then another 15 min to receive our drinks.  It took another 30 mins to receive our 1 med pizza.  Now, my 3 star is rating is for the entire experience.  If I were just rating the pizza then it would get a 5 star.  Their pizza was SO delicious! I would never eat in again but if the take out service is better than I would definitely order pizza to go!
author: C M.

description: San Francisco, I expected better from you. Are you kidding me with all these "best pizza I've ever had" reviews? It was the most basic pizza I've ever had from a non-chain establishment. Next time you're in San Diego, let me know, I'll recommend some 5 star worthy places that will satisfy your pizza cravings, NY style or Italian style, whatever tickles your fancy.
author: Milana A.

description: Came here with my family on a Tuesday night to get some pizza's.. Had a group of 8 but only 4 were there already and they refused to seat us at a table for 8 that they had ready for us until the next 4 got there.. That just seems dumb. So we sat the four of us and ordered everyone pizza and the others some to go as we didn't want to spend much time there. My friend ordered a pizza without red sauce because she can't eat red sauce and they said they couldn't do that?? So she had to order pasta. The waitress was rude and food wasn't even good. I don't recommend.
author: Olivia S.

description: This is for the service only. The food is amazing but our waitress as had terrible customer service. My brother, his girlfriend and I went here for dinner and we literally had to line up our empty glasses at the side of the table for us to get a refill. Overall food is an A- and the waitress was an F.
author: Nathasia N.

description:
UNRELIABLE!!!

It says they will deliver until 11PM and they have before. But, this time, after calling them 3 times, JIMMY finally informed me that they would not deliver to me because they were "SLOW!!!"
author: Jason M.

description: Yes, it's small and crowded. They are working their tails off to keep up with the non stop flow of traffic. Like the pizza very much.
author: Keith F.

description:
One of the best Italian restaurants I have ever stumbled upon. We ate the fettuccine Alfredo and added in sun dried tomatoes. I couldn't stop eating it. We also ordered cheese ravioli with pesto and it was phenomenal.

I will come here every time I visit San Francisco without a doubt. Easy to get to and amazing prices.
author: Russell S.

description: Good food with so so service in the heart of downtown. If you are lucky you can nab a seat at the window. Both the the greek pizza and the fettuccine were good as well as the deep fried ravioli app.
author: Darren G.

description:
Thanks to Yelp, we found this place within walking distance of our hotel (the JW Marriott). So glad we did! For our group of 3, we ordered a medium of their daily special which was a spinach, tomato, mozzarella, basil pizza. The pizza came our piping hot and was just the right size for a light bite (we'd already had dinner several hours earlier). 

The pizza had the right amount of ooey gooey cheese (a good quality mozzarella), freshly made & flavorful sauce, and fresh produce that you could actually taste! The crust was crispy on the outside yet still chewy inside, just the way I like it. Note: This isn't thick crust pizza, it's the kind you fold in half to eat. 

One more note: they don't serve pizza by the slice which was what we originally went looking for. No matter, ordering up a whole pie was definitely worth it!
author: Ixiim F.

description: We were in the mood for some pizza and pasta. Yelped this place and thought let's give it a try. Glad we did! The food was delicious and the service was good. If you are in the mood for some good pizza and pasta this is the place .... ask for Alex, great server with an amazing personality .
author: Leticia G.

description:
Probably closer to 3.5 stars, but I like to round up.

For takeout/delivery this place has great pizza, great salads, great pasta. Just great.
author: Anthony T.

description:
This was right across our hotel when we visited San Francisco a few months ago.  I was in a mood for pizza but was too busy sight seeing that I didnt get to try it out until our last day there.  We passed by it at least 10 times, and watched from outside the window as they threw the pizza dough in the air, and made it look like art.  Alot of people (tourists) were at awe as they made the pizza look sooo good!

I figured it would taste different since its probably going to be West Coast style pizza, which according to my cousins who live out here is totally different from East Coast (NY) style pizza.

Got a couple of pepperoni slices and wow, it felt like I was back home!  I thought we had already landed from Newark Liberty Airport! That was great!  Glad I had two slices before taking the cab to SF airport.  Im a fan and would definitely recommend this place if your love Italian and you love Pizza, this is your place.  Thanks Uncle Vito.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Okay honestly, I don't think that you can find a better calzone in the city. Maybe I am partial because Uncle Vito's is less than a block from my apartment.  

I do not dine in so my review is based solely on the fantastic tasting food.  

Salame, pepperoni, mushrooms, ricotta, parmesan, tomato sauce yummmm...

My only complaint is that on Sundays when I am hungover and in desperate need of salty cheesy goodness, they don't open until 4pm! Ayai Yai!  It has made for some terribly foggy brained afternoons.  Please Uncle Vito's open up earlier on Sundays!
author: Ali B.

description:
Not a bad pizza!  
Quick easy ordering.  Custom ordering available  
Fast delivery.  Cool drivers.
Will repeat!
author: Alex R.

description: Very good food and reasonably priced! I had the small broccoli and spinach pizza, my husband had the meatball sandwich. Good meatballs, weird choice of bread to use. Very quick service, but like most places in SF it is a bit crowded. No AC and we had a15 minute wait at 730 on a Monday night. The restaurant is small so it might be hard to be seated if you have a group bigger than 8.
author: Colleen M.

description:
Food here is pretty much always great, there is only one thing on the menu I don't enjoy but that's personal preference

Word to the wise CALL AHEAD because they get very busy, so if you want good quick service I would suggest take out

The ham and avo sandwich, the Canadian bacon burger and Hawaiian pizza are the go-to options for me but I also like the pasta

Every once and a while you will get slow or not as good service, but the food is always on point which is why this is one of my favorite places to eat when in SF
author: Corbin B.

description:
No slices after lunch, what's that about?? 

This is not a place to seek out.  It's a restaurant of the desperate and lost souls who need the comfort of pizza in the restaurant wast

 I had to buy a personal pizza late night, which was just not what I was looking for.  It's mediocre pizza, zero customer service, and average prices.
author: Dave S.

description:
Visiting from AZ, was very good. Greek salad was a good size. Split a mountain 12"
Pizza with my wife, very good. Crust light and crispy, good amount is cheese and toppings. Would eat here again.
author: Ian Y.

description: Fast service whether it's dine-in, take-out or delivery. Excellent pizza. The dough is always just the right amount of crunchy and soft, they balance all the ingredients perfectly. I come from an Italian family where we make pizza from scratch at home and I have to say that Uncle Vito's is one of the best pizzerias I've ever been to. I eat there almost once a week. It's unassuming, affordable and simply delicious. Definitely my go-to friendly neighborhood pizza joint.
author: Dany R.

description: Super crowded Saturday night. But worth the wait. Excellent service. The owner went out of his way to make us comfortable though it was so crowded. Really good pizza.
author: Vanessa G.

description: Sooo good! We ordered the grilled chicken salad (perfectly dressed) for $8 and a 12'' Mountain pizza (I added jalapeños) and it was so meaty and our server was very good! $4 Sierra Nevada on draft was also a great deal! Thanks Vito's!!!
author: Tonya H.

description: This is a tiny place two blocks up from my office. And by "up" I mean: UP -- a glute-busting hill that might just burn off the calories you'll eat there, but probably not. It's cramped, our table was by the bathroom, the menus and the walls were dingy and grubby, the waiter was rude, and it gets 5 stars! So good! I went back the next day and wisely cut my order down to split the fettuccine sienna between two and share a Caesar salad with Uncle Vito's cousin Sal's dressing. Heaven on a lunch plate.
author: Cindy M.

description: Best tasting pizza in the city. The guys' prepping the pizza look a little shady and act socially retarded, but It's definitely worth trying at least for delivery.
author: Rio B.

description: Craving meatballs all day and they were great. We also had pizza, lasagna and cheese pesto raviolis and some of our group said this was the highlight of their day.. that's compared to the golden gate bridge.  Alex our server had the best personality and was very good. We definitely recommend this place!! Thumbs up!!!
author: Shannon T.

description: Wooh! Want a great and lovely place to have brunch or just grab some pizza? Well Uncle Vito's is your place! The price is great, not to pricy or high. The taste! Is wonderful. No frozen shenanigans or that non-sense. Uncle Vito's is always fresh! I've been a huge fan sine 2000! Whats better is you can actually watch them prep your food. Now isn't that cool watching a man throwing dough in the air? Want a great place to eat! Go to Uncle Vito's,
author: William K.

description: We ordered a pepperoni pizza and the breaded raviolis to our hotel. Fast delivery and the food was hot, but that's about all that was good about our order.  The pizza was really greasy and pretty tasteless.  The raviolis had no taste either. Also, I'm pretty sure the marinara was actually salsa.
author: Angela J.

description:
Every pizza we've ordered from here has been the tastiest, freshest and full of toppings. 

Will keep coming back and perhaps next time we'll eat in.
author: Sarah J.

description: Delivery to hotel, after a wait on hold for 1 minute 30 seconds to even talk to somebody, I got nervous.  But, the call went well, pizza w pep and mushrooms delivered in 30 minutes to my hotel room, w a good caesar salad!  Pizza was great!  Fast!  How they do dat?!!!!
author: Jim C.

description: Across the street from Grant Hotel off Bush. Pretty cramped and busy restaurant. Tried the Ceasar salad with chicken, it was delicious! Tables could have been cleaner. This place takes take-orders, I think that a better way to go instead of waiting for a table and sitting so close the next table. Not a restaurant that I would go out of my way to eat at.
author: Maria D.

description: This is my closest italian place, and they make a really good veggie pizzas and are open till late. I haven't really been impressed with their pastas though - it seems like there's too much grease and too little flavor, so I wont go there for pasta again.
author: Marie V.

description: They're version of "supreme" pizza ( they call it the mountain) is the best supreme pizza I've ever had! I love the deep sauce flavor they have with perfect crust. I used to live close and I ordered from them all the time. Super consistent, and always delicious.
author: Lauren H.

description: Pizza was excellent and wasn't too pricey for what you got. People there were not very inviting but the food was good. Worth popping in for a pie!
author: Doug W.

description:
BEST PIZZA I HAVE EVER HAD!!!

I went here every day of my vacation when I was in san fran staying at the worldmark time share hotel down the street.

I seriously miss this pizza all the time.
author: The Serious Yelper K.

description: Special calzone with mushrooms and salami. Nice and quick service for taking away but nice place for a dinner.
author: Gino T.

description: What a great experience! Pizza was amazing, service was quick & friendly PLUS our order was slightly wrong, so our waitress brought us what we actually ordered, let us keep the extra food AND gave us a 25% discount! We'll be back!
author: Bret C.

description: They don't deserve a star! Simply Rude! Why do you put people on hold for 10 minutes only to tell them they can't deliver until 1pm! Mind you I called at 11am!
author: Romina N.

description: Discriminatory and humiliating treatment to kids, family and non-white (Indian) people. On January 1, 2017- we had a group of 25 people (10 kids ranging 14 months to 10 years)  went to Uncle Vito's. Manager(s) were rude. Won't give us place to seat. We were flexible. We decided to order and eat on the street, outside restaurant. Since it was cold, we had requested to have 1 or 2 tables for kids. He REFUSED and won't allow as if "Indians are not allowed to sit inside restaurant". So in freezing cold, we waited outside for 1 1/2 hours and ate our food.  We saw many white guys who came after us were given seat inside restaurant. We spend almost $400 and got humiliating treatment. We could have gone somewhere else. But kids were hungry and most of restaurants were full. Never been treated like SECOND/THIRD CLASS citizen. We ask questions, manger(s) were rudely replying to us. We asked for take out boxes. They asked us to re-use same x-large boxes to carry a piece of pizza.We were shocked to receive such discriminatory treatment in USA and that too in San Francisco. We are going to hire a lawyer and file a lawsuit for receiving such treatment. Going to civil right  and department of justice We will share this post to all social media, if Yelp will cancel or delete this post as Uncle Vito's Pizza is their paid customer. So yelp, stay away. Be neutral. We have enough evidence, including photographs  to show how kids were treated by restaurant manager(s).
author: Sharmila T.

description: Uncle Vito's food was very good. I had the chicken fettuccine and my friend had fettuccine with clams. The service was not great and the seating was tight, but I would go back again.
author: Jeff S.

description: Pizza was awesome!!  Garlic bread could have been a little more garlicy. But all-in-all, very good.
author: Jane W.

description: Great little pizza place on the corner. We had a pizza and spaghetti and fried cheese ravioli... All the food was great.
author: Travis J.

description: This restaurant made me so happy! Center of everything, and super popular. I ordered a cheese ravioli pesto without pesto, my friends got spaghetti with meatballs, and a tuna melt. The food was amazing, along with the service... Super quick and on point!! Our server was very helpful and really nice. This is a spot I'll always come to when I'm traveling in San Francisco!
author: Maria H.

description: After leaving a bad review which I hate to do I was really impressed with how the owner acknowledged my complaint.  I would give them another chance the next time I'm in the area because I believe they were just having an off night when I was there.
author: Kelli H.

description:
Disclaimer:
- I did not order the pizza or dine at the restaurant
- I showed up late to the event I went to which ordered the pizza, so the pizza was not the freshest

Had the cheese and pepperoni pizza here from Vito's and I was not impressed. Not at all. I normally am a fan of thin crust but this pizza was so oily, that the thin crust completely soaked through, making the crust a greasy mess. Also, because there was so much oil, the whole pizza was flavorless. I had a slice of the cheese pizza and the pepperoni (of which there were only a few slices of pepperoni) and they tasted the same, cause the oil overpowered everything. 

Maybe my experience would be better in the restaurant but I don't know if I want to try it after such a negative first impression.
author: Austin W.

description: This place was very close to our hotel which was what drew us in to begin with, along with price. We were aware there was a wait and they were pretty much on spot with how long it might take. We ordered the ravioli Fritis (amazing), garlic bread, and a large pizza. The pizza was okay (filled us up after walking around all day) and same for the garlic bread. The dough was very dry and flour-y tasting. Why so low of stars you might ask? After waiting for a table they sat us literally across from the stinkiest bathroom of all time. That is all we could smell. It was horrible. We rushed back to our hotel afterwards. All in all, one star for staff, one star for fritis, and one star for the pizza toppings!
author: Emily N.

description:
I ordered "The Mountain" over the phone this afternoon, quickly got dressed and headed out to pick up the pizza. I only live a little more than a block away and I've never tried it until today! The pizza was ready to go when I got there, 15mins after the phone call ! 

The place was decorated in pretty christmas lights, it was kind of empty on a regular afternoon day. I ordered a small for 3 people, that wasn't such a good decision since it costed $14. There are only 4 slices in a small. So if you're super hungry, I suggest that you shouldn't come here. I'm not sure how big the medium/large is. But the small, is really quite small..

Somewhat expensive, but good quality pizza!
author: Kelly H.

description: I like the pizza and salads. Pizza is fresh and juicy the way I like it. Salads are tasty the way my wife likes it. I went there with my wife and my baby in a stroller.
author: Amir S.

description: Had the basics:  Sausage pizza (w/ fresh garlic - made the difference!) and spaghetti and meatballs.  The pizza was divine and the spaghetti good, but not spectacular.  (Went back a second time just for pizza!)  Decent, but small, beer selection (wine also).  Saw someone with a salad that looked very good as well.  Service is adequate; albeit not super friendly.  (They seem to be going more for "efficiency" than anything else.)  The eating area is small, but I didn't feel it was as cramped as some other reviewers indicated.  (Kind of a typical, smaller Italian venue...)  Highly recommended for dinner OR lunch.  (And they do a brisk takeout business, which tells me the locals love it too!)
author: Shirley T.

description:
Been going to Vito's for years, finally made a yelp account.

This place is great. 

It has the classic pizza parlor look, so allow yourself to judge a book by its cover and get their pizza, you won't regret it.

Greek salad and their meatball sandwich are amazing too. 

Glad I can finally review my favorite Pizza place
author: Cem D.

description: Awesome pizza! Almost reminds me of New York! Come all the way from Hayward just get some Vito's pizza!
author: Sinat A.

description: Came to San Francisco for VMWorld 2014 and had no idea what restaurants were decent.  Yelp is like GPS for food around here.  Uncle Vito's was no exception. Great pizza within easy walking distance.  Called ahead and they had it ready within 2 minutes of our arrival.  Thanks guys.
author: Brandon L.

description: . Visiting from sacramento i used yelp as i frequently will to find a delicious experience. I was sorely dissapointed and had i not been constricted by time i would have walked out. I had several problems with my visit to this establishment. First, when ordering my pizza they refused to make my pizza how i requested. . . i was shocked. Then he overcharged me and argued with me about it. Then after originally ordering our food to go, we reconsidered and decided to eat in instead. They refused to let us eat there. Literally didn't quote "once it's to go its to go."  so rude. Also the pizza is greasy and wimpy crust. And the chicken ceaser salad Is a joke. The dressing it's funky and barely any toppings. I would never recommend this place to anyone. Terrible service, mediocre food.
author: Katie V.

description: Uncle Vito's is one of our favorite Italian restaurants in San Francisco.  Great pizza and specials.   Just had the feta cheese and spinach special.  It's great!
author: Tim M.

description: Hostess ignored us for 20 minutes after we came in. Finally got our name on the wait list. After 40 minute or so wait, we ordered. Grilled Chicken Salad was greasy. Pizza was mediocre. Service was indifferent. There are so many other better pizza joints around. Don't bother.
author: Tommy G.

description: Quick food for cheap. The meatball sub is a must-try.
author: Kelsey A.

description: You must try "The Mountain!" It's a meat lover's pizza with onions and peppers. It's is so good! Solid pizza in SF. I usually order and pick up and they pretty prompt. So if you're in the neighborhood definitely stop by.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I recently went in for some pizza. The food was excellent and the service was great. The cashier Ronald I believe his name was recommended a really good dish. Can't wait to go back and order another mountain pizza.
author: Jason C.

description: This is my regular delivery spot. I always get the lasagna or fettuccine primavera with chicken. Always good. And the salads are not to be missed, especially the anti-pasta salad and chicken Caesar. Just ordered the turkey, avocado and cheese sandwich. Possibly the best sandwich ever! It's toasted and the combination of avocado, melted cheese, the vinaigrette on a sesame roll is amazing. You really can't go wrong here. Try the sautéed mushrooms too. Really good.
author: Timoteo K.

description:
After spending several days in San Francisco --- and exhaustively walking up and down the hilly streets searching for the best places to eat, my husband and I happened upon this little gem. Not only is the food absolutely yummy, but they offer FREE DELIVERY.

Where else in San Francisco can you get a nice, Italian meal for two  (garlic bread and salads included) for under $30, and have it delivered right to your hotel room door? 

Initially, we veered away from having dinner delivered as everything was in walking distance and there was lots of restaurants nearby to choose from, but.... the last evening-- after days of near cardiac events walking throughout the Nob Hll neighborhood -- we threw caution to the wind and decided on delivery. I came to Yelp to read a few reviews, and that sold me. Not only did Uncle Vito's live up to its reviews, it surpassed them! 

Thank you, Uncle Vito, for coming to our rescue and delivering a meal otherwise worth the hike!
author: Kaycie B.

description: Great pizza, friendly service, and quick turn around time for our food! Our waitress was friendly and courteous.  We sat upstairs and it was nice and private as there were 8 of us dining.  We ordered the house salad and it was a pleasant surprise for a pizzeria.  Crisp lettuce, cheese, tomatoes, kalamata olives, garbanzo beans and kidney beans with a yummy Italian dressing.  The pizza crust was thin and crispy and the toppings tasted very fresh. We would definitely return here.
author: Beth R.

description: Our office ordered ONE medium pizza for delivery at 11am which is the time they open. It's now 12:34 pm, our lunch time will be over in less than half an hour and we have yet to receive this pizza of ours. I called at 12pm just to politely check in and get the status of our order and they apologized because they had just received a huge order. The man I spoke with said it would just be another 10-15 minutes before it arrived. Sadly, it's been over 30 minutes.
author: Lisa Marie N.

description: Awesome food and service! Highly recommend the pizza and mushroom hamburger! Food was fresh and delicious! Prices very doable!! Just wish we would of seen Uncle Vito! Lol
author: Lisa R.

description: Just Visiting San Francisco for a couple day from New York. My family and I had the best pizza at uncle Vito's . I have eaten some good pizza in NYC but uncle Vito's was best I had in a long time. You won't be disappointed you must check it out for your self.
author: Joseph V.

description:
Great pizza. Ordered the mountain pizza. Good crust, perfect topping.

Only bad things are: 
lots of people
We didn't get a great table (better than no table)
Bottom of the pizza crust was a little hard cooked

I would certainly go again
author: Bert V.

description:
Had this pizza at work once, so when I had a craving for pizza, I called to order delivery. I get through telling them my name and phone number (which took longer than it should have), and by the time I get to my address the guy just says "we don't deliver there." I ask him what the cut off area is and before I can even offer to pick it up, he hangs up. 

1 star for service, 3 stars for the actual pizza being decent (and cheap).

Suggestions:

- Ask the address first!
- Don't hang up immediately - I could have picked it up! 
- I guess I should have expected this since the average pie is $15. Womp.
author: Johanna L.

description: I will admit, I am pretty spoiled when it comes to pizza as I grew up in the greater NY area, but this place is actually pretty good. What you would expect from a pizza joint. The salad was a little weak but that not their bread and butter.
author: M Z.

description: It's only a few blocks from our Hilton hotel." Lets walk along Powell street to savor the union square and cable car vibes"I told my friend, who was  inspired by her yearning for the cheesy pizza, obediently followed me. Every step we took became more challenging because of the street elevation. And then there it was a block away my uncle awaited us. It is a local pizza joint. Old and busy like a good old uncle. The pizza was delicious and the view of the cable cars climbing up and down the hill is comforting. 3.89999 ciao uncle
author: Ann K.

description:
Our first night in San Francisco ended well because of this restaurant. We were starving when we arrived at 10pm and immediately wanted to find a restaurant that delivered.

We ordered the mountain, red eye, lasagna, and salad.


OMG.
The red eye pizza and the mountain are the best pizzas we've ever had! Even today we still think about it. Unfortunately we live over 5hrs away. The next time we come back to SF we're definitely coming back.

Lasagna was delicious too!
author: DJ P.

description: After eating at numerous places in SF, we found Vito's.  Food was great and service good!  Probably the best we found here! Not impressed with SF wait staff!  Very indifferent to customers!
author: David P.

description:
I have not used them for several years, but we ordered delivery for a work function on 9/19. They were here right on time.  Everything that was hot-was still steaming.  3 large pizza's were good.  Had the half tray of meat lasagna and fett alfredo each, hardly any left. Plus half tray of greek salad and garlic bread.

Enough for about 15-20 people.  Inc tip was 207.00.  Score!
author: Teri X.

description: Was staying at the Orchard Hotel a few steps away and waltzed in starving and desperate for food.  Vito's was closing in minutes but they still made us a small pizza (to go) piled high with fresh toppings.  Pizza was good but what really encouraged me to submit a review was this establishment's regard for their customers.  We really appreciated their kindness which made every bite of that pizza that much more enjoyable.
author: Naomi B.

description:
My favorite pizza place in the City. A couple of college friends introduced this place to me back in 1987, and I've been coming back ever since. I even got my wife and daughter hooked on the place now. What drew me in was the clam and garlic pizza. I order it every time I go there. I have tired other items on the menu that family and/or friends have shared with me, but nothing can pull me away from the clam and garlic.
It's a cool little place that gets crowed pretty quick for lunch an dinner. My wife likes their pasta the best. 
The crust is on the thinner NY style side. Its very tasty.
The restaurant is along a steep hill street, Powell, and so it has two levels, and at both levels you can see the sidewalk. :-)
Enjoy a good pizza and root beer here, or a glass of wine. (I'm not much of a beer drinker so I can't vouch for it).
author: Tyrone M.

description:
The food may be good here but the staff....eek! 

It's disgusting how perverted these men can be when you're walking past the restaurant on Powell Street. I can't believe these men sometimes. One of them especially... is extremely weird and a total desperate creep!!! After sharing my story with a few of my female co workers they agreed and said they've experienced the same thing!!! I couldn't believe it. Because of this, I will NEVER again order from here.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
I sat down two days ago. I had to meet a friend in half an hour, but it was next door and she can be a little late so I had 40 minutes to sit by myself and eat. 

They sat me down, the man didn't really pay much attention to me. No greeting, no i'll be with you in a second. He took my order and gave me a water. I sat and waited.

And waited.

And waited some more. Without water refills. Without "sorry it's taking so long." "Sorry all these people are being served before you."

After twenty five minutes I couldn't wait any longer. All I had ordered was a veggie burger and fries. I got up, and said I needed the order to go. The cooks are kind of playing around with each other and they stare at me blankly. And then they look to the counter and they say, "But it's ready!" I really didn't want to sit and eat, and I was running short on time so I said I needed it to go.

My waiter half-heartedly apologizes, and they go to ring me up. He swipes my card and says it's decline. I say that's impossible, but I give him another. Declined. I said that, that is really impossible because it's a visa gift card with twenty bucks. His cook friend comes over and says "Oh! It's out of paper."
