So how many cooks does it take to refill the paper? Four apparently. But that will still take them -- and I kid you not-- 10 minutes. In retrospect I should've walked away. I didn't. when they had finally got it, I paid and left. 

And when I finally got a chance to eat it-- TERRIBLE! Dry, and plain. I could barely swallow. 

I had a bad feeling so I checked my card transactions. They charged me not once, not twice, but three times for my disgusting meal. Now I have to spend my next day off trying to get these four men to figure out how to reimburse me. If refilling paper takes ten minutes, I can only imagine how much time I'm going to waste for a refund.
author: Raquel R.

description: seeking shelter during an extremely rainy,windy and cold afternoon..we were pleasantly surprised by the warming great house wine,delicious and reasonably priced hot turkey and mozzerella sandwich and hospitable and pleasant italien waitress,fredrika.at uncle vitos.
author: judith s.

description: Just stopped in and ordered a small cheese pizza to go.  I'm always skeptical about quality when a place delivers, but it was excellent.  Small cheese pizza extra light cheese made to order.  Didn't try the garlic bread but it sure looks good!
author: Frank M.

description:
I scanned Yelp for the closest, most decent pizzeria near our hotel at the Ritz and I think we really found it at Uncle Vito's. We've been here for 8 days and have eaten here twice after really long days touring the sites. 

The pizza is good. The cheese is melty and gooey, the crust is crispy and not too thick, and they don't skimp on toppings. The best part is the sauce. You can tell it's fresh.

They're quick and friendly. I'd definitely recommend this for people not willing to try some of the offerings in Chinatown and too lazy to go to North Beach for Italian...like me!
author: Rosie P.

description: Great food in a small very busy restaurant.  Staff worked fast to deliver tasty pizza and salad.  If you are in the area I highly recommend.
author: Tom D.

description:
We came here to grab something to bring back to the hotel room instead of having to eat out.  I ordered the eggplant parm sandwich, something I haven't had since moving out of NYC to Oregon.  The sandwich was extremely dry.  I don't think a little extra marinara would've killed them.  The eggplant was overcooked and kinda had a slight burnt taste.  

The personal sausage pizza was overloaded with cheese, bland, and the sauce was lackluster.  Could've gotten better and more for the same price elsewhere.
author: Steph L.

description: Walked in on a Saturday afternoon and got a slice of pepperoni pizza. It was large enough that I cut it in half and saved the second half for later. If you like Sbarro's pizza, that's what this reminded me of. It's super good and cheesy. Love that you can order by the slice!
author: Kat S.

description:
Not a bad place, but not great either.  Food was good, but lacked the type of flavor I have had at other, similar places.  Pizza and spaghetti sauces lacked flavor, tastes like the stuff you buy at the store.

Service was good.  Friendly staff.  Food came out quick and drink refills happened, eventually.

I wouldn't tell people to come, but I'd come back if I was in a hurry.
author: Chad S.

description: Empty restaurant. Multiple open tables.  I am only one so my only option to sit is crammed in a corner table with no room at all.  I ask to sit at one if the 4 tops, happy to move if they need the table( 4 groups of 4 would need to arrive - it's 9 pm).   Nope. Sit in the corner or don't eat there.  Wow!  My favorite pizza just isn't worth that.  Ever again.  What a disappointment
author: Debra R.

description: Me & my husband just had hawian pizza from there guys and we loved it ..properly baked with right amount of ham & pineapple & peppers...we really enjoyed & I will definitely recommend my friends & the visitor not to miss this place ...The staff was so nice & Efficient
author: Sunita C.

description: The food is good the service is great. Very easy going and friendly. Except this one guy who wears a shirt with Hawaiin drinks on it. He is very rude to staff and customers alike. I would rate this place 5 stars if he wasn't there. He makes the experience very uncomfortable. Anyway,  good pizza good service just walk away and come back another time if you see this wannabe manager with his weird shirts.
author: Rich S.

description:
How I wish I had an uncle named Vito!

This place is filled with tasty pizzas and pastas.
I have an obsession with spaghetti and meatballs ($10.75) and this place definitely cures my sudden craving for it. They give you tones of pastas and sauce so if I went here, I would also have my next day's lunch. The only thing I wish they would change is to reduce the size of the meatballs (for some reason, this makes me laugh). Right now, they give you 2 giant ones but I wish they were smaller so I can eat like a lady!

I also enjoy their cheese pizza (Med. $11.50). We like to ask for light sauce so I can really taste the pizza dough. 

I think the only problem I have with this place is it gets really busy and the wait could get long. Also, if you were seated upstairs during busy times, the waiter may forget about you and you will end up sipping on that water for a while. I would recommend this place to people who live near by. It is so much better to place an order and take it home to enjoy!
author: Alice L.

description: Great food and service - the pizza and pasta is outstanding. They have the best Cesar salad with lots of croutons and cheese.  The place is small and quaint- definitely love this place-coming back for sure.
author: Roberts P.

description: We are some waaay expensive appetizers at another place the found Uncle Vito's when walking around. I love pizza and usually make my own. Uncle Vito can make my pizza anytime. Quick and tasty.   If you are in downtown San Francisco you should give it a try.
author: Jerry Jeschke J.

description:
This is honesty one of the best pizza I have ever had. 
Their prices are cheap and affordable, the service is really friendly. 
A good place to eat!
author: Xavier L.

description:
Fancy is not always better...


This place is simple and small but the food is great.

Service was slow but there was one guy running around the whole place so I wont deduct stars for that.

My husband and I both ordered Pastas and shared an appitizers...
Everything was ahhhmazzing!

Will go again and this time in walking shoes since I climbed two huge uphill blocks...Its the city what did I expect.
author: Kourtney O.

description: Pizza is average at best, small was cut into 4 very poor slices, toppings slipped off when i picked it up, and the crust was soggy, Pasta was good but nothing special, price was reasonable service was fine, seatting cramped wouldnt go back though.
author: Martin T.

description: Food is great - pastas, lasagne, and pizzas are worth the trip if you're near the area.  It's pretty crammed inside, but the wait isn't that long. I've been there at least a dozen times and I've never had a complaint.  They also deliver which is convenient.
author: Jer M.

description: Ordered the pesto with no olives... cane with olives. OLIVE YOU SHOULD GO TO HELL. still ate the pizza.
author: Lesley M.

description:
Had delivery pizza, side salad and garlic bread with cheese.

I mean the price isn't bad but the food isn't all that great.  You get what you pay for.  Side salad - NOT GOOD.

Pizza is alright
author: Jorge C.

description: Uncle Vito's has become one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco.  I am usually very picky when it comes to pizza, and I won't settle for boring run of the mill pizza.  My GF brought me to Uncle Vito's during one of our SF trips, and we now go out of our way to stop by each time we are in SF.  The dough at Uncle Vito's makes each pizza so delicious.  There is something about the combination of the dough and sauce that is soooo good.  It is a fairly small, hole in the wall, type of place, but the food is consistently good.  I recommend Uncle Vito's to anyone looking to get away from all the touristy restaurants.  This is a great, local pizza joint in the heart of SF.
author: Michael M.

description: The cheese pizza is awesome!
author: Henriette K.

description:
This was right on the cusp between like and dislike and, in the end, I gave them the nod. 

This is based on a delivery order. I do want to go in and order pizza and see how that turns out.

I ordered a medium meat calzone and a cheeseburger with fries.
The calzone was soggy. and I thought the crust was a little overcooked. It did taste good. I just could not eat all of it because of the sogginess.

For delivery, I thought the cheeseburger and fries were above average. I ordered it cooked medium but it was probably medium well.

I have taken into account that this was delivery and not eating in the restaurant. Based on other reviews, I am going to give it another chance.
author: Mark D.

description: Friendly, efficient service. I had meat lasagne which was excellent.  It came with a huge salad loaded with variety of veggies. Companion had individual  pepperoni and hamburger pizza which was really good. Price was very reasonable. Steady stream of dinner customers on a week night. We recommend!
author: Cathi S.

description: Loved the feel of this place! Small hole in the wall Italian restaurant in the Nob Hill area on Bush Street. My parents ate here several times during their trip to San Francisco we joined them on one visit. We had a pepperoni pizza with a caeser salad that was delicious.  My mom had the spaghetti dinner with garlic bread she said that it was delicious. My dad had a calzone that he said was awesome. The only downside was the house white wine which was horrible.
author: Angela S.

description: Food was ok. Service was ok. But the best helpful thing to say is do not expect to dine in comfortably. Space was very limited - either you sit in a tiny crowded room or right next to the bathroom.  Space was very unwelcoming and for no reason we felt like idiots for having a toddler and a stroller before we even ordered. Had I known I would have had take out or insisted harder with spouse to leave.
author: Hana P.

description:
I love the fact that I can see directly into their kitchen from my living room window. It's a real rush of satisfaction to watch as an employee picks up the phone as you're calling, spy on them as they write down your order, and get to work the moment you hang up. Unless you want to come live with me, you will unfortunately be deprived of this wonderfulness. However!

As a picky New Yorker, I find their pizza quite good. A little on the pricey side but I can clean a small one off without hesitating. I've recently fallen in love with their meatball sub, too! Unwrapping it, you can't help but draw comparisons in size and weight to a premature baby but before you know it, it's gone and you loved every cheesy moment. 

I love seeing the twins, Marian and Vivian Brown, in their crazy outfits! Gives it a real San Francisco feel, as if the cable cars outside didn't. All in all, great little place!
author: Erin O.

description: This place was great!! Loved the pizza and the antipasto salad. Service was great and the wait was not long at all. Definitely recommend.
author: Maribel M.

description: I am currently visiting SF from LA and just had a pepperoni and cheese pizza from here. Simple and classic but it was the best pizza I've ever had. When you bite down on the cheese it doesn't all slide down. You get the best bite every bite. Must try!
author: Nnna P.

description:
I have probably eaten at Uncle Vito's more than any other restaurant in San Francisco. Largely because they are around  the corner from my home, but also because they make fantastic pizza.

I usually get takeout, but every time I've dined here I have excellent service. My only complaint is that when I order takeout pizza, they put a piece of tin foil between the pizza and the pizza box. After a while this causes the pizza to get very soggy because of all the grease. I suppose I should just ask them not to use the tin foil next time though!
author: Andrew M.

description:
Pros: super fast delivery (mind you, we were right around the corner); awesomely fresh toppings in just the right amounts; great sauce; good prices; and a large pizza really is a large!

Cons: the crust was completely totally meh. It wasn't terrible by any means, but I think it was the one thing that prevented this good pizza from being an amazing, awesome pizza. 

Given the options that are around, I wouldn't totally write off Uncle Vito's but it would be somewhere on the third or fourth option for ordering for delivery. 

Life's too short to waste on adequate pizza!
author: Cassandra J.

description: Local joint with great food! Great value also! The better had a pepperoni pizza that was really cheesy with a great crust. I had the pasta special; chicken ravioli with mushrooms, garlic, sun dried tomatoes and a delicious cream sauce. Good place for good Italian!
author: Michael B.

description: Pasta was tasteless. Pizza was bland and worst of all the ranch dressing was out of a box. Worst I ever had!!The service was ok at best... Sorry to say but when you own a restaurant in Sf you have to be better than this!
author: J D.

description:
My friend suggested we go here -- Italian is a common favorite food of ours and since we were in the area, it sounded appealing. 

Since it's not advertised with any kind of glaring, large, opulent sign, it's always good to see that it's constantly busy, and a wait time (good thing I didn't go when I was bitchy hungry, so since you have to walk up hills to get there and likely wait a little, I'd recommend not waiting until you're starving).

Definitely worth the wait though - although I spent time window shopping into the restaurant and yearned for the pizzas that continued to get passed to tables, my friend had a good point about being able to order good pizza in many places, but not necessarily good pasta. Fair enough. The ravioli sounded appealing anyway, with the meat sauce. 

It's really good. Pasta is just al dente, and they got the combination of meat/sauce ratio just right. And I'm normally not a meat sauce order-er. 

We didn't experience slow service at all, but I was trapped into the corner of the restaurant on the bottom floor, so when I needed to get up, my stomach had expanded so much that we literally had to move the table sideways for me to pass. Okay, so there were big guys surrounding the table which made the passage tighter than usual. 

But yes, the little hole-in-the-wall restaurant types score again.
author: Trish A.

description: I'm definitely a fan of Uncle Vito's Pizza and I would return but the reason that I gave four instead of five stars is because from the service to the food, I've had better somewhere else, but that doesn't mean that it still wasn't good. When we arrived to eat it was crowded but we didn't have to wait too long. The garlic bread seems to be frequently talked about in the reviews for this place, plus one of my favorite foods is garlic bread so I had to try it. From what I remember, the portion wasn't to big and the bread was covered in garlic, butter and herbs, but it at the same time wasn't anything special and like I'm going to say about everything, I've had better garlic bread at other places. I got a personal pizza and it was good, nothing that unique but the thickness was good, the cheese was good, and if I was in the area and in the mood for pizza I would get it again. The service was fine, not memorable, from what I remember the entire experience once we sat down was pretty quick.
author: Michael G.

description: Waitress was UNFRIENDLY AND COLD and never made eye contact.    Pizza great but won't go back. Want to at least be treated courtiously when we go out to eat.  So dissapointed as we were looking forward to going there.
author: Tracy H.

description: Great pizza.  Calzone was a bit soggy.  However, that could have happened during delivery time.  Garlic bread was just a sub roll cut in half.  Delivered to our hotel!
author: Kristin S.

description: Girlfriend and I went here on a whim for pizza. Ended up being amazing. She got pesto ravioli and it was some of the best pesto I've ever had (I snagged a couple bites!). Not too creamy, not too heavy, just the right amount of pesto. Pizza was awesome too. Straight, simple and awesome.
author: Michael Z.

description: Top notch oasis near Union Square. Solid pizza and pastas!
author: Cool K.

description: Good location, excellent food, service not that good specially if you arrive in rush hour, bad idea...
author: Ariel R.

description: If you are a table for two stay away from this restaurant.  Despite many tables for 4 being vacant the servers would not seat them until a table for two came open.  I recommend that if you are only two you tell them you are 4 people and you are waiting for the other two.  Great food but expect old fashioned grumpy service
author: Brian A S.

description:
This place, this Uncle Vito's Pizza is no uncle of mine. Maybe Vito is a cousin from that side of the family I don't like to talk about.
I've had the pizza and I've had the pasta and I was like, why does this place front like it's a champion Italian joint when it's sort of like the Olive Garden. Yeah, I said it, Uncle Vito's is on par with Olive Garden, The OG. Nothing tasted fresh. The service was average at best.
SHAME
WRONG
HORROR

If I ever go back it's because there's no way out.
author: Alexander R.

description: Vito's is comfort food.  Good service, hearty portions but no match for true Italian cooking.  Sauces are to compliment the dish, not be the dish.  Pizza is tasty but not Chicago.  I gave it 3 stars as a walk-in restaurant when you are hungry but not the place to impress your friends.
author: Everett K.

description: Had this pizza the night before the SF rock and roll half marathon.  Perfect carb loading choice.  I have eaten a lot of pizzas in my time and was really impressed with the crust and toppings.  Great pizzas, I will return next time I am in SF!
author: Sarah S.

description:
Delivery is quick. Pricing is reasonable.

I've ordered calzones a few times, and they are consistently disappointing. So why the heck do I keep ordering them? Well, the disappointment is with the fact that the 1/3 of the calzone on each end is awesome, but the middle 1/3 is a soggy mess that sticks to the box and winds up pretty much inedible. I would almost prefer they just cut the middle third out and didn't bother bringing it to me. Because the rest of it is sooooo good that the soggy section sits there taunting me with its wasted potential.

Order the calzone if you dare. Just don't plan on being able to eat all of it.
author: TJ P.

description: Pizza is FIVE STAR all the way!  Quality cheese, excellent crust, and very very good sauce.  By far the best pizza I have had in San Fran, and I try to visit here whenever I am in the city.
author: Erik B.

description: Awesome, awesome pizza. We ordered a small red eye to go while on vacation. They were quick and the pizza was delicious.
author: Jamie C.

description:
I'm not quite sure how but this pizza is really tasty, particularly The Mountain (House Combo) and The Red Eye (Pepperoni and roared red peppers). If you have a place in your heart for slightly greasiest than average, then this is the place to go. It's not out of this world but it's pretty good for Nob Hill/Lower Nob Hill. 

Inexplicably, they do not open until 5 on Sundays so you'll have to look elsewhere for your pizza fix on NFL Sundays.
author: T.J. S.

description: We ordered thin crust vegetarian pizza and truly loved it. The pizza was delicious and light and toppings were very fresh. I would definitely come here again. Our server Anastasia was very kind and helpful and kid friendly.
author: Neda S.

description:
I came here back in 2007 during a company conference and decided to give it a try again last Friday since I was craving pasta and I happened to be in the area. 

Simce Uncle Vito's is a block from Union Square, you can say this is a tourist go to place if you don't want to spend too much money as places like Scala's Bistro and Morton's steakhouse was down the street. 

The wait was about 15-20 minutes which is expected. We ordered "The Mountain" specialty pizza and the Fettucine Seina. The pizza was okay, I've had better combination pizza from round table. The Fettucine Seina was good except the chicken was way to marinated for my taste and did not really compliment the sauce the pasta came in. I should have just went to Steps of Rome.
author: Jocelyn T.

description: Waited an hour and a half (1:30) when they said 30 min on delivery and I was only 2 blocks away. I ordered at 10:15 and they arrived at 11:45.
author: Taylor M.

description: The people were nice and the pizza was just okay. The sauce was kind of flavorless, but the employees were accommodating during a really hectic time, right after a parade.
author: Ashton S.

description: Excellent pizza, more specifically my favorite the Bianca extra feta well done...awesome
author: Steven S.

description: Husband and I were looking for a late night restaurant while visiting San Fran. This place popped up on our Yelp search when looking for something near our hotel that was open past 10pm on a Monday. For a small, hole in the wall type of place, it was quite delicious. I loved that the coke wasn't flat! The garlic with cheese app was delicious. We had the medium pesto pizza as well, which was also really good. We ate everything. Had we ordered a large, we would've had left overs, which we didn't want.
author: Lina A.

description:
I am a health nut, meaning I almost never allow myself to eat carbs for dinner.  Yes, I am crazy, I do admit.  However, since I was running Bay to Breakers the next day, I had to carb load.  Soooo I walked down the street from my hostel and was seated right away, despite the long line (yay!).  Mind you, the seat was right next to the bathroom, but I was sooo hungry I took it.  My waitress was adorable and friendly and the service was speedy.  I had the ravioli special and it was YUMMMM.  Each dish came with a big piece of garlic bread too.  The portion sizes were generous. 
Food: 4.5/5
Atmosphere: Bad (maybe not if you aren't sitting next to the toilet).
author: Julia F.

description: We are staying at a hotel nearby & pulled up pizza places on yelp & noticed Uncle Vito's was real close. We are so glad we went with them because the food was amazing! I got a pepperoni pizza & my fiancé got the fettuccini & clams. Both were super tasty & the price was amazing! We will definitely be coming back next time we are in SF!!
author: Paul D.

description: Average at best.  Ordered the pizza.  Great crust but toppings are cut too large and under cooked.  Half carafe of house wine is a good value.
author: Bridget B.

description:
Having run some errands around the area, I found myself on Bush St. hungry and lazy not wanting to walk downhill or uphill. This is where Uncle Vito's comes in the picture and I decided I shall grab a slice...

Upon walking in the kitchen is clearly visible to the open public enticing the curious bystanders, with a pizza station and stoves to cook their pastas. Sadly they do not offer slices, but they do offer personal size pizzas. 

The Red Eye: Pepperoni, red onion, and roasted red peppers. The simplicity of the pizza made for a nice sweet bite because of the red onions and roasted red peppers. Pepperoni help makes you appreciate meat on your pizza. 

The Tia Mia: No pizza sauce. Mushrooms, spinach, and feta cheese. I was intrigued with the no sauce aspect of a pizza, and was surprised on how good it tasted. I think I would have fallen in love with it if it had pesto; a thought if I ever am in the area.

The wait was horrible, only because I was hungry, and the seating is near the line for those waiting to dine in. I heard another customer acclaimed the sauce they had on their pasta, and almost made me wish I had ordered pasta instead. However, the pizza was good and the personal size was perfect for my bite size needs. My to-go experience was good as I had the comfort of home to eat in my corner, but I'll be back to have a dine-in experience. It's a nice 3.5 restaurant, but I will round up because it seems everyone and I had a good time, and that matters too.
author: Casey L.

description: The Pesto Pizza was flavorful, the feta added a nice tang. The pepperoni was saucy and dekicious. The parmesean cheese topping on the side was fresh grated parmesean!
author: Stephanie I.

description:
Pizza snob here:
Best NY style pizze in SF -- which I guess doesn't say much, but it holds its own.  I only get delivery from them, and I am quite close, but my orders have always been correct and very speedy(under 30 mins).  The prices are ok, and I'm tempted to take away a star because their delivery drivers are a bunch of dicks, even though I always tip well, but.. whatever.
author: Yan L.

description: Very mediocre. We had it delivered to our hotel and they did timely. Pizza was hot. But just wasn't all that great.
author: Dyanna B.

description: Clean, friendly staff. Nothing fancy, super casual.  I ordered spaghetti with meat sauce which I rate 2 out of 5.  It was ok nothing special although my husband ordered the salami hot sandwich and rated it 3 out of 5.  It seems as though everyone else in the restaurant ordered pizza and by the looks of their faces, they were all satisfied.  Looks like we missed out on what looks like their specialty, their pizza.
author: Jewelz C.

description:
Waaaaaaay too much cheese. soggy, watery pizzas were the result. Ask for half cheese or find somewhere else. 

Wife's The Mountain pizza had only one mushroom. Wtf?

Taste wise not too bad just a pain in the arse to consume.
author: Robert M.

description: Staying in San Fran for a few days so I ordered a sausage and mushroom pizza for delivery to my hotel. The guy on the phone was super nice and the pizza came within 30 min. It was still hot and had great toppings. I'm a NYer so I consider myself a pizza snob, this pizza was just as good as a NY pizza. Will definitely order again!
author: Josephine J.

description: Place gives you a close family feel. The food is good but not expensive. Pizza is the specialty and its made from scratch.
author: Demetrius F.

description:
My gf and I order the Greek Pizza from Vito's at least once a month (with sun-dried tomatoes instead of bell peppers, which IMHO makes it more "Greek" anyway, but I digress).  We've had a few other items off the menu and they were all great, but their pizza is possibly the best I've had in SF (and I've lived here over 5 years).

Quick turnaround on phone orders, only downfall is slightly grouchy folks at the counter when you pay.  But hey, they're busy.  

Also, keep an eye out for the infamous SF Twins.  They eats there at least once a week, usually in their leopard-print outfits.  ADORABLE.
author: E C.

description: I ordered a soup and sandwich to go. Delicious and cheap! Highly recommend eating here. Note though, that they don't sell slices. Only full pizzas.
author: Josh E.

description:
Not the best pizza that I've had, but not bad either. Thinner crust with a decent taste. Worth ordering takeout if you're in the area. 

Mmmmmm, Pizza Room Service.
author: Adam M.

description: Food was delicious.  Ordered the 10" calzone which was huge, Antipasto Salad and the Broccoli & Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo and a pitcher of beer. Was too much food for 2 people but leftovers are always great and came out to $60 total.  Would have received 5 stars but front of the house service was horrible.  Server handed the bill then said oh forgot to ask if you wanted and dessert.  It was our wedding anniversary so probably would have ordered too.  Still a good place in the neighborhood and will go back!
author: Erika C.

description: Great price, decent food, I prefer the spaghetti or lasagna over the pizza. No wait to get in!
author: Shannon L.

description: This pizza place used to be good and now has gone down hill!. The service was horrible. Started with a greek salad that was over dressed and soaking in dressing- no bueno! Ordered a medium pizza which only had 5 slices and it was waaaay under cooked! Sausage on pizza was not fully cooked and cheese not fully melted, when I told the rude server that I ordered a medium he said "well this is a medium" so I replied " if this is a medium what size is a personal pizza? Like a bagel bite size?"  So I got up and told the manager I was not gona pay for an under cooked extra small pizza. He just looked at me and said ok- great customer service skills mr. Manager!!
author: Ingrid J.

description: Delivery within 30 minutes right to our hotel room. Hit the spot after searching for a fast tasty pie. cheese was delicious !
author: Steph L.

description: I'm sorry I reviewed the wrong place.  Meant to be the one in Sacramento.  Thanks for your reply, and although I didn't actually go here, it's nice to have a response!
author: Chris P.

description: It's all in the sauce!!  I've lived in the area for 7 years and must've passed by Uncle Vito's a zillion times.  Well, we finally stopped by for lunch yesterday on a rainy October afternoon.  I had the meat ravioli with meat sauce - mmm, that sauce was super yummy!!  I was full, but I was still trying to eat more.  My bf got the eggplant parmigiana, and he ate it up quick!  I gave it one less star for the ambiance - the place could use some spiffing up, maybe a coat of paint or something, and the soda was flat.  If I don't have wine with pasta, I want soda with some kick, you know?  Other than that, a good solid meal - loved that sauce!
author: Maile N.

description: If I had 3 hands I'd give this place three thumbs down... It tasted like little caesar ate a pine cone and shat a potato.
author: Jeff B.

description: This is a San Francisco legend - you've gotta try it. Maybe a block off the beaten path, but go eat there.   Classic Italian with a little SF historic twist.  Huge servings and a fun atmosphere.  It's simple, it's good and you don't walk out hungry - I walked out full and happy!
author: Mike W.

description:
Ask for fries extra crispy or they will be limp little things when they arrive if you are getting delivery.

I really like that the ketchup, mayo and mustard are on the side for burgers.

Pesto Fettucine is very creamy and has great flavor!  Delivery was quicker than they said, everything arrived HOT!
author: LA O.

description:
Hot damn, I've fallen in love with a sandwich.

Not just any sandwich, but the Eggplant parmigiana sammy, ordered with the pepperoncinis baked in.

I drool, just remembering. 

Pizza is fab, antipasto is hearty with great dressing but that sam is the thing that puts a swing in my step and a warmth in my cold, cold heart.
author: Teresita C.

description:
Great pizza!  Delicious and fresh... 

I picked up a large 2-topping pizza (sausage, mushroom) here 15 minutes after I ordered it, now that's what I call efficiency!  The location is kind of iffy for parking though, and you have to remember that Bush Street is one-way.. 

The Caesar salad was good and they're very generous with their sides of dressing, but the garlic bread was only so-so.  I'll definitely pass on the garlic bread next time!
author: Cora L.

description:
Had a great casual dinner last night at Uncle Vitos!   Started with an order of meatballs.... some of the best Ive ever eaten-- tastes like beef-pork veal combo.   The sauce was amazing- think "Sunday Gravy"...
Then had the Mountain pizza.  We loved that too.  Crust was very good--not too thick not too thin and perfectly crispy.  We shared a bottle of the house Chianti and it was actually very good....  served with Jelly Glasses---- loved it!  How old school.  :)   Even though it was extremely crowded in both dining rooms, our waiter was extremely efficient and personable.  We sat upstairs and it was kind of a tight fit up there but still very comfortable enough.   Plan to go back for the eggplant parm and maybe some more meat a balls.   :)  LOVE IT!
author: JoAnn S.

description: Recommended by the very friendly manager of the Golden Gate hotel across the street.  Uncle Vito's is a great local pizzeria.  We had a half carafe of house red.  Very fruity table wine.  The sort one expects in a neighborhood restaurant in Napoli.  We highly recommend the Greek Salad.  We had an excellent spinach and red pepper pizza with mozzarella.  Wonderful crust.
author: Alan Y.

description: Delicious pasta and pizza options, close to union square / nob hill. We loved our pizza and could have passed on the fried raviolis, but the pasta also looked tasty!
author: Stacy H.

description: In town for New Years Eve!  Great pie, great salad.
author: Andrew M.

description: The family and i we're staying at the Mark Hopkins and I thought we'd stay in and enjoy our room since we got an upgraded room with a spectacular bay/city view. Based on the decent reviews and close walking proximity to the hotel, Uncle Vitos looked pretty good. The chicken alfredo fettucini is awesome and very flavorful. The meatball sandwich is good and tasty, but could use a little more seasoning. Not a deal breaker though. The pizza was okay, but the kids love any kind of pizza. For me, Uncle Vitos is a solid 4 stars based on the food I ordered for take out. The prices were very reasonable too. Food service was also pretty fast considering it was a Friday night. If I'm ever staying around the Nob Hill area again, I'd definitely return.
author: Alan A.

description: This place has the BEST grilled breast chicken fettuccine in all of San Francisco. I love the taste of the sauce! It's sooooo delicious that I swear I don't mind eating fettuccine all day. The location is kinda off the center of downtown. It is towards Nob Hill BUT the staff here are very  approachable and quick. Prices are decent. Come here to eat the best Italian food!
author: Anny W.

description:
Last night my friend and I had a medium pizza with ground beef, bell pepper, mushrooms and extra tomato sauce and it was absolutely spectacular. The ground beef tasted so good and fresh, like nothing I've ever had on a pizza before. Being from the east coast originally, I know my pizza, and generally west coast pizza does not measure up. But Uncle Vito's is the exception. It is by far the best I've had in California in over thirty years. We also had small green salads that were unbelievably yummy. I've been here before and have never been disappointed by the food no matter what I ordered. 
The service was spotty and the seating is a bit cramped, but for me that's 
all part of the hole-in-the-wall pizzeria experience. The twins came in while we were there, and it's not the first time I've seen them at Vito's. They must know great pizza when they taste it.
author: Robert C.

description: Love this place!! My new favorite place to eat at in SF!! Awesome pastas, salads, and pizza. I dont know what people are complaining about stating theres too much cheese. Really, its a damn pizza.  I love cheese! Bring on the cheese. Oh and not pricey at all. 12 people cost us $80 including tip. You cant beat that. The fried ravioli is really good too. And a side salad can feed like 3-4 people.
author: Christina H.

description:
I'm kind of a pizza snob, coming from St. Louis and enjoying some of the country's best pies (settle down, New Yorkers!), so my expectations of any California pizza usually aren't that high.  

But we had a Red Eye delivered to our hotel room and thought is was the bomb.  Great, balanced crust with a touch of sweetness and excellent, tangy sauce.  I'd go back in a heartbeat.
author: steven t.

description: Just ordered a calzone & fried ravioli for 2 people for lunch. We ordered the 16" calzone and it was HUGE! Way bigger than anticipated. it could easily feed 4 people. Ate two strips and I'm already full! Delivery to our hotel "Worldmark by Wynham" on Bush St. It was a great deal and delivery was super fast ($24 plus tip, under 30 minutes)! We are here for 6 more days. We will probably order again while we are here!
author: Shannon S.

description: I ordered a small Mountain and a side salad to my hotel room.  It arrived fast and hot.  The salad was interesting... it had some beans in it.  There were also several black olives, which was very nice, I'm used to getting just one.  I ate about half of the salad before I realized I better start on the pizza or I'd run out of room!  And the pizza was good.  Not great, but much better than OK.  It was kind of greasy, and a 10" pizza cut into four pieces is a little tough to handle, I had to eat each piece as a mini-calzone :-)  I was happy, and next time I'm in the area I'd call them again.
author: John O.

description:
Walking into this place, I was doubtful that I'd be so pleased.  I don't know what it was, maybe the fugly decor?

Either way, my turkey/avocado/mozzarella sandwich was SO GOOD.  Thin sliced turkey, tons of avocado, melted cheese, crusty warm bread, Italian dressing?  It almost brought tears to my eyes.  

Thanks for the nice surprise.
author: Rachelle P.

description: I will give a 4 star for the service. But I really do not understand the high reviews for the food. The food had no flavor at all. The meatballs were soggy. I was so confused normally I can rely on yelp...Dont waste your time although the people are nice the food needs a major overhaul and some much needed seasoning because a little salt and pepper at the table wont do it.
author: Crystal G.

description: Guy was a bit of an ass but the pizza was amazing by far one of the best pizza places I've ever been to.
author: Jairo A.

description:
Just your average friendly neighborhood pizza joint - it's not Gaspare's, and it's not locally sourced flatbread topped with imported Tunisian olives or whatever, but everything is reasonably priced and it doesn't take 5 hours to get a pie.  Even if it did take that long, I could always get delivery, but I haven't bothered to yet.  

My go-to dishes are the personal pizza with pepperoni and garlic, and the spaghetti with garlic and oil (technically it comes with broccoli too but screw that, I want my carbs).  The pizza, while not super thin, has a couple of different types of cheeses and has a good balance of flavors (and, admittedly, not nearly as greasy as Gaspare's). The spaghetti is nearly always al dente with a very healthy dose of garlic, and comes with a large portion of garlic bread on sesame. 

I've tried their sausage sandwich and the meatball sandwich as well, both of which are okay - nothing particularly fancy or memorable.  The pesto pasta isn't bad either, though I prefer my pesto less creamy with more pine nuts - that's just me though.   Service is decent, and sometimes you'll get a SF twin sighting in the front window, complete with matching leopard print suits - I'm waiting for the day that I see them and Frank Chu in the same line of sight, at which point I may implode.
author: Sus... B.

description:
decent pizza
decent french fries
their side salad is excellent
the delivery and take out is fast
good neighborhood joint.
author: coffeecake j.

description: The food was great. The pizza was very small and we ordered the medium. If you came with a family of 5 then the large would be just right for you. The waiter was rude. I was taking a drink of my soda and the guy got in my face and said " move please." I thought that was beyond rude. But other then that it was fine.
author: Henry F.

description: Great pizza and the calzone was excellent.  We also had 2 past dishes and everyone loved their meals.  Price is great location is excellent and waiter was very nice and friendly. I will return !
author: Jodie V.

description: Good pasta dishes. I was pretty disappointed with their pizza; the crust was a little soggy and the sauce was not very flavorful.
author: Devon M.

description:
Dine in or pick up, Uncle Vito's "delivers." I've been eating there at least once a week for several years -- it's my last minute "I have no idea what's for dinner" savior.  Get there early if you want to eat-in, because it's cozy in terms of seating.  If you're lucky, "the twins" will be sitting in the window, dolling out advice to tourists and locals alike, in their matching cowboy hats. If you don't know who they are, check out their wikipedia page: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marian_and_Vivian_Brown

Unless I have visitors in town, I usually do pick up, and it's always, "15 minutes" and it's ready.  Always fresh and tasty -- my favorites are the Tia Mia, vegetarian, red eye (hard to beat if you're a meat-lover), Greek, and Hawaiian.  That might be the whole menu...needless to say I'm a fan!
author: Jenny G.

description:
My husband and I spent 10 days in SF while on our honeymoon and this is the only restaurant that we visited twice. Why? It was because of...

The Up - the calzone! OMG the calzone! I could eat it every day for the rest of my life. That calzone, plus the carafe of wine that we got made my goddamned night.

The Down - this place is cramped. The seating sucks, it feels like you're sitting right on top of your neighbor.

Edited to add: My husband read this review and decided if calzone made my night when we were on our honeymoon, he must not have been doing his job right. THAT'S HOW GOOD THE CALZONE IS. Put it in your face as soon as you can.
author: Nailah M.

description:
Understaffed, really long wait times.

I can deal with that if the food is good, but you can get better pizza from just about any chain or local pizza place.

-The crust was tasteless. So bland, it sucked the flavor out of everything else.
-The areas that had enough sauce to overpower the bland crust were far and few between making the whole pizza rather dry.
-The bottom was more like a tortilla chip than a pizza; it was thick and crunchy, not thin and crispy.

+The cheese, when eaten alone, was far better than most places.
author: Matt S.

description:
Came here with a small group, but felt like having my own thing so I ordered an 8" personal pan pizza with pepperoni and mushrooms.  The toppings were good, but I don't think there was anything special about the crust.

I was full, but had a bite of some of the other items ordered for the table.  The Pizza Bianco (no pizza sauce and comes with Canadian bacon, mushrooms and feta cheese) was amazing.  The bacon was particularly savory and the cheese was surprisingly good (I say that because I'm not a fan of feta).  The Fettucine with Baby Clams (sauteed with fresh garlic, mushrooms and roasted red peppers in a white sauce) was also quite good.  Rich.  The Fettucine Siena (with sun dried tomatoes, pesto sauce and grilled marinated chicken breast) was my least favorite by far.  The pesto is too thick and the chicken was overdone and dry.
author: Carol L.

description:
I used to order house meat pizza and spaghetti with meat sauce.
Recently I discovered their turkey sandwich with avocado and cheese, so yummy, the French roll is crispy outside and perfectly soft inside. I can't live a whole week without one now.

Fettuccine with baby clams are also good.  Sautéed mushrooms are the same mushrooms in their grilled burger but only 5 dollars for a medium large bowl of them.

Fast delivery too.
author: Kate C.

description: This restaurant was overall pretty good! The wait was very long for a Tuesday night at 9:30 pm. There is not much of a waiting space either and it was very hot throughout the restaurant. Even though the waitress messed up our order, the pizza and pasta was still very delicious! We would still definitely come back to this place to eat again.
author: Emily S.

description:
Nothing special here. I ordered a medium hawaiian pizza. My biggest complaint is that it all tasted sort of bland. The sauce doesn't have any discernible "kick" or "zing" to it. Seriously, a good pizza has to start with the sauce. The toppings were decent but nothing out of the ordinary. If you buy a soda there, you get one free refill.

Maybe their pasta is better, but otherwise I'd probably go wander elsewhere.
author: Brian T.

description: Hands down, one of the best pizza places I've been to! Good staff and great pizza. The staff is not very talkative, however, if asked a question, they will answer. I just got the old faithful pepperoni pizza. Still the best I've had. If your gonna get an appetizer, I would highly recommend the cheese ravioli friti!
author: Elijah Z.

description: Very disappointed with this restaurant. Particularly after reading so many reviews that were so positive. Nothing wrong with the service but the food was poor. Pizza bases were nothing special and neither like a genuine Italian pizza nor a NY style. My wife and I ordered pasta dishes. My meatballs were swimming in watery liquid and my wife's artichoke, mushroom an onions with fettucine was like nothing we have tasted before and I don't say that positively.  I really recommend looking at other Italian options when dining in SF. There has to be many more better than this.
author: Newton S.

description: So garlic bread is awesome, not much for atmosphere think they are setup for delivery, pizza right? Pizza was served hot, I like it that way, and it was good. Reason for 3 stars is I have had some DAMN good pizza over the years, would give 3 1/2 stars if I could. Team is nice. I came here as it's close to hotel I'm at, and wanted pizza. Heard someone saying calazome was good, just fyi.
author: Chris A.

description:
After waiting 20 mins for a table, the rudest waiter I have ever encountered told us to go upstairs then proceeded to get annoyed with us that we were a party of 2 instead of 3 (clearly he'd brought the wrong booking up). 

We were then rushed to order, but it took ages for the drinks to arrive. The garlic bread was dry dry dry dry and the pizza was seriously frozen-dinner quality. Half the pizza was missing toppings, and the toppings used were of the lowest quality (pre-cut olives ala Pizza Hut). 

The highlight of the night was the waiter hurrying us to pay, and watching us get our cash out and then counting it in front of us!

Disaster meal.
author: Scott D.

description: Service was disgraceful we were abandoned by our waiter, waiting waiting waiting.  Food was much better than service.
author: Paula A.

description: Food is 4 stars , service is 3 stars, atmosphere is a 3. Mountain pizza was delicious, medium easily fed 2 adults. Fair price, limited beer selection. Could be cleaner.
author: Peggy J.

description: Amazing food!  Some of the best Italian you'll ever find.  Don't miss it if you are heading to SF.
author: R R.

description:
Pizza here (veggie with LOTS of garlic) was DELICIOUS. The garlic truly does something wonderful to the pizza.

Ordered their marsala linguini too - I guess marsala anything is good...
author: Carol L.

description: I ordered the Red Eye for dinner. It was yummy! It was just a ten minute wait for a whole pizza. Not too much room to wait inside if you are ordering for take out (just a narrow aisle with about 4 chairs) so you could just stand outside and wave to the cable cars passing by.
author: Kathy N.

description: Red eye pizza really yummy! Spaghetti olio, broccoli garlicky & buttery!
author: Vici K.

description:
I was staying across the street from Vito's to participate in the Nike Women's Half Marathon this past weekend. I checked out the reviews here and decided to make it my pre-race dinner. Apparently, so did a big portion of the other 22,000 women there to run the race. It wasn't a big deal as I placed my order and walked back to my hotel to wait for it to be prepared. 

The guys behind the counter were working so hard to keep up with the large crowds. I would have liked to have tried a calzone or pizza, but was afraid how my stomach would handle it so I went with the Chicken Siena Pasta. It was very tasty and I enjoyed the included garlic bread as well. 

The guy that took my order was awesome because I offered to pay for a cup of ice but he filled up my ziploc bag for me for no charge. I needed to ice my knee/foot and my hotel didn't have ice machines so that was so appreciated.
author: Dean G.

description:
I have been coming to Uncle Vito's Pizza for many years. My cousin used to live across the street, and this was a good place to get a quick bite to eat.

Given that history, I came to Uncle Vito's tonight, with a group of people from France. We originally went to the Cheesecake Factory and the wait was an 1.45 min. No shock right? ( For tourists it is good, but I mean it is so not worth that long of a wait). Then we went to Uncle Vito's given the wait at the Cheesecake Factory. Uncle Vito's was able to sit us right away compared to the other restaurants I called in the area! BIG plus. 

It took awhile for our food to come, which in my book is a minus, I would say it was over an hour. When the food did arrive, they made two huge calzones which we ordered, but I mean these calzones were so big we could not fit them on the table! Enough to feed 5 people and it was just for 2. It made us all laugh and my French friends now know why Americans are so heavy :)

By mistake, they made large calzones instead of medium ones and I checked to be sure that they charged us correctly... and they did. 

Good place for a nice staff and good late night quick dinner with no frills. 

My rating- 3 1/2 stars.
author: Aneliese R.

description: 6 empty tables, waited 15 min for them to seat us. Ended up leaving - they take too long to seat people... Act like they don't need your business
author: Kevin L.

description: Two blocks from tourist mess. Pizza blanco  is my personal favorite. Greek salad is HUGE, house wine is cheap. What else you may ask for?
author: Lana P.

description: This place was a pleasant surprise for us!  Quick. Good pizza. Tasty antipasto salad and a perfect bottle of Chiati! Very affordable  with a great staff and cute atmosphere. Would go here every trip to SF.
author: A L.

description:
UNcle Viito's! (That's me trying to convey my Mario accent..)

If you're looking for pizza, I highly recommend this place. The Red Eye, the calzone, or just pepperoni are my favorites. Can't speak for the other dishes, as I only have gotten pizza/calzone for takeout. Plus who doesn't want to order pizza from a place with a name like Uncle Vito's?
author: Kyle G.

description: Only wanted a salad for dinner after a big lunch at an event. Ordered the Chicken Caesar's and it was great. Good amount of dressing and plenty of grated Parmesan, which is how I like it. And a freshly grilled piece of chicken breast on top! No cold, gummy-y chicken pieces here. Definitely hit the spot. One word about the wine: this is a neighborhood pizza joint, so don't expect too much here. The house chablis was a bit on the sweet side and would have been better colder, but oh well.
author: Kathleen H.

description: If the guy that took my phone order is Vito, then it must be short for Vitophan Chevapravatdumrong b/c the dude definitely wasn't Italian.  That aside, there wasn't anything out of the ordinary about the place.  I called in for a medium calzone (pepperoni, mushrooms, salami, ricotta and mozzarella cheese - 12" for 16.25).  After waiting for a couple minutes, I walked over to pick up my lunch.  The calzone was ready when I arrived and they were busy during the lunch hour; taking walk-ins and phone orders.  Either everybody besides Vito doesn't know how to or are unwilling to work the register as I had to sit until he got off the phone.  No big deal.  The calzone was alright though for the size/price I was thinking that it would be enough to feed two hungry people.  I was wrong, was famished and able to finish the whole thing myself.
author: Darren S.

description:
The Fantastic 4 landed here for dinner. We passed by this small corner pizzeria so many times in the past but never ate here. So we decided to give this place a shot. Plus, Matt heard many positive feedback about this place from; wanna take a guess?

We're very fortunate to have found parking nearly in front, but the restaurant was crowded, so we had to wait a bit for a table. When finally seated, we ordered the 12" (medium) Mountain House Combo Pizza. The $15.00 pizza contained salami, pepperoni, onion, bell-peppers, shroons and sausages. We wanted olives in our pizza, and they gave it to us without charging extra. Even though we're not pizza-eaters, the pizza was indeed very tasty. Matt also ordered a endless cup of Root-Beer ($1.25) and wife ordered 2 bottles of Heineken ($4.00 each for imported beers). The two adults had a good hearty meal.

The kids split a order of Spaghettini and Meatball. The $10.00 pasta was pretty good size and tasted well with the Garlic Bread on the side, which was included with the pasta. Sneaky Matt managed to take a meatball from the kids, who was not looking and concentrating on their meal. The meatball was really good and will be a propose choice on his next visit. The kids each had a cup of Lemonade ($1.25). 

For a family, who don't dine Italian often, we were really impressed with Uncle Vito's. We will be back here again, hopefully we can be lucky again to find parking close by in this busy Nob Hill area.
author: Matt G.

description:
I haven't been in yet, but for delivery I give it five tasty stars, particularly their calzone.

My first calzone was from a street vendor in Verona, as a handy way to eat a small pizza-like-thing on-the-go. America has super-sized it, and most places miss the mark with flavor and texture. Uncle Vito's are so big I don't think I'd be able to bench the thing (pictured) which, granted, is not saying much. But definitely the tastiest I've had outside of Italy - hearty and authentic. Perfect if you are a hungry, late-working troop of web monkeys. Uncle Vito's is the choice of the Yelp team now every time.
author: Bob G.

description: The pizza is definitely what makes Uncle Vito's worth the trip. The cheese and crust were amazing. The prices were not bad for the pizza, but high on other things. The garlic bread was absolutely terrible, and over priced for what you got. The service was also poor.
author: Shane L.

description:
When I rang up Uncle Vito's for a delivery, they warned me that they had just been inundated with calls and that it would take at least 45 minutes to get my order. I appreciated the honesty, placed my name in queue for a medium mushroom and pepperoni pizza and an order of toasted ravioli, and went into the kitchen to prepare us a salad to eat while we waited on the food to arrive. Then, not 30 minutes later, the phone rang! Our pizza had arrived earlier than expected. Not only that but it was quite scrumptious!

Way to under-promise and over-deliver Uncle Vito's!

UPDATE 5/2006:
Ordered again from Uncle Vito's and was WOWed once more. You would be hard-pressed to find better delivery pizza.
author: Miriam W.

description:
We got pizza delivered from here for a bachelorette party. The veggie pizza had a good mixture of vegetables but overall was very mediocre. I usually love garlic bread but the stuff from here was so tasteless and bland I only had one bite.

The revelation however was in the salads. The Greek salad consisted of greens, chickpeas, kidney beans, kalamata olives, and shaved feta. It was outstanding - especially for a pizza place delivery salad. I ate it again at 11 p.m. as a snack since all I ate all day was mounds and mounds of sugar. (I can't resist chocolate chip cookies and an ice cream sundae and chocolate dipped rice krispie treats and M&Ms and chocolate covered gummi bears and... you get the picture.) This made me feel like I was doing something healthy. And it tasted good, too!
author: Kathleen M.

description: I love my neighborhood pizza place, even though it's a bit overpriced (as everything in this city is) they have delicious pizza and solid salads. I always call in my order and then go pick it up, you'd think they would know be by now.... But they are all business over there and honestly, the service is nothing special - the usual straightforward, we give you what you want.
author: Krista K.

description: This is the best pizza I've had in the city. I got the Red Eye, it was affordable and delicious. I don't know what else to say, I'll definitely go back.
author: Josh N.

description: I hate to write a bad review, but I just can't help myself.  Service was great and the delivery was prompt.  But maybe they were fast because they didn't cook my pizza.  The crust was really soggy.  And the cheese was  gummy, or something.
author: Lee B.

description: The food was fantastic. The service was a little slow but would definitely return.
author: Tony K.

description: Uncle Vito's is an extremely small facility with big expectations! They have the best pizza and salad I made sure to go back the second time I was in San Francisco. I recommend the Greek salad. The first time I visited Uncle Vito's I ended up seated next to the bathroom... The food made up for it 100%.
author: Brittney M.

description:
I've had a long distance relationship with Vito's for a few years... I'd fly out monthly for work and make it point to meet up, at night-- preferably midweek, and late, when the other restaurants in the area were sleeping.  I'd stagger down Powell from hotel du priceline stop in and grab a salad and a pie.  The next night, I know... the horror's, I might even head back for more.  Love makes people do strange things...

I'd fly home, tell my wife about 'him' and ask her not to judge against our favorite place in CO.  Then the next month I'd do it all over again...

Now that we moved here, not much has changed, but now it's a threesome.  I've successfully transferred the pizza-crush via osmosis to my wife who now understands the draw.  I don't double-dip back-to-back like in the old days, but we do stop in once a month to keep the fire alive.

I'll also admit to cheating on Vitos and offer up the excuses "I was hungry.. it was there.  It's just food, it doesn't mean anything" , but just like life- cheaters never win.  You may have gotten a visit... Orgasmic and even a repeat...Gorginio's... but Vito's has my heart and no divorce is in sight.

If you have read these 350 words without one mention of the actual food in this meandering, verbose and tangential review and need to know what to do.  Follow closely, in this order:

1) Close your other tabs and searches -- you found the grail
2) Plan your order:  Ceasar or Greek salad and a red eye pizza
3) Step away from the computer, walk/trolley/ride to Vito's and enjoy

The skinny:
1) If you like to gamble your best chances to see the Doublemint Twins are mon-wed nights
2) the seating upstairs is quieter, but nothing beats the window
3) skip the diet coke Mary Kate and get a root beer, a REAL one with sugar with your pizza.

If you want to try a special, fine.. order pasta... fine but don't come crying back to Yelp when you are unimpressed with the end result and wish you READ the name on the sign and followed directions.  If there is Pizza in the name, order it.  This not an Italian restaurant, it's a pizza place, get it?

Don't be "that guy" OK?
author: Dave E.

description:
I want to meet Uncle Vito and tell him that his pasta really satisfies me. Then I want to see if he can satisfy me too. Just kidding. 

Uncle Vito's is a nice little 5 minute walk from my house and I feel like a lucky girl because of that. I have ordered takeout quite a few times and have never been disappointed with the food. I have had their pizza, quite a few of their pastas, and tried a salad. Their pizza is really good. I like vegetables on my pizza and the vegetables have always been really fresh. I think their pizza is a bit on the pricey side but I blame that on its Nob Hill/down town/touristy location. The pasta is appropriately priced. The portions are pretty big and the taste is great quality. 

My favorite thing to order is their Fettuccine Siena. If you're a pesto person, definitely check this out. Soooo yummy. I recently ordered their Fettuccine with Baby Clams in light red sauce and was really pleased with that too. They weren't skimpy with the clams! 

I have never dined there but I can tell you that it is always crowded! It's hard just to get in the door to pick up your food. And every time I have ever ordered they told me 15 minutes. It's always a bit more than that. I usually have to wait about 5 more minutes. But when you see the cooks and waiters racing around that place you understand that they are working as hard as they can. 

One more piece of advice: Order their little side salad! You will be impressed! It's a hearty side salad that can satisfy two people easily and it's only $3.95!!! It has tomatoes, olives, onions, shredded mozzarella cheese and comes with a tasty Italian dressing (and I normally don't like Italian dressing!). If you don't like salad you should still order this. Just stare at it and think about what a good deal it would have been if you actually liked salad. Then feed it to your iguana (minus the cheese and olives).
author: Liz M.

description:
Uncle Vito's saved our lives.  We were walking around our hotel looking for some place for dinner last Sunday and could not find a single place open (it was 6pm).  We just wanted something easy - like pizza - and found this place through a yelp search based on our location.  We ordered a large Red Eye (pepperoni, red onion and roasted peppers) b/c we were starving.  It was excellent - and huge!  Between my husband and I we had half the pizza left over and it cost about the same as ordering from a chain or somewhere not nearly as good.  

Ps. doesn't look like much from outside - but within 10 minutes of being seated they were turning people away.  From our pizza experience I would say it was b/c of the food - but again, this was pretty much the only place we found open within an 8 block radius.
author: Kristen Z.

description: Pizza is tasty, even my picky toddler ate a whole slice. It took about 10-15 min to make it. Very on point.
author: Natalie S.

description: The greasiest pasta in the city, I had the "Pasta Sienna" last night and it should be called "Pasta fatty" horrible, and the Minestrone was so tasteless I thought I was having just water and some old cut vegetables. Don't get me wrong I love my Mexican friends but if you have Mexicans cooking on an "Italian" restaurant your food won't EVER be authentic italian, they tend to add that 'Mexican touch" which works good when eating Mexican but here, Uncle Vito I don't think I will recommend your restaurant to our visitors in SF
author: Alberto C.

description:
What do you do when you're on vacation, staying in a time share in Union Square and you don't want to get dressed up to go to dinner and pay way too much money for not that much food????   You order take out from Uncle Vito's and party like a fat kid with a birthday cake to himself.

We ordered the fried cheese ravioli, garlic cheese bread, fettucini pesto, fettucini alfredo (yes, I wanted all the starch and carbs I could get) and a personal pizza for my son.  They had our order ready to pick up in 15 minutes and the portions were larger than I expected.  We got the food back to the room and between the 3 of us, we couldn't finish it all.

The pasta was cooked perfectly, the raviolis were fantastic and the pizza looked amazing (and by the way my son scarfed it down, it was obviously delicious).  All of this yumminess and it didn't kill my debit card :)

If you're in the area and you enjoy good food, then swing by Uncle Vito's, you won't regret it.
author: Missy L.

description:
Had to wait a few min but well worth it. 
Great salad and pizza to order. 
Server had a great attitude despite the stairs and the food could not have been better!
author: Robert C.

description:
Great cafe like atmosphere with delicious food. I had the fettuccine siena and it was amazing! My favorite casual Italian places in SF.

The only thing to look out for is they don't open until 4:00p on Sundays - so don't try to go there for a Sunday lunch.
author: C.J. W.

description:
As we walked the beautiful San Francisco streets searching for somewhere to have dinner, we came upon Uncle Vito's and decided to give it a try... I am soooo happy we did.  Coming from Chicago, I always like to try pizza from other cities, I have to say this pizza was really really goood!!!  I loved the french fries too!!  My boyfriend said they tasted like they were from McDonalds which apparently is a good thing - I just thought they were delicious!  The crust was made fresh, and the flavor was not overpowering so the flavors of the toppings were the stars!  veggies were so fresh, cheese was delicious, and the pepperoni and sausage (according to the BF) was great!  

We got lucky and were able to grab the last table - not in the best spot, but considering the large group of couples and families that came in after us, we were happy we got a table at all.  Our server was great, we had a wonderful dinner at Uncle Vito's and will definitely be back there - should we have the pleasure of returning to San Francisco sometime soon!
author: Lupe D.

description: Ordered a pizza for pick up to bring back to my hotel. The pizza was ready in 15 minutes and was hot and fresh. This is a classic east coast style pie. The cheese was fresh and the pepperoni and sausage were flavorful. This is a great pizza joint.
author: Sean V.

description: Convenient, very quick, and always good. Uncle Vito's has a great greek salad that's ready in 3 minutes. Dining in or taking out, the staff is always super friendly. Food is fresh and there are many options. Very casual, affordable prices, great for everyday meals.
author: Katie W.

description: Great location near AAU with delicious pasta! Try the cheese ravioli with pesto.
author: Tawny F.

description:
The pizza is good but not the best I've had.

What I will say though is the best meatball subs are the best I have ever had in my life

I hope that does not raise your expectations and thus reduce your overall satisfaction with it if you order it but still... order it, eat it, and enjoy :)
author: Noah P.

description: Pizza is surprisingly good. The rest of the menu is average at best. Always very crowded with Union Square foot traffic.
author: Robert A.

description: I have been here several times, best pizza period. Unless you can get to Italy. Uncle Vito's should blow your mind, he makes the Doe daily an the sauce is just right. Also a great price on house wine. Try the salad too, great portions and very reasonably priced for great quality food. My pizza: tomatoes, feta, spinach. Amazing!
author: Casey G.

description: Really recommend this place. The eggplant parmesan sandwich is really good. I've also tried the fettuccini alfredo...yum! The food here has not changed in quality or taste that is why I keep going back.
author: HAWA A.

description: I can't say enough good things about Vito's.  My boyfriend and I were in SF on a weekend getaway vacation and I heard about this place through Yelp.  It was two blocks from our hotel, so we went to check it out.  We were seated right away and even had a window seat which was fun for people-watching.  My boyfriend started off with a locally brewed beer I had a half carafe of house white wine and we split some cheesy garlic bread.  That wine was the best deal of the night.  It's 5.75 for the half carafe and that was about 4 1/2 glasses of wine!  Plus, it was decent wine.  The garlic bread was delicious and also a great deal for how much it was.  We split a medium pizza for the entree.  I thought the pizza was good, not the best I've ever had, but I didn't have anything to complain about it either.  We did not feel rushed throughout the meal, the waiter was attentive enough and for how much we spent, I don't think you will find a better deal in the whole city!
author: Kara R.

description: Really good pizza close to our hotel.  The ingredients are all high quality.  Was expecting thinner crust but hubby and I threw down a medium pepperoni mushroom and black olive pie pretty quick after a day pub crawling around the city.
author: Carrie H.

description: We were walking past and crossed the street. Seduced by the smells emanating from this restaurant, we walked back across the street and entered into this cramped pizza place. We were sat in a dark part of the restaurant at a tiny table next to the bathroom (while highly convenient, this would not have been my first choice). The pizza was divine. I'm from Chicago and we take our pizza very seriously. The crust was perfectly thin (my personal preference). The cheese and pepperoni were heaven. We paired the pizza up with a local brew, by recommendation from the waitress. Fantastic.
author: Jo P.

description:
we got the vegetarian pizza, delicious!!!
The cheese melts in your mouth like no other pizza, and the toppings are abound, like nowhere else.
The service is excellent, Angel was our waiter, and fast
First time for me , but for sure not the last one
author: Rolando S.

description:
Came to San Fran recently on business. Wanted to try a few pies. 

I ordered Uncle Vito's for delivery at about 9:45pm on a Tuesday night. The man who answered the phone politely took my order and ensured me it wasn't too late for delivery. Delivery was within their estimate (30-45), and was friendly enough.

I ordered The Mountain. The pizza hit the spot for the evening but to be honest the sauce was a little bland - it gets a solid 3Star review for the amount of pizza for the money (comparatively speaking), but it didn't taste quite as fresh as I had hoped. Overall, fairly good, and I'd probably eat here again, but I would try to eat in-house to see if it tasted more robust and fresh.

I had a pie from Pizza Orgasmica a few nights prior, and while Uncle Vito's definitely  gives you more for your money, Orgasmica noticeably tasted better.
author: Jayson H.

description:
Food is so so, about 3/5
The service is what kills this place.  Every time i go in there the servers are just assholes!  Its like I am bothering them being a customer.  Being right on Powell street insures this place is filled with tourist.  I'm not a tourist, I'm a local, dont treat me as disposable. 
-- 
I Tried Vito's out one last time, i call in my order for pick up, everything is good.  I go to pick it up, they dont have my order and act like i never called.  They asked if i wanted to place an order now?  I said your done, and walked out.
author: Anthony P.

description: I live next door to this place.... and once a year, its convenience suckers me in. Yesterday the Cook was a total dck to me. As gross as this may sound, Burger King makes a better grilled chicken sandwich. Avoid Uncle Vitos, Crappy Food, Terrible Service.
author: Love U.

description: The food was great and affordable. The cheese on the pizza tasted amazing and the sauce was great. You can tell that they use fresh ingredients.
author: Arthur L.

description: Unpretentious Italian food. Pizza was excellent. Fettuccine was sublime. All for affordable prices.
author: Rod P.

description: Absolutely amazing. The mrs and I were traveling on business and ran across this amazing gem that was up the street from our hotel. They had the absolute best Alfredo I've ever had in my life. It was like eating Christmas cookies. Their pizza was pretty amazing too. And you can't leave this place without trying their ravioli frita app. Completely exceeded our expectations.
author: Jon K.

description:
The best food ever...favorite pasta of all time...chicken breast fettucine...this is to die for...the portion is large and can easily be split with 2 people..Amazing pizza...and 
out of this world sandwiches..best hole in the wall restaurant ever....
author: My M.

description:
This is from last December... We were staying on Nob Hill at The Mark Hopkins and wanted some lunch.  We went to the Top of The Mark, but it was tea time and was over $50, maybe $75 for lunch!  I asked the hostess if she could recommend a place where we could just get a bite to eat.  It was my wife, my daughter and me.  She directed us down the hill to a sandwich place.  Along the way, we spotted Uncle Vito's and knew we had found a good place for lunch!

We ordered a veggie pasta, an eggplant sandwich and a meat ball sandwich.  We had enough food for about eight people!  It was all delicious!  The veggies in the pasta were cooked perfectly, it was amazing.  The sandwiches were stuffed with their fillings on perfect bread!

Oh, I almost forgot, it was so reasonable!  We kept saying you can't find a sandwich in downtown Seattle for less than $10 and this was a real bargain.

The waiter was a little gruff at first, but after my wife's raving, he warmed up.

I would suggest this to anyone.  What a find!
author: Peter A.

description:
Bad food bad service ... Tourist trap ruunnnnnnn!!

with tons of food in the city..  made the mistake of just eating something close as we were late to meeting some friends at 5A5..... 

before an hour passed after eating (we had the antipasto and what tasted like microwave pizza).... both me and my bud were feeling so bad we both yacked.... serious..
author: Dennis L.

description: Very small dining area, and you better not be in a hurry!  But the pizza is incredibly good--tangy, authentic sauce and a crust that is just thick enough.
author: Marilyn P.

description: This update is LONG overdue. After a somewhat lackluster initial experience (see previous review) I was hesitant to return but I decided to give these guys a second chance and I'm glad I did. The Pizza is actually quite good and reasonably priced, and I'm happy to say that ever since the first time they have always gotten the order correct and have NOT tried to seat me next to the restroom. Nice!!
author: Mike J.

description: I liked it a lot.  Tasted homemade. Like I was eating at home or at some Italian friends house.  It's a small mom and pop place so it's a bit cramped but we were lucky enough to find a seat by the window.
author: Anna M.

description: The turkey avocado sandwich is DELICIOUS! $6 for a substantially large sandwich that makes me want to come back.
author: CJ J.

description: Awesome pizza! I was at a skeeball event near Union Square and Uncle Vito's was provided. Some of the best pizza I've had in the City!
author: Joe G.

description:
If you want good food,  fast friendly service in a casual environment then GO HERE! 
I'm a chef and I appreciate good food. Im also Italian so I'm used to good Italian food. This is like going to Mama's house for pasta and pizza. Portions are quite generous and the prices are cheap. We have been here over twenty times and keep coming back. The house wine isn't the best but if you want a really awesome wine just pick one up next door and bring it in. You will be pleased with the pasta and pizza for sure!
author: Alfonso C.

description:
We stopped in yesterday for a couple of sandwiches.  I tried 2 different tastes--a meatball and the turkey avocado.  The turkey avocado sandwich was great.  The bread was delicious!  The meatball sandwich was pretty good, but it came with green peppers, so it was like eating some weird combination of a Californian cheese steak and meatball sub.  It needed more sauce and the meatball was good, but I will definitely ask for no green peppers next time.

We took the sandwiches to go, so there is no comment here about service.  It was, however, fast.
author: Katharine A.

description: Pizza was good. Service was poor. Seems like they are trying to squeeze a buck by understaffing. Maybe an off night, but cannot recommend.
author: Rob A.

description:
My fiance and I have been coming here for three years and have loved it. Now that we literally live across the street, we have spent a fair amount of money with them. Unfortunately their service has fallen under the table. Every time we stop in, now matter what time of day or customer quantity, the guys like to ignore you for a few minutes, I guess to see if you are worth their paycheck. Then randomly when you order a pizza, they like to burn it and let you take it home with you instead of making a fresh one. Apparently making a pizza is like beef bourguignon and requires enormous patience and effort. 
On a good day, this place hits the spot and is delicious but when they mess up, its not worth the money.
author: LoriLee L.

description: Tasty. Not knock-your-socks-off great, but pretty good. The caesar salad was good - not dripping with dressing like some, and I had a personal pizza with mushrooms that was very flavorful. It was a bit drippy in the middle, as some people have said, but overall it satisfied the pizza craving!
author: Kami H.

description: I ordered for delivery and it came within a half hour. In my opinion this is some of the better pizza in the area, and I'm a Chicagoan with high pizza expectations. The crust is the standout here.
author: Derek S.

description:
If you find a place that delivers a pizza as tasty as the Vito's Greek, AND it delivers chocolate cake too, let me know.

Until then, just know that Vito's rocks!!
author: David M.

description: I moved to the area about a month ago, and have already had pizza from here on several occasions. It's always been excellent, hot, and delivered in a timely manner. The garlic bread with cheese is an excellent side! And free delivery to boot. For price and quality, I've yet to find anything better.
author: Tim W.

description:
Get the turkey with avocado and swiss on a french roll for $5.50 and you'll understand why this place is worthy of all the repeat customers. AMAZING! The best sandwich I've ever had in my entire life. Every time I'm in San Francisco I stop here, despite the hundreds of other options. 

It's located right along the Powell St. cable car line, so after you finish eating you can hop on and ride down to Fisherman's Wharf to digest and watch the sail boats coming into the bay from under the Golden Gate.
author: John K.

description: Good food, not too over price for the area. Chiken ravioli with mushrooms and sundry tomatoes sauce was reallyyyy good!!! Service so so....
author: Elsie J.

description: Great pizza but the service kinda sucks.
author: Thomas W.

description: I used to live upstairs so I did a lot of take out.  Pizza is okay.  Salads and Italian sausage sandwiches were always pretty good.
author: Suz L.

description:
On our last night in SF, I wanted to have something real. Ok, the diner the night before wasn't exactly artificial, but you know. So, a real -seemingly private operated- pizzeria/restaurant seemed perfect. Had seen it on the cable car ride before and memorized the street corner. Lady love and son were out shopping but it was no trouble at all to get a table for one - in fact I could even choose one at the window. 

What had won me over was reading the menu already outside: even just the pizzas and their toppings sounded nicely chosen. I wasn't wrong: have to admit that I do not remember my toppings (14 days round trip of the US give you so much input that you can't process all of it !) - but it was delicious. Which, with pizza means (make or break poing) that even already the bread/dough and the sauce were professionally composed. An equally reasonably priced Sierra Nevada beer (which I had grown fond of lately) rounded the picture.
