LOL, the one time I could have used it (meeting time with lady grew near) I actually had to ask for the cheque. (You know how in some places already halfway through the meal the bill is put on the table) So obviously no hassle and hurry here. What a shame that I didn't have another day to check out the pasta and bring the family !
author: Frank B.

description:
I like this place a lot. I only order delivery, so I can't speak on behalf of the restaurant space, but the delivery dudes are a nice bunch. I also like that they don't fuss around with credit card info over the phone waves; instead, they do a grave rubbing at my door. I like that.

My boyfriend freaks for the fennel (?) in their sauce. Good prices and always reasonable delivery time.
author: Brittany L.

description:
this all started because of my desperate search for french fry delivery.
i had to have french fries one evening and sure enough my diligence paid off.  

these are not flawless french fries, you may need to put them in the microwave for 5 seconds just so they're piping hot, delivery takes a small toll on them unfortunately, something the restaurant needs to perfect.  

i noticed on the menu that they offered a garden burger, i ordered it and to my surprise it was pretty good.  i like my veggie burger to be "well done" and the american cheese is nostalgic of my childhood love of MacDonald's disgusting happy meal.  i would have to say this place serves one of the best veggie burgers in San Francisco surprisingly.
author: Noel J.

description: Cheese Pizza was good but too greasy. I also got the garlic bread with cheese which was better.
author: Marcelo D.

description: The meal itself was very good! I like the whole atmosphere of the place. It was a little cramped in the walkway and I was basically sitting next to the family next to me, but I didn't really mind. I didn't get to see the upstairs of Uncle Vito's but I'm sure it's similar to the bottom floor. I did spot some locals enjoying a nice meal in their neighborhood, but I did see my fair share of tourists. The service was decent. It took a while to get a waitress to stop at my table and when one did, my waitress didn't introduce herself. The portions are pretty big so make sure your eyes aren't bigger than your stomach! The location is nice because it is close enough to downtown but in a more quiet area. I ordered the eggplant parmigiana which came with a side salad, my mom ordered the anipasta salad, and my dad had some half cheese/half spinach and mushroom pizza. We all kind of picked around at each others plates and it was nice! I would go back!
author: Kathryn F.

description: just ordered today my usual mushroom ,olives and pepperoni they came fast and everything was hot so that is good !
author: Nellie J.

description: Just bought a BarBeque burger from this place. I made sure i specified over the phone that I wanted it VERY WELL DONE. Ofcourse I get it back home, take a bite, and see nothing but pink goo on the inside. All in all I payed $9 for a bunch of soggy fries and a pickle. Thanks for nothing.
author: Sean R.

description: Great food good prices. Close to resort and they deliver. Great calzones.
author: Clinton S.

description:
This place isn't much for frills. There is no ambiance to speak of. The service is adequate at best. The tables are crowded together. 

But the pizza is pretty darn fantastic, especially after a long day of hiking the hills of San Francisco! 

Note: the pasta was pretty weak. I would only ever order pizza from this place. But the pizza is well worth seeking out Uncle Vito's!!
author: Joseph B.

description: I could tell that the pizza was just "ok" however they screwed it up badly in the making. I asked for a pizza with pesto and red sauce..... The pizza was made with pesto and cooked, when it came out of the oven they noticed their mistake and added the uncooked pizza sauce to the top, which was cold..... It screwed up the whole thing. It was lazy. I used to run pizza places, pizza is cheap, refire the thing if you screw up.
author: Eric D.

description: I've had Uncle Vito's twice now and still love their pizza.  We get the house special and it never disappoints.  Garlic bread is always a plus too!  Love this place.
author: A J.

description: One rainy night while visiting San Francisco -- staying at a hotel on Bush Street -- I walked to Uncle Vito's and ordered a small cheese pizza to go. Went back to my hotel and ate probably the best pizza I ever had in my life. That was 5 or 6 years ago and now we hit Uncle Vito's every time we're in town.
author: Kerry K.

description:
This place gets really crowded, since it's near a bunch of tourist-y hotels, so plan accordingly. However, take-out is generally prompt. The first time I went here, I got a single order of lasagna, and didn't realize that it would be more than enough for two people; that is to say, portions are roughly enormous. It was tasty, though.

More recently, I got a pizza. I would not recommend their pizza. As others have noted, it was somewhat soggy, the crust wasn't cooked enough, the toppings hadn't been cut at all (seriously, who just puts a giant slice of ham on top of a pizza?), and so on.

Stick with the pasta and such and you'll be fine. Just don't be fooled into thinking that Uncle Vito's is a pizza place.
author: James B.

description: I'm really fond of this place. The price is affordable and the food is very tasty. A great experience overall.
author: James C.

description:
The first time i ordered pizza from these guys it took them 1 hour and 40 minutes to deliver it. It was cold and dry and tasted like stale pizza. I called them back and let them know this, and they promised me 40% off the next time i ordered and that it would be delivered faster. 

I figured i would give it another shot. Couple of months later, i call back for delivery and the person on the phone checks with the manager and tells me that was never told to me and that implied i was lying. 

Nevertheless, I don't think the pizza could have tasted any better if delivered on time either. 

Nasty customer service tops nasty pizza.
author: Karthick S.

description:
The restaurant site said, Uncle Vito wakes up early every morning and makes the dough himself. Give me a break, the pizza we got was SUPER soggy, so vito must have made this batch in the shower. 

From the Website:
"Uncle Vito rises early each morning, prepares fresh dough from unbleached flour, cuts the freshest vegetables and grates part-skim milk mozzarella (less fat, but full flavor). All pizzas can be ordered with light cheese."
author: D. T.

description: When I used to work around this area, I'd always order lunch here. I'd always get the turkey/avocado sandwich and they toast it it's so bomb! Big & inexpensive! I've also had their greek salad and greek pizza which taste great as well!
author: Diane L.

description:
I can not review their food. I did not get a chance to eat. My husband and I walked in. A young gentlemen greeted us immediately and sat us by the window. A table for two in an extremely small room. Our table faced the window which was nice but it was so crammed into the corner that I could not hang my purse on the back of my chair, and there was little to no room to place it under the table.

We sat down, we waited 15 minutes. No one came back to the table. No menu, no water, nothing. The strange thing was the place was not busy, the waiter clearly saw us. We saw him three times. Once taking food to another couple, once seating a family and third speaking to an older gentleman about how much money he makes. 

We got up and left after waiting 15 minutes. It was 8:30pm on a Tuesday. I would understand if it was a Friday, Saturday or even Sunday but.. a Tuesday? 

Bottom line, service sucked on Tuesday April 17th 2012.
author: Megan J.

description:
Mmmm the Fettucine Siena is sooo tasty. I'm eating my leftovers for lunch as I type this and wish I had more :(

The pizza is just your average pizza, but the pastas are very traditional yet amazingly good - and filling! They give you a huge amount for $10-11.

I love this place - perfect post-happy hour restaurant. It's a great location, they deliver, you can sit in, the service is great, prices are reasonable and if you're lucky you'll run into the famous San Francisco Twins dining in.
author: Melissa P.

description:
I think the pizza you grow up on generally becomes your favorite pizza in your adult life. I didn't grow up in NY or LA or even the US for that matter but i am in the US now and I am always in a serach for a pizza that has the same taste of my hometown pizza (western pizza or houston pizza) Uncle Vitos is the closest that I have tasted to that hometown pizza in the US. I loved it.

 I ordered the mountain and it came with huge pieces of onions and green peppers, generous peperoni and salami (which is hard to find in AZ where I live) and we can't forget about the mushrooms. Sliced paper thin and almost melt in your mouth. I ordered delivery and in the box, I was pleased to find a tin foil lined bottom. The tin foil traps in the oils and water and makes the bottom of the crust a big soggy....which is exctly how I love it but probably is not everyone's cup of tea.

For every trip here on after, I plan on stopping and getting a pizza from here just so I have a small taste of home.
author: Mike Z.

description:
Having lived my whole life in Tucson, AZ and Olympia, WA there is no possible way to say I have high expectations for pizza. I also think it's absurd when people go over the top in reviews - "I'd rather starve than eat here" - so I will temper myself. I'd rather eat at Chuck-E-Cheese. 

The side salad - rusting lettuce coated in dressing and cheese. Kidney and Garbanzo beans straight out of the can on either side of the plate.

The calzone - so watery there was a pool of red sauce / ricotta mixture at the bottom. Tasted only like the salami and pepperoni that was in it. 

The veggie pizza - Tomatoes, green peppers, onions. Really? That's all you can do for veggies? Pizza hut does more than that. 

It always smelled so good when we walked by, and we couldn't have been more disappointed when we got the food.
author: Nick W.

description:
I saw a fellow Albany person went here, so I thought, me too!  Same reaction as his post.  Good pizza, not great.  This is the type of pizza we get at home all the time.  But, there must be something about San Francisco and the production of dough.  Because the crust is simple but clearly has more flavor than our standard (mediocre) pizza crust in Albany.  It is near the Union Sq hotels and if want to eat something and you're tired of blowing out your travel allowance, then this is a good place.
The room is nothing fancy and reminds me of a neighborhood joint.  Again, this can be a welcome relief from all the business restaurants.  Basic service.  They take credit cards which helps.
12" pie and a bottle of beer was $23.50.  Two slices thrown into a box for hotel room snacking later ( I never remember to eat my leftovers in the hotel fridge....ends being something the maid throws out)
I like the neighborhood.
author: Van S.

description:
I had high hopes for Uncle Vito's. I'd read some pretty good reviews and after a long day of work without eating I was seriously ready for some good pizza.

The service was prompt and decent enough - although nothing spectacular. Things seemed clean and ok for a pizza place in an old building. Not too packed, but not eerily empty either. Just right.

But the pizza was extremely disappointing. I ordered a medium with pepperoni and garlic. The crust is a New York style here and I found it to be a little on the rubbery side of chewy.  The top of the pizza was oily and despite the loads of fresh garlic, which was making my mouth water, the taste was just lacking. It was a bland, oily, and typical cheap pizza.

My recommendation is to look elsewhere. In a city like this, you don't have to settle.
author: Michael E.

description: Not that good...crust is just OK, too much cheese for me.  We went here off the recommendation of in-laws, but ehhhh....The pizza made our stomachs hurt.  The place is Dirty with a capital D.  I'm really not sure why anyone likes this place...if you want good pizza in San Fran, go to Tony's Pizza off of Stockton Street.
author: Howie H.

description:
The calzone is the reason to go.  Order a large and order it take-out --- otherwise, you'll being dealing with lots of out of town tourists who have, in my experience, generally been loud and unconscious.

Definitely great calzone though.  MmmMM!
author: Alacrity I.

description:
I've only had delivery from this restaurant:

Review based SOLELY on the PESTO CHEESE RAVIOLI

 I've never ordered anything but the Pesto Cheese Ravioli... and I must say.. the pesto cream sauce is AMAZING.. super creamy goodness with lots of pesto flavor... make sure to dunk everything you can in it.. garlic bread, other peoples pasta, soOoo good :)
author: Kristina L.

description:
Me: Super tired.  Hungry enough to know that I won't be a happy camper if I go to sleep without dinner.

Uncle Vito's: Less than a block from where I'm staying.  Good Yelp reviews.

I ventured over to Uncle Vito's because it would be fast, decently cheap, and was right there.  And I got my order to go.  The staff was friendly enough, the food was reasonably priced, and I was in and out of there within 10-15 minutes, to enjoy dinner while passing out in my hotel room.  The food was okay - I got the ravioli fritti which had some funky nutmeg after taste to it - nothing special but it was fine.  I'd try the pizza next time, I'm just wary of personal pizzas in general.
author: Tamar F.

description:
A well positioned pizza/sub joint, next to the trolley tracks yet seemingly far enough from the tourist areas to have a local feel to it. Walls were quite dirty however tables and kitchen appeared fine.

I purchased a two topping large pizza (16 inch) with onions and canadian bacon. Well cooked and toppings were fairly plentiful. My draft beer had a taste of metal to it, so I'd go for soda or water. The service seemed really inefficient and slow. OK but I certainly wouldn't come rushing back.
author: X to the Z M.

description:
This place was conveniently located across the street from our hotel. We decided to eat here because of reviews on yelp. 
This place was so cute! Like a little city pizzeria in manhattan. Ohhh... and let me tell you about the super cute waiter! lol
Walking into this place, I could tell where the "regulars" were and that it was like a Cheers type of place. I was so envious!
You probably want to hear about the pizza right? Well, we ordered a chef's salad and the lettuce wasn't the freshest. It was limp drowned in cheese and dressing. EWWW!
However, I didn't come here for the salad, I came here for the pizza! 
It was so yummy. The perfect blend of sauce and cheese. It was total NY style fold and eat pizza. 
I recommend this place for the pizza, not for salad!
author: Laura R.

description:
The time now is 9pm.

Uncle Vitos is the sort of thing that happens when you're at work late. It reaches 8pm, work shows no sign of letting up, and you and your coworkers appear to be in for the long haul.

Of course, it helps that Uncle Vito's is only 4 blocks or so away from our office, and we can walk over to pick things up.

I tried the garlic cheese bread and the pepperoni and pineapple pizza. The bread was good (but how difficult is it to screw up garlic bread) but the pizza was extremely greasy. Not usually a fan, but what did we expect with pepperoni and pineapple.

A bit too much sauce for my liking, but the flavors were good and the crust would have been good had it been a little less greasy.

Negatives: I was on hold for like 5 minutes. They seemed to be very busy. They have free delivery, but that would have taken 45 minutes.

Ah well. Back to work.
author: Stephanie H.

description: Excellent food.  Spaghetti and meat sauce awesome!! Deep fried cheese Ravioli 's awesome, spinach and mushroom salad with poppy seed dressing great and the spaghetti and clams in the red sauce awesome.  Great Service.
author: Scott M.

description:
My fiancee and I frequent this place and love it. It is really close to our apartment and the pasta is great. I usually get the fettucini with baby clams in a white wine sauce. The portion they give you doesn't seem very big, but I can never finish the entire plate in one sitting. Their wine is decently priced and their service is usually pretty good unless it is super busy in there.

There are two things that I don't like about this restaurant. The first thing is that it is small. I understand that places in San Francisco are going to be smaller than places outside of the city, but the amount of tables they have in the restaurant compared to the amount of space is ridiculous. You could wait 15-30 minutes for a table and when you get it, you have to press your ass against someone's face in order to sit in the chair they have waiting for you. The second thing is the pizza. If you are eating at the restaurant then feel free to order as much pizza as your heart desires. It will be great. But, if you order pizza for pick up/delivery, when you get it home it is a soggy mess. Our pizza just fell apart when we tried to eat it. It was so disappointing.

Other than that, I give my Uncle Vito's place four stars. I just love this place!
author: Andrew P.

description:
Uncle Vito's makes great Italian food.  While we didn't order pizza (We had a linguine with clams and wine sauce, along with their Greek salad), I was happy with my choice.  Greek salad is excellent, when done RIGHT, and Uncle Vito's definitely had this staple starter down.  The clam that came in the pasta was definitely fresh.  I'm a sucker for creamy sauce with pasta, and while anything containing cream is somewhat heavy, Uncle Vito's mastered the art of delivering a rich dish that didn't leave me totally exhausted afterwards.

Their meals come in LARGE portions (as is the norm for Italian), so be prepared, and consider ordering to share.

The reason why I give Uncle Vitos 4 stars instead of 5, is because when we walked in, it took us a bit more time than is typical to be addressed.  That being said, we walked in during the midst of the evening dinner rush, and they seemed to be quite busy.

All in all, GO! You'll enjoy it.
author: Funky C.

description: Good pizza! If you want more than just a greasy slice of pizza, something more hearty and fresh this is the place! Hawaiian has fresh pineapple, huge slice of ham, lots of cheese :) small pizza is perfect for one, large is very large! Salads are also great. Nice comfy atmosphere!
author: Karolina B.

description:
Uncle Vito's restaurant has very good Italian eats such as spaghetti, linguine, spaghetti with clams, pizza, etc. 

I LIKE: 
1) spaghetti with white sauce and clams
2)their food in general is good
3)decent pricing, actually worth exactly the money you put in
4)good service
5)fast service
6)workers and employees don't seem racist

I DON'T LIKE: 

1)they are sometimes packed, the wait time will be about 1 1/2 hours.
author: Keit K.

description: I used to come here all the time growing up, but haven't been for about 11 years. Just returned and it was still great. Uncle Vito's makes really good pizza and doesn't skimp out on their toppings. We ordered the hawaiian and there was no shortage of meat on it. Their pizza is a little under cooked, so if you prefer it a bit more crispy I suggest asking them to cook it a little longer for you.
author: Ashley P.

description:
Good pizza, nothing fancy. Decent thickness in crust handle and thin otherwise. Not crunchy thin...but good New England pizza thin. The cheeze pizza had a good amount of garlic salt seasoning. Mmmm!

The service was good...when it was around. It disappeared once or twice...but whatever, nothing to really complain about.
author: Darth J.

description:
What happened???? I had been here several times and this was the most disappointing. 

Things were just excessive. If the food was toned down a bit I actually think it would be better. Sometimes less is more.
I should have just stuck with a cheese pizza. Left with a belly ache.
author: Roger H.

description: It's been two years since I went to The City and when I was hungry, my high school English teacher recommended me this place for lunch so I decided to go to Uncle Vito's for lunch. When I got there, it was quaint and rustic (in a good way) as if it feels like right at home. I ordered a small pizza and a soda for lunch and boy I was as happy as a cow jumping on a fence in the morning. The pizza has that great flavor and feeling when you take the first bite of the pizza. For me coming from the Central Valley, I just love this pizza place in San Francisco and I will be eating here again when I visit The City (and maybe have pasta this time).
author: Ramon R.

description: Terrible service, they forgot about us constantly in their little upstairs patio, told us it'd be 10 minutes to wait for a table and it took 45. Food was good but forget that place, not in to waiting all night for a fricken pizza
author: Matt F.

description: Easy place for dinner if staying in Nob Hill area.  Staff was very helpful and food was good.
author: Violet D.

description:
Mmm, eggplant parm.  I got takeout and Uncle Vito's made me happy.  

A few blocks away on Powell, in the touristy blocks by Union Square, there's a place that's 1/2 nasty pizza and 1/2 disgusting slop chinese buffet, and they charge too much.  I went there once or twice in a hurry and regretted it.  That's the quality I usually expect around here.

This time I got solid food with a generous price.  Room for improvement in some ways, but above expectation in others.

Back home in NY, there was only one chain I would order from at work, because they used quality salad ingredients.  Instead of a wooden tomato, stale vinaigrette and wilty iceberg lettuce from a cave... they used fresh romaine, plus garbanzos for flavor, protein and fillingness that crappy salad lacks.  One day they stealthily switched to crap ingredients, and made me go boohoo and never order again. 

Uncle Vito's advertised a side salad with the eggplant parm and I was suspicious.  

The cook and counter person were super polite when they handed me a heavier bag then I expected.  When I opened it at work, there was magic surprise garlic bread (standard bread, but yay!)  And it wasn't a side salad- it was a super deluxe, high quality, very fresh salad.  Some iceberg lettuce, but 2/3 romaine.  Shredded mozz.  Plum tomato with flavor, a cut above.  Not-canned kalamata olives. Garbanzo AND kidney beans.  Good, non-stale vinaigrette.  

The eggplant parm was much larger than expected but with mixed execution.  The worst drawback was being quite underdone.  The cheese topping wasn't crusty/bubbling on the sides and needed a solid 5 minutes more in the oven.  However, the eggplant was prepared very well.  It wasn't soggy inside or out, and the breading wasn't  fried-hard either.  The sauce wasn't as chunky marinara-style as some places use, but decent, except for needing less salt.  It's surely made for many things they serve, and I suspect the salt was overbalanced by the breading in this.  They advertised using part skim mozz with flavor, but not overly greasy, and they were right.  

A solid $10 meal, overall worth a try.
author: Pat L.

description: We relied on other yelp reviews to find some decent pizza while shopping in Union Square. Uncle Vito's was just what we were looking for! Inexpensive, tasty, and fresh! We kept it simple with pepperoni pizza and a couple of drinks. No complaints! Also, the restroom was very clean. A bonus!!
author: Jamie C.

description: My friend lives a block away from here and frequents it about once a week, if not more.  She'd been raving about the pizzas here and she finally took me to experience what she'd talked up a ton.  While we ordered her favorite, the veggie pizza, we also added a few other things to the mix.  As a vegetarian, it's pretty shocking, but I typically don't care at all for salads.  She wanted to get a Greek salad, so we got it - and I actually really enjoyed it.  We also got the garlic bread to start because we were so hungry, and it was super yummy as well.  The pizza was pretty good, but what I thought was actually super good was the pesto cheese ravioli.  Mmmm.. that was definitely my flavor savor.. I recommend getting it!
author: Rachana S.

description: Needed some pizza delivered to the office for a weekend lunch and ran into Uncle Vito's.  We ordered a Hawaiian and Pizza Bianco (the better of the two) and I felt it was just very average pizza.  The ingredients of the Hawaiian were rather bland, but maybe that was because they delivered it to us instead of us eating in the restaurant.  I've got to say that they indicated a 45 minute delivery to the Ferry Building are but they made it in about half the time.  Super quick delivery, and much appreciated, but hopefully I'll have something with a little more zing to it next time I visit Uncle Vito.
author: Albie F.

description:
We were just visiting San Francisco for the night and were really craving Italian.  We asked some locals at a neighborhood bar who suggested Uncle Vito's.  What a great find for the area!  

Not only was it affordable, the portions were huge and the food was really good.  My husband is a bit of a lasagna snob and he devoured it!  We had an appetizer, entree that came with a great salad, and garlic bread, a small pizza and 2 glasses of wine.  The tab was only $39.00.

Wish we had something comparable in Sacramento.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
There's a lot of love for this place. I get it... but I've definitely had better. 

I was walking around downtown on this busy Friday evening searching for a place to dine in solo (good luck) and resorted to Uncle Vito's take out since it's right around the corner from my place. I got the calzone and side caesar salad, but forgot to ask for no sauce so it wasn't perfect for me. The calzone was good, but not great, and I honestly could've made a better salad. 

I want to try a pizza, since the ingredients in the calzone were quite tasty, so I'll go back for sure. But for $19, it wasn't the best single dining choice I've made.
author: Jackie T.

description: Cheap and conveniently located. Sometimes it can be difficult to get a table since the restaurant is so small, but worth the wait to get a $10-12 carafe of wine! Highly recommend the calzone.
author: Jenny Z.

description:
Kudos for bringing New York style pizza to an anonymous, good neighborhood joint. The ingredients are fresh, and the Vito side salad is a nice accompaniment with its chickpeas, red beans, fresh Greek olives, grated cheese, and housemade Italian dressing. 

But, though its pizza is pretty good, it is about average to below-average from the POV of a neighborhood NYC pizza joint. The flavors are just muted, and not seasoned enough with salt, herbs, and the right kind of tomatoes. The cheese is better; it's the crust and sauce where the pizza falls a bit short. The former is too thin, not handtossed enough, and as a result, doesn't deliver the same magical combination of chewy and crunchy that any NYC pizza lover looks for. Not the right thickness, either.

And nothing by the slice, just the usual personal-small-medium-large pizza portions. A bit pricey! 7 bucks for what I could get by the slice for 4.
author: Kevvy K.

description:
I've been going to Uncle Vito's for 15 years, and they continue to deliver one of the best old-fashioned Italian/pizza menus in the city. No pretense, no frills. This is not the place to go if you're looking for the hot spot de jour. It is, however, the place to go to get a great pie or slice, or a bowl of piping hot pasta. Menu highlights (other than pizza, which we'll get to in a moment) include the grilled chicken breast fettuccine, fettuccine pesto, and good old-fashioned spaghetti and meatballs. The kind of food you could get in North Beach 20 years ago but these days is woefully difficult to find. 

The pizza is great, and the delivery is always prompt and friendly. Nice touch that the veggies are always fresh (ok, except for canned olives, but what else do you put on pizza?) and the meats are a cut above (no pun intended) what you usually find on a delivery or take-out pizza. Oddly, the pizzas actually get better the larger you order. Usually when I'm getting delivery it's for two or more people, so I get a medium or large. Now and then I've ordered a small just for myself, and for some reason they seem to have a hard time. Maybe "small pizza" is simply a contradiction in terms. 

That's the only ding. Overall the food is great, fresh, and clearly made by folks who love to make old-fashioned Italian-American food. And it's a fun spot to hide out and grab a bite and a carafe of house wine. Enjoy!
author: Chris L.

description:
So, I don't know if it was only because I was so hungry at the time or if it was because it was really that good, but daaaay-um. The pepperoni pizza my husband and I had delivered to our nearby hotel hit the spot SO HARD.

I don't think it was only because I was so hungry, actually, I think it really was that good. The crust was tasty and of the perfect chewy/crispy consistency and thickness, the sauce and cheese were flavorful, the pepperoni was good (but how can you really go wrong with pepperoni?), and there was that lovely sheen of grease--but not too much grease.

An employee of the hotel recommended them when I asked if there was a nearby pizza place and said they had free delivery. As I was so exhausted from walking all day, I took his recommendation and ordered a pizza, and I'm so glad he did! It was delivered quickly and the pizza was hot and as I mentioned, delicious.
author: Rachael R.

description: Love their pizza! Sauce to cheese to dough ratio...perfecto! House salad is bomb. Love it!
author: Erin T.

description: My boyfriend and I ordered food to go, and this place was amazing! We had the cheese ravioli pesto and "the mountain" pizza. The service was also great! 5-stars all around.
author: Brooke N.

description: Pizza was good and the salad was decent, customer service was the worst I've ever had! From the cashier to the waiter, they were completely rude! If they hadn't of already taken our money, we would have left and gone somewhere else! I don't recommend this place at all.
author: Jodi M.

description: The price is right.  I mean, where else in SF can you get fed and drunk for roughly 10 bucks -  that is, a glass of house wine and a pizza?!?!  Nowhere!!  And the wine is decent, and the pizza is hearty and delicious.  My kid loved it.  But, our waiter was unbelievable.  We had to chase after him to place the order, then to get something else in addition, then he took $20 and "forgot" to return with the change, almost $10!  Then someone accidentally dropped a Slice of pizza on the floor, and he never bothered to clean that up.  And people were stepping into it and making an even bigger mess.  I mean, what else could go wrong?!  But the food was decent and the price was right - hence, the stars.
author: LANA R.

description: AWESOME PIZZA!!!! Me and my husband both did personal pizzas, both were amazing!!! fast delivery, if we ever come back to san fran on vacation will definitely come back
author: Maria B.

description: The best Italian food ever Especially for the price and delivery is a reasonable waiting 30-50 minutes for a good portion of amazingly delicious pizza pastas love the clam fettuccini and spaghetti. Yum Yum Yum. great customer service. my favorite italian place in sf
author: Jen L.

description:
This is a cozy neighborhood restaurant that serves a good pizza. No reservations are taken so there is usually a wait at peak hours.

 I thought that the Greek salad was really good. As for the pizza, the crust was good but the pepperoni topping I would rate as excellent. Yes, the pepperoni was greasy but the house burgundy wine was used in a medicinal manner. So it was all good. 

I liked Uncle Vito's location. It's up and over a bit from Union Sq. so not touristy but still very accessible to parking and entertainment if it's your dining option for the day/evening of activities. 

It looks like I need to return to sample the sandwiches here.
author: Theresa H.

description: Uncle Vito's has never disappointed me. In all reality I was pleasantly surprised by the flavor and customer service. Having passed the shop many times I assumed it was the standard mom and pops pizza place (edible food and thats it lol) but time and time again I enjoy their pizza and service.  The only thing I have to say that could be considered negative but I find rather amusing -  they deliver their sodas in beer six pack holders. So you get 6 cokes in a Budweiser six pack holder which could lead coworkers to think you're having beer with your lunch LOLs.
author: M P.

description:
Ate here on my first night in town.  Service was nice enough.  Ordered a small Greek and a beer.  Only had Sierra Nevada and 1 other beer (the name slips my mind at the moment) on tap.  Pizza was more than enough for one.  

The Greek is topped with pepperoni, salami, feta, black olives and red peppers on a red sauce.  Mine came with green peppers (I was a little sad.  I really like red peppers).  Crust was fantastic, nice balance of toppings.  I would have liked to have see a bit more feta. 

Looking around, the larger pizzas looked just a good.  There were a few interesting specialty pizzas on the menu.  I'm tempted to come back again before I leave town.
author: Ryan S.

description: A huge portion of delicious Vegetarian Lasagne, killer tomato sauce, lotso veg, nice house salad, with extra garlic / cheese bread, all delivered to our door for $21 inc tip. You just can't go wrong!!
author: Terry D.

description: Great pizza. food taste fresh and wait time isn't long at all. nice thin crust and I will always go back
author: Romarr P.

description:
Review of pizza delivery only....well, the pizza too, obviously.

7:00 PM on lazy Friday night: We didn't want to budge from the couch nor stop the exciting game of Rock Band.  So what to do for dinner?  Order pizza from one of the highest rated delivery pizza places by South Beach, that's what.  

Bad idea, especially since we were already getting hit with hunger pangs by this time.

7:10 PM: I placed an order for a 16" large Mountain (salami, pepperoni, onions, bell peppers, mushrooms and sausage).  The pizza man told me I could expect my pizza in 45 minutes.

7:55 PM: No pizza in sight.  We give them the benefit of the doubt and wait another 15 minutes while I rock to Radiohead's "Creep" at medium skill level.

8:10 PM: Still no pizza.  I ask the SO to call Uncle Vito's and follow up.  "The delivery guy just left the restaurant, will be there really soon, " the pizza man tells him.  In the meantime, my energy level is really low from a lack of food and I'm missing a lot of my notes on Bon Jovi's "Wanted Dead or Alive."

8:25 PM: Is the pizza guy lost?  No phone call, no door bell ring still.  The SO is annoyed and decides to stand outside in the cold to flag down the pizza delivery guy in case he drives by the apartment.  Meanwhile, my vision is getting blurred and I'm slowly entering the red zone during my horrible rendition of Stone Temple Pilots' "Vasoline" (what, it's a hard song!).

8:30 PM: No sign of pizza guy.  SO comes back inside annoyed and really really hungry, while I'm desperately trying to save myself from getting booed off stage again (had to retry Vasoline).

8:40 PM: The SO calls Uncle Vito's again.  "There's a lot of traffic, he'll be there soon."  Traffic from Bush/Powell Street to Bryant/Beale??  That's 1.3 miles and even though I'm no expert cab driver, I can make that distance in less than 10 minutes.  I've completely given up on Vasoline and resort to a much much easier Yeah Yeah Yeahs' "Map" to end the night on a good note (pun intended).

8:45PM: A very disgruntled SO goes back outside and finds the pizza delivery guy.  Paid him $25 and stormed up the stairs so that we could finally have dinner after waiting 1.5 hours.     

Even though I was ravenous and gobbled the first slice in a few seconds, I was still coherent to realize that the pizza was extremely soggy upon arrival.  After filling my gravely empty tummy with some sustenance, we popped a few slices into the toaster oven.  The toasted pizza was a lot better the second time around.  Toppings were plentiful and the crust was decent, but it wasn't THE best pizza ever.  Not even close.  The cheese wasn't even that stringy!

I'm sure if we ate in at the restaurant, we'd have a much more pleasant experience.  But there's no way I'm ordering delivery from them ever again.
author: Diane L.

description:
Superb pizza with thin crispy crust. Best I've had since I moved here from NYC 13 years ago. I had a personal pizza with pepperoni and sausage and my partner had the mountain pizza. Acceptable table wine for reasonable price. They also have draft beer. Service is slow even for an early lunch on a Tuesday but the help is really nice.
I'll definitely be back.
author: Francoise F.

description:
The last time I got a pizza from this joint,  Obama had just clinched the election, therefore Uncle Vito's will forever be etched in my memory in a very positive fashion...

Last night I opted for their spaghettini with meat balls.  I'm going to say it was fair @ best...   

I must relay my experience with another couple who were sitting one table to my right.  My table didn't have the usual parmesan, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper.   The thoughtful patrons to my right were kind enough to give me their condiments without me even asking.   Then, when my coke needed a refill, they took it upon themselves to ask my server to replenish my beverage.  Unreal!  There are some really nice people in the world.  It really astounds me...

In the future, I'll stick with a pie...   Meaning a pizza pie...  Didn't see the famous Brown twins who enjoy eating @ this place.  They live a couple blocks away.

The nice couple to my right, made a three star food experience into a five star dining experience.   To that couple, Domo Arigato Gozaimashita!!!
author: Randal P.

description: I love Uncle Vito's Pizza! The pizza is Delish and it is a cute little spot to people watch!
author: Julie C.

description:
Can't say enough good things about Vito's sandwiches.  This place has become a staple of mine for good, affordable food.

Honestly, where else in SF can you get a fresh-baked meatball or eggplant parmesan sandwich right out of a pizza oven for under $6?

Besides Subway (which doesn't count), I don't know of any.  But Vito's gets the job done every time.
author: Bryan S.

description:
I don't know how so much plastic gets in pizza. Chew chew chew chew chew chew chew chew chew.

I live around the corner so of course want to like it, but wow. I've only tried the pizza, eventually will try the other dishes. Like when I'm really OMG drunk and my kitchen just exploded so I have no other options.
author: Whitney W.

description:
Pizza still rocks; I just wanted to update this review with the following tidbits of advice.

This is the second time they tried to seat me and my date in the little table over the bathroom.  Do yourself a favor and tell your waiter that you'd like to wait for the next available table.

Oh and the cheap carafe of house-wine very likely comes from a box, but for non-aficionados  its a very economical way to enjoy a little bit of boozing with your pizza.  Pretty sure it went for $8 to $10 bucks.
author: Rocco B.

description:
I came to this place for the first time last weekend. We stood there for close to ten minutes before anyone even acknoledged us, and then when they did there was little communication about where to wait or if a table was available.

I didn't try their pizza, so I have no idea about that.  I did order the fettucini roma and it was awful and tasteless. The worst part of the whole meal though was my boyfriends "vegetarian" lasagna which had chunks of beef in it. I understand things happen, but there was a LOT.
author: Alia B.

description:
pros: food was amazing, it was fresh and the artichoke and broccoli creamy pasta was delicious!! 
 
cons: short staffed which made the wait time a little longer, but was still worth it, small space and not a lot of room.

i would definitely eat here again.
author: Jessica C.

description:
after drinking a tunnel top this is the closest pizza we found.

everything was a-okay. average. 5 of 10, 2.5 stars. medi-o-ker. we got garlic bread, pizza, and fried ravioli.

the fried ravioli wasn't as exciting as i hoped it would be.
author: Ameer N.

description: I regret ordering a medium pepperoni sausage pizza. It is kind of pricey, but the pizza is AMAZING. The crust is thin and tasty to eat. I will be back!
author: Thu L.

description:
I have been to Uncle Vito's multiple times considering it is right around the corner from my place and I do not feel like venturing far for food, especially when I'm ravenous. I have only ordered personal pizza's there so far, pepperoni and the greek. Both were delicious even thought the pepperoni is always a little to oily, but no probs I use a napkin. I would give them more stars but I have not tasted the pastas yet, also their pizza menu is kinda small for me. I was craving a margarita pizza one day and they could not make it because they have no basil or whatever. They have always been friendly when I entered and very quick with your order. I usually order, sit, play games on my phone, and it is ready in 10. 
Also I see the double mint twins in there quite often. Totally cute!
Yes I recommend Vito's
author: Tori B.

description: Seriously good pizza!!  I don't know why so many people said such bad things... Here are my thoughts... If you get bad service once, that'll happen, but probably not often.... If you want East coast pizza, go to the east coast... But you're in San Francisco, and this is really good pizza for being in San Francisco.  My boyfriend and I had a 12 inch pepperoni pizza, garlic cheese bread, 1/2 craft of wine, and a root beer... Bill was $26!  I would have paid double that for this food.  Our server wasn't above and beyond fantastic, but he was good.  We will definitely be back next time we're in the area... SOOOOO Good
author: Liz M.

description: Ordered the medium mountain. Was ready on time, took it home, ate it up, GOOD!  Very fresh tasting ingredients, cheese was chewy and flavorful, crust was cooked just right. No complaints, will go back for more. New in town, so will compare to other local pizza places soon.
author: Tom R.

description: Place was very cozy and food was great. Service was quick. Recommend to anyone in the area looking for a quality pizza joint
author: Jason H.

description:
3 star 1st experience + 5 star 2nd experience = 4 stars, woohoo!

On my most recent take-out pizza mission, I made the wise choice of getting a Red Eye instead of my usual Mountain... and now I get it. Yes, now I understand the lines on Sunday, the evening crowds, the hustle and bustle of an every day at Vito's. It's not just the Powell location... they actually make darn good pizza!!!  

I misjudged you, Uncle V. But now I know better. 

YUM.
author: G. J.

description: One of the best pizza joints you will find in Union Sq area.
author: alberto c.

description: Delicious!! I had pizza and a side salad (which was so big and delicious...not your typical side salad) delivered to my hotel room. Not only was it delivered within the time promised (only 30min), it was delicious, the pizza hot and the salad so crisp and cold. Plus the delivery guy Freddie was so kind and professional. Highly recommend!! Delicious food and great delivery guy!
author: Sandy B.

description: The mushroom and green bell pepper personal pizza was good for a late night snack.  I don't normally care for thin crust pizza, but the ingredients made for a great pizza!!
author: Melissa N.

description: I've never actually eaten inside because I always get a pizza to-go. It's usually pretty crowded so I don't even bother waiting for seating. The pizza is pretty good. It's a bit on the greasy side, but it's still satisfying when you're hungry! I ordered a large "mountain" pizza and my friends and I devoured it within seconds. Although I must admit that I have had better, I'll still definitely come back when I have to satisfy my pizza craving!
author: Michelle L.

description: Not good food or delivery. Waited for for 70 minutes after we ordered. Pep&saug pizza arrived cold.
author: Rodney L.

description: We stopped in for lunch after being hit by a pizza craving. This was a great spot to get our fix! We ordered the Mountain pizza and it was really good. Service was friendly and the restaurant itself had a nice, relaxed and casual vibe. Great afternoon treat!
author: Jo C.

description: This is a cool little place on the corner of Powell and Bush St.  Limited seating, but you never got the impression they were hurrying you along like they do in smaller restaurants.  I had the calzone, which was pretty darn good, though I had to ask for a cup of marinara to dip it.  You guys gotta put that on the plate standard, trust me.  My wife had the spaghetti, said it was okay, I'm sure she was jealous of my calzone.  The waiter working our section was really working his butt off, but was still very friendly.  I'd go back again.
author: Mike K.

description:
I will admit this place is getting at least one star for the nostalgia factor alone. You see, prior to last week, I think the last time I was in this place was during my first visit to SF to see my luv between college semesters...decades ago, kiddies. So when an article about the Brown Twins turned up in SF Gate and mentioned Uncle Vito's, I wasn't at all surprised when that same luv thought it would be a good place to grab dinner on what has become our standing Monday Night date. Trust me, if we had TV, we'd be home watching Monday Night football. So far this season, I don't think we've missed much...

Overall the service is OK and this is reliably good pizza, though I don't feel the need to make up excuses to have it again any time soon since there are just so many places we enjoy and so little time. It's just good to know that after 25 years I can still show up here for a Mountain if I want, flirt across the table with my same old luv (HA! Sweetness), and see the Brown Twins through the front window again too. It's good to be local.  : )
author: mnypny b.

description:
It's amazing the amount of influence The Food Network can have on you.  A segment featuring New York and Chicago style pizza gave me an instant craving for pizza.  But not one to pass up a home-cooked meal, I had to stave off my desire for pizza for another time.
  
Receiving favorable ratings, I left it up to Uncle Vito to fulfill these cravings.  And once again, Yelpers did not disappoint.  For those who live in the area, Uncle Vito delivers great pizza--cheesy and greasy, just how I like it...Beats Victor's, by far.  And despite getting lost in my building, the delivery man was a total sweetheart.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Yes this place lacks a lot of the finer things. It's not a very pretty place. It's very small and cramped. The beer selection stinks. With the truth told about the decor. The pizza is delicious!  Go for it and not the ambience.
author: D D.

description: Best pasta. Best pizza. OUT OF THIS WORLD AMAZING!!!!!!! Hands down the best food I've eaten in San Fran! They know exactly what they're doing at Uncle Vito's!
author: Tal D.

description:
Yum.
I had my first Uncle Vito's pizza tonight and was pleasantly surprised.  Simple pepperoni pizza delivered hot and fresh, along with a tasty greek salad.  It was the perfect accompaniment to the Top Chef reunion show (had to catch up before the finale) Uncle Vito, I'm definitely your bitch, bitch.
author: phil h.

description:
Just got an anchovy and mushroom here. Their ingredients are good quality and the sauce is good. They do turn out a lot of pies, so there is the automaton problem, with getting some things clumped together and things like that. If I made pizzas professionally I would get fired for going too slow though. I'd want every one to be a masterpiece.

More anchovies please :-)
author: Roxmarie M.

description: Got take-out today here for the first time.  The good thing about this place, is that they are very quick.  They said to be there in 15 minutes, and we were, and the pizza was ready!  Good job.  Now, the not so good.  The pizza was very mediocre, and was quite expensive.  The worst part was that the pizza soaked the paper it was placed on in the box, and it was practically impossible to separate the pizza from the soggy paper mess it was sticking to.  Not what I would consider appetizing!  Sorry, but I won't be getting anything from this place again.  Try Victor's on Polk, or Pizza Pino on California.  They are both much better.
author: Briar S.

description: I ordered a Hawaiian pizza. It came with large, thin slices of ham. I prefer the smaller diced variety. They also put green peppers on their Hawaiian...which doesn't really make it a Hawaiian pizza anymore. Not a good combination. Also, the box comes lined with aluminum foil, which leaves a slight metallic taste if any of the ingredients touch the lining. Overall, not awful, but you can do much better.
author: Jordan C.

description: Not bad pizza...not great pizza. Sadly, we got pizza from here twice...first time, hammered, so the pizza was great, but at that point, anything probably would have done...second time, sober and it was average. I'm in Chicago so I am spoiled with great pizza. It was good, not great.  The place was clean and service was fast. Got a nice table right next to the window so people watching was great.
author: Joey S.

description:
One of my greatest regrets about leaving my old 'hood is that Uncle Vito's no longer delivers to my home.  I know everyone keeps going on about the pizza (which is great), but I LIVED on the greek salads.  The greens are always crisp (big deal for me - I am a produce freak), the veggies are fresh and the feta is generously applied.  

If I were eating in the restaurant, they would probably only get 4 stars from me, but I miss my cheerful Sunday night salad delivery...
author: Suzanne B.

description: Yummy! We had pizza, salad, and random french fries. The food and service were good. We would go back.
author: michelle w.

description:
I live right down the street from my Uncle Vito's. 
Here let me order for you.
1. Avocado and cheese (mozzarella) sand which
2. Chicken Breast salad
3. Grilled Chicken Breast Fettuccine
4. Garlic bread with cheese
and a glass if red wine or a cold beer.
uummm that sounds so good. I promise that everything on the menu is very tasty. They even deliver and are open everyday....how great is this?! 
The owner is a pretty great guy, I love it when he is working the counter with his Hawaiian shirt. 
There is usually a line but it is worth the wait. 
And guess who also dines at Uncle Vito's....The Twins they always have a table reserved for them, window side. 
Enjoy Uncle Vito's...I always do.
author: Der Maibaum L.

description:
I just ordered dinner to go from Uncle Vito's and I'm completely surprised how good it was.  

We had an Italian sandwich (ham and salami,) lasagna, a chicken Caesar and a side salad and the whole thing was $25. On top of that, the lasagna was so big, half of it's chilling in the freeze. 

Vito's is not on my list.
author: Jason R.

description:
Shatangi loved the Pesto. just the right amount of toppings like sun-dried tomatoes. The mountain is a winner too even if it's a little OTT. Get it delivered. Not a great ambiance in the dining room and a teeny-tiny waiting area for to-go orders. A good pie.

Shatangi told you
author: Njon W.

description:
I came here to meet some friends for dinner the other night.  They had waited in line (though not for too long they said) and by the time I showed up they were already seated and had ordered.

Garlic Bread: Yum!
Hawaiian Pizza: I usually don't eat this, but it was good!  Loved the addition of green onions alongside the ham and pineapple.

A decent place to get dinner if I'm in the neighborhood, but I doubt I'd travel across the city to come here.  Unless meeting friends of course.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
I'm going to keep this brief.

FOOD: Pretty good.  Delicious lasagna, but a bit on the runny side. I like it thick and dense.  Fried raviolis, not so good. (It was an impulse buy, ok?  We were STARVING.)  Spaghetti and meatballs, also good.  Garlic bread, ok.  Side salad was FABULOUS.  Far too few restaurants include beans in their salads, and Uncle Vito's has two kinds.  Hooray!

LOCATION: Sucks.  Parking is not cool in that hood.

PRICES: A bit on the high end.  $10 for lasagna, but you do get garlic bread and a salad.  So, in the end, it's a good deal.

THE WAIT: LONG... not cool.  Best idea is to order ahead and then pick it up for take-out.  The place is always packed and it's hard to walk through the restaurant, let alone get a table.
author: Love Z.

description: Very convenient for those staying on Bush. Service is a bit slow but friendly enough. All servers are so busy no time to chat. Pizza was very good. Pasta was average. Five diners on two occcassions so got to try several entrees.Since two main cooks and several servers converse in Spanish, I'm sure Vito is long gone.
author: Joe M.

description: Pizza dough was a little dense/thick for our taste, but sauce and topping was good. Overall, average pizza.
author: Tim R.

description:
It's about time I review this place because my husband and I come here about once a week.  If I died and you cut me open you're probably about 25% likely to find Vito's in my system.  Just today my lunch was leftovers from last night's pizza.

So the low down - Vito's is very casual.  And very busy (I assume) because it's always bustling at 9pm when we show up.  Something you must absolutely try - the Red Eye pizza.  Pepperoni, red onions, and roasted red peppers.  OMG - GOOD.  

To note, I've had a pasta dish or two here and they're just "okay".  So read my lips - you must go for the pizza :)  And on Monday nights, I think, you may spot the Twins.  Woot woot!
author: Tracey E.

description:
Not only is the pizza great but the pasta isn't bad either!  The service isn't great but I only go for the food.

Try the mushroom appetizer, you won't be sorry ;)
author: Helen B.

description:
A great casual place to grab lunch when you're in Union Square.  

We ordered the Greek pizza...and for the kids a canadian bacon and pineapple.  The Greek was really good.  My dad said best pizza he's had in a long time...but then he doesn't live anywhere near Zachary's.

Service was very friendly, with crayons and coloring pages for the kids.  They only have maybe a dozen tables, and of those about 4 are four-tops...so our group of six had to split between two tables.  But we had no problem walking in and getting seated immediately at 1:00 during the holiday Union Square madness.  

UV's is one block uphill from the Disney store, right on the corner.
author: Linda M.

description:
Dear lord...

I ate here for the first time tonight and nearly touched myself.

When I got into the place, there were a ton of people all fighting for seating in a packed restaurant.  I was preparing to have a hefty wait ahead of me, but before I knew it I was seated.

My date hadn't arrived yet, but once he did, our orders were taken and our food arrived pretty quickly.

The house white wine totally rocked my world and, arguably, I had too much of it, which is probably why this review isn't being written so well.

After splitting a spinach salad then eating some fettucine roma, I was full and fulfilled.

The only reason I give Uncle Vito's 4 out of 5 stars is because the price can add up quickly.

GREAT food!!

YES!!!!!!!!!!!!

Go now..   but if you do, pick me up a block away first.
author: Jess R.

description:
Love this neighborhood joint. Great pizzas, decent pasta and kick ass service. Have had the pizza multiple times, and it has never failed me. What I also love about this place is the house red wine: a half carrafe is around 5.25 or so, and superb to boot. The pizza has a great crust, not too thick, but what I enjoy the most is the sauce. Has to be one of the tastier pizza sauces I've come across. Tangy with a tinge of oregano and basil. Superb!
And I haven't even started talking about the fries: they're thinly sliced,well fried potatoes with just the right amount of salt. That along with the pizza and wine truly hit all spots. Hence the top rating!
After a good meal, recommend a night cap at Summer place, a block away on Bush.
author: DJ R.

description:
Another usual tourist trap but this one is worth visiting if you're in the area. Always busy with tourists and a few locals and nice to see the cable cars stopping by as conductors run in-out with their meal to-go. 

Pizza is so-so but I love their Greek Salad, Garlic Bread, and Meatball Sandwich. Fries and other side orders are not worth the money. I've heard their sandwiches/burgers are good too but haven't got around to them.

No matter lunch or dinner they are always busy so prepare to wait 15-20 minutes depending on the size of the group or do what I do. I call in my order to go, hop on the cable car going up the hill, run in-out and hop back on and go to a nearby park to enjoy my meal. If you're really nice to the conductor he'll hold up the cable car for you to run in and get your food, especially if he is ordering from the same place. 

Price is ok. For a Greek salad and meatball sandwich I paid $13.29. I look forward to getting the same meal again. Enjoy!
author: Nana R.

description:
Good fries when I need to quench my hunger for a couple bucks!

Chicken soup was so impressive I wanted to smack Uncle Vito and say "damn that was some good chicken soup.." 

Pizza wise... lets just say I'm there every Friday and its factoring into my search for a permanent place here in SF.

Service wise they always treat me well.

6/8/10 Update... ok I'm in there almost twice a week.  So I'm gonna upgrade the my rating.  I'm still getting most excellent service there and I've become a regular.  I even blog about it on my FB page.
author: Sidney I.

description:
Well I certainly didn't think this place was all that for delivered pizza.  Delivery took 1.5 hours, but it was Friday night, and I was too lazy to walk 5 blocks to get it.  The pizza was hot and somewhat tasty, but I thought it was overpriced for just ok pizza.  Now the delivery guy was kind of cute....

Any reccommendations for pizza joints in this area?
author: Amy Z.

description:
Good!  Unfortunately, we came too late for pizza's by the slice.

I came in because of the Yelp reviews and it's proximity to the Golden Gate Theatre.

more later...
author: James G.

description:
This place delivers?  Man, what the fuck have I been doing, ordering from Cybelle's.  This place is way better.  Okay, maybe I haven't actually had their pizza.  But whenever I walk past, I stare in because I'm weird like that, and there are always lots of people who appear to be enjoying the pizza pizza pie.  And the pie actually looks pretty damn good.  Not like, east coast good, but SF good.

I have had a couple of the pastas.  Spaghetti and meat sauce was appropriately hearty and comforting.  And the spinach salad really does rock a little bit.  I mean, maybe it's just the dressing, but whatever.

Oh, another reason I think that the pizza is probably good is that I had some calzone, and the dough was pretty rocking.  Like, it was a really good balance of things.  It wasn't all bloated and spongey, but nor was it all crackery.  It was, you know, the way it's supposed to be.  The way that some places (North Beach Pizza, I'm looking at you!) just can't seem to understand.  A tip:  if you order  the calzone, maybe don't get the ricotta and sub in something else.  It doesn't add much, and is kind of watery.  But the calzone still rocks my socks.  

Yeah.  No real snarkiness here.  Sincerity.  Who knew I was capable.  

As an added bonus, the San Francisco twins are frequently here.  Yay for SF celebrities!
author: Coco D.

description:
Pretty good pizza, but like others, my main reason for ordering from Uncle Vito's is that they're a block from my place.

The pizza will definitely get a little soggy enroute, but I've learned to turn my oven on so I can pop the pizza in for a few minutes after it's delivered -- the pizza gets recrispified and my hunger gets satisfied. Truly my genius knows no bounds.

I've never eaten inside the place and have no desire to do so.
author: Chris M.

description: Great New York style, thin crust pizza!  Delivery was on time, hot pizza. Very happy!
author: Harold H.

description:
This is a small two story restaurant with a good vibe. There is not host you just kind of stand around and the waiters will seat you. They are good at keeping track of who is next, how many in your party, etc. If you try and grab a table when they have a seating order you will most likely get yanked out of you seat as they seem to be pretty on top of it.

Pretty good food. The crust of our pizza was overcooked a bit which left a charcoal taste in your mouth. The pizza is served in a New York style (thinner). The meats and cheeses tasted fresh and good. I was underwhelmed by the sauce. They do serve other items besides pizza, like salads, pastas and cal zones. Make sure you call ahead if you have a group that way you won't end up waiting forever.

There is better pizza available but this is a good spot to be sure. Of course that better pizza is in New York. I haven't tried too many pizza spots in San Francisco but I would go back here again. The wait is the main drawback of eating here.
author: Jason F.

description:
We stumbled across Uncle VIto's on our way to downtown and decided to give it a try. We got seated right away in this small, dim lit restaurant and proceeded to order. We ordered a small "Mountain" pizza (was a lil too cheesy for me, though), Cheese Ravioli Friti, and Fettucine Siena (sun dried tomatoes, pesto sauce
and chicken) which came with garlic bread. The food was good, fresh, and the prices were worth it ($32.00 plus 2 drinks). We were pretty stuffed and ended up taking some of the pasta and a slice of the pizza home. The staff here was also very friendly and attentive.
author: M W.

description:
Coming from a place that is known for some awesome pizza (Chicago), I had to compare and say that Uncle Vito's pizza.... was pretty horrible. Was too cheesy with half cooked pizza dough; very soggy. Not good! Gah

Garlic bread was okay.
author: Rin R.

description: Spent last week in San Fran with my husband on vacation. After a long day of traveling, we got to our hotel on Nob Hill and wanted a quick, close bite. They recommended Uncle Vito's. We enjoyed our pizza - the Mountain, and some cheese garlic bread. Several nights later, we got back to the hotel exhausted, but hadn't done dinner, so we ordered in - Vito's again. My husband got a hot turkey sandwich and I had the HUGE Antipasto salad (SOOOO GOOD). Great little place! Service was a little rough the night we ate in, but not too bad.
author: Misty D.

description:
EATING GOOD IN THE NIEGHBORHOOD

Uncle Vito's is definently my favorite place to eat in Lower Nob. Consistently fantastic pizza and great service. I love this place.... Always take out-of-towners and local friends that live in other neighborhoods to this great place because it always makes a great impression.
author: Austin P.

description: Great calzone and salad, twice in 5 day stay! Quaint atmosphere as well, but seemed kind of the 'norm' here in the city!!
author: Christian H.

description: Love this place. They deliver. They are fast & friendly. Any pasta dish they make, they will switch the sauce, add chicken, whatever you ask. I love that they are accommodating!!! Fettucine Sienna, Lasagna & Spaghettini Oglio are probably my favorite pasta dishes, but their ravioli is good too! Their pizza is totally outstanding (and I used to live in New York, so I know pizza!) Again, they will do any kind of pie you want. They don't do much in terms of dessert (carrot cake & chocolate cake.) That would be my only comment, add more variety...
author: Alyssa P.

description: Pretty solid little hole on the wall. Tried two different pastas and they were both good. Served hot and quick.
author: Charlie B.

description: I always get the lasagna here since I love lasagnas!! And its great very casual atmosphere and can do some redecorating but its okay since the foods good. I tried the pesto and calzone pizza here as well and was very pleased!
author: Nikka L.

description:
My first experience with Yelp - I popped in pizza delivery and scanned around.  Vito's sounded good to me so I ordered a large "Mountain" (everything on it) and a mushroom burger.

The guy answering the phone put me on hold for a sec, no biggie, and took my order no problem.  He said it would be 45 minutes.  It was about 40, and the food was steaming hot.  I'm on Beale and Howard, downtown financial district, and I was ordering on a Friday night, primetime.  This is good delivery!

So get this - the burger was excellent!  Grilled mushrooms and swiss cheese and PLENTY of both on there.  The bun was delicious.  The fixin's were all fresh - and get this - the fries that came with it were still good!!!  Yes!  Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside and hardly soggy.  Good luck getting that anywhere else.

The Pizza was also quite good, with fresh toppings and a great balance of crust, sauce, and cheese.  I prefer New York pizza, Arinels (in Berkeley) being my favorite.  This pizza was definitely more NY style than most, the crust especially.

I'm certainly going to order again soon.
author: Matt H.

description: The pizza here is pretty good.  When I was a fat kid I use to play little league.  If you didn't play little league in the OC you were an outcast.  All the white kids did it.   I was the only fat asian kid out there.  If we won we would go to Lampost Pizza.  The best pizza place ever!  We always won so I ended up eating a lot of lampost pizza.  Hence my fattyness.  The crust here is very similar to that of Lampost pizza.  Memories...  *tear*  The fettucini siena was really good.  I am not a huge pesto fan but it wasn't oily or greasy.  I liked how they lightly sauced it and didn't drown the pasta in pesto sauce.
author: Fatty A.

description: For the money, it's a good value in SF. Decent Pasta-and it's all around $10. Neighborhood place, everyone is friendly.
author: Daniel F.

description: My friend and I were referred to Uncle Vito's by a former employee of the place who now works at another restaurant, I asked him where the best pizza in SF was.  It was easy to find, there was a parking garage less than a block away.  Service was friendly and fast, we were seated by the window where you can people watch.  My friend ordered the personal sized pesto/red onion/sun-dried tomatoes, and I ordered the special of the day, roasted red peppers/spinach/mushrooms.  They were both delicious, had fresh ingredients, and we both agreed the Pesto pizza was awesome!  I would definitely come back, the price was good and service and food were great.
author: Karen P.

description: Food .... Pizza was incredibly good ... Fun small atmosphere .... Service ... Lot to be desired. One woman working whole place... and she was ... slow......
author: Kevin F.

description: Oh my goodness... this place has got to have the BEST italian food in the state. The service is lightning fast and the waiters are extremely friendly! You definately get your money's worth here at Uncle Vito's Pizza which is rare considering this is San Francisco! This place blew my expectations! If you guys think you cam to San Francisco for their clam chowder, then you'll love the fetuci with baby clams! The size of the plate is about as big as my forearm and at only 12 dollars this meal was more than filling! Unlike all those other places that screws you over with 4 or 5 little clams, this place has at least 3 baby clams per forkfull! The most TASTY dish I've had here my entire week stay! If i could give this place 10 stars I would. This place deserves it and the waiters are definately a big reason why!
author: Disenchantedone Z.

description: Pasta for $10-$12 and pretty much a bottle of wine for $8 is a pretty damn good deal. My Swedish coworkers were the ones that recommended this place. It's not fancy, and it's catered towards a neighborhood restaurant. If you can get past that, you'll really enjoy this place
author: Eric A.

description: Had a personal pizza today and it was good. I can't say it was the best pizza I've ever had but it was one of the better ones I've had. I would definitely go back.
author: Marvin K.

description:
this place is ALWAYS poppin every time i order. I've dined in once and all other times I'd rather avoid the line and crowd and take my meal home. 
there pizza is scrumptious but my favorite item on their menu?...the greek salad!  it makes love to my tatse buds the way no other salad ever has....*sigh* have yet to have a better one in the city.  staff is hella chill but be prepared to wait if you wanna dine on site, gets a bit chaotic.
author: Jen S.

description:
In San Francisco for vacation.  Saw a steady business in and out of this place so we decided to try it for dinner.

I hate when I arrive, see five tables open, and am told to wait.  Then when a group of 4 arrives after I've been waiting, they get seated before me.  Just demonstrates poor service and sets the wrong tone right from the start.

Shared a pizza and house salad with my spouse.  Salad was your basic house salad.  Not bad, not great.  The pizza was tasty.  We got "the mountain" which had onions, peppers, sausage, pepperoni and salami.  For the price, it was solidly decent.  

Place was small.  Tables were crammed in so close to each other, that the guy behind me kept bumping me through out dinner.  The server could barely navigate between all the tables and people.  Very claustrophobic feeling.

Bottom line - it's a decent pizza place.  Prices were very reasonable.  Food was good, but not great.  I'd maybe try it again, but not if it was so crowded - they just don't have the space or the trained staff to deal with more than about 10 people eating there at once.
author: Andrea v.

description:
Yummy Pizza!  Everything seems fresh.  I have tried their meat lasagna and Alfredo pasta.  Those are the two other dishes that I've tried besides the pizza... not bad but I've had better.  

Focus on their pizza...one of the best and freshest that I've had so far!
author: Maria E.

description: Nice place for a quick sit down dinner. The pizza is made fast and excellent tasting. I do recommend the fettucini with  baby clams and white sauce. If your in the restaurant. Be on the look out for the Twins.
author: Santiago S.

description: I ordered a pepperoni and mushroom personal pizza and a side salad.  The salad was standard with the nice addition of chickpeas, kidney beans, and a ton of mozzarella.  The pizza was mediocre, nothing special about it, a little bland.  The marinated mushrooms were nice.  I guess I was expecting better from a place with an old time neon sign out front.  I give this place a solid meh.
author: Diana W.

description: Uncle Vitos.......come on down.....bring your wife and the whole family....this place is great. We met Vito himself, and served us when they were about to close. We ordered a large roni pizza and it was only $20 bones. It was so fresh and the pepperoni was so good. We sprinkled some oregano and parmeasan cheese on top and we were ready to go. Wooo it was delish. We had it two nights in a row!!!
author: Ronie B.

description: I love this place. Not only is it 3 blocks from my apartment, but they deliver for free, pick-up is usually ready within 10-15 minutes of calling and the restaurant is always lively and is frequented by the famous SF Twins!!! The portion sizes are huge (family style almost), the quality amazing and you can't beat the price. I almost always go for the pasta or pizza specials ($8-$10) and have left overs for the next day. I end up taking all my out of town friends/family here at some point. It's a SF staple and my tradition in the making.
author: Lauren J.

description:
Needed food for a group lunch meeting and Vito's came through. Great taste pizza.
Will try the calzone next time.
author: RG I.

description:
Meh, good flavor on the sauce, decent toppings, SOGGY execution on delivery like most other SF pizza.   Why can't somebody in SF deliver a decent PIE? 

Christ....ROUND TABLE does a better job than most of these joints. 

To be fair, this review is delivery only - never been to the restauraunt.
author: Rick R.

description: Mediocre at best. Pizza was way too cheesy and barely any sauce. Previous comment was spot on with order papa johns instead.
author: Aaron S.

description:
Maybe I'm missing something.  I see rave reviews for Uncle Vito's and while it's definitely decent, it's nothing I would go out of my way to get. The pizza is fine (pesto was pretty good, cheese was average, vegetarian was super bland), but every time I have gotten delivery, it has arrived cold.  Cold hard cheese makes my mouth and tummy sad!

To be fair, I've never eaten in the restaurant and I've never their pasta or sandwiches. Is that what I'm missing? Is that what would make me love this place?
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I ate here a few nights ago. They were busy as usual and the staff was very pleasant.

The meal wasn't memorable until today, when I discovered I have a gluten allergy. Uncle Vito's Spaghetti and Meatballs was my last semolina pasta ever!

Especially the ravioli will be missed.
author: Sunny Joy B.

description: Totally experienced better.  Guess the takeout is so bad?  It was boring, bad, blah, expensive, and I wished I had a kitchen in my hotel room so I could have made it myself.  End of story.
author: Namrata A.

description:
My roommate, my boyfriend and I were headed out to a Giants game and realized before we devour loads of beer, we need to eat something. My roommate ordered a pizza from Vito's' and voila- it was their right when they said it was going to be!

 Despite the fact that I eat 2, or was it 3 pieces in about, uh, let's say 5 minutes , and chucked it up at the game, damnit it was the BEST pizza I've had in a very long time! Just MAKE SURE you take your time to enjoy it.

Price: very realizable
author: Anne-Marie C.

description:
My local pizza joint has the best pizza in San Francisco. I know these things, because my first job was for a pizza joint opened by Italian brothers from New York. The sauce is perfect, the toppings always fresh, and if you ask for fresh garlic then you'd better REALLY LIKE GARLIC. I know I do. 

I rave about this place to everyone. About time I reviewed it on Yelp.
author: Darren M.

description:
Trip to San Franciso,
Ordered Uncle Vito's Pizza to the Grand Hyatt November 30, 2009.

Pizza:  yummy!!   NO complaints!   
Salad:  great
Husband ordered a tuna sandwich.   Overall great!

They just forgot silverwear, which we didn't have in the room!  They had to come back and deliver this.  (they came very fast and threw in two cokes).

We ordered this TWO more times during our week long trip!  Yes, it's good!
author: Avonna S.

description:
I'm from NYC and in typical fashion I'm really snobby about my pizza. I recently moved a few blocks from Uncle Vito's, though, so I've had their pizza several times now.

What can I say? It's damn good!
author: Jacqui M.

description:
Here's the deal. Uncle Vito's is the nearest pizza place to me so I can just order my pizza (or pasta or whatever), wait ten minutes, walk down and pick it up. I have been doing this at least once a week for almost four years. 

Here is a list of things that make it so awesome (excluding proximity):

White pizza (pizza with no marinara sauce)
Their house salad dressing
Fettucine Sienna (but ask for extra pesto)
Antipasto (it's huge and a major bargain)
Some of the waiters are really hot

What makes it less than awesome:

No chicken parm? WTF?
Sandwiches (eh, could be better)
45 minutes to deliver right down the street but 15 minutes to pick up? What about all those poor cripples in the neighborhood?

What makes it suck? (and hence the three stars?)

The fact that I have been getting food here at least once a week (if not more) for like four years and everytime I walk in they treat me like a complete stranger. Come on, people.
author: David F.

description: First night visiting in San Francisco and found out about Uncle Vito's from our hotel concierge. I ordered the Mountain and loved it!!! Piled high with meats and fresh onions and peppers. My daughter ordered the fettuccine alfredo and said it was some of the best she's ever had.  Great place to try if you're in Union Square.
author: Chris T.

description:
We went inside, and they were not busy.  There were three employees upfront chatting by the pizza oven.  They saw us, but they would not acknowledge us.  Since there was plenty of seating available I asked them if we could seat ourselves (a sign said wait to be seated).  They said (rather abruptly), no that someone would be there soon.

We waited for another minute, and no one.  The three employees continued babbling amongst themselves.  

We left, and no one noticed or cared.

Now the world knows!
author: Noah B.

description: There was a really long wait, which was a drag (though proof of its popularity), but the staff gave us free garlic bread and wine as compensation without even asking. The staff was super friendly and fun to joke around with, the atmosphere was warm and inviting, the prices were more than reasonable, and the food was delicious. Not a single complaint for anything. If you're thinking about going here, just do it.
author: Yuri R.

description: In our quest to never order the same pizza twice (at least until we find THE pizza) we came upon Uncle Vitos. Meh. It was ok. Super fast delivery, I'll give them that.  But overall, pretty unremarkable.
author: M E.

description: Uncle Vito's is a local joint that has been on the same corner of Bush and Powell for as many years as I have been visiting this city.  Though I can speak well of their pasta dishes, what I typically go there for is the pizza.  It's really de-lish served up hot with loadss of toppings. In no way do they scrimp on those!  Now for those of you looking for a down home local spot with honest food at fair prices, hit them up at Uncle Vito's.  BTW, I recommend the pizza with mushrooms and pepperoni!!!  It's on the Powell Street cable car line!
author: Gary M.

description: Hands down the best pizza I've ever had. Everything is perfect. The crust was crisp on the bottom but still nice and soft. The sauce wasn't to salty nor to sweet and the cheese is sooooo yummy. We split a pizza half pepperoni and half greek. A must try for everyone!
author: becca a.

description:
Good for San Francisco, but just average for the pizza I've had in my life.  The red eye with mushrooms was good, the place 3.0-3.5 stars.
