Kevvy K's review is dead on about the food.  

As for the restaurant itself, typical pizza parlor, nothing fancy, sit down eat then go.

$23 for a large 4 topping is a great price for San Fran
author: P H.

description:
The food here is fantastic!!  This place came highly recommended by a friend of mine.  So, we stopped in for a late night dinner.  It was pretty crowded even at 9:30 pm on a Monday night.  We ordered a side of garlic bread and we split a small calzone.  The garlic bread was awesome.  It could have used a little more garlic, but the bread was really crispy on the outside and super soft in the middle.  The calzone was perfect--with lots of mozzarella, ricotta, pepperoni, mushrooms and sauce.  

Hopefully, my friend will mail me some Vito's to LA when I'm craving it.  =)
author: Heather W.

description:
I live close by, so I hit Uncle Vito's every few weeks. The pizza is probably the best I've had in SF...maybe I liked Little Star more, but, dude, I'm not schlepping to the Mission for a pizza on a Tuesday night. Eff that noise.

Pizza's always good, but it's expensive, even for pizza, which is really expensive in this town already. But hey, if I ran a joint with a fancy neon sign right in the heart of tourist-town, I'd grab a few bucks here and there too. 

Pasta protions are pretty damn big. You can feed two normal people with a single order. They have some pesto/sundried tomato pasta thing that's really awesome, and the meatballs are great.

Delivery does seem slow, but take out is usually ready right when they say it will be. Just do whatever they tell you on the phone -- if they say pick it up in 20, be there in 20. 

Whatever, this is a damn good pizza, certainly the best in downtown/Nob Hill, and if they were a few bucks cheaper they'd have five stars from me.

Also, when picking up pasta, check to make sure they remembered the garlic bread. They bat like .500 when it comes to sticking garlic bread in the bag. And one time they forgot a whole order of some appetizer we ordered, but I didn't do anything about it because I didn't feel like walking back over there. Anyway. Check your bags before leaving, I guess.
author: That Was A Good Drum Break ..

description:
So funny- it seems that people LOVE this place.  Who are these people?  I went based on a an absolutely GLOWING reccomendation from a co-worker.  

Pizza Hut has better pizza than this place!  And the rest of the food... well... to be frank, kind of tastes like shit.

The one star is for the staff- people working there are very nice.  And to be fair- it isn't their fault that they have to serve crappy food...
author: Stephanie R.

description: I loooooove Uncle Vito's Greek pizza! with a side greek salad. Great little place worth the steep uphill walk! On my very first trip to SF I had it 2x and have been back every single time after that when visiting. I have also had their spaghetti and meatballs, fettuccine siena, and eggplant parmigiana.. all very tasty, but my favorite is The Greek pizza, go and get it!!!
author: Nanci P.

description:
Hooray for Uncle Vito's! A late night pizza craving hit me and I stopped by this joint on my way home. The staff was friendly and I was walking out of there with my pizza in no time. 

The pizza itself was scrumptious, crispy with just enough cheese and sauce. The topping were perfect and on top, rather than under the cheese. And the price was decent. 

Now that I know they're just around the corner from me, I might be getting pizza from these guys a bit more often.
author: Jamila C.

description:
I love this place. I don't come here for the pizza but I come here for the pasta. Either to go or to dine in, their pastas are good.  Try any of these: 
fettucine with baby clams, 
fettucine sienna 
Grilled chicken breast fettucine. 
Their servings are big so go with someone to share.
author: JB L.

description:
This seems like one of those places where you chow down after a late night out at the bars. I had the calzone which looked awesome on the menu. I wasn't that into it because I'm not a big fan of ricotta cheese. If it were all mozzarella instead, I think I would have loved it. 
The fried ravioli I had was decent, but most fried foods taste pretty good just because it's fried. I thought it was a bit bland though.
author: Diana S.

description:
Ate there alone on a Friday night. Got a cramped table upstairs (but all the yablles are cramped). It was steamy in there but tolerable. Got the Greek salad and an 8 inch pizza with sausage mushroom and spinach. The salad was super tasty, but a little heavy on the dressing. The pizza was very good, with fresh toppings and good crust and great for one.
Overall, very pleased with my last minute, solo diner choice.
author: Traci T.

description:
Very good delivery pizza. I've found that asking for the pizza well done or crispy gets me exactly what I want. Toppings taste fresh, frankly I like this place. Gotten a burger on a lazy/recovery Sunday when I couldn't motivate to make brunch and was pleasantly surprised. 

Seen that a few folks had delivery speed issues. Not sure if it's just cause I'm close by relative to them, but I always get my food quick and hot.
author: Pierre C.

description:
Wow...I'd grown so familiar with this place, walking by it nearly everyday on my way home from work and seeing those famous elderly identical twins there so many times.  However, I had never stepped foot into the place until this past weekend.  I've missed out on so much good pizza, it hurt when I tasted it.  The sauce was the best I'd had in a long time, it had just the right amount of spiciness to it, the crust was excellent and the toppings were fresh with some good quality cheese.

I tried m'lady's fettuccine alfredo, and that was really good as well.

If you're downtown and want a good pizza, skip Blondie's or any of those other hack pizza joints, walk a couple blocks up the hill, burn some carbs and eat the best pizza in the city.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Usually this place is overcrowded and touristy. However, the pizzas, salads, and (vegetarian, yay!) lasagna keep me coming back for more. 
Keep up the good work, Tio Vito.
author: Chadwick M.

description: Just moved to the neighborhood and I'm so happy to have found an easy go -to spot for a good pizza. They are quick with there delievry orders and its FREE! I didn't expect their other dishes to be just as good, but OMG the fetticini chicken dish w/ mushrooms and broccoli was DELICIOUS. I will definatley be coming back! Everyone is so nice there as well and the prices are reasoanble for where it's located.
author: Mehrnoush A.

description: As far as a restaurant that is near Union Square, a great place. Pizza is good and I'd still like to try their sandwiches. Twice we got carry out pizzas and they were pretty bad. A soggy, greasy mess. A pretty big contrast from when I've ate there, although, they can be quite greasy still.
author: Wes K.

description: I'm definitely a regular.  I come for pasta twice a week and they always have great service and good pasta for a decent price in the city.  I would suggest Uncle Vito's to anyone who is tired of the crazy trendy restaurants of the downtown area without having to leave San Francisco.
author: Miryam S.

description: Totally great pizza...only downside to this location is no slices which the 330 ritch location provides when you're waiting in line to get into the club. :)
author: Nikki M.

description: Delivery was quick and just what we needed.  We got the mountain pizza and minus the hair I found in it, it was really good.  It was nice to have the green peppers not cooked before putting it into the pizza oven, which I've noticed some places do.  The garlic bread with cheese was also delicious and the caesar salad was very fresh.
author: Kim S.

description: I love Uncle Vito's Pizza!!! Try their Red Eye Pizza and add extra garlic. Just delicious.
author: Claudia K.

description:
We ate here because it was right around the block from our hotel (Grosvenor Suites). We went on a Friday night and had a short wait before the 5 of us were seated in the very small dining room downstairs. The food came quickly and our waitress was very efficient. Compared to other nearby places, the prices are very good. I ate the spghetti which was good but a little too spicey for my liking. My husband and kids enjoyed the pizza. We even had the honor of being seated near the famous twins (there is a newspaper article about them in the front window). They are older women who were wearing leopard print from head to toe and eat here often- always at the same table.
We enjoyed Uncle Vitos enough that we decided to go a 2nd night. This time we had to wait 20 minutes to be seated. I'm sure this was because the San Francisco marathon was the next morning and everyone was there to carbo load-including us. We were seated upstairs in a tiny dining room and service was slow. As we left, the line was out the door but everyone was entertained since you can watch the pizzas being made through the front windows.
Overall, Uncle Vitos is a good place to eat. It isn't anything spectacular but location and price make it great.
author: J. J.

description:
Really great pizza. Fast delivery. We had The Red Eye: Pepperoni, red onion and roasted red peppers. Delicious!

I've also had several of their pasta dishes and have always been happy
author: Sachin A.

description:
Uncle Vito has got some of the best food around.  of course the za's are great but try the other dishes!  The food is awesome and you'll know why during lunch that place is just packed out the door!  Good luck finding a seat right away and expect to wait.

have a beer or two while you're there because they have them on tap!

enjoy the carefully made italian masterpieces!
author: Harry H.

description:
They brought me pizza! I know, I know, that's the point of a pizza delivery place.  But still I called them up, they brought me pizza and they were nice about it. None of this you need a minimum order before we bring you something. No sneer that all I wanted was mushrooms on my pizza.

It could've been warmer. I would've thrown it on the grill to warm it up (big tip -- this is the BEST thing to do with leftover pizza). But it was good and I was hungry. Closer to east coast pizza than most others. Will definitely order from them again.
author: Margie L.

description:
This is about the best pizza I have had in years.  Woe to you sheeple who dine on chain pizza.  Uncle Vito has some real pizza for you!

The crust is perfect, not too thick, not greasy, not too thin, and a tiny bit chewy.  The sauce is yummy, not your standard runny out of the can fare.

I knew this would be a great pizza when the guys running the cable car stopped the car to pick up their pizza the other night.

Anyway, they lose a star for mediocre Ravoli Friti.  It's probably some family recipe and I'll get visited by Vito and his crew for insulting it, but I gotta tell it like it is.  :-)

Stick with the pizza and you'll have a five star experience!
author: Daniel A.

description: On a recent trip with family to San Fran, one night we were too tired from the days touristy events to go out to dinner, so we ordered in from a little pizzeria we saw just down the street.  We ordered a large pizza, half cheese for the kids, and half filled with goodies for the big kids.  It was, by far, the absolute BEST pizza we've ever had!  The crust is hand-tossed, not too thick, the sauce was to die for and plentiful, the cheese and other toppings were generous, fresh and tasty.  Truly, never have we had a pizza this good, and I grew up on east coast pizza!  Five stars folks ... definitely check out Uncle Vito's if you're ever in SF!
author: Ann B.

description: Try the sauceless pizza.  You can really taste the other toppings; feta and spinach.  I loved the chewy crust, too.  Get there just before noon or you might not find a table.  Sorta takes a while to get the check.  I just walked up to the register to pay rather than wait.
author: Lisa H.

description:
3.5
What a pleasant surprise this place was.  We almost ending up leaving ony because we couldn't get anyone to seat us, but after we were seated the experience was very good.  Be aware that the pasta portions are HUGE.  My husband and I will share next time.  The anitpasta salad was delish, my husband loved his spaghetti and meatballs, and I had the pesta with chicken and sundried tomatoes.  Very reasonably priced.  We will be back.
author: Rise G.

description: Amazing greek salad but tell them to leave off the beans or beets. Pizza was B+ but I am from the east coast so I am a harsh pizza critic.
author: A H.

description:
My family was in town, starving and in search of a last-minute dinner spot in Nob Hill.  It was 10:30 and Uncle Vito's was the first thing we found that was still open.  At that hour, beggars really can't be choosers, but Uncle Vito's proved to be a good choice for our casual family dinner.

Had we found this restaurant earlier in the evening, we would've moved right along to another restaurant.  It's a tourist spot that's filled to the brim at normal dinner hours.  Every now and then I come by for take out, and folks can barely squeeze past the door.  Delivery might be the way to go next time.

I recommend the Fettucini Siena: sundried tomatoes, pesto, and chicken breast.  I like the flavor and texture that the sundried tomatoes bring, and the pasta isn't drowning in sauce either.  As for pizza, I like the Red Eye: pepperoni, red onion, and roasted red peppers.  I add fresh tomatoes and it hits the spot.
author: Andrea U.

description: Stumbled on Uncle Vito's wandering around looking for a place to have lunch. The dining room was small and packed with locals. My companion had a salad, I had a pizza and we shared the pasta special of the day. Being from Los Angeles, we asked for substitutions and the waiter seemed to be laughing at us a little, but not in a mean way, in a, jeez, tourists are crazy kind of way, which of course, we were. But he made the substitutions and everything tasted incredibly good.  If you like American-style Italian, you will like Uncle Vito's.
author: Lelah B.

description: Just so-so pizza, dry crust not much taste, sauce is commercial but I'm from NY so I guess I'm spoiled.
author: J E.

description: On a cold, cold night in San Francisco -- this was a real find. Warm, comforting food, nice people at the other tables.
author: Peggy L.

description: Good little neighborhood pizza joint.  Super casual.
author: Steve G.

description: Good pizza at fair prices for the area, beer and wine are cheap.  Makes a great lunch spot and easy delivery.
author: Michael I.

description: Great hole-in-the wall place.  We found it by accident but went back two more nights.  Everything I tried was delicious!!!!
author: Brian H.

description:
Solid pizza place...quick delivery.

Try the Spag Olio w/ Garlic and Broccoli.
author: Dpb T.

description:
Why did I veer from Za on Hyde Street-- well, because I wanted to try something new.  I guess you could say I was comparison shopping when I picked up my small pizza from Vito's.

My selection of  Canadian bacon was not a good choice because the meat tasted like deli meat from a plastic bag.  The sauce was unremarkable and the crust had no flavor.  I usually look forward to the end on my slice to a pillow of tasty crust, but I was tempted to just leave that crust on my plate (horrors).

The place was packed on a Saturday night, and it was hard to even enter the restaurant... I don't know why.
author: Karen W.

description:
I googled delivery in google maps for nob hill. I think I should have searched for it on yelp first. 

I ordered a personal pizza, a spinach salad and a ravioli appetizer. Pretty inexpensive, only $19. As far as the taste and the flavor, I have had better. I thought I would try a neighborhood place, but next time I will definitely be prepared to spend some cash on amici's and order what I know I will like.
author: Carolina H.

description:
Great place and just around the corner for me :-) 
If only I could afford to eat pizza everyday, unfortunately I don't have time to go to the gym that often...  So, I have to be aware not to eat here too often.

Pizzas and Sandwiches are great. I love pasta, though, I'm not a fan of their pastas. The Sandwiches are cheap and very good. The pizzas are a bit more expensive than Pizza hut, but a lot better. 
Most of the time there is a wait, but trust me, it's worth it. If you can't wait, you can always call them in advance and let them deliver it to your place, cause yes, they deliver! 
The staff is very friendly, nice and funny. 
Good place, and just 2 blocks from Union Square. They are open until 11 pm, just perfect.
Go here on Monday evenings and you'll see the San Francisco Twins :)

owh, and their garlic bread is good too!
author: Helen D.

description:
Before I lived in the City, I would visit at least twice a year. And I would sometimes head straight to Uncle Vito's even before checking into the hotel. As I would drive across the bridge...just imagining the pizza, with fresh garlic on top of course, would make my mouth water. For the year I lived there, I had the pleasure of introducing several of my friends to the fabulous pizza. 

While I am a big fan of the pizza, I've also tried their salads and pasta... also great. 

Uncle Vito's is just one of the many things I miss about the City.
author: Amanda F.

description: Ordered the pizza tonight guy was a bit rude put me on hold for a minute. He said the pizza will be delivered to my hotel in 40 minutes. They never showed up. I would have been fine if he told me I'm busy I can't deliver right now.
author: Os N.

description: Seemed to me and my girlfriend that this place was an alternative to Ex-Lax. I think it was the mushrooms en entree.
author: Taylor W.

description:
3.5. it also helps that they are a block away from my apartment.

if you can get over the staff the pizza is actually quite good. our favorite is the mountain - and its one of those pizzas that reheats well despite being laden down with toppings. 

mm... pizza...
author: laura f.

description:
Only really been here for sandwiches togo but I do enjoy their avocado and turkey sandwich.  Little greasy sometimes but enjoyable occasionally.

UPDATE: 6/9/06 - Had pizza delivery from there and the Red something pizza was excellent.  Like the sauce and the crust.  Moved from 3 to 4 stars.
author: Dana C.

description:
My husband loves this pizza, but I was unimpressed.  I thought it tasted like the cheap, mediocre pizza I used to get on the east coast (Jerry's Pizza) -- only this pie was about 3-4 times more expensive than Jerry's.  Actually, I commented that Jerry's pizza tasted BETTER than this place.  Maybe I'm a thin-crust pizza snob -- I dunno....
Delivery was pretty prompt though -- that's one positive.
author: Karen K.

description:
Uncle Vito's rocks.  First, the pizzas are really scrumptious and are delivered at a minimum temperature of 5000 degrees, so they vaporize the roof of your mouth.  That's just how they're supposed to be.

As hot as the pizza is, the waitresses are even hotter.

All this and not too much of a vaporization of my wallet.

Rawr.
author: Apollo L.

description:
Hungover/drunk whatever...It's a block away from my apartment.  I can stumble and crawl down and up the hill and have a nice pizza ready to soak up all the alcohol.  

Pizza isn't half bad, but like they say in this city it's all about location.
author: Aaron G.

description:
The pizza here isn't half bad. Selling it by the slice, is really convenient.

The best thing about this place? The turkey avocado sandwich. You can NEVER go wrong with that! It's probably one of the better sandwiches, through the whole city. 

Service here is normal. Don't expect anything extraordinary. 

Pretty close to a NYC slice though =).
author: Charles K.

description:
Went tonight because of it's proximity to our hotel and the good Yelp rating. Now, I must say we hit a bit of bad luck. Unfortunately, for Uncle Vito's and customers, the only bathroom was overflowing and seeping into the restaurant.  When we got there, the problem didn't seem that bad. So, we waited and waited to be seated. After about 35 minutes of waiting and dodging the overflow that was running under our feet, we overheard someone say that they were no longer serving. No one even came over to tell us or apologize.  By then it was too late to go somewhere else. We then ordered pizza and a salad to go. When our order was ready, I asked if there was utensils for two people, the guy behind the counter nodded.  Got back to to the hotel and shared the knife and fork. The missing utensils was the least of the annoyances.
The correct way to handle the situation would have been to come over
and say "I'm sorry you've had to wait but we can't serve anyone because of our plumbing problem. Can we offer you some free garlic bread?" or "your salad is on the house."
On top of it all, the pizza was just "so, so".  
The staff can definitely use some lessons in customer relations and damage control.
author: Virgil S.

description: Went in after seeing some recommendations, and had the calzone, which was quite good. The beer selection's lacking, but they've some passable choices (Red Tail Ale, Anchor Steam, Sierra Nevada). Service was acceptable.
author: Eric A.

description:
I ordered an anchovy / onion / olive pizza.  It came with artichokes onions and olives.  I was fully prepared to forgive this (I don't mind artichokes) but the pizza was very doughy, thick, and slightly undercooked.  Sauce flavors were OK but nothing special. All in all, I would call it mediocre.  Judging from the reviews, I guess some people must like doughy undercooked thick pizzas. 

On the upside, the pizza was very fresh.  Also, the spinach and mushroom salad was pretty decent, the place was not overpriced, and the service was friendly.

Overall, it struck me as so-so at best..
author: Hal P.

description: Great pizza.  Great crust.  Despite the good Yelp reviews, I had low expectations because of its touristy location.  The pizza was really amazing.  My daughter and I split the special of the day, broccoli, feta, and mozz.  It was delicious.  My husband and son had The Mountain.  They loved it too.  Only had pizza but everything else that came out to the other tables looked and smelled good.  Great place for families and getting a quick pizza fix.  Glad we went.
author: Beth F.

description: Love Uncle Vito's!!  Small, the ambiance is a little spartan, but there, it's all about the great pizza right?  Love the red eye pizza.  Ask them to add Garlic!
author: David M.

description: The service was quick and friendly. The atmosphere was good. The food was decent. I had a small Mountain pizza - the toppings were fresh and tasty, the crust was good, though they went easy on the cheese. The place is small though and gets crowded quickly - tried to go again this last Saturday night and couldn't even get through the door.
author: Dallas S.

description:
I don't give out 5 star reviews for pizza places unless they're my favorite, but this was good enough to warrant a 4 :)

Ordered about 25 for an event and they were all hot and delicious upon delivery (though the delivery was a few minutes later than I'd requested).  The slices are pretty filling and we had a lot of pizza left over.  (yay for getting to take home a whole pie) I'd say a pie can easily feed 3-4 people. and average pie is between $16-22

I only had the plain cheese, but it was good even reheated.  actually... kind of want some now.... mmmm pizzzzaaaaaaa
author: Becky M.

description: Pretty good pizza. Fair price, close to union square. Would return for a quick and tasty lunch.
author: H K.

description:
Ah!  Now, why would I want to trek down to the hipster-ridden Mission for a slice of pizza from Arinelli when really, I can just walk down a few blocks from home and get the same Neopolitan-style goodness at Uncle Vito's???  Really?  Why?

This reminds me of pizza from New York --- perhaps not as perfect but comes close to it.  Good sauce/cheese ratio.  Sauce is the best in the hood.  The crust offers the perfect sog and crunch.  Come here when you're hankering for a slice.  

Calzones are not bad as well.

I've had their pasta dishes as well --- they're pretty craptastic.  But why go for the pasta when the pizza is so lovely?
author: Guava C.

description:
Yeah.  It was good...I guess.

I opted for a wee pizza for one for lunch one
Saturday afternoon.  Sometimes I think the
slice is a better option since there is more of 
the interior real estate on the slice.

Anywho, I had my classic sausage and green
pepper and it was fine.  Nice crust.  Maybe a
little light on the sausage and peppers but ok, it
*was* a small.  I grabbed a menu on my way out.

Here's the thing.  I live within walking distance.
Yeah, it's maybe a little far to walk to deliver but
as far as I remember, most of the delivery guys
use cars now, right?

So, I call up Uncle Vito to have a good sized pizza
delivered.  He hears my address.  No dice.  No pizza.

What the fuck!  I say, hey....Unc, I can walk it, it's
*that* close.  He says no deal.  But what if I...click.

I rip the menu in half and gently dump it in the recycling.

Not so good, that call....
author: K-leen F.

description:
Located on the corner of Bush and Powell where would you put your kitchen?  I sure wouldn't put it looking out on Bush and Powell, I'd put it in the back somewhere.  With a location like this, it only would make sense, but that common sense isn't shown here.  A small dining room means that it very quickly fills up, but there really isn't anything interesting about the dining room.  

The food doesn't really help the issue.  I had the cheese ravioli with meat sauce and was very disappointed.  The ravioli tasted like something taken out of the freezer, not something even semi-homemade.  The meat sauce lacked good spices and the garlic bread was nothing more than a sub roll split in 2 and buttered. 

Overall nothing worth going back for.  Take the time to walk to Little Italy for Italian food, don't waste your time and money here.
author: Jason H.

description:
Nothing fewer than 5 stars for this awesome pizza place - the fact that it is my neighbor makes it even better!

Try the eggplant parmesan sub as a vegetarian option.  It can be a little heavy on the peppers/onions, so I usually scrape them off.  The fettuccine alfredo is my favorite pasta dish.  No microwave (!!!) and the pasta is freshly prepared.

Pizza has just enough crust and is not greasy.  My only criticism is that their single slices are adequate at best, and the fried ravioli aren't as good as mozzarella sticks.

Overall a solid bet if you can put up with the tourists!  No clue about their reliability as to delivery, because I always pick it up, but the food has always been fresh.
author: Jillian W.

description:
Sometimes, the only thing that can save a girl from committing homicide at the work place is a fresh, hot slice of pizza.

My theatrical place of employment is a block away, and during busy tech weekends, the choice of satisfying take-out is a no-brainer:

Deal with the inept and rude staff at Cafe Espresso to get an overpriced, over-doughy and under-stuffed pannini? I don't think so.

Eat anything at Lori's? As if.

Wait 45 minutes at Persimmon for odd food that doesn't know which part of the globe it comes from? Nah.

Pop up the street to get a personalized mini pizza? DING DING DING!

Not only are the folks in this shop always nice, fast and courteous, the crust is decent and not of the "thick, chewy rubber that expands in your mouth as you eat"-variety, the toppings are always fresh and they truly understand the meaning of going light on the cheese.

So, when you truly want to kill an actor, stuff your lighting designer in a cannon and shoot her to the moon or simply want to duct tape the mouth of your director shut, eating a slice of pie at Uncle Vito's and coming back with a happy pizza-belly can be your way of avoiding career suicide!
author: Tatjana G.

description:
I've been eating at Uncle Vito's for years and their pasta is the best in the city, and very reasonably priced. Just don't drive (duh it's SF), and don't expect quick service (perfection takes time).

I highly recommend trying their weekly special. (usually a ravioli)
author: Stephan K.

description:
I moved here from Boston 2yrs ago, and needless to say the Pizza in Boston & NYC is far superior as Pizza.  Gourmet pizza is better in SF, but it's always "frilly" with things like broccoli.

Uncle Vito's doesn't do slices unfortunately, but it does do personal sized pizzas for about $6 (+/-) with freshly made crust that's not thick, but not too thin... crisp bottom and soft inside.  The sauce is made everyday it seems & you can put whatever toppings you want on your pizza for a reasonable cost!!  

I recommend simplicity by just adding Ricotta and Spinach to a cheese pizza.  F***ing superb. Oh yeah, and get the Garlic Cheese Bread with some dipping pizza sauce.... 

 I'm ordering from there today for lunch, because they also deliver, for FREE ----
author: Jake B.

description:
Yeah. Pretty solid. Nobody is hitting any home runs here, but if you want standard pizza/grilled food. This is it for the neighborhood.

Definitely not a destination. I can't say I've ever considered sitting down at a table to eat. Way too many tourists anyways.

The pizza? ok. The chicken sandwiches? ok. The burger's? ok. The calzones? meh. 

Nobody is winning any awards with this one, but if you're in the neighborhood and you're hungry for food then this is the place.
author: Aaron F.

description:
Pretty good pizza, I must say. However, the cons would be: 

Delivery took over an hour. We also had to convince them that Russian Hill should be in their delivery radius, which apparently it won't be on any night they are busy. 

End result, pizza was pretty yummy, or maybe it was that I was so hungry I'd enjoy anything at that point!
author: Lara M.

description:
I ate at Uncle Vito's a few nights ago with my son and daughter.  We checked into our hotel on Nob Hill at around 7pm and asked the front desk which restaurants they would recommend within walking distance.  I am very health conscious and usually stay away from pizza/pasta places, but of course my 2 teenagers love it.  So we walked down the hill to Uncle Vito's and put our name on the waiting list.  They said it would be about a 15-20 minute wait, and it was just that.  This place is quite small and dark inside and tables are very close together.
Trying to be as healthy as possible, I ordered a medium size veggie pizza with light cheese, which I shared with my son.  We each had our own Greek salads.  It all tasted good.  My daughter had a pesto fettucini pasta which she said was too rich and creamy for her liking, and she left most of it (had it boxed up and gave it to one of the homeless on the streets).  She ended up sharing our pizza.  Overall, we enjoyed the pizza.  But this was the only place in SF that we ate pizza so I don't have any other restaurant to compare it to.
author: Maxie G.

description: fresh pizza,many choices. pretty pricy but can't blame because of the neighborhood.
author: Suabot J.

description: Super scrumptious and delightful!  A great selection of specialty pizzas. Expect it to be crowded if you go on weekends since it has some tourist appear and is right off of Powell, but they do deliver free.  Not as heavy/fattening as Domino's.  My preferred pizza joint.
author: shojua p.

description: Spent a ton of money and ordered for my team at the office for the world series.  Thought it was over priced and mediocre.  Was in the neighborhood after a visit to my dentist on Sutter.  Service was so bad. There were only 2 other occupied tables.  They didn't even say "seat yourself or 2) "Be with you in a minute".  It was so uncomfortable that I left after 5 minutes.  No one said a word.  Wankers.  and I'm not a tourist!  Want better Za, without the pizza nazi attitude.  Go to Goat hill or Littlestar.
author: Danny T.

description: Try the pesto pizza. MUY MUY BUENO.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Given the proximity to my apartment in the ChiFiNob, I reeeeally wanted Uncle Vito's to rock my world. But alas, it's crap.

On a random Tuesday a friend came over craving pizza, so we decided to try it out. The place itself is adorable and entertaining: Mario and Luigi looking dudes tossing dough with a front row view of the Hyde cable car line. The hostess sat us at the one available table, a tiny group of sticks in the corner by the window that could barely house my 6'4 friend's 4 foot long legs. Not a good start, but he's used to it. We asked if they could make a 1/2 vegan,1/2 pie fit for a carnivore, and much to our surprise they said yes. Pie and beer ordered, we watched the tourists risk their goofball lives hang off the passing cable cars.

Then we got our first red flag: the beer. Flat Sierra Nevada in glasses that taste like ass is really hard to choke down.

The pie comes. Looks great, piping hot, bland as shit. My side had a few tasteless veggies and blah sauce, and he was not impressed with the cooked state of the animals that lost their lives for his side. The crust, while obviously homemade, was completely tasteless. Boring and all-around disappointing. Total bummer.
author: Emily D.

description:
After a long day of sightseeing in the city my mom and I decided to stop by this pizza shop near our hotel for a coke and a slice.  One problem, this place doesn't do slices, only whole pies.  We decided to dine in since our feet were about to give out on us from walking all day long.

I had a personal peperoni and feta pizza, my mom on the other hand tried the special which was a spinach and feta.  Both pizzas were just okay, nothing to really write home about.  What I really did not like about this place was the service.  It was pretty bad and apparently we weren't the only ones that experienced it.  It took a month of Sundays just to get someone to take our order.  For our waiter to bring our drinks took us two reminder calls and 20 minutes and for our food to arrive another 45 minutes.  Granted it was 8:30PM, but they were really not that busy.

All-in-all I would definitely rather call Domino's and wait in the comfort of my hotel room rather than eat at this place.
author: Mario C.

description: Uncle Vito's has delicious eggplant parmigiana!  It's hard to find good pizza for delivery and on that front Uncle V's fails.  However when it comes to Eggplant Parm they really have something tasty. Not too much cheese or breading.  Delicious sauce.  Huge portion, enough for another meal,w/garlic bread and side salad included $9. Always arrives hot and w/in the time they quote if not earlier.  I try EP whenever it's on a menue and this one rates high on my list and #1 for EP delievery!
author: emily b.

description: This is very much like Pasquale's, but located in the Nob Hill area.  Delicious pasta options at a very affordable rate.  My boyfriend and I had dinner here as I was beginning to carbo load for the Nike Women's Marathon.  We shared a calzone, which was very delicious and cheesy.  I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and my boyfriend ordered the lasagne.  Both our orders came with garlic bread.  The quality of the food was great and the portions were large.  Gotta love taking home left-overs.  It can be a bit cramped but there is also seating on a second floor.  Service was friendly.
author: Christine E.

description:
Pretty good pizza, but nothing really spectacular.  Maybe I'm biased a bit because I do like NYC style pizza and this pizza, as others have mentioned, is definitely more SF than NY. 

When my partner is out of town, I tend to eat stuff  that maybe she wouldn't approve of.  She thinks of pizza as "empty calories".  As my waistline can attest to, they are anything but "empty."

So, I am somewhat of a connoisseur of pizza, because she's out of town quite a bit.  

No matter the vendor, I usually order pepperoni, Onions, Mushroom and Olives.  Classic stuff.   The ingredients that the good Unka used was fresh -- fresher than most.  So the pizza was fresher than most.  Crust was fine, though overly done on one or two slices.  Overall, much like Larry Ellison when asked about his $1M philandering fine, "I'd do it again."

-Mike
author: Mike P.

description: The pizza tasted fine, and cooked quickly. It is nothing fancy, and is a big step up from Pizza Hut. The service is slow, and the girl manning the register always looks pissed. They also seemed to lose track of things I have stood there for 5 mins. waiting for my bill for pickup, and my pizza is already done.
author: Nathan M.

description: Nice little place.  Very small and cramped inside but it adds to the "authenticity" of it!  Great prices and real friendly and fast.  In and out in 10 minutes with our pizza.
author: Tyler P.

description: Definitely go to Vito's for the food, not the ambiance or service. The pizza is good, but not remarkable. I didn't try the pasta, but it definitely looked good and they had a nice menu selection to choose from. The server was nice enough, but I guess very busy as he didn't check on me once after I got my food (not that I really minded that), but I did have to go up front to get my check since he never brought it by. The dining area is pretty small, but nice enough and intimate. I'd go back.
author: Marjie T.

description: "throw the menu away!" thats what i was told to do last night after calling to check on an order that my customers at the bar i work at had ordered over an hour and a half ago.  I told the man on the phone that i ordered to the bar very often and may not continue to do so if they appeared to forget orders/were too slow. "throw the menu way" good one uncle vito, way to go.
author: David R.

description: This is my go-to pizza joint.  Love the Red Eye pizza.  Another good neighborhood spot.  Big plus that they deliver.
author: Janice Y.

description: Dropped in late night while in Union Square area - you get the feeling of a family-run business that as been there for a long time, even if it is not (I do not know for sure). Not a "destination" restuarant, but certainly a great place to drop in for pizza et al and to rest your legs.
author: Kevin W.

description:
My ex girlfriend loved this place for its pizza, so naturally I spent a lot of time here too.  

The pizza is very good, but that's where my appreciation stops.  I've had the burgers a few times, and lets face it, this is not their core competency.  

No problem though, the pizza is very "tombstone at the grocery store"-ish.  That's the only way I can describe it.
author: Adam C.

description:
Probably one of the worst pizzas I've ever had. Ordered a Hawaiian: the crust was soggy, the cheese was non-existent, and the toppings were generally tasteless. The Greek salad was similarly lackluster.

Would have given Uncle Vito's one star, except who can resist beer delivery?
author: Ryan B.

description: Not happy with this pizza at all read the reviews thought I would give it a try. Pizza took over an hour to deliver and when it got here was completely soggy!!!! I was so hungry I just ate the crust and toppings that were less than impressive. I would not suggest this for delivery maybe their food is better there.
author: Amanda C.

description: Super fast delivery (20 minutes from making the phone call to delivering it to my hotel room [on the same street])! Good customer service! Great food! I had the Red Eye and garlic bread with cheese. LOVED IT!
author: Lisa M.

description: This place is inexpensive and good!  Nice and attentive staff.  I went in and ordered a pizza to go on my way home from work.  I don't even think it took 10 minutes!  Thin crust with pepperoni, garlic, and mushrooms........don't forget to ask your Uncle Vito to put ricotta cheese on it too for serious deliciousness!
author: Nicole W.

description: I realize that ordering a burger at a pizza place isn't the smartest thing to do but I was starving and Uncle Vito's was right there! I wasn't disappointed. They use ground chuck to make their own patties and the burger was tender and delicious.
author: Aesah L.

description: Uncle Vito's is a bi-monthly staple. We usually do pick up since we live in the area but the times we have come in we have had a great experience. I love the pizza Bianca and my boyfriend loves the Greek. Admittedly it is a little steep (the medium is not that large) but it is good quality and always made fresh to order. Warning: it can get crowded on weekend nights, so be prepared to wait in the front door.
author: Emmy L.

description:
The food is OK, but the service poor.   I have been three times ... OK call it two and a half.  The third time they tried to seat my wife and me just outside the men's room.  We left.  

First time was pizza with salad.  Pizza was OK.  Salad was swimming in dressing.  I had to prop up one end of the plate and make a little lake of it.  Second time was some kind of pasta dish.  Nothing memorable.  

The real strike against this place is the service.  Every time both my wife and I have been there (separate and together) we have been struck by how much it seems that serving people is an imposition to the staff.  They all seem so unhappy, too.  One time when I tried to pay my bill, the guy at the cash register initially ignored me and then was rude as he took the money.

The food is no great shakes, the service is bad and after the seating I am not going back.  The search for a reasonable Italian place continues.
author: Roy C.

description:
I moved to SF from NY a year and a half ago and was so disappointed with the pizza out here... until I found Uncle Vitos.

It's extremely easy to put yourself into a food coma with their pepperoni pizza.  Its just sooooo damn good.  Tons of pepperoni, tons of cheese, just the right amount of sauce and always a good amount of those delicious oven bubbles in the crust.

Beware of their Hawaiian pizza - it comes with green peppers.  Is this some kind of California tradition?  Gross.  The meatball sub ALSO comes covered in green peppers but is still totally worth it.  I'm really picky about my ground meat so trust me, it's good.  No surprises here.

Definitely order a side salad - they are cheap and they are huge.  Comes topped with loads of shredded mozerella, beans and their olives - don't get me started on how good those are.  Their homemade Italian dressing seems to change a lot but is always yummy.
author: Kelly S.

description:
I love Uncle Vito's!!! I know it's just a pizza place but it's not just a pizza place. Their meat lasagna is delicious. The pizza is great and their homemade salad dressing is so yummy! The first time we ordered, we tried the fried ravioli's which weren't my favorite but I've loved everything else I've tried. 

Great for delivery or take-out. They are always on-time.
author: Danielle M.

description: This is based on delivery of a hawaiian pizza at 10 PM on Monday. The crust was nice and chewy but thin and the toppings were in the right proportions, and they deliver late, which is awesome. The delivery guy was nice. Can't complain :)
author: Allie D.

description: Best pizza ever..i use to love blondie's pizza until i found out about Uncle vito which is much better and less greasy. the pizza is consistently good. The crust is perfect. I'm a big fan of their chicken cesar salad, meatball sandwich, and mushroom burger....i eat here twice a week because its sooo good....Take out is better because it gets really pack ....The service is fast and the price is decent. the workers are also super nice....
author: Tiffany L.

description: Not great, but not the worst.  I have ordered here a few times and I have gone in for a meal.  The pizza is crispy, but a little flavorless.  I added pepperoni to half and that made it tastier, but the true test is the plain.  The meal I had was lasagna and it was a huge serving and okay.  The salad they serve w/ it could be better, iceberg doesn't rock my world.
author: Heather S.

description:
We came here for a late night snack after checking into our hotel that was just down the street.

What a nice surprise. The service was great and the food was pretty good too. 

My boyfriend ordered a ground beef and onion pizza and garlic cheese bread I had a ceaser salad. He tells me the pizza was really good although I didn't have any. The salad was HUGE. It was made from romaine hearts only (the best part!!) and a homemade dressing.

Although not the greatest restaurant in the world, it definately was worth what we paid.
author: Ali H.

description:
Fair at best.  A friend had raved about the garlic pizza served up by Uncle Vito.  We opted for the calzone.  The portion was generous and the price was right.  My boyfriend insisted his fountain coca cola was served up just right, so that's a plus I guess, since he knows his soda well.

I wasn't wooed and my socks weren't knocked off.  I won't go out of my way to go to this place, but it's a solid neighborhood joint.  If I'm in the hood again it's fair to say I'll come back to try the pizza.
author: Ashley Q.

description: Woohoo!  For the price and the quality of food, you can't beat this place!  Especially for the location, if you happen to be staying at a hotel a block away -- like we were!  We were thrilled with the simple, yummy caesar salad and fettucine sienna (pesto with sun dried tomatoes and bits of grilled chicken).  Would definitely recommend it for no-frills comfort food.
author: J H.

description: Uncle Vito!  Please accept my apologies that I have been pouring my heart and soul into reviews of places I have only visited once or twice!  How did you slip through the cracks?  Thank you, Uncle Vito, for being so efficient and when I order a calzone, by the time I'm done burning off the mozarella calories on the walk up the hill, you have it waiting for me, piping hot.  I thank you on behalf of the sweet Chinese family who sews the butt back on my jeans when I break through them (Specialty's cookie effect).  Uncle Vito, you are so nice to let me and any of my loud friends be rowdy upstairs while not breaking the bank.  If I had one drop of Italian blood running through my veins, I'd hope to have an Uncle Vito who makes Italian fare just as well as you do!
author: ellyk E.

description: I mean... I am from NYC... pizza's kind of our thing.  Uncle Vito's taste straight off the streets of Brooklyn.  The pizza is unbelievable. My husband was working in SF, and I would make excuses to head over to Uncle Vito's to grab a quick slice.... Seriously.... check it out. From a picky New Yorker... CHECK IT!!!!
author: Jenna C.

description: I wish I were related to Uncle Vito, because he makes one kick ass pizza.  Its the best slice of pie I've found in SF so far!  Give me a pepperoni and pineapple with a side of ranch any day and you've made me a very happy girl!
author: Ms. M. M.

description: Ok, so I may be very picky, but I worked in the service industry so I know what a good restaurant should be like.  I called, they said 1 hr 10 min... it was 2 hours AND the pizza was cold when it arrived.  That's the worst thing ever that can happen to my experience... cold food upon delivery when I'm starving!  Granted, after I took the time to heat up the pizza it was better than an actual orgasm, I still struggled with even giving 3 stars because of the cold food upon delivery issue.
author: Laura D.

description: Got the meatball sandwich based on the reviews, pretty damn good. Next time I'm in SF I'll be going here again that's for sure.
author: Andrew S.

description: The non-acidic tomato sauce has a wonderful garlic-infused flavor, and they'll make a thicker crust if requested, but the pizza is overshadowed by the outstanding calzones, overstuffed and large enough to feed four easily. The pasta dishes are excellent and, as already noted, mushrooms sauteed in olive oil and garlic are terrific . . . especially encased in a calzone.
author: Gourmet G.

description: I would give them a 0 if I could for their piss-poor customer service on the phone. I tried to set up a group reservation for 9 people from a local non-profit -- for a fun meeting -- and the guy on the phone was downright rude. I don't shop or eat at places that don't offer good service and can't even be friendly.
author: Bunny L.

description: So my mom and dad come up from la-la land and stay at The White Swan across the street, and every time they call me and you can hear the drool through the phone: "Katie, we're going to Uncle Joe's to have a MEATBALL SANDWICH"  My family speaks mostly in capital letters and always always gets names wrong. Sometimes its Cousin Vinny's, Uncle Victor's, whatever. They've started raving about it to people in LA. And considering my parents know their way around meatball sandwiches, Uncle Vito's must be doing something right. I got a pretty solid Hawaiian pizza, an excellent antipasto salad and the reliable staple, a meatball sandwich to go last week and it was just as good as the drool implied. Quick pick up, fun to eat at, I'm into it.
author: Katie T.

description: When I walked in the cashier was nice but he was pushing us to get a table and sit down and eat when we were just looking. They have a variety of dishes including pizzas, pasta, and salads. We ended up eating there and the waitress was borderline rude. My friend and I ordered a lasagna to split (it wasn't small, but it was too small to split). Everything was fine until we found a hair in our food. We stopped eating and didn't even finish our lasagna when a waiter passing by we told him and he asked us if we wanted another. We told him no because why would we want anything else from there after we found a hair in our food? I went up to the cashier and told him and he told us that no one had long hair so how was it possible to have one in our food. I didn't understand this because our waitress had long dark hair which was exactly what was in our food. I asked for a discount and he didn't even give us a whole two bucks off. I would rate the food (without the hair) three stars but the service a one. Not going there again.
author: Cesar S.

description: I gotta admit, I think I was a 'ho for this pizza for about 5 years.  How can you not be?  You live in Lower Nob, walk all day long, up & down those hills, and you gotta walk by the wondy smells comin' outta this kitchen day and night.  Necessarily . . . 'ho for Uncle Vito's Pizza.  They deliver, FAST!  When you are finally home, chillin' with the BF, what better way to end the night but with pizza delivery and a DVD?  I was addicted to the pesto pomodoro with goat cheese pizza, but everything is great, including the salads.  Cheap prices, great pizza dough, made well.  I don't like eating in there, because it's crowded and everyone can see you from Bush Street and point at you with pizza sauce & cheese dripping down my face.  Otherwise, really, really good!
author: A W.

description:
Uncle Vito, Can I sit on your lap while you talk to me about cheese and pepperoni? What? You're not really my uncle? Whew! Cuz I'm kind of crushing on you right now...

Uncle Vito is the hottest italian in Union Square. Finally! The perfect little pizza for perfect little me (it's good to have a dream...). I have a thing for "personal sized" pizza. Maybe I just don't like sharing- I was an only child, after all. Their small is 10" and was the perfect size for the linebacker in me. Mmmmm...How I relished every last bite of my perfect, minimally greasy pepperoni-and-fresh-garlic-covered disc of heaven. I answered, "extra sauce, please" and was rewarded with a gold star- finally! A place that gets the concept of "extra". I also ordered the Ravioli Fritti (fried ravioli) appetizer (I like a little deep-fryer action with my pepperoni grease) and though I downed the whole thing, I strongly suggest skipping it and going for an even larger pizza if you're really famished. 
This was all delivered to my Russian Hill location in under 40 minutes and cost about $14. $14! That's one hot deal for service with a smile, hassle-free delivery, a full happy tummy, and a driver who actually had change for once.
I think you'll fall in love with Uncle Vito, too. But don't get any ideas. He's Mine!
author: Autumn K.

description: I am disappointed to report that uncle vito's was not what i expected of a four star pizza place. we picked up a mountain pizza last night and it was under cooked and soggy. the vegetables were cut way to large were still cold in the middle. i won't be back.
author: ellen m.

description: Good neighborhood spot. I like the eggplant parmesan.
author: Joshua S.

description: I'm not sure why I didn't upgrade this to 5 stars sooner.  I love Uncle Vito's; their pizza is some of the best in SF, their salads and appetizers are good, and it definitely has that neighborhoody feel to it.  The pastas are hit or miss, the burger I got here once was nothing special, but don't kid yourself, you're here for pizza and they do that damn well.
author: Joseph N.

description: I no longer live in San Francisco, but oh how I miss my Uncle Vito's pizza! The atmosphere in this teeny, tiny place is perfect if you ask me ~ no frills mixed with friendly and efficient service. The No. 2 is the absolute best. The name of that favorite has changed, but the ingredients (spinach, feta, tomatoes) are the same. Yum!
author: Kara A.

description: Living only a block, uphill, I am always impressed by Vito's delivery service.  The delivery man mastered my building directory, which was amazing considering the fact that I do not even know how to buzz up.  The food was delivered hot and fresh.  The lasagna was mouth wateringly good, especially the fact that it came with a well equipped salad and bread.  Being italian, I am faithful to my family's fettucini alfredo recipe.  However, we took the plundge and ordered Vito's selection and were pleased.  It still did not compare to my homemade version of the pasta, but it was totally legit.
author: Michelle N.

description: Delicious! I am new to the neighborhood and a tasty pizza is important... I don't even have to leave my block to find that with Uncle Vito's! The Calzone and all the others that i have tried are great! They are fast and priced reasonably... my only gripe is they don't offer slices but oh well looks like i just have to get the whole pie! Great job guys...
author: Miguel V.

description: I'm was one of the 99% tourists, so I don't know if my vote counts.  ;)  The pizza was really, realy good.  The best I've had in a long time.   Service could have been better, but it looked like our server had every table in the place.
author: Ashley R.

description: Yum, yum, yum. And they deliver to SOMA. Pizza is not incredibly innovative, they don't have an oven flown in from Italy that cooks at 800 degrees, there is no option to put fresh buffalo mozzarella on your pie. This is good delivery pizza. Don't order this to impress your guests or friends. But Uncle Vito's really hits the spot when you are in the middle of a lazy Entourage marathon and there is no way you are getting out of your sweatpants to leave the house.
author: Dana H.

description: Great food. The dishes were much larger than we thought - and that's a good thing
author: James H.

description: This place was good.  We had a group of 13 for lunch and they sat us upstairs.  We called ahead and they set up tables for us even though they don't take reso's, which was totally awesome of them.  But the pizza was nothing mind blowing, just good pie.
author: Megan H.

description: As a Northeastern Pennsylvania transplant and pizza afficionado, I deem Uncle Vito's to be one of the best in the Bay Area. Classic Neopolitan style pizza with perfect crust and sauce. If you miss NY Style pizza, this is pretty close!
author: Stephanie I.

description:
Please save your money and eat at a pizza place that is actually good...and also run by business-minded adults.  Places like this make me sad when San Francisco has so many amazing places to go instead.  The Nob Hill Cafe is just a few short blocks away...as is Local...as is Za.  So many good places.  

I am not one to typically write reviews, but the ridiculousness of this place made me come right back home and write this.  We walked in at 6:45 pm on a Sunday to find several empty tables.  A man who wouldn't even look us in the eye said "um, you need to wait like um, like 5 mins or 15 mins for a table,"  When I asked why we couldn't sit at any of the open tables, he replied with "those are tables for 4.  you are 2."   I spoke with a women who I assume is a manager and she said "it's the weekend.  we are expecting a lot of people to come in and they may need a bigger table.  you can wait a while for a smaller table".  So let me get this straight - you are going to make me wait in an empty restaurant for a table to open up so you can save all of the empty tables for people who aren't even there...  I really hope the empty restaurant is a sign that this place will either (a) be out of business soon for terrible operations or (b) lead them to hire people who are reasonable and polite.

The pizza isn't even good.  It's just convenient.  Which apparently isn't the case any longer.  There are SO many amazing pizza places in San Francisco and sadly, this just isn't one of them.
author: Caren W.

description: Delicious Gourmet Tasting Pizza!  I used to live a blck away from here and grabbing a pie to go and eating it in the comfort of your own home was the way to do it!
author: Shiho F.

description: This place is REALLY good.  We ate here twice while vacationing in SF... mostly because it was open after 8:00, unlike alot of places nearby, but I still wasn't disappointed with the food at all.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the pizza that my boyfriend had was way too greasy.  He liked it, just wasn't a fan of the huge amount of grease.  Really small place, service was ok.  The french fries were AWESOME!  I know, it's weird to think the best thing about this place is the fries, but seriously... they're amazing!  Plus, Uncle Vito's is one of the few places that serve Dr. Pepper from a fountain around here, so that's a plus!  :)
author: Rebekah C.

description:
i got take out.  i had to wrestle paper off both pieces of garlic bread. i thought it  might be a  mistake but not on both pieces come on.  and it wasn't even good.

the pizza was blah, at best and expensive

funny side note, i saw people get seated at the bathroom table, they got up to move pretty quickly
author: kiki b.

description:
go for the food and you will be very happy,
go for the service and you will be very dissapointed.
great pizza at a reasonable price.
that's basically all you need to know.
author: Steve S.

description: I used to work right by here and it was SOOOooo good.  Their pizza is very fresh and just the right thickness.  I've had their salad to-go but I'd stick with the pizza if I were you.
author: Jared F.

description: "Deliziosoooo" as the Italian would say. Service was fast. It took them 15 mins to deliver my pizza. Also, they offer fresh garlic. yum.
author: Seema H.

description: I must concur on the 5 star ratings of others based on pizza quality alone. I ordered a medium Hawaiian pizza for takeout. It took  about 15 minutes to get ready, and I'd say it was well worth the $16 I spent.  I thought the pizza was a little bit odd, but maybe because everything on it was fresh and not overcooked to a shrived dried gum? I could get used to not having that sort of pizza defect in this city.
author: Mark B.

description: I know it's a pizza restaurant but I only had time to grab a quick sandwich.  Good thing I did cause it was one of the best sandwiches I've ever had.  I did not expect the sandwich to be toasted and that really made it awesome.  I ordered just a plain ham and cheese but it was awesome!  Got to go back for a pizza next time.
author: S K.

description: Awesome pizza with great toppings -- veggies, meats, everything is fresh and flavorful.  For a little extra kick get the fresh garlic, but be forewarned, it's potent.  Especially nice to have it right in the neighborhood for quick pick-up (never eaten in).
author: Danielle G.

description: This is my go to spot. It's simple, good Italian food. I try to go at least once a week. Took my family here when they were in town and it was there favorite place they ate all week. My favorites: Red Eye Pizza, Lasagna, side salad, carafe of wine.
author: Gabriel M.

description: I like this place. The pizza is consistently good and it seems like a small family-owned place, which I am always in support of. I've had the Red Eye and the Greek. The Red Eye was better but the Greek wasn't bad either. I've also tried the cheesy garlic bread, and if you're a cheese lover like me then this one hits the spot. They also have free delivery.
author: Priyam D.

description: I always knew I loved the pizza at this place, but today I discovered that I love their sandwiches, as well!  Got the turkey, avocado and cheese and was very content!  It was the closet thing I have had to snarf's(in Boulder) since livin in the city!  Love the fact that it was toasted!  My friend got the meatball sandwich and he told me it was good , it was luscious!
author: ELIZABETH W.

description: Always good and if you're a business they'll start an account for you. I have eaten a lot of Uncle Vito's slices while pulling all nighter at work and their quality and service can't be beat.
author: Maggie M.

description: Best pizza ever.  Yummmm.  Don't hesitate, just go.  Tried the veggie and cheese.  Amazing!
author: Laura P.

description: We are pizza lovers!  I think my wife (part Italian) would literally fly to Naples just to have pizza!  Great crust is the key and this is the best.  Sometimes busy, sometimes inattentive waiters, but it seems sort of appropriate for what it is.  The Pizza is consistent and good, what more could you ask for?
author: bill A.

description: This has quickly become one of my favorite places to eat in my neighborhood.  The pizza and calzones are great - it doesn't beat Zachary's, but then again, not many pizza places do.  Don't just use Vito's for delivery, the restaurant is super cute - warm and cozy.  And their very inexpensive, yet very very tasty house wines are the cherry on the sundae for a dinner here!
author: Stephanie P.

description: So glad I live only 2 blocks away. My favorite local pizza joint. Pies here are damn good. The best thin crust I've had in SF. Perfect amount of sauce, cheese, and toppings, all of which taste amazing. Calzones are hella good too. I don't think I'm ever gonna get around to trying out their pastas or burgers. The pizzas are just too good to pass up. This place gets packed around dinner time even on a weeknight.
author: Bruce D.

description: The food was pretty flavorless and the service was mediocre at best.  The place is small and unwelcoming as well.
author: Mack D.

description: I've been coming here since the early 90's and they have simple, yet good soulful food!  Go here for lunch for the turkey/avocado sandwich with the saute mushroom appetizer.  Great, fatty fettucine and 'can't go wrong' pizzas.  Basically, this place is the ultimate for good old fashion italian comfort food.  Nothing fancy, or particulary gourmet, but a great place to chow down if you're not on a diet ;-)
author: Jon Z.

description: Fairly decent, not too greasy, but not the best I've ever had.  Sauce was pretty decent, but not much else to brag about.  If this is the best pizza in San Francisco, then San Francisco is in big trouble!
author: Mike O.

description: Hells yeah! Finally, the first pizza in the city that I've found that can actually stand up to the Midwest test. Really superb sauce and cheese with some great, fresh toppings. I highly recommend getting The Mountain, but don't expect to talk to anybody important when you're done eating it unless you have some Listerine nearby. Not exactly cheap, but the delivery is reliable and I would say it's worth the price.  I'll have to check out Uncle Vito's place the next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Michael E.

description: Sadly, for being so close to my place, not my favorite pizza. The sauce was a little sweet and the pizza a little doughy. Quick service and a heaping portion of veggies on the pizza was a plus.
author: Megan S.

description:
Tasty, reasonable, and not afraid to deliver in the tenderloin.

Plus they call me pet names on the phone, which we all know I'm a sucker for.
author: A W.

description: The service is okay, but I've always liked their pizza. Really great sauce:)
author: Lindsay B.

description: The food is good - traditional, authentic pasta and pizza. However, the manager-chef-maitre d' looked sooooo busy. Don't expect a smile or a nice greeting... his sole concern is to get you seated, and feed you. Place is a bit too crowded as well.
author: Ryan M.

description: I admit it, I judged you. I didn't think your pizza would be that great, even after I merrily scarfed you the first time. But dog you have won me over.
author: Shannon V.

description: Yes, it looks like a hole in the wall, and the inside isn't fancy but who cares? The food is pretty good and CHEAP. Sauteed mushrooms (heap o' 'shrooms on a plate with garlic and olive oil) are tasty - don't be intimidated!
author: Alden C.

description: I have ordered the "fettuccine siena" dish since 1995, sometimes once a week. Recently I ordered a $100 tub of it for a law school meeting. Virtually everyone came to me later asking for the restaurant and dish names.
author: Bronwyn G.

description: I ordered the special and had it delivered.  Price to pizza ratio is pretty good.  Ingredients were good.  I must say the dough was tasteless and the sauce was kinda bland, but overall it was pretty good.  I'd basically keep this place in my rotation of pizza places.
author: John M.

description: I like these guy's meat lasagna, tons of tomato sauce.  Just make sure they put it in the oven long enough.  I've had it served to me tepid before, and that's just not cool.
author: matthew w.

description: Uncle Vito's is a great place to pick up a pizza or calzone to take back to your hotel room.  I discovered this little place while walking down Powell.  Fast and delicious, I highly recommend the calzone!
author: Brian M.

description:
Solid red sauce joint. Good prices. 
I have never tried their Pizza. Their pasta are good and their meatballs approaching greatness.
author: Maximilian A.

description: It's  "le bomb".  EVERYTHING is "top top top" here, pizza, pasta, anti pasta, seafood, service and prices.  Its popular and gets pretty crowded... It's also a fun casual date place.
author: erica u.

description: The BEST pizza in the city!!! The only other place that can even come close to Vito's is Pizza Orgasmica, but Vito's always wins my vote. Their sauce is to die for, it's got just the right amount of sweet and salty. Plus they always seem to know how to smother it with cheese so it's perfectly gooey. They offer great vegetarian alternatives as well. The only downside is that the restaurant is not comfortable to eat in, so plan to take-out or deliver. Uncle Vito's is so good I have them on speed dial ;)
author: Vara P.

description: Good Pizza my fav pesto with sun-dried tomatoes, good spaghetti, Good Greek Salad extra feta cheese and they deliver too!!!
author: Arissa C.

description: Great pizza when you just want to pick up a personal pizza and eat it on the street!
author: Chris  F.

description: I worked at Uncle Vito's for like 2 weeks back in the 80s. I just couldn't keep up with those wicked Brazilian guys there. I got tossed out on my keester. I still go eat there every time I'm in town
author: Chris E.

description: My dear ol' Uncle Vito. I only order here because it is a few blocks from home. Pizza is good. Burgers are good. Pasta also goodl. Garlic bread is pre-made and needs more garlic.
author: Christina B.

description: Great pizza! made fresh when you order it. This place gets really busy around dinner time and sometimes has standing room only by the register to wait for your food, but it's easy to see why. Some of the best pizza I've ever had.
author: Jay T.

description: OMG! I was amazed at how good my slice of a pie was I almost wanted seconds and thirds. Vito's is right around the way from the job and I never been in the two years I've been in the area. I might slide through today and get a slice or two. Wait let me CDF for a minute. I only have one cheat day a week and that was it.  I'm not to sure whats on the menu since we ordered over the phone and we had a expert but I'm definitely stopping by on my own to see what more they have to offer.
author: Karim R.

description: Had pizza tonite great price looked crowded inside, got seated in like a minute. Great food and the Caesar Salad and the Italian dressing were fantastic, not too strong and overpowering lettuce fresh An all together great experience.
author: nikki g.

description: 5 stars or not 5 stars... well this ain't Little Star but it is one of the best pizza and calzones I have had in SF. This place won't even deliver to me I have to get it from my boyfriend's house but I think about it all the time anyway.  As mentioned the pizza and calzone are awesome and I even tried their cheesy bread and Greek Salad, both were excellent. I mean this is order in pizza people not gourmet fancypantsness, and I found it because of Yelp. Awww...
author: Jennifer M.

description: MAN the grilled chicken and broccoli alfredo kicks ASS.  like seriously.  i've had many a white sauce pasta in this town, and this is the leader of the pack  although, they suck for not delivering past van ness avenue (even if you're just riggggght there).  havent had the pizza but i heard thats good too!
author: Kimby T.

description: Was hung over today and really wanted eggplant parmesan.  Ordered it and it was really soggy and not how I'm accustomed to: firm and more breaded.  I think maybe they didn't fry it enough or at all and just baked it.  I've heard the pizza is good, though.
author: Evan R.

description: Tight dining quarters but fantastic food. Excellent cheese bread antipasta salad and Greek pizza. The iced tea was bad. The Sierra Nevada was cold. We would go back.
author: Alan I.

description: This is a tiny place near Union Square. I had a combination pizza during lunch during my last visit and found it to be satisfactory (not great). I wasn't partial to the cheese for some reason (seemed bland). The wait was also pretty bad just to get a glass of water and the small pizza seemed overpriced ($10+). I know it's in downtown and all, but I don't know, I was expecting more. I ended up being seated in the back at the table next to the restroom (great) because the place was so small and "busy." The server was a nice enough guy but he was tasked with serving everybody in the restaurant and tagging to-go orders. Their pasta looked good although but I did not have a chance to try it. Maybe I need to try something more interesting next time on their menu, but overall I was unimpressed. I tend to enjoy Village Pizza (way over on Van Ness) much more.
author: Al B.

description: I have been ordering delivery from Uncle Vito's for years. The reason I keep going back to them is because their salads are always FRESH! I have ordered delivery from other pizza places in the city but Uncle's Vito's is the only one I trust to provide a fresh salad every time. Their pizza is awesome too. But I'm a pasta person and sometimes I wish they had more meat, sauce, or veggies in their pasta dishes. It is not consistent but even so I still order their grilled chicken breast fettuccine most often.
author: k l.

description: We've tried every delivery place around the neighborhood, and Uncle Vito's is definitely the best.  i wish I had an Uncle Vito.  My uncle eats mayonnaise out of a jar, and lives off of disability for injuries that are what many doctors refer to as "psychosomatic" but I digress.  Crust is tasty, sauce is tangy, toppings are plentiful.  So far delivery experience has been fairly quick.
author: Jason L.

description: Great little pizza, pasta, and sandwich joint.  The pizza is great.  The eggplant parmigiana sandwich is awesome.  Greek salad is amazing.  Very reasonably priced.  We got 2 sandwiches, a greek salad, a plate of fries, a sparkling water and a beer for under $30.  Great cozy atmosphere.
author: Eric M.

description: An OK pizza with somewhat of a soggy crust for my liking. If I order again from here, I think I'll try the calzone instead.
author: Neil K.

description: Ordered up the Red Eye combo (pepperoni, red bell peppers, and red onions) with extra cheese, and what a taste sensation!  All the flavors were excellent.  The crust wasn't Chicago thick or NY thin, but a good middle ground, SF style.  The only downside was the crust wasn't as crisp as I'd like.  Not sure if it was because it was in the foil lined pizza box  for a few minutes before I wholly devoured it.  Nonetheless, UVP does pizza right.
author: M A N I K.

description: This place is close to work, so we get food here A LOT. I wish it were their salads that I craved- and not their calzones. But alas- it is not to be. Their calzones and pizzas, and hot sandwiches are divine. They loose one star for not having a salad that is worthy of a single hunger pang.
author: Melissa B.

description: Yummy, yummy, yummy. My office is down on Post and Mason so it usually takes quite some convincing to get me to walk up the streets of San Francisco for some food. Uncle Vito's is a little tiny restaurant that not only does take out but can deliver which is great for those of us that have lunch meetings. They not only serve pizza but make great salads, pastas and awesome sandwiches. This place is great, gotta try it if you are within walking or delivery distance.
author: Heather L.

description: Glad to have this place in the hood.  Good pizza served by nice men.
author: Tamar N.

description: I have definitely experienced better.  Being that this is the closest pizza place that delivers when you spend more than $10, I decided to give it a try.  The pizza for pretty small for a medium (6 slices) with barely any pepperoni and the garlic was basically thrown onto 2 slices, not spread out at all.  I also ordered garlic bread which was weaker to the toast that I make for myself in the mornings.  Nothing really beats New York pizza like Patsy's or Grimaldi's, but I still enjoy the taste that I have to have it out here in SF.  I should've went with Pizza Hut.  Such a high rating here from everyone but this is my experience and this is my rating.
author: Limzer L.

description: This is definitely my delivery place.  They're usually on time and all the guys are totally  nice.  For me, the dough is the best part.  Its soft and delicious.  Good sauce, great toppings.  I hear their burgers are great too!
author: Lauren M.

description: I was looking for a new pizzeria to try on Yelp and found this place.  Delivery time was good, and the pizza was good.  I'll probably order from them again.  I must say though, the dough was very salty!
author: CAKE E.

description: I like this pizza and I like their salad too. sometimes the service sucks and they send you the wrong food...but other than that its good. Its the closest pizza place to my house so we've tried them a few times. I wont however wait more than 20 min for a table. Its a bit crowded, it feels like your hair will fall in the people behind you's food but its all good.
author: Sarah D.

description: Good Flavor little too much cheese. Need have some crisper crust. A little bit more crust cell definition. It was better the next day when  I threw it in on my stone wish i would have done this the first time.
author: Sean J.

description: This is my favorite pizza joint in the neighborhood. Always fast service, very tasty pizza and decently priced. Not the best pizza ever, but nothing to complain about either. Definitely a good spot.
author: Audrey V.

description: Some of the best pizza one can have delivered downtown, that's fo sho!  And the prices are OK.  They're friendly on the phone.  They were always my favorite when I worked closer to them.  They do seem to be willing to deliver to quite a large area too!
author: Kerry L.

description: Being born and raised and lived in New York until about 7 months ago, finding edible pizza in SF is very difficult to find. This pizza is ok. It isn't anything like New York pizza, but it is like the pizza you would find in a restaurant where pizza isn't its specialty. What I really love about this place is the ravioli pesto. It is amazing. The best pesto ever! It is creamy and tasty. The one thing I was surprised to see on the menu was fried ravioli. Very "New York Sicilian" and it is tasty too.  The food is good and the place is packed every night. I still recommend the pesto.
author: Bella T.

description: I live in the neighborhood and I think Vito's is a great place to have close by.  Delicious pizza, big salads and they are friendly and fast.  A little bit pricey, but considering the neighborhood and the fact that most places hike up their prices because of all the tourists, it is pretty reasonable.  Mmm, I could go for a Vito's pizza right now
author: Lauren H.

description: I live near this restaurant and pass by often and it seems to always be busy.  It's located right On Powel Street and I believe they rely on tourists who are easy to please.  Pasta is OK, spinach salad was good, service is good but the pizza is completely unremarkable.
author: Jeff Z.

description: Great little casual Italian place near Union Square.  Yes, it's on the cable line, but don't confuse it with other tourist screwjobs nearby.  The pizza is consistently good, with crisp, tasty crust and high-quality toppings (the kind that make you fight over the heaviest slices with your friends).  As far as the staff and clientele, you'll find Uncle Vito's unpretentous and friendly.  A big bonus for the house wine which is not by any means award-winning but a bargain at around $8 for a large carafe.
author: MScott S.

description: An excellent cheap eat right off  a Union Square plagued with mediocrity and over priced showmanship.  Worth a visit
author: Porfirio R.

description:
i love their pepperoni pizza! super fast delivery service too! this pizza also tastes amazing the next day as well. i'm not as detailed as most people on here when they describe every detail of the pizza ... but all i can say is that the crust was good ... the sauce was just right (not too sweet - not acidic) ... and just the right amount of cheese. these are all requirements for me. 

try fried ravioli appetizer. it's pretty good. last time i decided to try their lasagna ... not so good. not much noodles and way too much cheese ... but i'll still give this place 5 stars because they aren't expected to make a good lasagna - it's a pizza place for crying out loud!
author: James J.

description: Good pizza.  Delivery is very punctual as well.  Ask for the red pepper and parm as the drivers are not packing.   This is my place to order from in a pinch.
author: Rob C.

description: Best damn meatball sandwich ive ever had bar none.
author: Honest A.
