description: A dense, flat, floury crust. Large, salty slices of Canadian bacon. This was a nice little pizza delivered to my hotel in a timely fashion on a Friday night. That's all I wanted.
author: Ben L.

description: I'm giving Uncle Vitos 4 stars because it is good food for a good price in a neighborhood that is overpriced.  If you are staying on Nob Hill and don't want to spend $30/person for every meal then this is a good lunch or dinner stop. Also, you don't have to lose much altitude, man those streets are steep. It is very small so a line can form at dinnertime. For lunch the meatball sandwich is good and the calzones are big. I think they have Sierra Nevada Pale Ale too.
author: Hans R.

description: I've eaten here in house once and had the overwhelming pizza calzone which was very good but much more than even a glutton like myself I could eat.  I've ordered once from here and while I had some trouble getting them to actually take my order and the delivery took a while but the pizza was very good.  I will be giving them some additional business for sure.
author: Derek D.

description: Used to go here to get subs when I stayed at the Orchard Hotel across the street.  Really good subs, but I have never had their pizza.
author: Pele N.

description: Its alright pizza and calzones,but I wouldn't tell someone to go here. You have the normal goof troop tourists and random weirdo in there. The salads look like they made them on accident and its still not even that cheap.
author: Mike L.

description: Amazing pizza, great sandwhiches, meatball sandwhich is so good, fries are nice too.  Pasta is good but not like anything you couldn't get in North Beach better.  I think this is one of the best places for pizza in the city, the pesto pizza is perfect.
author: Steven K.

description: I've only gotten take-out from Uncle Vito's, and I like the place mainly because of its convenience and quick service.  The food is not spectacular, but I do love the sausage sandwich and the pizza is better than the chains. Unfortunately, the pesto pizza was super salty when I had it, and the sausage pizza didn't have a remarkable dough or sauce. I recommend Uncle Vito's if it is close.
author: Lorenzo M.

description: Ordered delivery from Uncle Vito's to our hotel, since we were going to be spending the evening packing to go home.  I ordered the meat lasagna with salad and my husband ordered the Hawaiian pizza.  I didn't try his pizza so I'm only reviewing the lasagna. The portion was quite large, I could only eat about 1/3 of it, but found it was mostly cheese & sauce, little noodle in it, and it was a bit on the salty side.  I enjoyed the side salad that accompanied the lasagna..had some beans, cheese and olives which was a bit more interesting than a usual side, and the homemade Italian dressing was quite good. There was also a piece of garlic bread which I wasn't expecting, it was a bit dry so I dipped it in the sauce. The delivery was quick, but perhaps I should have gone with pizza instead!
author: Tania J.

description: If I was only rating the quality of the food it would be a 5... but the employees are consistantly rude... call ahead and get take out... good food, bad people
author: Andrew K.

description: Walked up there from the Westin St. Francis.  Hand carried a medium peperoni and two Heinekens back to the bride.  Pizza was decent, nothing to write home about.  Garlic bread was greasy/buttery.
author: John P.

description: Lisa: MY FAVORITE PIZZA PLACE!  everything on the menu is sooooo yummy!  my favorite is the spinach salad, and their sauteed mushrooms. pizza is thin crusted and pasta is so tasty! LOVE IT HERE!
author: Lisa M.

description: Pizza's really good. House salad was cold and crisp and reasonably priced. Atmosphere nothing to write home about. Good value for money in San Francisco.
author: K R.

description: I love the chicken ravioli special, the meat calzone the veggie ravioli special, and the delivery is great. always overly satisfied with them. we bring our out-of-town visitors here, and they love it too.
author: Sunny M.

description: Really great pizza.  I ordered the Hawaiian and loved every bit of it.  It was not terribly greasy and all of the ingredients seemed really fresh.  I did not dine in, but ordered out instead.  They were terribly busy, but still managed to get my order out in about 20 minutes.  Will be going back.
author: Christopher Z.

description: This place is kick-ass!  We had the Fried Ravioli and the Fettucine Siena.....both were incredible.  The only real complaint that I have is one of the chef's acted like a total turd, but the waitstaff was excellent.  Highly reccomend this place if you're hanging around Union Square and need a bite.
author: Andrew A.

description:
You like soggy bottoms? I dont.

Better than Dominos, thats about it. Why cant we get a good East Coast pizza place in San Francisco? Gah.
author: Maggie X.

description: MMMMMMMM! I have had their food for years, and OMG I love it! Great Pizza's, Pasta's, Salad's. Burger's.......We get them to make a pizza with ground beef, mushrooms and olives, it is soo yummy!!! Good service, but great food.
author: N H.

description:
I just ordered delivery here for the first time.  

I decided to go with the pepperoni pizza cos its simple and should allow me to compare it with my usual North Beach pizza.

My verdict-  The pizza was sweet, esp the sauce.  Overall, it was pretty mediocre and not the same chewiness i i get from NB which i do miss right now.

The guy on the phone was very nice though. =)
author: cindy L.

description: Their pizza dough is pretty amazing.  I'm also addicted to their caesar salad dressing.
author: B A.

description:
We got the medium mountain pizza.  its alright. but more on the bad side of alright than good...

I admit we ordered it and picked it up later than expected so that could have contributed to the freshness of the pizza but I don't think thats it.  The taste was just average over all.  I had a pizza craving and their pizza just didn't really do it for me.  The sauce, crust/dough, toppings... eh.  i'll definitely try another place next time.
author: S T.

description: I'm only rating the pasta and it's... not very good. This place gets away with mediocre food because of its location, its homely appearance and (connected to the first factor) the heavy tourist traffic.
author: Mark T.

description: Amazingly good. The Pizzas here are better than any place in North Beach i think. Even the spaghetti with meatballs, my personal favorite, is better than most. Located just couple block from Union Sqaure and very accessible by cable car, in fact, i've witnessed cable car operators stop and wait for their pizzas delievered to them.
author: benjamin c.

description: I have ordered delivery food for my office for 15 years from Uncle Vito's. It is by far the best place in Union Square for fast, excellent Italian food. Don't even hesitate about ordering from here if you are close to Union Square! Enjoy!!!
author: Charlie W.

description: This place rocks!  Pizza is good, salads are really good and they deliver in about 45 minutes.  Weekend hours suck a bit.  Not open until 4pm.  I had to watch the Laker's lose in Utah today without a pizza.
author: Kevin D.

description:
This place is great!  Some of the best pizza I've had.  Add the extra garlic, it is so worth it.  

Close to a bunch of hotels, seemed like a local hang out, and the cooks were friendly.
author: Kyle M.

description:
Everything on the menu is pretty good but minus one star for their service.  They tend to get pretty pack and forget about you while you wait for your order.  I sat there waiting for my pizza for almost 30 minutes, finally I went up to ask if it was ready and the guy said "oh, it's been sitting here for awhile".  I was sitting in right infront of him all this time and he couldn't spare 3 minutes to hand me my pizza until I asked.

BTW, their turkey avocado sandwich is surprisingly really good.
author: Kate L.

description: Complete Jerk Offs. Very rude on the phone and obviously did not want my business. Epic Fail.
author: J C.

description: mmm! i've been trying most of their menus, and most of them are really good. good price, good food. this simple. just try.
author: Joe T.

description: Really good tuna sandwich made just how I like it.  Who knew a pizza place could make such good sandwiches?  The Greek salad is also pleasing to the taste buds and the pizzas are amazing.  Best reason to go is probably the handsome and friendly waiter.  I'll be back again and again.
author: Swizan R.

description: I was really hoping this place would be good, but it was pretty average. I ordered a small calzone and since I don't eat pork I went with the veggie one with garlic instead of olives. I was pretty disappointed that they couldn't add chicken for a few bucks extra, since a few of their menu items have grilled chicken in them. But other than that, the service was fast and friendly. When I got my calzone it smelled great and looked pretty big for a small, so I was pretty excited. Perhaps this propelled my expectations a little too high, because sadly there just wasn't enough punch to the flavor for my standards. In general, the calzone was very wet and drippy because of the vegetables, so I was beginning to think getting the veggie calzone was a mistake. A few hours later and I can feel myself getting hungry again, probably because I was never fully satisfied to begin with.. But I'm willing to give this place another chance in the future... Until then, 2 stars for spending $15 on something that probably wasn't worth it.
author: P A U L.

description: I am a huge fan of Vitos. The pizza bursts with flavor in every bite. The dough is perfectly fluffy, but slightly crisped and the tomato sauce is so tomatoey and any topping you choose is of the highest quality ingredients. Vitos pizza always aids you during a hangover and even if you are not hurting it is so satifying. If you think you know what good pizza is, then try Uncle Vitos. Oh, my favorite pizza is the pepperoni, mushroom and Jalapeno.
author: Katherine S.

description: me: cheese ravioli with meat sauce, a little easy on the sauce. my roommate: chicken alfredo with extra sauce. the sauteed mushrooms are incredible. yay for orangina, too! great food, comfortable family-feeling atmosphere, relatively inexpensive. really nice place to take someone on a date :)
author: AJ M.

description: The famous F twins live here. Seriously, they do. Which makes it good Italian and quirky! When my grandfather visits from FL. this is where he wants to go.
author: amber d.

description: I hate this place!  I will do anything in my power to boycott this place.  I've had a couple bad experiences.  I used to eat there a lot, but this one time, it was about 11pm and the dining area was pretty empty because it was late.  They tried to sit my boyfriend and I by the bathroom (right in between the 2 doors!).  My boyfriend asked if we could sit somewhere else because ew!  who likes sitting by the bathroom?  They wouldn't sit us in the dining area because she said "we can't sit 2 people at a 4 person table!"  Are you kidding me?  There was hardly anyone in the damn place.  whatever.  I went back again with a friend because we just wanted a quick bite before we went out.  The guy misunderstood my order, and when I ordered a pesto and mushroom pizza, he gave me one of these fancy pizzas from the menu with all this crap on it that I never ordered.  When I told him it was wrong, he basically firmly told me that that is what I ordered and i was wrong.  He was such a dick about it too!  R.I.P Uncle Vito's!!  Never again!  Your pizza isn't even that good!  I'd give them NO stars if i could!
author: Hello J.

description: we ordered a large vegetarian pizza yesterday for delivery, and it was pretty good.  we added jalapenos to it, so when they brought over the pizza, they didn't bring any red chili flakes.  boo.  we ordered it extra crispy and well done, so the pizza wasn't soggy when it arrived.  on a cold day, pizza hit the spot!!
author: Helen T.

description: Great place to stop in for a pizza. Has a true Italian essence. Great corner for people watching if you can find a seat next to the window.
author: Trevor D.

description: Went here with the family on a recent business/vacation trip to the Bay Area.  Quick service. Cheap prices for San Francisco. Great food. We had linguine pesto, veggie pizza and a toasted ham, salami and cheese sandwhich. All were very good. Despite it's Nob Hill location there were a lot of locals in the restaurant -always a good sign.
author: David S.

description: These people took about one hour to deliver (they said it would take 30 minutes) and then the pizza was mediocre. They didn't include marinara sauce with the bread sticks. All around a bad experience.
author: oskar v.

description: It's open till 11pm, so you can grab a late night pizza to go. My problem with the place is the fact that they always put that damn piece of foil under the pizza when you get it to go and it makes the pizza soggy. What part of "Can I please not have the foil in my box this time" is hard to understand. Every damn time!! I ordered the veggie last night and had to take it back because it was soaked in juices from the veggies. Yes, I understand there are juices that come out when veggies are cooked, but if you cook for a living then you should know to blot or towel dry your produce. Common cooking industry sense. The guy was so flustered with me and I understand. Who wants to be told how to do their job? I had a new pizza made and it was much more delightful. The minestrone is not vegetarian and I was unaware of that as well. It's close to home though and they are always on time. Hit miss people. Hit and miss.
author: monika l.

description: Great casual, kid-friendly, local Italian and pizza joint.  Excellent pasta, great calzones.
author: Jim P.

description: the bread is good but do not order the fettuccine with baby clams! the pizza was not as good as Cybelle's
author: Jen P.

description: The pizza is great and the sandwiches are just as good, plus they're cheap.  I have never had a bad experience here.
author: mike V.

description: I was reading some of the reviews, and I guess I'm not the only one who heads over here cuz it's close to my apartment (so why haven't I met all these neighbors??)  I've been here a couple of times, and the pizza is yummy.  The house red is pretty tasty too, to go along with your pizza.  A great place to sit down and have a tasty meal.
author: Susan S.

description: About a year ago I would have given them 5 stars but since then they just keep disappointing me over and over again to the point where I may start going elsewhere. I liked it because it was only a block away and the food was usually pretty good. Last night topped it all. Believe me, I am one of those people who gets if your busy and I am understanding about it but I can only be so patient. First when I called they had me on hold for about 10-15 minutes to the point where I hung up and called back. They told me 45-min to an hour for the food. No problem. Well 2 hours later do you think I was happy?? So I called them. The guy on the phone asked me 5 times what my address was and was fumbling over his words like my order was lost. Then he put me on hold for another 5 minutes and then said he just left and is on his way. Well I only live 1/2 a block away so when it took him 15 minutes to get here you can imagine how unhappy I was. Then the food.......... ravioli appetizer was ice cold, garlic bread with cheese ice cold. pasta, luke warm and it was all stuck together like it had been sitting for a while. Obviously it had been!!!
author: lisa v.

description:
we ordered some pizza for march madness and while it was pretty tasty, the game was over before it arrived. i guess it was a busy night but we only live about 5 blocks away...

Thinish crust pizza that has a nice, crisp crust (we thought the advice of a fellow yelper and stuck the pizza in the oven after it was delivered and it was really good). 

I don't think we would go out of our way to order from uncle vito's again but it was pretty good and the crust was thin which is awesome.
author: joseph j.

description: The pizza was just OK- not much sauce and the crust was bland
author: Andrew M.

description: I had read reviews before going, I wanted to have lunch, I ordered a personal combination pizza to go. It made my truck smell delicious, i peaked inside the box and saw the toppings and crust and it was to tempting, i ate the pizza on the road. Every bite was good, the crust the cheese, everything about it. I found myself nibbling on the last slice to make it last longer. It was absolutely Gourmet. Perfect for the city experience. I know i will be returning again. -Thanks
author: Gabe G.

description: Just had a small pizza with garlic for take-out, but I was impressed. I went in only after studying them through the glass. Everything looked legit, so I gave it a shot. Great pie. New-York-nice-guy type service, so I felt like I was in the Big Apple.
author: Paul W.

description: Thanks to stumbling across the reviews here on yelp. We decided to check out Uncle Vitos on our trip to San Fran this week.  I think that we both agree that it is quite possibly the best pizza we've had. The sauce is superb and the dough itself is cooked perfectly, not too doughy, not too thick or think.  We loved it so much we went back again the next day before we flew back to NYC.
author: Schrodinger B.

description: Still trying to find a 5 star pizza place in the City. This place is good, but not great. The pizza is better then the chains and other small places. This is where the Cable Car guys get their dinner, so if that tells you anything. Delivery can take a while on the weekend, but at least they take credit cards.
author: Brian R.

description: the restaurant is pretty small...nothing exciting...but its packed!!! my party of 4 had to sit at a table for 2.  the food is excellent, had pasta my first time, and i've had the calzone a few times since.  probably the best calzone i've ever had!! great quick delivery too.
author: kunal p.
